Reviews.Title: “Wow stay somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Livncentrd
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good location terrible service!! Rude front desk staff check in was a nightmare. Room key didnt work every night we stayed. Dirty linens Just not worth the trouble. We stayed on the executive level and were treated terribly - very very rude staff. Rooms hot due to the motion sensor controls. Hotel restaurant and bar staff slow and not friendly at all. Don't waste your time or money on this one. Spend a few more bucks and stay at the ritz or Roosevelt

Reviews.Title: “Charged for valet parking when I had no car”
Reviews.Author: Why-dont-you-listen
Reviews.Content: This hotel charged me $94 for parking even though I had no car. When I checked out, the attendant at the front desk supposedly fixed the issue, but they still billed my credit card later that week after I left. They clearly assigned the charge from someone else's room to mine. The attendant at the front desk even admitted that they could not read the signature on the parking permit and just randomly assigned it to my room since there wasn't a parking charge on my room. They refuse to consider the issue and after 2 months of dealing with their accounting office and my credit card company, the issue is still unresolved. Their customer service is horrific. The front desk says the issue is accounting's problem and accounting dept says the issue is the front desk's problem. I have spoken to 3 managers already. Do not use this hotel. They lack the customer service and hospitality to be in the hospitality business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the French Quater”
Reviews.Author: OneFunRedhead
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fabulous from Check in to check out! Friendly staff, clean room and great location. Its right on the corner of Bourbon st and Canal and has a balcony you can enjoy the view of Bourbon street on the 2nd floor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's starting to get a little run down...”
Reviews.Author: IslandManRides
Reviews.Content: First off, the staff was just fine. However, the rooms were tired and dirty. There was/is a thick layer of dust on the carpet at the edges and corners. Obviously the vacuum won't get close enough to the wall. The floor in the bathroom had long dark hair on it upon check in. The shower rod was falling apart. The sealant in the shower had voids in it, allowing bacteria a place to hide. The lack of cleanliness in the room made the stay feel dirty. The beds were most likely the hardest we have ever attempted to sleep on. They were simply too hard and did not provide a single night of restful sleep. This property is obviously a cash cow for the company, with it's proximity to Bourbon St and its conference abilities. It is tired and needs a re-do. Your challenge is huge though. Traffic and volume vs room quality = continued investment, diligence of housekeeping and maintenance and high standards, while keeping the property affordable. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable ...”
Reviews.Author: Loveheelers
Reviews.Content: Very nice! Comfortable and clean! Lots of pillows! Everything you'd want in a hotel. All the staff were VERY friendly ... not one exception. We used the valet and their parking ($32), again, super friendly and big truck was returned perfectly! They were all VERY busy and all of them had a smile and a "Go Saints" when they saw our shirts as we headed out for the game. The location is perfect is you are going to be walking to the SuperDome and the French Quarter ... its about half way between both on Bourbon and Canal St. If you eat at McDonald's staying there you ought to be smacked. There are so many WONDERFUL restaurants just within a couple of blocks. You can even catch a trolley car that will take you to the Aquarium of the Americas and/or the Quarter right across the street. There's no other city like this and this hotel is the perfect place after a long day!! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor-New Orleans is a very nice hotel with a great location. The location of this hotel made sightseeing around the Big Easy, exactly that...Easy! Its central location at Canal and Bourbon also made late night ventures quite simple. The only drawbacks were the lack of free WiFi and the very limited channel selections on the TV (plus no HD). The beds were comfortable and the housekeeping did their job quite well. Would definitly stay there again when I make my way back to the Bayou.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised... Aug 22-26”
Reviews.Author: trock24
Reviews.Content: The convention I was attending picked this hotel as our main stay. Since this was my first time here, I just stayed where they recommended, since it was easy. Very nice hotel, and the rooms were spacious and clean. The location is in walking distance to just about everything. Bourbon street is block over, and the streetcars are just in front of the hotel. There are lots of restaurants within a 5-10 min walk (some of the best in New Orleans). I would recommend this hotel if you want a nice easy trip to New Orleans. Just a note... on check-out day, there were a lot of people outside the hotel. We thought everyone was waiting for a cab, but it turned out, everyone was waiting for their vehicles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shelly A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for labor day weekend and had a fantastic time. The location is unbeatable, right by the French quarter, loads of restaurants, bars, movie theater and the water in walking distance. Rooms are alright, and access to wifi convenient.

Reviews.Title: “ASTOR”
Reviews.Author: GREG J
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in September of 2011, and the hotel was awesome. The staff was very helpfull and the rooms were spotless. The resturant and bars were a lot of fun!! What more can you say?? It is on the corner of Bourbon and Canal Street!!!!!! It was a great stay, thanks Greg Johnson See you in September 2012!!!

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: Robin13travels
Reviews.Content: Our ac was not cooling the room. A friend in another room had the same problem. It took several calls over a day and a half to get it fixed. They left the room full of dust. Then, the day we checked out, they said the valet could not bring our car. We had to ride a shuttle a couple of blocks to a parking deck. The when the guy came with the car, he passed by us. We had to yell until he stopped as he was taking our car back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunbirdawgrox
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for three nights and were delighted with our stay. The hotel itself is very nice, with an impressive lobby area and spacious rooms for an older hotel. The bathrooms were modern and clean. There is a small rooftop pool overlooking Canal Street with a nice sized deck. The pool is small, but worked to keep us cool on a hot New Orleans afternoon. What made our stay exceptional was the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff, ranging from the front desk, housekeeping, to administration (who would make welcoming comments to guests as they were passing in the hallway). A special thank you goes to Ms. Pamela in the Executive Club Level. We enjoyed breakfast there daily, and her and her staff were especially wonderful and friendly. On our last day, Ms. Pamela surprised my two young daughters with a gift of Crowne Plaza small stuffed animals. They were very excited! In addition to the mardi gras masks they purchased, the stuffed animals with the hotel's name on them will be another lasting reminder of our trip for them. As my family plans future travel, they now ask if we are staying in a Crowne Plaza. Bottom line, there are a lot of great hotels to choose from that are also convenient to the French Quarter, but the staff at exceeded our expectations, and we will definitely stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza when we return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MeanGreenGrad08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights right after getting married in January 2011...we went to New Orleans for our mini-moon. We actually didn't pay for our hotel stay because we had to attend a timeshare presentation. The hotel is beautiful, especially the lobby and the architecture. Our room was a little dated, but comfortable and nice. The timeshare organization had given us a room with 2 queen beds, so that wouldn't have been our first choice, but it was free! The room was shockingly quiet, even though the hotel is located at the corner of Canal and Bourbon, and there's partying going on right down the street. Didn't even need the earplugs they give us. It's also right across the street from a major streetcar stop. We didn't drive anywhere...either walked or took the streetcar. We splurged on room service a couple times, and the food was good and came in large portions. The complimentary breakfast was also good. We wish we would've eaten in the restaurant. I would definitely stay here again...everything was great, and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the corner of Canal and Bourbon. The Bourbon House restaurant is on the lobby level, we ate there for breakfast and it was pretty good but nothing great. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was just normal, nothing fancy. Check in allowed us to check in early! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Nixie-USA
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here this July. It was nice but had a few issues. The first was that the sheets were stained with what looked like blood. Due to flight delays, we didn't get check in until about 2am and after realizing that the sheets were clean and the stain as old, we avoided that section of the bed (it was a king size) and went to sleep. If it had been earlier, I would have insisted on new sheets. It was a stain that the person making the bed had to have seen too. That sheet should not have been used in a guest room! It did make me wonder if cleaning corners had been cut elsewhere. The other problem in the room was the air conditioner. The panel was off the wall and just resting next to it and sticking out. We asked if it could be reattached (it appeared to be missing its screws) but it was never taken care of. It also was having trouble keeping the room cool evn though we set it for as low as it could go. It was a little but cooler than average for NOLA in July when we were there so it wasn't horrible but if it had been normal temps, it would have been uncomfortably warm. Now the good: fantastic location! It has a little bit of street noise (but it's a city so of course!) but overall was a quiet hotel so you could enjoy the French Quarter but still get away from the hubbub when you wanted to. The staff was very friendly and everyone said hello when they passed you in the hallways. Common areas were clean and check in was easy. Checking out was a little harder but that was because they let us have a late check out and we happened to hit a tour group checking in as we were trying to check out. It happens! The room was nice. There was a lot of room to spread out in (and lots if counter space in the bathroom!) The bed (with clean unstained sheets) was very comfortable. It was great to have wifi and coffee in the room. I know there have been some complaints about the brand of coffee in the rooms on here so I wasn't expecting much but it was very good coffee! Overall, I don't know if I will ever go back to New Orleans. (It seemed to be a see it once type place but I am not opposed to visiting the city again either.) If I did go back, I would consider staying at this hotel again if the price wasn't too outlandish. I would recommend it to friends but not as a "you gotta stay here!" type place. But in all fairness, there is not where else I would recommend as a better choice either. I think the sheets issue is really what is holding me back from full reccomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Naw'lins Baby !!!”
Reviews.Author: mamabroxy
Reviews.Content: of the hotel, the service from the cleaning persons, they were very coopertive , and replaced things that needed to be replaced, towels, coffee, lots of sugar, and they were very pleasant , especially Jasmine, the best maid EVER ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jilfar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. The room was beautiful - clean and spacious. The staff were very helpful - especially Bull, who carried up our heavy bags. The only down side was the lack of a car park, but the valet service was very good and though we left at a very busy time, they were very quick to bring our car round. The location was great for exploring the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans - Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Wolfpacker34
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the place to stay on bourbon street this is a great option without paying the prices for the JW or Ritz. This hotel has an excellent bar and restaurant attached. I was going between average and very good for a few reasons. First I was in the historic end top floor and my view was an AC unit/wall for the next building. There was also vomit in the hall from where someone had a little too much fun the night before and was there until lunch. Otherwise this is a great location and somewhere I would stay again if I visited.

Reviews.Title: “first time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lisalaughs
Reviews.Content: We were here for a convention in the hotel. The room was clean, beds comfortable, linens soft. A bit of a musty smell in some areas of hotel. The hotel is located on corner of canal and bourbon streets. Very good street band playing lively music. Can hear street sounds at all hours. The hotel restaurant had the best food that we were able to find in the french quarter area. I am vegetarian and was able to find options. Hotel is just a couple of blocks down from a courtyard that serves beignets, and has excellent musicians playing music with soul. Beautiful. My son and I had the rooftop pool all to ourselves!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and attention to details.”
Reviews.Author: Latinliver
Reviews.Content: Great looking hotel with a great location but thats about it. The service at the desk?... Non existent. Good luck getting the agents to look you in the eye or even say hello as you walk by the desk. Room cleanliness? More like lack of it. We found dust everywhere, a leaky shower, carpet filthy, mold by window and garbage behind tv from prior guests. The AC went down twice in my first two days and the second time took over an hour for someone to come out. For a hotel with so much character, it doesn't seem to have rubbed off on the staff. Unfortunate considering the city has so much personality.

Reviews.Title: “hotel and restraurant”
Reviews.Author: Wayne T
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent in all resoects The Landing Restraurant service and food was so good i felt like maving in. The steak was truly the best i"ve ever had, there breakfast was the same. The staff was friendly and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but front desk & maintenance service horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jamie G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a concert. When we return to our room after the concert we couldn't get into our room. It took 20 mins for someone to come & look at our door. They couldn't fix the problem right away so told us to go do something at 11:30 at night & they would fix it. So we left well when we came back later on the door was still not fixed!!! The never fixed our door. So we had to wait another 20 mins if not longer for the maintenance man to come let us in again!! Then we had problems with our AC. When I told the front desk the morning I was leaving all they wanted to do was give me complementary breakfast. First I dont go to NO often so wont be going back for breakfast. They were just no help on service. It was a very big inconvenience to us with all the room trouble we had!! So I paid almost $200.00 for a room I couldn't get into when I wanted too.

Reviews.Title: “Walk out into the festivities”
Reviews.Author: Sheena T
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good property as a whole. It is dated but still well kept. The service of the staff is excellent and the location could not be better if you are looking to be in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: cityrider76
Reviews.Content: Made a last minute over night reservation here and I was leery due to the Bourbon St location. The rooms were well taken care of, nice and clean however. I did note that the mattresses had bed bug proof encasements which made me feel better as well. The quality of the hotel is on par with a typical Marriott or Hyatt chain hotel and it seemed much nicer then the other places we passed on Bourbon St. The hotel also included ear plugs and eye covers on the bed in case the street noise is too much- but I personally didn't use them and was fine- it was a week night during a slow time however. The bell staff and check in desk staff were very efficient and helpful. Two notes- the hotel rooms did not feature balconies overlooking Bourbon St- which suited me perfectly- however if that's the type of establishment you're after I'd look elsewhere. I would also note that the only area of disappointment with the hotel was the valet service. When we arrived (at an off peak time) it took 15 minutes for the valet to take the car. When we left the next morning it was FAR worse though. No one answered when we called down @ 8 am for the car so we went directly ton the valet stand. We waited for more than 45 minutes for our car with a crowd of angry guests. It was awful and seemed to be the only area that was really under staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie W
Reviews.Content: Truly a home run with this hotel! Outstanding location, outstanding accommodations, outstanding service and, for our most recent stay, outstanding value. Most of the time I have not been that impressed with the benefits I've been offered as a Platinum Ambassador. However, not the case with the Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor-New Orleans. They made me feel very valued as an elite member of the Priority Club rewards program. I cannot say enough about how pleased my wife and I were with the experience we had at this hotel. We were pleased with the service we received from all of the employees we dealt with, but special kudos go to the ladies at the front desk and the ladies in the executive lounge. From our perspective it's a great place to stay in the heart of the French Quarter. I know we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: MLabrie
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel couldn't be better and the staff more attentive. Bourbon Street is right around the corner with tons of options for food and entertainment. Sure the hotel needs updates, but it's still a great place to stay. I was made to feel important from the moment I walked in. Paul, the concierge, was extremely helpful and friendly and Pam at the Executive Club made sure I started my days off on the right foot!!

Reviews.Title: “Completely not worth the hassle....find another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dee D
Reviews.Content: As noted by other reviewers, the location is great. Right at the corner of Bourbon and Canal...walkable to any sites in the French Quarter, the River Walk, and the Casino. That is pretty much the only good thing about this hotel. The rooms are old and have this moldy, musty smell that just seems to soak right into your clothing. I had to wash everything I brought with me to get rid of the stench, even unworn clothing! The first room we were given had dirty linens on the bed, a dirty bathtub, and some sort of powder spill that noone bothered to try and vacuum. The second room was slightly better, but the odor was horrid. The front desk is non-responsive. Our smoke alarm was beeping and it took 3 calls to send up a maintnenance man that took the thing off the wall, promising to return with a new one and never coming back again. I was charged for parking when I had no car and the front desk staff was excessively rude when I tried to correct the error. All-in-All...if you want to stay at a shabby hotel, with a relatively nice lobby, stinky/dirty rooms, and rude staff - this is the place for you...else, I'd keep looking. The Sheraton on Canal is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Valet service has not improved”
Reviews.Author: pflovett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on new years eve and complained about the valet and the service is still expensive and inefficent. The executive lounge is still great with a good variety of local food choices . The rooms were very spacious and comfortable and the staff was very accomidating to us and our children. The hotel is walking distance to the riverwalk , convention center, downtown, and the marketplace. You have to pay 10for in room wifi even for platinum members.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Des1Edmonton_Alberta
Reviews.Content: The Astor Crowne Plaza is a historic hotel but comes with all the comforts and amenities of today's accomodations. Good location for walking around Canal Street and French Quarter. Room was excellent and air conditioning a must for July heat. Bed simply wonderful which will help when you wander in after a day of melting in the sun and a night soaking up Bourbon Street. Occasional musicians right out hotel door which adds to the flavour of New Orleans. Be sure to walk down Royal Street near by for lots of antique shops, vintage jewellery and art work by local artists. Jackson Square close enough to enjoy an evening stroll to get your Tarot Cards read. Plenty of bars and live music on Bourbon Street, take your pick or go slightly off Bourbon for a good meal at Muriel's (801 Chartres Street) or Antoines Restaurant which is a hidden treasure of history and good food. In the Astor Hotel there's plenty of good menu choice at the Bourbon House restaurant, and if you love seafood you will have difficulty choosing. The Astor is a good location for walking in New Orleans, and if you get tired just flag a bicycle rickshaw or take a horse and buggy tour around the quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Joenn
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. It's in the heart of everything you want to see in New Orleans. And while there's a few things I would add to the rooms, like more counterspace and refrigerators, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Travis P
Reviews.Content: I loved every minute at the hotel. If you come please ask for Loren Collins and Brionne Grisset at the front desk. I came down on a bussiness trip with Best Buy and those two ladies took care of me the entire week I was here. If Im ever in town I will definitely be coming back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: rnrkitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the National Lutheran Youth Gathering. This hotel is very beautiful and convenient. However, I would not make this my first choice for a number of reasons. We were on the 3rd floor, and were not allowed to take the stairs anywhere. This is a huge waste of resources. Often we would be waiting for 20+ minutes to get an elevator down to the lobby. Our toilets kept plugging up. Gross. It took them forever to come and fix it, and multiple phone calls. The pool is extremely small. Also, there was a storm one day, and it took ages for the TV and internet to be fixed after they went down. Now, the GOOD STUFF The beds...OMG the beds. I don't think I even moved when I slept they were so comfortable. They give you eye masks and earplugs, but we never needed them. The fitness center was fantastic. We were traveling with a large group of athletic boys, and this thrilled them to no end. My biggest gripe with "nice" hotels is that nothing is ever free..if you're paying that much for a hotel room, something should be free!!! Breakfast, or internet, or something. I would opt for a Holiday Inn Express over this hotel, but if you're one who prefers a luxury hotel, then this is a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience or even that good”
Reviews.Author: Beepme
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans about 8 times a year. I decided to take the family and try out this hotel. Usually, I stay at the Sheraton or Amrriott. I Reserved room in tower and upon arrival was told some organization had bought out the tower and we were forced to stay in an older room with old brick walls and horrible view. To make matters worse, my duaghter had been looking forward to the pool and we were told we would have to go next door to the Holiday Inn and use thier pool---can you believe that?? I never heard of paying for a room and being sent next door which really isn't "next door". No free internet in the room, no breakfast included, old, very cramped room...Spend the extra $$ and stay just down the street at the Sheraton or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TxTraveler7997
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New Orleans for my birthday, and we brought along 2 other couples with us. We all stayed here, and none of us had any problems with the hotel. My husband and I had both read the reviews on here about the "excessive noise" at night, but we never really noticed it after about 11:00 PM or so. We would hear a band start playing each night around 6:00ish, and then by the time we came back to our room (which was never past 11/11:30), it had quieted down. The hotel was clean, the pool was nice (although a little small), and the bar/restaurant downstairs was great, too. And the location was fantastic. I liked being sort of on the edge of the French Quarter because we could walk out of the hotel and be on Bourbon Street, yet we weren't right in the middle of all of the noise. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Years-- Two Very Different Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Windcurrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza Astor New Orleans in March of both 2011 and 2012, during our children's Spring Breaks, on our way to other states. We had very different experiences on the two visits. In 2011 we arrived in the early afternoon and were given rooms facing an alley. We slept very well, found the hotel staff very pleasant, and were genuinely happy with the food from room service. The location, on a slightly seedy part of Canal Street, isn't ideal with children, but we had made the reservation from the road during a peak travel season, had trouble finding any rooms in New Orleans, and were grateful to have found space in a hotel that close to the French Quarter. In 2012 we arrived at night, after a long drive. When I mentioned our reservation request for a room in a quiet location, the clerk was honest enough to admit that nothing like that was available, but then said that she was upgrading us to 2 king suites, which were next to each other, which would make us very comfortable with the children. The bedrooms both faced right onto Bourbon Street, which meant that the New Orleans party noise went on until dawn. There seemed to be no glazing on the windows to cut the sound. Luckily, I had a fan in the car. I used that and ear plugs and managed to sleep. My husband, who can normally sleep through almost any noise, didn't sleep at all. I wouldn't stay there again unless I was guaranteed a room away from Bourbon Street. New Orleans is a party town, but you don't want to try to sleep in the epicenter of the party.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're forced to....”
Reviews.Author: OnthegoSA
Reviews.Content: Asked for a quiet room - left for dinner and returned to a convention of teenagers. My room was right in the middle of them, and the same with my business associates on another floor. We had about 2 hours of sleep with the following day a busy one. The phone didn't work in my room - had to use my cell phone to call security, and again to order hot tea (no tea bags in room - no bottled water either). Door to the bathroom opens right in front of the sink. Just a run-of-the-mill, poorly managed property. No one at the front door to valet park either.

Reviews.Title: “Staff facilitated a robbery us and then blamed it on us”
Reviews.Author: Darren215
Reviews.Content: We checked in 9:30pm on a Wednesday night. There were three people in the hotel lobby that knew we checked in all staff members. We brought our bags to the room and went out to eat. I was the last to leave my room, I ran back in to grab my iphone (thank goodness) and shut the door. When we came back ~12:00am, my laptop bag was gone, my friends camera, and expensive bottles of alcohol were all taken from the room. No signs of forced entry or anything. When we called the hotel staff to report the incident, they had no interest whatsoever to help us, make us feel better, or feel safe. In fact, they first question was "Are you sure you brought your laptop?" I was absolutely sure I did, because the robber was actually very courteous and left my house keys and my wedding invitations (both were in my laptop bag) nicely stacked on the bed. There second question was are you sure you locked the door. Normally both of these questions would be legit questions to ask, however, after repeated assurances that we were certain of both facts, the staff continued to press the issue like it was our fault. I later found out why they kept pressing the issue because they not only did not want to be charged with a crime but they wanted to cover themselves insurance wise. The insurance company called me a month later and said that the hotel told them that I stated, "I was not sure that I brought a laptop nor was i sure I shut the door behind me." When we asked them to check the security cameras, they said they didn't have any, and that it would be an "invasion of privacy". Last time I checked, most hotels have security cameras everywhere including the hallways. We didn't expected much, but they really didn't give much nor did they give us an reassurance that it wouldn't happen again. The next day when we talked to the day manager, I noticed that the girl that check us in was watching us out of the corner of her eye as we were talking to him. I don't know what her reason was, but it didn't look or feel right. In any event, the day manager also was not very helpful, but at least he told us that he would contact the insurance company and gave us his card to contact him if we had any further questions. After wasting a full day of trying to get some help from the hotel staff, we decided to drop the issue and try to have a good time. However, the staff would not let us do that. On our last day there, we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant, for whatever stupid reason. It took them 1.5 hours just to get our food AND they messed up our order. The manager did his best to make things better, but still brought us the wrong order. The food was also over priced. You could easily get the same quality food right out side for less than half the price. We thought we would finish up the trip with a nice lunch at a "fancy restaurant" and it ended up being the worse meal we had in New Orleans. On top of all this, we had "fantastic" bell service. We had left our bags with the bell service before eating and when we went back to get them (1) rather than getting our bags, they brought us into the conference room and made us pick up our own bags. (Doesn't usually bell service mean "I'll bring your bags wherever you need?" (2) They lost one of our bags. When we said we had nine bags, their inital response was, "are you sure you had a blue bag with a brown handle?". Their second response was "I don't know what happened to your bag, I put them all right here." Rather than going to look for our bag. I sawed they had moved our bags from the bell room to the conference room. When i asked if maybe they bag was in the bell room, the bellman's response was, "No, i put all the bags in that room." So I walked over they myself, and pointed out the bag, right there on the first shelf. Rather than apologizing, he starting getting defensive and giving us excuses. I don't know if he was just lazy, or trying to steal our bag, but it doesn't matter. I'm a pretty low maintenance guy and this by far was the worse experience I've ever had. I've stayed in 2 star, 3 star hotels/motels and gotten better service. I stayed at Crowne Plazas in other cities, and this one just doesn't compare. I don't think this is a real Crowne Plaza. Bottom line - The rooms are actually nice to sleep in BUT sub par service; sub par food SUB PAR SECURITY. If you stay here, bring your valuables with you, don't leave anything in the room. Don't expect the staff to help if you need something. Expect 1 star service and security and you'll be straight.

Reviews.Title: “Great for French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: PhilbeachTraveller
Reviews.Content: Being an older hotel, our room was on the small side but very nicely decorated. The aircon was a bit temperamental (freezing at night but not very efficient during the day). Bed was big and comfy but would be a challenge for vertically challenged people as it was very high. The bathroom was a bit cramped and very little space to put toiletries etc. The coffee maker was in the bathroom which I found extremely bizarre, if not a tad unhygenic. The hairdryer was the best I've ever encountered in a hotel - very powerful. WiFi was a bit funny - couldn't connect in the room for free but if you go into the lobby and connect down there, it'll work in your room (for 24 hours). Reception staff could have been better. We were part of a group of 35 and we were given the wrong room - not a huge deal. Instead of just changing the names around, the receptionist kept insisting we go and knock on the door of our 'real' room and ask our fellow travellers to switch. As it was already about 10 pm, we really couldn't see the point in disrupting them and so asked the receptionist to just change the booking which I could see she really took umbrage with. As it turned out, I'm not sure she actually did this as to connect to the WiFi you have to type in your name and room number. If I had been naughty, I could have charged things to the other couple as they were still registered to our room number. Other people in our party had issues with Reception, mainly lack of responsiveness or the impression that they didn't actually care. Being in a busy part of the city, we had no problem with noise. The lobby/common areas were nicely decorated but busy with a lot of functions so was sometimes hard to negotiate through the crowds. The bar got very busy at the weekend, with only one bartender so they need to look at staffing levels during peak times. Our tour operator had arranged for us to have breakfast included (I don't think it normally is) and this was served in one of the conference rooms. Pretty poor choice and the 'bouncers' or whatever they were, fairly rude and unaccommodating. No cereal or toast until we asked and then it was brought up reluctantly. This may not be the hotel's fault as I'm not sure what our tour operator arranged, but it could have been dealt with a bit better. It's a great location though and nice to be in an older building with more character.

Reviews.Title: “Work Conference”
Reviews.Author: NWlivin
Reviews.Content: I came here for a work conference. The location was great and has a nice bar with many areas to meet up with attendees when not in the conference. The room was comfortable, I was on a high floor so it was not loud. The service was lacking and though I asked for help with the hair dryer many times, I never did get any help. I would like to visit New Orleans again but would maybe like to check out other hotels. The wi-fi is AWFUL here, normally I would not care but for a work situation it is frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Kasidie
Reviews.Content: Given how dirty and "wet aged" Bourbon Street is (still a lot of fun, just calling it like it is), we expected the hotel to be a bit down and perhaps moldy. We were pleasantly surprised! It is very clean, up to date, with great bed linens and - very important - fantastic room air conditioning. The rooms are fairly standard in size, but still adequate. Ours faced Bourbon Street and the noise proofing was pretty good. And it was easy getting a taxi whenever needed. Loved our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the regular people”
Reviews.Author: samsearay
Reviews.Content: Our arrival was a bit harried because the exit sign blew away in Katrina, and was never replaced.The bellhop informed us that people ask him "what happened to the sign" ten times a day!!!! We followed our noses to the next exit before the bridge, and some very kind delivery drivers, directed us to Canal St. Two blocks to the left. It was a miracle, but there was our hotel!! The room was very nicely appointed, We were treated very well by all the staff. One valet in particular went out of his way the morning of July 2nd . We had rented a mustang convertible. He HAPPILY repacked our trunk at the curb with a smile on his face and a GREAT attitude. He gave us the best directions to get back to I10. My husband and I both work in the hospitality business, and your staff is doing an excellent job. From the curb to the room and back.!!! Although i was not a fan of Bourbon St. I found the people of Louisiana to be very friendly. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in New Orleans...still needs improvements though”
Reviews.Author: muchfuntravelin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before when visiting New Orleans & the location is excellent...you're walking distance from everything! I would expect the location of the hotel rooms along Bourbon Street to be loud, but stayed on other side & the machinery that runs throughout the day & night outside our window was very loud & annoying. We are platinum members, but since we were with a group, we weren't given access to the executive floor/room. The rooms don't have refrigerators either, so we kept a cooler in our room. Many of the guests were leaving on Sunday morning & when I requested a bellman with a cart, I was told someone would be there soon. When I called again about 30 minutes later to request a later checkout so we wouldn't be charged for the extra day, the woman on the phone was rude to me. About 20 minutes later, finally a bellman arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Little improvement and would consider higher rating”
Reviews.Author: southerndreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights July 13 and 14th. We have stayed four or five previous times because of location it can't be beat for location. We are locals here in New Orleans. Hotel check in was very quick and smooth. Bellhop was quick and very good. Upon check in there were NO King beds which we requested or refrigerator for room we requested. Sleeping on a queen bed was uncomfortable when you are not use to one smaller bed. The queen was OK but felt cramped for two people. They only have a few refrigerators and not standard in each room as it (should be) for a four star hotel. Location is awesome. Ask for Canal Street side and higher room and you should be good to go. Lower rooms near Bourbon noise they give you ear plugs on check in. That should tell you it's noisy area at times. The only real issues I had valet called 8:30 Saturday morning waking us to get my key fob for car they needed to move my car valet key was said not to open car? They parked it Friday afternoon and Friday night. It worked then unless they never locked it so don't understand why they woke us up on Saturday morning? No one ever figured that one out? The hot water pressure on 13th floor kept going in and out during showers that maintenance was made aware of but never fixed, they blamed it on not turning faucet correctly but that was a line of bull The only thing they could immediately improve is heat the pool it was 50 degrees after a rainy week in New Orleans. Everyone wanted to swim and hang out but to cold to get in. A pool bar or drink service at pool would be a big plus for a four star hotel especially in this area. This hotel is walking distance to everything and I recommend. Hopefully they will read a few of these comments and address for better service. Hope this helps a visitor to the big easy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: princessria1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NOLA and I must say it definitely will not be my last. My friends and I stayed at Astor Crown Plaza during the Essence Music Festival July 5-8, 2012 and weâ€™re so glad we did. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. This hotel is located right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal Street. â€œThe Heart of it allâ€�. From the time we first arrived until our departure we had extraordinary service. The first desk attendants were all very pleasant and eager to assist anyway they could. Iesha was AWESOME! Greeted us with smile every time! Paul the Concierge was Awesome as well. Always available and greeted you with a hand shake and smile. The Security there was excellent, even with the crowds and all the entertainment I always felt very safe. We stayed on the sixth floor over looking Bourbon ST. We had a view of the beautiful rooftop pool and noise was never an issue. The Bourbon House Restaurant was always clean, the waitress and hostess were polite and the food was great, brought out in a timely manner and everything prepared fresh! The bell guys were pleasant so were the Valet in getting you transportation when needed. I could go on and on but to sum it all up, would I stay here again ABSOLUTELY! If youâ€™re coming to NOLA anytime soon, this is definitely where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: terrylovesthesun
Reviews.Content: The airport shuttle takes you there for $20.The best location for site seeing! I walked and got on the trolley right in front of the hotel. Huge, clean rooms, staff friendly and helpful. The pool great to cool off after walking in the heat! Free internet in the lobby with key card. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Keishac
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at my favorite hotel in New Orleans during Essence Festival. All I can say is location, location, location! :) We love that it's conveniently located on the corner of Canal and Bourbon St. and you can basically park your car and walk the entire stay! Valet parking is always a little crazy during Essence Festival, but as I've said in my other reviews, usually valet parking is a breeze at Astor Crowne Plaza. Our room was on the 13th floor and I had a great view of Canal Street. Special thanks to Don Zimmer! You're the best! Also, Megan (front desk) and Merlin (concierge) for their great customer service! I can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not advise for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ranae J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor-New Orleans June 23-26, 2012. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that we did not have king beds because we booked through Hotels.com and are not guaranteed what we booked. So, we got two double beds instead. Since then, Hotels.com has told us that this is not customary. We went up to 3rd floor to check out the roof top pool. Well apparently they used some interesting angle shots when taking pictures of the pool because it is not bigger than a 20 person hot tub. Not to mention, it had a layer of scum floating on the top. Therefore, we did not get to relax in the pool at all during our stay. Our rooms were adequate and clean with plenty of pillows on beds and the housekeeping staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The only disappointment with the room was that there is no microwave and not refrigerator. The coffee in this hotel is sub-par. For the amount we paid, we should have at least been able to get a decent cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “How was your visit?”
Reviews.Author: Madalene U
Reviews.Content: The linen was changed daily. Fresh wash clothes and towels were also provided. Trash was taken out and the room looked nice whenever we returned back to the hotel. Most of all when we visited the priority breakfast cafe it was excellent. The hostesses were very polite especially Ms Dinah.

Reviews.Title: “NOLA rocks!”
Reviews.Author: LynnJohn333
Reviews.Content: On your next or first visit to New Orleans consider staying at this beautiful old hotel. Within easy walking distance of all French Quarter attractions you will savour the ambiance and friendly staff. Don't forget to try one of their delicious oyster Po' Boy sandwiches in the lounge...yummy! We were heading for a Western Caribbean cruise out of NOLA and the extra few days we spent at this hotel were wonderful. Explore all the nearby streets to find interesting shops and people!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlwiggins75
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here during the Essence Music Festival weekend and had a great time! The staff was really helpful and friendly. If you want to be amongst the action, this is an excellent location, which is on the corner of Canal and Bourbon Street. The only complaint was the valet parking was rather expensive; however the driver of the shuttle bus, Jimmy, was very friendly. We'll probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: william t
Reviews.Content: The water in the shower completely stop many times during your shower. The air conditioning in the rooms must be on a motion sensor cause when you leave the room & come back later the room is hot. That also happens when you go to bed, NO MOVEMENT NO AIR!! The valet tells you 10-15 mins call ahead to get your car but the phone call goes to a answering machine telling you to come downstairs to get help. It took 1hr to get my car, I almost missed my flight. I would never stay there again & would not even recommened it to my worst enemy. Please dont ruin your trip by staying here, WE DID!!!

Reviews.Title: “0 star customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: The only thing 4 star about this hotel is the elevator and housekeeping (the room was clean). The bathroom faucet was dripping. The service was the worst! On a hot Saturday, it took them 2 hours (we had to wait outside-nowhere to sit, it was sweltering) to get our previously valet-parked car, which was parked 3 blocks and 8 lights away--this is a far cry from the "just give us a call 15 minutes before you leave" that we were instructed to do when we dropped the car off. When we came back that evening, we asked the lady at the front desk how to avoid that nightmare when we were leaving on Sunday. She just kept repeating the same thing: to call 15 minutes before we were ready to leave. We tried to explain that we did that earlier that day and no one answered. When we asked if we could just call the front desk if no one answered the valet parking number, she said no because all she was going to do is forward our call back to the number that no one answered. Her face said "I don't really care". She was interrupting, abrasive, and extremely frustrating. She didn't have anything to say except call 15 min before you leave, like a broken record. No' I'm sorry', 'let me find out', or anything. A kind or understanding word here would have gone a long way, instead we were made to feel like we were unwelcome and bothering her. She was so Freaking Rude!! This woman was actually in the middle of stapling people's parking bills together along with another sheet of paper that said we would be taking a shuttle bus to the parking garage the next morning. We got this shoved under our door later that night. Did she not read the darn thing? Or was she being sarcastic by repeating the 'call 15 minutes before you leave' mantra. Wow. Will never go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Someone snuck into our room and stole stuff (probably hotel staff, since there were no signs of a break in).”
Reviews.Author: LAtravel8
Reviews.Content: Came back to the room last night and noticed that our camera, a laptop, and a couple bottles of alcohol were missing. Security seemed to not care and had an attitude, so we called the police. They came to write a report, hotel staff still hasn't done anything. Guess this is normal at Crowne Plaza Hotels. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorGirl75
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. We stayed in the other side of the hotel which they bought out from another hotel. Our room was fantastic. Everything was pretty clean and the bed was comfortable. Megan and Dana at the desk were exceptionally helpful and polite. The pool is small but it's in a neat location. Downfalls of the hotel were that the valet service took a really long time to bring around cars and that some of the other staff wasn't as friendly or happy to help as Megan and Dana were. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff - Dinah”
Reviews.Author: Belkeno2k3
Reviews.Content: Dinah (a hotel staff) was an angel. She was a huge help and was alwzys very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious customer service”
Reviews.Author: Stephaniewynne
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel and was prepared for the valet parking situation. It was hot and chaotic, but that pretty much describes every parking lot in New Orleans. I could have overlooked that if it weren't for the incredibly poor customer service we received after a scary encounter with another guest. The hotel itself is centrally located and nicely decorated, the room was comfortable and fairly clean, although the toilet had been used and not flushed when we arrived. I also feel that for the price they charge for this hotel, a continental breakfast would have been a nice touch. These are nit-picky items and not a deal breaker, but the customer service killed any chances that we will ever return to ANY Crowne hotels. At 12:30 a.m. my family was woken by very loud banging on our door by an aggressive, loud intoxicated man trying to get in to the room. My children were terrified. My husband spent 15 minutes trying to convince the man that he had the wrong room. The man went down the hallway trying other doors before he came back to ours again. I called security while my husband again tried to get the increasingly belligerent man to understand that he was at the wrong room. Ten minutes later security arrived. The guard explained to the man that he had to stop knocking on doors and the man explained that he was a guest who had been separated from his group who had the key to his room. He was directed back to the front desk by the security guard and told to ask for a replacement key. The man left and we thought that was the end. Just about the time I got the kids calmed back down, the man was back, this time trying to use his key to unlock our door, and banging and yelling for us to let him in. My husband again told him he was at the wrong room, and he wandered off to try his key on several more doors before he left. In the morning my husband inquired at the front desk why the man was allowed to wander the hallways after he was given a replacement key instead of being escorted by hotel staff to the correct room. It was irresponsible of the hotel staff to let a belligerent, intoxicated individual wander the hallways in the middle of the night pounding on doors and yelling at the other guests. Not only was the staff completely unsympathetic and unconcerned, they refused to offer any sort of compensation. We were told that because we booked our trip through a third party, they had no responsibility or authorization to offer any compensation. We travel frequently and have received far better service at far less expensive hotels. We love New Orleans and expect that it will be loud, chaotic and full of drunks. That's part of the charm... what we also expect is to feel safe in our own hotel room and to be taken seriously when we have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Juli75452
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty and the rooms are a decent size. The staff is friendly. This was our 6th hotel to stay in during our 3000+ mile road trip, and to me it didn't quite measure up to the other places we stayed. If you are coming to the French Quarter, this hotel is in a great location. If you like a nice quiet cold room after a long hot day this might not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “very good!”
Reviews.Author: handeberilgen
Reviews.Content: i truly was not waiting the hotel to be this good for the price plus the location it was our first trip to here we loved it i would advise everyone to stay close to attractions and stay at this hotel i have already advised 2 of my friends to book here... thanks for the great stay...

Reviews.Title: “sort of an 'eye' of the storm”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaEagerEater
Reviews.Content: Located at Canal and Bourbon Street in the heart of the bustle and confusion that is New Orleans, this hotel is an oasis of cool and calm. On arrival, a pick-up brass band was jamming on the corner with street dancers dancing, watchers watching, drunks drinking. A treat for the eyes and ears and a great introduction to the weekend in the French Quarter. The check in was flawless and quick and we stayed three nights, enjoying most every minute. Our room on the 14th floor was quiet, the AC kept us under the blanket at night, and the restaurant on the first floor was first rate. We could however, hear the drum of what I assume was the building's AC system and was glad we were so high up. The river was visible from our window. The bell staff and valet crew were courteous, efficient, AND helpful. The room was only average sized and plainly furnished; luxury it is not. But it was clean and the linens fresh. The housekeeping is good. The pool was closed the entire time we were there based upon, so they said, predicted rain/lightning. I did point out that the sun was shining and had been so for quite awhile. The pool is tiny and not particularly scenic so it wasn't a deal-breaker for us. For the money (about $200 per night) it is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Was better on our last trip!”
Reviews.Author: Jjeennifer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two and half years ago and loved it because of the location and staff. This time the location...still great, concierge...so nice, and a young man named Justin who waited on us in the bar one night. We were so excited to be there, but the bellman didn't even offer to help us with our bags, and when we got to our room I stepped on wet carpet under the air conditioner. I thought it was probably just the humidity so I waited until the next day when it was sopping wet and smelled moldy and we were told to pack up and come down to the desk. We did and they put us in a room that was easily half the size of the first(same size bed), for the same price. After unpacking I spoke with the girl at the desk, she was very sweet and she explained she wasn't the one that moved us, and told her very kindly that surely there could be some kind of compensation since the room and bathroom were so small. I did end up with free Internet (9.95), but we were disappointed. When we left the bellmen who in the past were so friendly, greeting us each time, never did, and acted bothered to hail us a cab when we checked out a week a later.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: sochatai
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff is very nice and helpful. The room was big and spacious. The hotel is located on the corner of Canal and Bourbon Streets. The hotel is elegant in style. I would not recommend this hotel for families with kids under 12. T-shirts and shorts are a little out of place at this hotel. There is a pool. but we didn't get there. Our room was on the 13th floor over looking Bourbon Street. We could hear the music and the louder people on the street, but they weren't annoying. My only comment is that they should have a small refrigerator in the room. There is plenty of room for one. The restaurant at the hotel has good food, but is a little on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: Was in town with friends for 2 nights and this place lived up to all the positive things I had heard. You cannot beat the location... hugging Bourbon Street and a short 4-block walk to Harrah's. I didn't get a chance to mingle with many of the employees since I wasn't at the hotel very much, but they all were professionally dressed and willing to help give directions. The only downside downside with this hotel is that they charge for wifi, and the rooms are a bit pricey, but it was worth every penny due to the upscale design of the place and the location. The rooms were large and spacious as well as very clean. I will be back to this hotel at some point in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JazboOttawa
Reviews.Content: I must echo the other reveiws. It is all about location. You face Canal with all the modern amenities, drug stores, shopping, restaurants and of course the street car stops. Walk 30 seconds and you start your adventures on Bourbon and the rest of the FQ. 5 minutes the other way and you are on the waterfront, casiono, aquarium, shopping etc. Nice room, maybe a little worn, but still in good shape, good bathroom, TV etc. Most importantly the air conditioning worked very well. The front desk staff and the bell captain were the nicest folks in the world. We thought the cost was well worth the convenience of staying at Canal and Bourbon. The only downside would be the indifferent service and high prices of a hotel breakfast. Normally we do not have breakfast in a hotel, but we had not had time to scout the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Greatness!”
Reviews.Author: TheGaret
Reviews.Content: Location! Location! Location! At the corner of Bourbon and Canal Streets! Centrally located. In the middle of everything. Bars, scenery, fun, fun and more fun! Room is great! Old building with lots of character. Bed was perfect after long days of hitting the sights! Great value. Will stay there my next time around..

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: KennyT52564
Reviews.Content: I held my 30 year class reunion at the Astor Crowne Plaza this past weekend. I cannot express enough gratitude to the staff of the hotel. Ann Broussard in catering went above and beyond for us. She was always available and anticipated our every need. I booked the evnts through a local destination management company Louisiana Travel Services who also did an outstanding job of organizing our events, meals, and hotel room block. This took the pressure off of me of having to arrange all the payments, feild all those questions my classmates had, and I highly reccommend hiring them if your planning something in New Orleans. They also were on site at every event which allowed me to just be a guest at my reunion. Thanks Angelo and Melanie. I did get one surprise when I arrived at the hotel. I had been upgraded to a suite by the Hotel Manager because LTS requested it. What a treat! I have stayed in many hotels throughout my years and I can honestly say that bed was my favorite! I would also like to mention Ben in catering who attended to our dinner dance on Saturday night. All I can say is he is remarkable. This was simply the best experience I've ever had planning our reunion! The Astor Crowne Plaza cannot be beat if you want the best that New Orleans has to offer! THANY YOU ASTOR and LTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection - A True Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in New Orleans on Memorial Day weekend last year and we, along with the majority of our out of town guests stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza. We experienced a death in the family as we were leaving for the wedding which caused our last stay at the Astor to be a complete blur to do wedding festivities and planning for a funeral. For our one year anniversary we rented a condo on the beach in Alabama and saw it fitting to stop in New Orleans for a night and stay at the Astor again. It was nothing short of perfection! Upon check-in we realized we had been upgraded to a suite with access to the executive club.The suite was similar to the room we stayed in for our wedding weekend, what a treat! I am not sure if this was a coinidence or if the staff at the Astor caught that we were repeat guest from our wedding and arranged it but either way, it was a delightful surprise and an amazing start to our anniversary weekend! From the front desk staff to the bell hops - the Astor staff is AMAZING and makes you feel right at home. You are immeditately greeted with a friendly smile upon getting out of your vehicle, refreshing after a 4 hour drive! As a sales manager in the hospitality industry I can only hope that my staff treats our guests as the Astor team does. I would, and do reccommend this property to anyone and everyone I encounter who are traveling to the French Quarter. You will not find a better location, more friendly staff, better decor or a more comfortable bed in New Orleans! My husband and I are going to make a point to travel to New Orleans a few times a year and will ALWAYS select the Astor Crowne Plaza for overnight accomodations! I can not thank you enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LauraG72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convient to the French Quarter and the trolley lines. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The concierge is very helpful and helped us book a trip to a plantaion, and gave us suggestions and directions for the Garden District. Our room was on the second floor so it was a bit loud on a Saturday night with the noise of Bourbon Street, but it quiet the other nights.. Try to ask to stay on a higher floor so the noise won't bother you. Overall a very nice hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love”
Reviews.Author: Toni M
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the Astor for a wonderful stay. I will list my favorite things about this hotel. Location is great. The beds are dreamy. The customer service top notch, Pam in the 4th floor executive club was so sweet and very helpful, she makes the best coffee in town. There is a valet named Bernard( I think) who was very nice in spite of the busy pick up and drop off area in front. Can I think of something they could improve on? Not really. Good Job Astor, well played. Toni

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Bed Bug problem. The young lady at the front desk was completely unhelpful. Reported to Manager Irving Jackson. He was equally indifferent. It is a nice place. How could the staff be so poorly trained? My wife is now miserable and needs to visit Kaiser for treatment and prescription.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location but very small pool.”
Reviews.Author: Snuffypoo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Astor Crowne plaza hotel was made most enjoyable by the very knowledgeable concierge Paul Kernen. He was a pleasure to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service? They get it!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian3
Reviews.Content: Unsure why there are a few negative reviews here, this hotel was well above-par, and I've travelled extensively. Have to commend the concierge staff - Paul Kernen was especially attentive, helpful and engaging. If there was a question, it was answered in a professional, courteous fashion. The bell captain was a riot. Good fun and always with a smile. The front desk staff was also terrific. Couldn't do enough for you! Five-star service. The location - as mentioned in other reviews - is ideal. Right at Canal and Bourbon, and within walking distance of great shopping, antiquing and of course, restaurants. The one slight criticism I'd have has nothing to do with the hotel, but found it difficult to round up a 'healthy' meal. It's great to eat rich for a couple of days, but a salad would be nice. Two breakfast joints didn't even serve fruit as an option....eggs, bacon, pancakes was about it...but I digress. Also, pay heed to what the staff tell you. There are some extremely dangerous neighbourhoods within a few blocks of the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, surly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gordosmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza, Canal Street, New Orleans for 2 nights in April, 2012. Our first i pression was unfavourable. As we pulled up in a cab, four bellhops were standing a few yards away shooting the breeze. The cab driver put our bags on the sidewalk and the bellhops ignored us. We wheeled them ourselves into the hotel. The receptionists, uniformly young and attractive, were also unformly sour-faced. We were checked in such a perfunctory manner it bordered on rudeness. Things impoved markedly on entering our room. It was excellent. Spacious, well furnished and well up to the tandard epected of a quality hotel. Unfoertunately, the perceived attitude of staff contrinued with the barmen and waiters in the house bar. Perhaps because it was the weekend of the French Quarter Festival staff were under pressure.Whatever the reason attitudes need to be improved. On checking out I was asked how I enjoyed my stay. I related the above experiences. The recptionist said she was mortified as she remembered checking me in. I told her a smile and an "enjoy your stay" can work wonders. She apologised pofusely. I expect the next few people she checked in were treated more warmly than my wife and Iwere

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jayme_ann_Matt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June of 2012. Front desk staff could have been more polite, all other staff were lovely. Rooms were nice and clean no issues there, Beds seam to be very high off the ground and you have to jump to get into them.. fantastic location Bourbon street is not even a minute walk around the corner. being so close to Bourbon street we didnt hear any street noise at all. which was good.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great! I highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: MHKtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just one night on business in early June 2012. Of course, I was likely the only person staying there on business, the remainder seeming to be at the corner of Canal and Bourbon for other reasons. Despite the odd mix of binge-drinking frat boys and families, everything seemed to work out OK and the rooms were very clean and well-appointed, the staff very friendly, and surprisingly quiet given the location. I suppose my not knowing what to expect made it a pleasant surprise but overall I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. It being a historic hotel is another bonus, but made up with modern amenities. If you are staying for a conference, don't bother with the faceless hotels down near convention center, give this one a try and enjoy being right in the heart of the fun stuff.

Reviews.Title: “OK Room, Bad Food, Fabulous Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: GAeventgirl
Reviews.Content: Don't miss the Concierge at this hotel. Paul Kernen is the BEST. He will help you plan excursions, book restaurants and has plenty of suggestions to make the most of your stay! His assistance was invaluable for booking VIP transportation at the last minute. You can reach him prior to your stay at conciergedesk1@astorneworleans.com. The hotel location is great if you want to be "in the middle" of the all French Quarter action. I was on business for one week and not interested in that. Fortunately, I was put on the 14th floor over the air conditioning units so the white noise blocked out everything. The view was excellent - overlooked the Hotel Monteleone/Mississippi. I could see the cruise ships pass by. For New Orleans, the hotel food was shockingly horrible. Dickie Brennan's Bourbon House Restaurant and Seafood Bar rents out space in the hotel and is the only in-house restaurant. For breakfast you can have the $24 buffet... that's the only option. Can't order off the menu. I suggest iHop down the street. And for a great dinner, ACME Oyster company is around the corner or the Redfish Grill is directly across the street. Room service was mediocre at best but I had to order breakfast twice. Both times items were missing or wrong. For $35, don't bother. The staff exudes the Southern Hospitality that you expect. The hotel is old and rooms are in need of a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: LatinDiva2nv
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect... Walking distance to everything... The ladies at the front desk were so super helpful from check in to places to eat things to see to check out!!! The entire staff was just so friendly!!! Great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed from Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Betty C
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, the suite set up, hotel staff were very helpful, especially the bell hops and the hard-working valet parking staff. The bed was very high and I had to stand on my tip-toes to scooch onto it backside first. It didn't occur to me to request a step stool as one other reviewer wrote, but that would have been smart. However, once on the bed, it was magical!! I have to find out what specific mattress they have because I honestly haven't sleep that well in a long time, very comfortable, the right amount of sheets, covers and pillows. We visited the outdoor pool which was very refreshing and, while being on the 3rd floor, gave the impression of being roof-top. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: crabbysue
Reviews.Content: Had great experience. Beautiful room on the top floor.The staff was so friendly and accommodating. The epitome of legendary southern hospitality. The only problem with the room was the height of the bed. I had to take a running start to leap into the bed! I did request a step stool to help climb into the bed, and they brought one right away. We are Priority Club members and requested and received a room upgrade, early check in and late checkout. The location of the hotel can't be beat, especially if you are going to be using the streetcars, just step outside the door. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an authentic New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip was as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: jkdrallen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 16th wedding anniversary in New Orleans and chose to spend it at the Crown Plaza. It was the saturday after thanksgiving and little did we know, the southern Classic football game was in town. HOWEVER, the staff, bellhops, and management were top notch in every way, and I even had patience simply due to the tone they used. The location is perfect for your downtown experience. We loved it so much, we're going back in July for a gathering. The room was clean, updated, and fairly quiet. We could not ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Nisha W
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, excellent location but on the Historical side the rooms are small. No free wifi in the rooms which it should be after paying the high rate but it is free in the Lobby, where they do that at and no microwave or refrigerator Overall good stay, clean, and nice staff. Wait too long for valet to bring your car.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: BobMQC
Reviews.Content: A couple of issues have unfortunately pushed me over to an overall negative view of this hotel. Spotting an insect in the bathroom was one. I think insects are unacceptable in a hotel charging over $200 and belonging to a major chain, reflecting poorly on the whole chain. In addition, the faucet in the shower was really hard to use, resulting in so-so water pressure. Dryer had to be replaced (after a reminder). Overall, the bathroom was a put off, there were some other (smaller) service issues, and the hotel in general leaves an impression of having seen better days. On the plus side, the rooms are of good size, quite, seem clean, beds comfortable and all the major amenities there. Staff was friendly, and the location convenient. The restaurant was awesome for dinner, though breakfast somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice of hotels in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Ashton B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend. The room was ok, but bathroom cleanliness is not their best attribute. The AC did not work properly the second night. Also, you could not call valet for your car, you had to request in person. On two occasions, I waited for approximately one hour for my car, as they brought the wrong car, twice. Valet needs to improve, they were friendly, but unconcerned. I will think twice about staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gisela E
Reviews.Content: During a brief visit to New Orleans we stayed at the Astor Crown Plaza Hotel. It is perfectly situated bordering the French Quarter at the corner of Canal and Bourbon Street and within easy walking distance to shops and many attractions. The staff was friendly, the room was spacious for a downtown location, well equipped, and the whole unit was very clean. On the downside the bed was very high and not being tall, I literally had to climb into the bed and getting out was a dropping off. I have no idea how a less agile person can manage.The bath was in need of upgrade.The shower itself was very nice but the bathtab had 3 fairly large black chipmarks, the cover of the shower dial was missing exposing the raw edges of the tiles and the temperature dial was so faded making it barely visible. The hairdryer was not very user friendly. There was no â€œonâ€� switch only a small rubber reset button on the side to turn it on. It had to be pressed really hard which I found out on the second day. Free Internet was only provided in the lobby not in the room. We were travelling for 2 weeks staying at various places and even far less costly places provided free in-room Internet and up to date bathroom fixtures.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, front desk was awesome with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Gj2005
Reviews.Content: My room was up high on the canal st side I was on the 13th floor. Anytime I had a problem front desk took care of my issues but when I asked to speak with a manager I was transferred to a Melissa who never answered. Meagan and Britney were very helpful with food and music places and also get the maintenance guys to fix my a/c and toilet promptly. Overall my stay was pleasant and I can assure you I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: argawana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Astor for 2 nights during the Memorial Day holiday. We always consulted Trip Advisor before booking a hotel for our holiday. Unfortunately most of the top rated hotel were already fully booked due to long week-end. Initially we were a bit cautious to book Astor because it was in the mid range of hotel rating in New Orleans. But what a surprise ! The hotel is in a great location in French Quarter, close to good restaurants and Bourbon St if you are up to parties and stuff; but still quiet enough so you can get good sleep. The room is huge and beds are comfortable. There are few bad reviews related to the valet parking, so we prepared ourself for the worst. Again, we were surprised that they are actually are quite efficient and helpful. They charged $31 for overnight parking. This is a fair price considering the location of the hotel is in the middle of attraction and I have no problem spending few extra dollars for that. I notice some hotels nearby charged $38 for valet. Overall : recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was very helpful ,especially the Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: litch722
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I found that Paul the concierge went way out of his way to help us enjoy every aspect of planning our itinerary in New Orleans,This was the first time in the city and he was very knowledgeable and efficient along with being very personable in our dealings with him. Top Knotch

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF BRITTANY @ Front Desk!!! Everything else was ok”
Reviews.Author: DWFRN
Reviews.Content: First...the good: The Hotel was nice, location great, located at the corner of Bourbon/Canal. This was great because you can easily walk (< 1 minute) down Bourbon St. for the night life, Hit CVS or Wall Greens right across the street if you need anything or hop on the trolly-street car that takes you into the Garden District. There are plenty of shops along canal as well. Also if you book tours, Its easy for the tour shuttles to park in front of the Hotel and pick you up since Canal is a large boulevard. They have a bar in the lobby thats nice, clean but small. The pool area is fair but the area around it is nice. The rooms were nice, cozy and very comfortable!!! Valet parking was $30/night which is standard for the industry. The business center was great, You can use the computer and print stuff for free. There were only 3 computers so I'd recommend going early or during off hours if you need to get stuff done for work etc. The second floor has a balcony that was great looking down on Bourbon street that have no seats but tables to set your drinks on. No glass allowed up there for obvious reasons. The staff with the exception of Brittany at the front desk (mid shift) were very nice and helpful. The not-so-good: I don't like sounding negative but I got to write an honest review. I stayed there 5 nights and would leave the room by 8:00 AM and return by 5:00 PM with no new towels nor the room cleaned every day of my stay. I'd have to call daily and request towels and cleaning. (the cleanings not a big deal but the towels I prefer changed) The staff was very nice and friendly when cleaning. The walls were thin...at least in our room. We could here very loudly the sinks being turned on, the showers running, people dropping things in the shower, toilets flushing. It didn't ruin any sleep or anything but just thought I'd mention it because we thought it was odd...that it was sooo loud. My worst experience of my stay was dealing with Brittany at the front desk.....I approach the front desk as she was talking to her co-worker about what she wants to do when she gets out of work tonight, I didn't interrupt because I thought she would stop and then assist me...uh nope she when on for 3 minutes until I finally asked if they were "open" after rolling her eyes and exhaling irritatedly she looked up and said with a VERY bad attitude "Yes...what did you need?" I don't want to make this review super long but I had the misfortune of dealing with her 3 more times....all 3 times she had the lazy, I don't want to be here attitude. I must say this bothered me the most because I couldn't believe the RUDENESS and LAZY attitude of this person....So traveler's BEWARE!! Approach with caution when you see Brittany...age 20-25 African American Female working the front desk.
