I didn't complain to the Management because I had my 87 year old Grand Father with me who hadn't been to NOLA since 1944 and is a WWII Vet. and that day I was taking him to the WWII Museum and with tours scheduled everyday I didn't want to have a time consuming delay by complaining about a bad employee. Aside from that, the stay was nice. Sometimes you got to take the good with the bad. All the other staff aside from Brittany were wonderful!! There was a huge wireless convention in town and that may have contributed to the rooms not getting cleaned etc.. Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Room 445 Executive level single King size bed”
Reviews.Author: Kaz I
Reviews.Content: Just checked out from this hotel we had great experience with staffs work there. They always wear a smile on their face. Their location is great for bourbon st or quick walk to harrah's. Their maid service does morning cleaning and turn down service at night. This room does need some attention on bathroom fixture. Grab bar and lower bath faucet needs to be tightened. Room is very large and feels somewhat empty since there are work desk, two chair with tabletop, dresser with flat screen TV and chair and ottoman that does not take too much of this room Restaurant in this hotel is great and if oyster is your thing, Acme Oyster bar is basically attached to the building. Since Crowne Plaza is the Brand's higher end hotel, I will come back to this location as long as I can keep per night cost down when I book.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: morunner
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for JazzFest and chose the Crowne Plaza off of a list. The location was perfect and luckily, we were on the 13th floor away from the noise. We were able to walk most places and took the RTA to the fairgrounds. The staff was very friendly. Pass on the breakfast in the hotel. We waited a half hour to sit and paid $50 for cold eggs. There are awesome places to eat off the beaten path (Johnny's PoBoys has a great breakfast for cheap). I would definitely stay at the Crowne again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot, but the little extras really made the difference”
Reviews.Author: NOLAKID
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay during Jazz Fest. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. What really made the hotel stand out for us, was when Miss Jackie our 13th floor housekeeping supervisor introduced herself and my Wife casually mentioned my birthday was in a few days. Well, on my birthday placed in our room was a beautiful gift basket and a lovely handwritten note. Miss Jackie even left us a phone message saying that she was off for a few days, and that she hoped we received the basket and that she hoped I had a great birthday. My only criticism of the hotel was that I am an executive club member therefore allowing me admittance into the lounge that serves a continental breakfast each morning. The breakfast was fine and so was the woman that supervises. The problem was the (two)corporate employees standing right next to the supervisor and watching her every move with their hands behind their backs. This was most unwelcoming. I understand these me were from corporate, but they might loosen the tie, this is New Orleans(during Jazz Fest), and observe from the table directly in front of the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but may not be worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: Meg1028
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for the first time for Jazz Fest 2012. This was the hotel we stayed at for most of our trip (4 nights out of 7,) and overall we were happy with this hotel. That being said, it was also quite expensive! The location is excellent, at Canal and Bourbon Street, and you can get anywhere you'd like easily. Much is within walking distance, including both the Canal St. and St. Charles streetcars, and there are plenty of taxis available out front also. Staff here were very friendly, as are most people in New Orleans, and there is tourist information available. The concierge, Paul was very helpful to us, making recommendations on sites and restaurants, and booking swamp and plantation tours for us as well! The rooms seems quite large considering the location of the hotel, and compared to other places we stayed in NOLA, butI was NOT overly impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms. The first room we went into had a dirty floor, including bobby pins on the floor that certainly were not mine, and when I went to move the blankets on one of the two beds I pulled out a past guest's itinerary that had been tucked under the fold, so who knows when the bedding on that bed had last been changed... I called down to the front desk, and they moved us to the room directly across the hall, but it certainly didn't seem to be a surprise to them that the room was dirty, and they did not really do anything to make amends for it, such as upgrading our room. The second rooms seemed to be fairly clean, minus the lampshade which appeared to be stained from water damage. It seemed like housekeeping was a bit lax, and arriving rather late, often after noon. The room was very quiet considering the location directly on Bourbon Street, but we were on the ninth floor, which no doubt helped dissipate some of the noise, but we were also pleasantly surprised by the lack of noise from other rooms and within the hotel. My husband did have some trouble sleeping due to the continual humming of the air conditioning units, but they do provide you with ear plugs, so if you are a light sleeper it may be worth using those. I would consider staying at this hotel again in the future, but only if the price was lower... And I would recommend this hotel with a few "disclaimers."

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: kbr0095
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here during 2nd weekend of Jazzfest and we had very little bad to say about the hotel. For one, the pool was awesome and overlooks both Bourbon and Canal Streets (although, for someone average height or shorter, you may need to use a chair to see over the walls). Second, not enough can be said about the location. Lastly, the beds were super comfortable and the room was next to immaculate. A few cons: 1. The room temperature didn't seem to be regulated very well. There was only one small vent on the far side of the room and despite having the thermostat cranked down to 66 (which is as low as it will go), there were moments where it felt stuffy. 2. Either the shower head or the water pressure were horrible. There never seemed to be a setting that felt strong enough to either of our likings. 3. Proximity to Krystal. We literally ended up there every night and my stomach surely payed the price the next morning (obviously this isn't the hotel's fault, but damn you Krystal!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Addie62
Reviews.Content: My firend I stayed at the Astor for 4 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. The rooms were nice and the beds very comfortable. We did not have such a great view, but that did not really matter. The hotel staff was very efficient and helpful in recommending restaurants. The location was ideal and we had a great time. I did have a problem that I was charged twice for the room in error, but Ms. Arionne in Accounting was very gracious and helpful on this matter and I thank her. Overall we had a great experience and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbWas
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights during Jazz Fest along with about 10 other rooms gathering for a wedding. My biggest complaint was that the rooms, all booked at the same time, months before, and for the same price were widely disparate in size and accomodation. Most asked for king standard rooms. We had a king sized bed in a very small room with a very small bath. Others in our party were given much larger rooms with two queen beds and one had a king bed with a separate sitting area. This may have been the result of a full house because of the Festival. Our room was on the second floor of the older section of the hotel. Lighting in the bathroom was very poor. Nowhere in the room was very suitable for make-up application. Also the ventilation in the bathroom was poor. Otherwise, the room was adequate and clean. While we were given ear plugs, we did not find the location on Canal Street to be noisy. A few sirens, but no partying. The lobby of the hotel was pleasant. The bell men and the concierge were very helpful. The front desk attendants were helpful, but seemed overworked. On Saturday morning at 10:00, there was only one attendant at the main desk. Check-in time was listed as 3PM on our reservation, but we were unable to get into our room until after 4PM. Not a bad experience, but I would try another place the next time I visited New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay right in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: LACastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Saturday night during Jazz Fest. It was so easy to valet the car, stow our bags and go explore the town early in the morning. We came back mid-afternoon when we were able to check right into our room and have our bags brought up. As Bourbon Street picked up in the evening we were concerned about the noise even though we were on the 12th floor. When we went downstairs we discovered there was a traveling band directly under our window. Later that night when we returned to the room, the band was gone and we never heard another peep from the craziness that is Bourbon Street. When we called for the car the next morning they were prompt in bringing it to us. Valet service is over $30 but all parking in New Orleans is at a premium. This hotel is in the perfect spot to catch the cable car to the Garden District which is cheap and worth the ride even if you don't depart and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Onlythebestwilldo78
Reviews.Content: Over all this is nice hotel. There are great views of Bourbon St. from a second floor terrace. I booked via a prepaid website and did not realize that I would be charged $31 for valet parking. Oh well... the guys working valet were so nice and gracious that it made the $31 well worth it. Kudos to them. I felt safe the entire time I was there. The hotel has security on the premises :0). The restaurant that is in the hotel lobby left a lot to be desired. I went to the bar to order dinner to take back to my room. I was ignored by both bar tenders for 5-10 minutes. Everything was a problem with them. The male bartender's name was Michael and I'm not sure of the female bartender. I'm not sure what the problem was but I had to ask them if they would take my order. Not how it should be. If there is a next time of staying at this hotel, I'll be sure not to eat at that restaurant. The rooms are a little dated, but it's not a big deal. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. Over all the staff at the hotel was nice (expect for the front desk staff...they could use some polishing). I won't let them spoil my overall feeling about the hotel. I'm not sure if I will stay here again in the future, but if I was assigned this hotel in the future, I would be fine with it.

Reviews.Title: “a good experience - try it”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxduo
Reviews.Content: Given the ups and downs of TA reviews, it was a pleasant experience to find the hotel to be a good accomodation in a good location with helpful staff.The room which was requested at reservation was assigned to us upon arrival. King room, high floor,view of Bourbon Street. The pleasant bonus was that they assigned us to the 12th floor. This is designated as a 'quiet zone' so there were no loud room parties or children running the corridors. It was quiet with no disturbances whatever during a week-long stay. There was no distubing noise from the street.There was only one occasion when one could hear a softly, muted sound of a sax for a few minutes. Rather enjoyable in fact. A gentle musical reminder that this was New Orleans - City of Musicians. The King room was spacious and the decor was soothing tones and in fresh condition. The bed was comfortable with a pillowtop mattress, a comfy arm chair and an ergonomically-correct desk chair. This made room service at the window a comfortable way to dine. Room service was timely and tasty for breakfast and dinner. One of the attractions of this property is the main floor location of Dickie Brennans Bourbon House for dining - it is a classic formal dining room. Dinner at the window was a must-do. The attached, casual Cypress Cafe was open for breakfast and lunch. All excellent menus. The attached bar in the gracious lobby was a hopping place with remarkably helpful bar staff. see separate reviews on al these. The location was great as read all on TA. As noted - Boubon Street at this end is rather surprisingly - one strip club after another. It is worth one stroll to experience the full length. The further one strolls along it the more improvement in architecture and atmosphere. Thereafter: a more tastful way into the heart of the FQ is upon exiting the hotel's front door, turn left onto Canal. Walk a few steps to Royal Street. Turn left on Royal. It has a more pleasant atmosphere with lots of galeries, antique shops and the Louisianna Supreme Courthouse. On this recommended street, there were more street musicians and an enjoyable stroll to Jackson Square and all that is at the heart of the quarter. Not to be missed is the third floor outdoor pool and patio. There are good views of Bourbon Street and plenty of choice in seating areas in sun or shade.Be aware that there is mostly shade in the mornings. The sunny areas begin after 1pm. It is a restful and relaxing environment with choice of table & chair conversaion areas or sun lounges. Worth a visit early in your stay. This hotel is recommended as a very good selection for the combination of ideal location, good quality accomodations and fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: This was really not what I was expecting. I have been in New Orleans before and have gone inside to use the restroom. The lobby area was nice so I decided I wanted to stay here if I ever returned. I did return only to be disappointed. We were suppose to have a room with a view and a pullout couch for the others. We walked in to find a great view of Canal St. only to realize there was no couch. We called the front desk from the room and all they could tell us was to come down. After getting a "new" room we opened it to find that it had a great view of a wall and not much else. The main bedroom was clean but when we pulled out the couch it was filthy. After going around and seeing the sights everyone needed to sleep because we were leaving for a cruise in the morning. We were kept up at night with not only the sounds of the french Quarter but others guests roaming the halls drunk and loud. We called the front desk and they said it would be taken care of. Only it continued until I just blanked out. When we left in morning we had to wait for quite a while until a valet brought a car back. We only had twenties on us and the valet said he couldn't break it, but since I was in a rush to hurry I just gave it to him. I'm extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: patk774
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 nights during the French Quarter Festival. The hotel was very nice - clean, nice-sized room, friendly staff. The location - on Canal Street between Royal and Bourbon - was fantastic. Our room had no view, but it was very quiet - no noise issues whatsoever. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelforanswers
Reviews.Content: Rooms were adequate and clean, except from a carpet stain here and there. Beds were very comfortable. Location is excellent, right in the middle of everything. A Mc Donald s is on the same block, great for a cheap breakfast. An Ihop is within two blocks. CVS just across the street was very convenient. Just be sure to ask for a high floor to avoid street noise ( sometimes musicians play right in front of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, located right off of Bourbon Street.”
Reviews.Author: mbberven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Astor for two nights while attending a business conference. The hotel was adequate, the room met my needs, I was located on the Bourbon Street side, I did not find it to be all that loud really. They provide ear plugs if you are sensitive to noice. My collegue was located on the other side and said it was "very" quiet, so option to request that side. Located right on Canal and Bourbon, many dining choices available. The conference rooms were great, convieniantly located and in good working order. I would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nemahbin
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - this hotel has that. All the local sights within easy walking distance. The staff was courteous and was there to please. Our room was one of the smallest rooms we had ever been in. It was in "inside" room not on a street side, so was quiet except for the soda/ice machine. The room did need a little repair - door did not close well, towel rack almost off the wall. It was, however, clean - bed and pillows very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “ideal downtown location”
Reviews.Author: The_Littlechilds
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean and i had a very spacious room. The windows did a very good job of blocking out the noise given the location, and the room had great air con as it was very warm during my stay. The staff were very professional and welcoming and I would make this hotel my first choice if I was to return to New Orleans. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “I Was Warned”
Reviews.Author: dbowdle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the weekend just before Mardi Gras with three friends. I had read earlier reviews that warned of the unbelievably poor valet service. To their credit, the hotel also warned me by letter that I should park at a lot about eight blocks from the hotel and take their shuttle. What the hotel failed to warn me about was the lack of shuttle service. After we checked out, we went out to the front of the hotel and talked to some people in the shuttle line who claimed that they had been waiting over 30 minutes. We decided to walk the eight blocks even though we were hungover. Not a great experience! On the positive side, the beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. We also enjoyed the balconies until we were kicked off so the hotel could hold a private function.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Bakers12484
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect. Paul, the consierge gave us the best adice and directions. Bourbon Oyster House (part of hotel) was the best with a great happy hour. Our guest room was spacious and beautiful and service was great! Registration was so welcoming and effortless that you knew you would good stay.You don't spend much time in your room in New Orleans but you want to come back to a clean quiet and restful evening especially after a night on Bourbon St. This hotel was perfectly located and a great choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place in a dirty city”
Reviews.Author: Handsomeman57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice clean escape from the fun but filthy streets of New Orleans and in particular Bourbon st. the location is perfect and central to everything. (Its on the corner of Bourban and Canal St) so once you get bourbon St. out of your system you are still close to everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on Bourbon Street!”
Reviews.Author: Fjeldbar
Reviews.Content: I really was impressed by this hotel. I have stayed at all Holiday Inn properties in the Quarter and have not been too happy with service or cleanliness of hotels! This hotel has professional staff, from housekeeping to desk personnel. Location is great, high floors do not seem to have a lot of noise( for being on Bourbon and Canal). Great restaurant ... Bourbon House, is connected to hotel! Wireless Internet is a $9.95 charge, even for Platinum members. That was the only negative that I experienced!

Reviews.Title: “SEC Championship Tournament”
Reviews.Author: TommyTSnowHill
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremely courteous and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant experience; however, the location of this property (corner of Canal & Bourbon Sts.) was rather seedy at best. One litterally had to negotiate a gauntlet of panhandlers, blaring music,and suspicious charity soliciters to get in and out of the lobby. Seven years after Katrina you could still smell that musty odor of standing water on the carpets for an extended period of time leaves behind. Or room also looked down on abandoned property that was a classic example of urban blight which further denegrated the overall impression. The amenities were nice but the end result was less than favorable. I would not go back to this property, nor would I suggest it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TJTarheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza over a 5 day period recently. It is located on the corner of Canal and Bourbon, making walking distances to all the hot spots an easy stroll: Riverwalk, Harrah's, Aquarium, Jackson Square, Cafe Du Monde, French Market. Pros: Location, comfy beds, and surprisingly quiet given its location at the rowdy end of Bourbon Street. Cons: cleaning of our room was hit-and-miss (forgot to re-stock in-room coffee one day, didn't leave any hand towels another day) and no bathroom in the lobby, which meant going 14 floors to the room when we were in the lounge. Right out the side door is a Krystal's Burgers (Bourbon Street side) where you can buy an eggs/bacon combo breakfast for under $4.00. Save the extra cash for the hard to beat New Orleans cuisine later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: firstswan
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in this lovely hotel, service was very good and the rooms were excellent, comfortable beds and you can't beat the location on the corner of Canal and Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras 2012”
Reviews.Author: love2travel160
Reviews.Content: OMG! We visited the weekend before Fat Tuesday and left Ash Wednesday, OMG! The room was spacious and clean. The location was wonderful for us considering, when we wanted to sleep, we werent interrupted by the noise from the street and party goers. The hotel is in an Excellent location, right on the corner of Bourbon St; excellent location! The only problem with the room for us was that the ac unit faced the head of the bed, so the air blew in our face while we slept. The resturant was expensive and the menu did not appeal to our taste ie if im not mistaken steaks nor burgers were on the menu, as were are allergic to seafood. However, we had breakfast one morning in a meeting room, can I say that was delicious and reasonably priced. The folks that prepared and served food were wonderful, along with the guy that kept our table clean from clutter was great as well. During this timeframe, occupants wore wrist bands to enter the hotel and the security was good about making sure stragglers didnt enter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hospitality and location but mostly hospitality”
Reviews.Author: espressotogo
Reviews.Content: Everyone was kind and helpful. when I asked for a room away from Burbon St. I got it. when I asked for a top floor room I got it. The room was clean, comfortable, and even though it was over 80 in the day outside, the room didn't even need a fan. It was quiet and couldn't hear the street noise at all. I will gladly stay here again. No problems, no attitude, only simply easy going time in The Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds HORRIBLE AC system!”
Reviews.Author: DSK1111
Reviews.Content: The location is is great! The beds were awesome but I will never stay here again because our room was hot! We had the maintenance man come in 3 times and finally decovered one of the chill lines was disconnected. The other 2 times we were told nothing was wrong it was just because it was an old chill system and if it detects no movement it turns OFF! It was horrible! We had to tolerate by leaving our door to the room open to get ready in the morning as the hallway and lobby worked great! I tried to place an order to eat through the bartender but I was ignored so I finally had to go sit at a table in the restraurant to order! That took 10 min to just get someone to come to the table and do that. We used 30,000 extra points to stay here but let me tell you it will not happen again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service.”
Reviews.Author: miraong
Reviews.Content: We were booked here by our travel agent. We rented 3 rooms. We arrived different times but had the same treatment. Receptionists are very abrupt and not very helpful. They had problems with our booking and did not even try to help us figure it out, I tried to explain but she keeps interrupting my explanation and keep insisting that it is what it is. The room is big and clean, but the bathroom is dirty and rusted. Very noisy at night and you can hear your neighbors and the noise outside, they did give us an ear plug. Checking out was the same thing, different receptionist but the same "I don't care don't bother me" attitude. So disappointed will not stay here anymore, there are more hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: derbycityvisitor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel March 30-April 3 for the Final Four. The hotel is at best a 2 to 2.5 star hotel with 5 star prices. It is abundantly clear that this hotel could use a major shake up in General Managers as the service was some of the poorest we have ever experienced. It started with our first enounter at the hotel bar where the bartender yelled to a guest of the hotel to come get his drink. The bartender remarked (under his breath that this may be called the "Big Easy" but it is not the "Big Work"). So, my wife took the drink that the bartender made over to the guest. The next sorry service experience was at the hotel restaurant. We tried to have our first breakfast there. I mean really, how can anyone mess up breakfast?? We had to wait for 45 minutes before our order was taken and then another 45 minutes before finally being served. To make matters worse, when the food arrived for two of the four guests at our table it was unedible. There was never any apology for the delay in taking our order or the delay in bringing our food. When I asked to speak to the manager about the food, I was informed that he "was too busy". When we arrived in our room facing Canal Street we noticed there were ear plugs on the table by the television. My wife and remarked at the time that it must be for Mardi Gras when the French Quarter gets crazy. Little did we know that the ear plugs were for nightly use due to frequent ambulance, police and fire runs made by New Orleans emergency personnel. To top it all off, our room was never cleaned our last day at the hotel. My wife and I love New Orleans. We have visited here many times. We love the diversity, the culture, the music and the food, plus, this visit our team, the University of Kentucky won the NCAA Championship. It was very regrettable and disappointing that we had to stay at one of the worst hotels we have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: tmde
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, & I just got back from a two night stay at the Crowne Plaza. We travel to New Orleans often & have stayed at various hotels there. The Crown Plaza hotel was just okay, I expected better. We stayed in a suite on the third floor. The first room we were assigned stunk of smoke, while I know this is not the hotel's fault, I would have thought that the maids would have said something to someone when they cleaned the room so it could have been cleaned & santized. After bringing it the hotel's attention, we were assigned another room, which still had trash in it from the previous people. The room was very large with a large sitting room with a tv, a hallway with a bathroom, then the bedroom & two closets. The hallways on the third floor smelled very badly, moldy, but on the our third day there it smelled better, so maybe someone complained & sent someone to freshen up the carpet. We ordered room service twice, once for breakfast & once for supper. The service was fairly quick. Breakfast was good but supper wasn't. I ordered a shrimp po-boy, something that's very easy to make. The shrimp on it was small & obviously pre-breaded/frozen, like you buy at a grocery freezer section. I was disappointed. I expected better in New Orleans. I've gotten better at our local Mama's fried chicken. We also went to the pool & it is very small & the area is small, but the gym is surprisingly large. The executive lounge was closed between 10 or 11am & 4pm daily. All together, it didn't meet our expectations & we probably won't stay there again. Be aware of rooms facing Bourbon Street. There was a band playing all afternoon & most of the night below our window. We used a sound machine, so it drowned out most of the noise. Also, there was a marathon going on the day we left & we forced to either walk 8 blocks with our luggage or wait a few hours to leave. There was no other options given. We would have expected the hotel to have either warned us the night before about this or if possible arrange for a shuttle type form of transportation. So we, along with other guests from the hotel, drug our suitcases along Canal street for 8 blocks, forced our way across running people from the marathon, to finally arrive at our vehicles. It was not fun or easy. My daughter & I came very close to being trampled!

Reviews.Title: “Conference in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SmileyClown
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double Queen bed room on the 12th floor overlooking Bourbon St. booked by my work for a conference. I went with 5 other women and we all had our own rooms, which were $200/nt each. The bed was very comfortable with a pillow top mattress. The bathroom was a nice size and it was nice to be on the 12th floor as it was quieter. If you are going for work, I would suggest utlizing the ear plugs the hotel provides as you could hear the music and nightlife coming from Bourbon St until at least 1:00 am. The pool was on the 3rd floor but was small and there was no hot tub which would have been very nice. We did enjoy sitting by the pool at the patio table as the chairs rocked slightly and it was very relaxing. Paul the concierge was very helpful with dining options and reservations. He really helped us out during our 4 day stay. The Palace Place was my favorite, priced around $25 and was very close to the hotel just a block away. There was a CVS across the street which was convenient. You can pretty much walk almost anywhere in the city. The hotel was on the corner of Canal and Bourbon st and was on the cusp of the French Quarter, so the location was great. We walked all over down to the River and took the St. Charles streetcar for a nice, but slow sightseeing ride for $1.25 each way. It would have been nice to book a tour but our timeframe didn't allow for this. Our conference was at the Marriott just 2 blocks away and the Marriott was a massive hotel with a huge lobby with coffee cafe and lots of places to sit. It was very modern but was completely sold out first thing. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RonMaricopa_AZ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with reward points, and was just a bit concerned after reading less than glowing reviews about this and all hotels in NOLA. I am happy to report our experience here was excellent. Upon check in the desk person upgraded us on the spot, and we had access to a daily free breakfast and happy hour. The room was quiet and sleep was peaceful. Every person on the staff we met had a smile on their face and treated us as best as we could ever hope. Without a doubt, when we make a return trip, we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: WSRF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the corner of Canal and Bourbon Street. In the evening there is usually a band playing on Bourbon Street on the sidewalk directly across from the hotel. I was on the 12th floor facing Bourbon and could just barely hear the music. I didn't hear any other street noise. This is a crowded intersection, every time I came out of the hotel there was a crowd on the sidewalk. The room was nice with a comfortable bed. In the five days I stayed I didn't receive maid service on one day and one other day they didn't replace the coffee I'd used. Otherwise the service was fine. The concierge was very helpful with tours, dinners and arranging transportation. There are a lot of hotels in this area and if noise or constant crowds are a concern you might consider something on the other side of Canal street. You could still be close to the French Quarter but would have far less of a crowd and there is very little noise.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Tamela R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay the the Astro Crowne Plaza. Honestly, the hotel was not what I expected with a 4 star rating. The hotel lobby is beautiful, bright and clean. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, we checked in very late in the evening after a long flight, only to find that there were only king rooms left when we had booked a double room and a single room. After a few minutes of searching they found a suite for my traveling partners and a king for myself. We were in town for a Nursing Convention. Now up to our rooms, mine on the 5th floor. The king bed room was average size with an extremely long hallway to travel from the bed to the bathroom. Stains were everywhere! Carpet, curtains, bedskirt, chair not what you would expect from a property rated 4 stars. The sheets appreared clean, and on flashlight inspection we did not detect bedbugs, Yes, we checked! The carpet had fuzz and lint as if it had not been vacuumed properly. The second and third day the room appeared to have been cleaned more thoroughly. Fourth and fith days must have had a different housekeeper as the room was barely touched. The property is extremely noisy, street people seem to collect and play music all night long, in addition the nightly garbage collection at 1am causes much loss of sleep. My friends in the "suite" experience much the same, stains on the carpet, curtains and furniture as well as broken furniture in the sitting area. The maid service was poor. The noise was much worse as they were closer to the street. The kicker was when my friend was curling her hair with her curling iron sparks shot out from the outlet in the bathroom. The sparks caught her blouse on fire that went through her shirt and burned her abodmen. The fireworks tripped the circut breaker in the room and all went dark. They called down to the desk and a maintanence man and the manager came up to investigate. I was in the room when the manager told her that he would replace her blouse, as it was the least, he could do. But unfortunately when we checked out several days later the incident had been completely forgotten by the staff and since there are 3 managers they didn't know which one said he would replace her blouse. We were very disappointed. This was my first trip to New Orleans, it will not be my last, I however will never stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “some pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: turquoise11
Reviews.Content: Over all I liked my stay. The room was small, the bed comfortable and decorated nicely. The location was convienient - the split buildng meant we walked up stairs to our room. Our room was quiet - my sister's very loud overlooking bourbon on a saturday night. Internet was 9.99 per device per day. Security was good and front door service great. Parking is off site and they have to valet it to you. If you are partying on bourbon - I would reccomend. For me - I'll stay closer to jackson square next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Matt L
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and the rooms were spacious and clean. Great location, the staff was friendly, and it was easy to get around the hotel regarding the lobby, elevators, etc. No complaints. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: vxg_lr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business one night. The hotel room was too small and dated. The bathtub curtain was dirty. Sink was too small to fit any toiletries. Worst part is very hard to find your room as numbering of rooms on floor is random. Tv was poor with weak audio. Internet is $9.99. The place seems ditty and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in nice location just be careful of you have anything valuable!”
Reviews.Author: Lov2travelallyear
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Front staff were nice and the concierge was very helpful! The only issue I had was having my iPad stolen. I was told that there wasn't any video showing somebody stole it. However, their hotel was the only place it could have been stolen since I had it right before I dropped it off at their locked luggage room so I could explore around town without having to carry it. When we returned to get our bags they gave us bags that weren't ours which made me a little nervous. Just in case right before leaving the hotel, I looked in my bag and saw the cover and did no further checking until I got home and noticed the cover was all the theif left me. My iPad was gone. I thought I was safe leaving it there because the bellhop was there and it's locked but my suggestion to other travelers is be safe and don't leave anything of value whatsoever. As annoying as that may be...I've learned my very expensive lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with above average gym”
Reviews.Author: dean210_11
Reviews.Content: Pretty average hotel. Only thing above average was hotel fitness center had more equipment than most other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Winejunkie_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza from 3/10-3/13. We flew in and took a taxi to the hotel. We were early but they had a room ready for us. Checked in smoothly and went on our way. Our room faced Bourbon Street and we were on the 5th floor, we had no problems with noise or sleeping. I booked this Hotel through Bookit.com. It was a great location & the price was also good (compared to others I looked at). Checkout was smoothe also. We were very happy and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: B_Vicky
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, good location, good service , good food , good Club rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sd0453
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crown Plaza for St. Patty's Day weekend. This hotel is in a perfect location, right on Canal Street between Royal and Bourbon streets. It is merely steps away from the legendary scene right on Bourbon street. The hotel lobby and staff were excellent. This place really has a classy New Orleans feel to it. Our room was very clean, however it was not quite 5-star worthy. There was no refrigerator and the view was nothing special. Still, it was perfectly comfortable for us.The pool is a little small and stays on the shaded side of the hotel. We took a cab to the airport because it was cheaper than any of the airport shuttles that sat in front of the hotel. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, just a couple of complaints”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor for a weekend, and found the hotel to be generally great! The hotel location couldn't be any better. The physical condition is great as well - it's a new hotel, only 9 years old or so, but it is architecturally very consistent with the area. The service was generally very good, with the only real problem being the valet parking issue. The hotel location is great, and that's both a positive and a negative. The location, on the corner of Canal and Bourbon, couldn't be any better for a trip to the French Quarter. Besides being right at the French Quarter, it's only a 10 minute walk to Harrah's, and less than a half hour all the way down to the World War II museum. However, the great location means no parking at site, and there's not enough room for drop off and pick up in the front of the hotel - and they can't have people go around the corner, because that's Bourbon Street, which is obviously even worse. The bell staff did help out wonderfully when we got in on a Friday evening by coming down the street and meeting us farther out, helping direct traffic, and making the arrival more pleasant. Check in on the same Friday evening was crowded, but moved very fast. One woman behind the counter saw us and called me around to the end of the counter where she was able to help us right away. They got us checked in and to our room very quickly and efficiently. On the way into the hotel were several tables with a woman selling souvenirs - t-shirts, magnets, masks, beads - which was a little odd for a nice hotel. It did detract from the elegance of the hotel, but it is New Orleans with a crazy party atmosphere, so maybe it wasn't so bad after all. Our room was on the Executive Floor, which is on the fourth floor - surprisingly low, but still nice. The room was larger than average, well appointed, and in good condition. There is a comfortable king size bed that is higher than you might expect (a surprise when you wake up in the morning and have forgotten before you slide off the edge). All the standard amenities are there, including flat screen TV, desk, upholstered chair with ottoman, closet with safe, etc. The chair appears like it might not be comfortable, but was actually nice. As part of the conformance to architectural requirements for the historic district, the windows appear that they can be opened. However, that is just the look, to keep the appearance up outside. They are double paned, which helps with the noise from below. Speaking of the noise, it is on Bourbon Street, but we had no problem on the 4th floor. The bathrooms were what you would expect for a nice hotel like this. No problems at all. A tip, though, if you find yourself singing in the shower, or not feeling very good after indulging in too much alcohol from the night before, keep in mind that your neighbor can hear everything through the ventilation in the shower area. The Executive Lounge was very nice for a US hotel. Breakfast was good, with two hot items that changed each day - one day was sausage and oatmeal, the other was cheese omelette and potatoes. Plus, there were several other good items, including very good croissants - freshly made, not some like you'd find at a grocery store. In the evenings, as others have said, there is wine, beer, and soft drinks, plus appetizers. The drinks were fine - first beer/wine was free - and the cheese and fruit were good. The hot appetizers were standard frozen appetizer quality - not really worth the calories. The staff was very friendly and helpful, continually looping through the room to pick up plates and glasses when needed. We ate breakfast at the buffet in the hotel restaurant one morning, and the buffet was fairly unimpressive. While the food quality was fine (the bacon and sausage were good), it all seemed like it had been out a little long, and the selection wasn't what it should have been - no eggs to order, for example. The layout of the buffet line seemed like an afterthought, too - almost like they set it up just so they could say they had a buffet, but really didn't put in any effort. Checkout was quick and efficient, although there was an extra charge on the bill for each night. I asked the woman at the desk about it, and she promptly took it off without question. However, when I met my wife outside, as she was picking up our car from valet, that's when things got ugly. Several reviewers have mentioned problems with the valet parking, but I didn't realize how bad the problem would be. Because of the aforementioned lack of drop off / pick up space in front of the hotel, there is also a problem with valet when you leave the hotel. The valet parking is expensive - $31+, as mentioned many times for an SUV - but there is generally an understanding that valet parking includes taking your car when you get there and returning it when you leave. They don't quite have the same understanding here. Our first clue was when we called down to have them bring the car around. There was an automated message that they were so busy they weren't accepting calls, and you had to come down in person. Then, when we went to the valet stand, we were told that, if we waited for them to bring the car, it would take AT LEAST 30 minutes (their emphasis, not mine). Or, if we didn't wan to wait, we could take a shuttle to the lot where our car was, and leave from there. We opted for the latter. To add insult to injury, though, it took 10-15 minutes to fill the shuttle, so we had to wait there the entire time. Once we got to the lot, a couple of miles down Canal, we were able to get our car fairly easily. However, it was quite annoying to see the sign on the lot that the car was parked in, and to find out the price for that lot was $2/day. That means I paid them $60 to drive my car down the street. I understand that parking in the FQ and CBD is at a premium, but this was too much. All in all, this is a very nice hotel in a great location in a fun city. We didn't let the valet parking ruin the memory of the trip, but it did leave a sour taste...

Reviews.Title: “Duana the magnificent”
Reviews.Author: chicostravellin
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Sunday evening for a two night stay. Booked in and we were surprised with the tiny room facing a brick wall that we were upgraded too, considering we stay many many nights with this franchise and are usually treated with far better rooms. The next morning I called the front desk and spoke with Duana (I hope this is how you spell her name) and advised that it was our first time in New Orleans and asked if there was a room with a view that we could switch to. Duana within minutes said, yes I do and you will love this room. And love it we did. It had a great view and had all the room anyone would need. Now about the hotel. It is beautiful and located right on Canal and Bourbon, out the door and you are in the middle of it all. The executive lounge is a great place to get away and have a few snacks and offers drinks at very reasonable prices. We also have to say that the onsite restaurant (I am sorry I forget the name) is FANTASTIC. It was the best restaurant that we ate at during our trip. The Duck Confit salad I had was out of this world, and the seafood platter was the best seafood and catfish we had in the city (and we had our share). The prices are great too. When we return again, we will eat here every night. For the management. We cannot tell you how much Duana helped make our stay a fabulous one. We were actually set to leave after the first night, due to the room selection we had been offered as the view was horrible, but Duana made everything right. Duana was extremely friendly and helpful and a joy to deal with over the phone and in person. It is people like Duana that will bring us back and keep us singing the praises of your hotel for a long long time. Thanks again Duana.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sylviaandmatt
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Attended a conference here right after Mardi Gras. Rooms are modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: txtb911
Reviews.Content: If hanging out in the French Quarter and Garden District are on the top of your list, then look no further than the Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor-New Orleans. Located on the corner of Canal and Bourbon, this hotel puts you right in the middle of the action, while keeping you comfortable in style. The staff was incredible, the rooms were quiet, the beds were comfortable, and in case I didn't mention it, the location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible internet”
Reviews.Author: ShelldNY
Reviews.Content: Staying here currently and posting this from my phone as haven't been able to get on the internet on my laptop since arrival 24 hours ago. The staff seem disinterested overall. Definitely won't stay here again. Not good if you are on a business trip and need to work in your room. Very frustrating - have spent over an hour on the phone with some kind of outsourced tech support for the hotel's internet so far. When paying to stay here, I don't feel like I should have to wait on hold to get on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: katlady050
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Rock and Roll 1/2 Marathon. Clean, quiet, professional staff. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: danawho
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week before Mardi GRAS weekend. Parades come right in front of the hotel. Half a block to party central Borbuon st. The only problem is if you arrive during a parade you will a long wait to get to the hotel. If you don't have to many bags there a points on canal st that where when there is a break in the parade you can cross, but it is block off to vehicles. Same with the departure. No need to rents cars during the Mardi GRAS can't drive them anywhere take a shuttle from and back to the airport. Its worth the 80.00 round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shmader1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Walk out the door on to Bourbon street. Room 405 was excellent and huge. And the concierge level breakfast and happy hour was awesome. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Some slight traffic noise at night. But that is to be expected at this location. Earplugs were provided upon arrival. But did not need them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of ambiance”
Reviews.Author: debinnh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 8 nights over MardiGras. We were first put in the "new" tower, but didn't like the view, so asked to see some other rooms, I am so glad we did. I loved the ambiance of the old section of the hotel. High ceilings, plaster walls, exposed brick. Lovely. We had a room overlooking Canal Street, on the second floor, so we could watch the parades from our room when we wanted, or we could go to the hotel balcony or just outside on the street. The trolley was at our front door, (while it was still running. It stopped on Friday for the parades and did not start back up until after we left). Being on the corner of Bourbon Street meant we were right near all the fun too! The free breakfast buffet at the executive lounge for Priority Club members had fruit, cereal, breads and bagels, pastries and one hot dish each morning. We took advantage a few times, but just outside the door were too many other good places for breakfast to eat here every morning. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom adequate sized. We had a few minor issues when we first checked in: a broken light, a missing knob on a dresser drawer, a broken safety latch on the door. All were fixed within an hour of us reporting it. Excellent service! I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Money taken from the safe...”
Reviews.Author: Ajm4
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 ladies and I stayed at this hotel for Mardi Gras. It was the perfect location for the event.. close to everything! The hotel was clean. Beds comfy. BUT one day, one of the girls left the safe unlocked, but closed, when we went out for breakfast. When we returned only a few hours later we noticed the safe was wide open. The three of us that were using the safe all counted our money (which we had counted before we left for the day for our budgets). Two of us had $200 missing and one who had less money to begin with had $100 missing...how convenient. Seems to me that it was an attempt to to take just enough but not so much to be noticed...We suspect the thief only took bits from each of us probably hoping Mardi Grasers were partying too hard to count their money each day...wrong!The room had been cleaned and so had our safe... Looks like we would have been better off not to use the safe like the other two girls? We did not immediately report the missing cash because we took it as a stupid tax and didn't know if they would take us seriously since there was no way to prove it since its cash and the safe was unlocked. I understand that there is a reason safes lock but just because something isn't locked does not give a hotel employee the right to steel it..I leave my clothes out and don't expect that to go missing too! When I got home I decided I should notify them. I called the Manager on duty. I expressed that I was not interested in getting any money back as I understood there was no way to prove how much went missing but that I thought he should be aware that someone who had access to our room on the specified day had stolen from our hotel room and who knows how many other guests. He listened. Did not have much to say. Asked for my phone number to follow up...that was over a week ago..still no follow up. Of course I don't expect the money back but a follow up phone call or even an apology would be professional. I will never stay at a Crowne Plaza again as their staff cannot be trusted and their managerial staff are unable to deal with such issues in a caring or professional manner. Overall, the trip went really well but not being able to feel safe within my own 4 star hotel room put a damper on the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wendyc13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and the location is great. I could look out my window and see burbon street. Room was comfortable and clean. They do give u ear plugs but I did not need them even though I could here the music all night from burbon. I am a light sleeper so I was a little worried when I could here the music but I think I was so tired from running around all day and the music was actually soothing (jazz). The service was excellent. Everyone was professional and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: CougRN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip which coincided with the end of Mardi Gras. The location is great (Canal and Bourbon) and check-in was fairly quick, but not overly friendly or welcoming. This is an older hotel and kept very clean and updated. The lobby was clean as were the rooms. The rooms were spacious for an older hotel however you could hear a bit of street noise at times. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were a bit dark lighting wise, but nicely sized. There was Wi-Fi in the room but you had to pay for faster service. I was there on Fat Tuesday and there was security present to get into the hotel. You needed an armband to get past security which added to a feeling of safety with the security presence during Mardi Gras. I would probably stay there again if I returned to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lollybrown
Reviews.Content: The check in was good. The staff was friendly. My room was nice and clean. I went during Mardi Gras so I was made to wear a plastice hospital like bracelet during my stay. I didn't really like that but I tried to understand. They have a great restuarant on the property as well. Food from room service was good as well. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, okay service”
Reviews.Author: SuzieBell66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (Canal & Bourbon). The room including the bathroom was immaculate. The desk staff was helpful but not has friendly as they could have been. My biggest complaint was the fact that WiFi cost $9.95/day for EACH device which meant spending $20/ day for my phone & laptop. I could have gone to the lobby for free WiFi but for over $200/night it should have been free in the room also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: IMDAREF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Astor from Feb 17th to Feb 22. We were advised prior to our stay about the parking problems during Mardi Gras before our stay, so we were prepared for that nightmare. Not complaining about having to park seven blocks away, that is part of the trip you work around. And it turned out to be not so bad.... Check in was quick and easy. Friendly front desk staff were helpful and quickly got us to our room. King bed room was a little tight, bathroom a little small, but clean! Had no issues with our room. Maid service was prompt every day and had no issues with getting clean towels and such.... Location is perfect for Mardi Gras. Walking distance to everything; Jackson Square, French Market, Riverwalk.... Worst part of the whole trip was getting the car delivered back to the hotel from the valet parking lot. Overall, a very enjoyable stay at the Crowne Plaza Astor!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: nyjazzfan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for our trip for Mardi Gras. They explained our arrival procedure (slightly complicated during parades) and assured me they would try to get me my requested high room with a view- thanks Don Zimmer- who actually took the time to call me- and got us a great room with a view of the Canal St parades. The hotel is well located and adequately elegant without being ostentatious. There was no problem with cleanliness despite it being Mardi Gras. Service was generally professional, friendly and competent. One big plus was the ability to use both the Canal St and Bourbon St balconies during some of the parades. People often pay a premium for these. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chargil
Reviews.Content: We were actually booked at the cotton exchange hotel for Mardi gras. Upon our arrival (with printed confirmation in hand) we were told we did not have a reservation. The manager did however get us booked into the Astor crowne plaza hotel. They even matched the price of the cotton exchange. They were always friendly and even up graded us to executive class. The location is superb and the rooms are beautiful. We will definitly stay here again on our next trip to new Orleans. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loopwhole
Reviews.Content: Stayed the six nights ending with Mardi Gras (Fat Tuesday) night. Considering the special circumstances, service was very very good. There were plenty of staff to assist you with checking and loading in and out. The room was well appointed, including a no extra charge wall safe. There is an extra charge of $10.95 per night for hotel wi-fi. The room was clean and housekeepping was very good. The hotel restaurant, Bourbon House, is locally managed and offers a very "NewOrleanish" menu; the fresh half-shell oysters were as good as I've ever had. The location is generally good, particularly if your interests focus on Bourbon St., Royal St., or the St Charles or Canal streetcar lines. However, if the Frenchmen St. or French Market areas are among your primary interests, it's walkable, but you're in for a pretty long hike. The Carnival parades on Canal St. caused congestion in and around the entrance which was somewhat inconvenient, but this would only be applicable to Carnival season. Our 11th floor Bourbon St. facing room was relatively quiet considering the circumstances and that we're not particularly noise sensitive, but I would not have wanted to be any closer to the street. Overall, this is a well managed and very nice property, but other than the restaurant and location, it is not particularly "NewOrleanish" or otherwise noteworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nytoparis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during Mardi Gras. Location is excellent for visiting the French Quarter and watching the parades, since the bigger ones go along Canal St. Rooms were small but well appointed. On a Sunday morning I asked the front desk clerk whether I needed exact change for the streetcar or if bills were accepted. She promptly replied that dollar bills were ok. So we head over to the streetcar just to find out that it was not running that day due to the parades. I feel that the clerk should have mentioned this fact to us when we inquired about it, specially when she offered maps of the parade route to the couple in front of us while we waited in line. We were also dissapointed that no one seem to be able to tell us if taxis would be operating on monday (lundi gras- they said yes, a cabbie said dont count on it). We ended up taking a much earlier flight just to be safe (found a taxi at 4:30am). Would stay again due to the excellent location, but hopefully will not need help from staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Mandy3214
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend & I came to New Orleans on vacation. We had an awesome time! Not only was the hotel great but I was thoroughly impressed by a couple of ladies at the front desk. Duana checked us in and had remembered me from a previous stay. She was so accomodating and was able to answer all of my questions. She gave us a the perfect room in a corner and with a great view of Bourbon street. She was so sweet and I hope you have the pleasure of meeting her. The manager, Melissa Kennedy was also great! She took time to go over the parade route & schedule & even gave us some helpful information in case it rains. I love this hotel & city & I will definetly be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: HelenaTiki
Reviews.Content: Great location, attentive staff and fabulous banquet food and service. Beds were among the best I've ever had in a hotel. The room was nice and clean but not special (got the cheaper one)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cdh51
Reviews.Content: Terrific location on the edge of the French Quarter. Since we had lived near New Orleans, we are familiar with the city. We prefer not to eat in the Quarter (with a few exceptions) and love that the bus and streetcar lines are within a few feet of the hotel, providing access to our favorite restaurants. We did arrive during a Mardi Gras parade - and wish that the hotel had told us where the valet parking was located (it is several blocks away). Canal is closed down and public transportation is iffy during parades. We spent hours trying to get to the hotel. Had we known where the parking was, we would have left our car and walked with our stuff. The staff is very attentive and helpful - had an issue with the HVAC - and they sent someone from maintenance within 3 minutes. They volunteered to give us a late checkout since my husband's meeting didn't end until after checkout. It was kind of crazy because of Mardi Gras season - but the staff was unfazed - and cheerful. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant - but then we never eat in hotel restaurants - there is a reason that they get a bad rap. Why eat in when there are so many wonderful restaurants in New Orleans? I do not think that it is the sort of hotel that families would enjoy - it's an upscale, old style hotel, more like a boutique hotel. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kiwitexas
Reviews.Content: Great location on Canal/Bourbon St. Close to French Quarter Restaurants, Street Car lines, All French Quarter entertainment. Our room was in the old building. Looked out on a roof. They have a good bar and place for breakfast. Since we were seldom in the room it was a great place to stay. Paul, the Concierge was good, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor attention to details”
Reviews.Author: campbfh2
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel in great condition with a beautiful interior. The rooms are very nice and the beds are comfortable. The location is prime, being right on the corner of Bourbon Street. While this is a great hotel for a romantic vacation, this hotel would be a poor choice for business travelers or families with children. Pros: Excellent Location Bar and great restaurant in the hotel Beautiful and Clean Rooms Ear Plugs and Eye Masks provided Cons: No Gift Shop to purchase bottled water or other necessities No refrigerators in the room Room service does not sell bottled water Ironing board in the room in poor condition Iron in the room covered with black tar-like substance Noisy Rooms (outside noise and hallway noise)

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable waiter !”
Reviews.Author: scott g
Reviews.Content: hotel was nice and clean , front desk very friendly , room pretty clean , bell hops very helpful ,restaurant well now where do i start , breakfast walked in no sign saying wait to be seated no one around , fine proceeded to find a table , found one went to sit down , across the room a waiter yelled dont just sit down go back to the entrance and wait to be seated , we were stunned to be yelled at in front of the other guest so we proceeded to the entrance when the same man walked by and said in a rude tone this is not a seat yourself restaurant . he yelled at some kid to seat us , of course we declined and found our way to brennans for breakfast !!! the sad part is the restaurant was almost empty . needless to say we never spent an extra dime in that hotel the next two days !

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: gjscraftygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in November of 2011, when we earned a free trip to NOLA. The hotel was pre-arranged for us, and knowing the company that arranged the accommodations, we had confidence that it would be an outstanding place. The customer service was awesome. The concierge was quick to answer any and all questions and made several calls on our behalf to get us reservations, transportation and more. He was super friendly (sorry, have forgotten his name). The hotel is part of the Priority Club/Holiday Inn brand and had all of the affluence you would expect in NOLA. If you are looking for a hotel right in the 'thick of it', then this is a good choice. Sitting on the corner of Bourbon and Canal streets, you're in easy walking distance to most of everything in downtown NOLA. If you are there and have the opportunity to experience an event in their ballrooms, be assured that they nice as well. If you don't even want to leave the hotel for dinner, you have an option if a restaurant downstairs too. I would give this hotel 3.5 stars if I could!

Reviews.Title: “There was a reason this place was inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoy
Reviews.Content: 1. Good: service 2. Bad: Lack of attention to detail when cleaning rooms. A little dusty, minor odor. 3. Hidden Costs: $9.95/day for internet (free in lobby) $28/day parking

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2travel0313
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Sugar Bowl/New Years Eve. We had a GREAT time! The location can't be beat! Rooms were clean and had a view of Bourbon street! I gave the rooms a 4 because there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. Beds were SOOOO comfy! We will definately stay here again next time we're in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs training in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tina H
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay here for a busines conference. My entire experience with this hotel has been disappointing. Was surprised at check in on the lack of eye contact, sour faces and that no one asked to help us with luggage. Not even in my room for 15 minutes, and in walks another guest with the keys to my room. Later, early evening, asked a Housekeeping supervisor for help with the cold temperature in my room. She interrupted every single question or comment I had. Temperature didn't get remedied. Later in the evening, I called maintenance for help. They did something, using tools. Well, I was no longer cold! By 4am, the heat was unbearable and I just shut the unit off. Within about five minutes, the door on the HVAC unit crashed to the floor, just missing a mirror and putting holes into the wall. Oh, and then there is the scaring 14 lives out of me. At 7am when I went to speak with the front desk about it they were unbelievably uncaring. Did say I could move to another room. But, never offered to help me move, or to put me in a nicer room...nothing. I schlep all my stuff to another room without any help or a cart and see the same lovely roof and HVAC views. On a positive note, the bad customer service by staff was pretty universal. The food was awful. If you look around, you notice it isn't all that clean. Bathrooms in our meeting area were constantly propped open with a mop pail. This is probably a great place to stay for those who are here to party, but for a conference or a business meeting, I absolutely would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Mixed feelings on the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Karen75013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza January 27-29, 2012. The location of this hotel is perfect...On the corner of Canal and Bourbon streets. A little noisy but you have to expect that when staying that close to Bourbon street. The hotel is very pretty -- Nice lobby. Our first contact was with the valet folks. They were very friendly and helpful. NOTE: The hotel only offers valet which is about $30 a day and your car will actually be parked about 8 blocks from the hotel. It's unlimited in/out if you need your car. We had no use for ours once we arrived. Another thing to note is that it will take, on average, 30 minutes to get your car each time. Could be more if they are shorthanded or busier. We knew that going in, so it was not an issue for us. We ended up leaving some things in the car and they happily took care of running down to the garage and retrieving our items and delivering them to our room. Our next interaction was with the front desk when we checked in. The girl that helped us was not very friendly at all....I would say almost arrogant. She said we would get free internet but offered no further explanation. Of course when we tried to connect to it, it didnt work so we had to call and ask. We still had no luck so decided to forget it. She didnt mention anything about what the hotel had to offer as far as restaurants, bar, etc. so we figured all of that out on our own. Just not very inviting at all. We felt as though she was annoyed being there. Our room....At first glance, it was clean -- I think a bit of a stretch to call it a nice room. There is no refrigerator or microwave. The bed was great - very comfortable. We felt like there were many small things that they could have easily cared for but didnt. The room didnt smell fresh but appeared to be clean. The water pressure in the bathroom was awful. Took forever to get the shampoo out of my hair. The tub faucet was broken and the air vent that you are very close to inside the shower was really dusty and dirty. I dropped something on the floor and got down to look for it under the TV stand -- I found pills from a previous guest, I assumed, dust and other trash so the room had not been thoroughly cleaned in a while. We also had trouble with are room cards for most of the trip. We had to try it 6-7 times to get it to work but it eventually would open. We ordered room service a few times and it was delicious each time and service was good as well. We stayed in an executive suite -- not sure that meant anything as far as a nicer room but it did give us access to the executive lounge. It was a very nice and big room with nice decor, two flat screen TVs, lots of chairs, couches. They offered free breakfast each morning between 6-10am and cocktails and snacks between 6-8pm. During the evening time, they offer a complimentary drink and offered additional drinks at a very low cost which was nice. Overall, not that impressed with the hotel. Not sure that I would stay there again nor would I recommend it to family/friends. It definitely will not be my first choice next time we visit New Orleans. You are paying for the location in my opinion -- A lot of small, but important details left unattended to by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jlbod
Reviews.Content: Bedding was very comfortable , small room , cramped bathroom , moved coffee pot just to put shaving kit on counter. No fan in bathroom, very low showerhead .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: thallsy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and provides a spacious, open lobby and a roof top pool (worth checking out if you need to lounge one afternoon). The location is very convenient if you are planning to check out the night life along Bourbon and, being at the end of the street, also allows a bit of an escape from all the noise (although expect to hear a bit of it through the night, but ... that's what NOLA is also about). The beds are comfortable and you'll sleep well. The concierge was fantastic. He helped book three tours for us, one for the city, the bayou and two plantations. The city tour will give you a great feel for NOLA and is a definite must if you only have a few days. Also, the swamp tour was a highlight and we saw about a dozen alligators - can't say they are shy to approach the boat! For the history buffs, the plantations are also worth seeing for some of the old South. He helped us pack in quite the experience for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alison032
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Astor Crowne Plaza in January. The location was great..just far enough from all the noise! We were on the top floor with a great view. The room was okay. Apparently they have just done a big up grade but it still looked a bit tired. They offered a free breakfast in the executive lounge and it was great. The best part of the hotel was the Bourbon House restaurant on the main floor. We had two meals there and the food and service were excellent. I would highly recommend the restaurant even if you are not staying at the hotel. The hotel staff were all very nice and helpful. It was a nice hotel and we would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location and great service”
Reviews.Author: franbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for five nights. The location was great, right on Bourbon Street and Canal Street. We had enough points for four nights and paid for one night. Our room was lovely and looked out on the French Quarter. Paul, the concierge was very helpful in recommending restaurants and activities. The room included turn down service with chocolates or pralines left on the bed in the evening. The executive breakfast room provided nice snacks and wines in the afternoon and a very nice breakfast buffet. The pastries were excellent. Every morning we were greeted in such a friendly manner that we felt like family. The only negative thing was the fitness equipment which was not well maintained. There were adequate machines, but some of them were out of order for our entire stay. We found the Crowne Plaza to be a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on a business trip. My room on the 11th floor was spacious. The beds are comfortable, though strangely high - I'm quite tall and couldn't sit on them and put my feet on the ground. I could hear music from the street well into the night (4 AM?) but I imagine that is true anywhere this close to Bourbon Street. Room service breakfast was subpar - but there's really no reason to order room service with so many breakfast options within easy walking distance. There are probably cozier and more atmospheric places to stay in New Orleans, but this is a safe, friendly hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and even better location!”
Reviews.Author: roses4889
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! The hotel was located on the corner of Bourbon Street and Canal Street so everything was within walking distance. The lobby was beautiful; the staff was helpful and pleasant. The room was nice, the beds were comfortable. You could hear some noise late at night if your room is located on the Bourbon Street side of the hotel, but that was expected and it did not interfere with our sleep. The hotel has a restaurant, Dickie Brennanâ€™s Bourbon House Restaurant and Seafood Bar. We unfortunately, did not get a chance to eat there but heard all wonderful things about the food and service. We could not have asked for a better stay and I would highly recommend the Astor Crowne Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with your final bill”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2_11
Reviews.Content: Although the room was acceptable, the front desk staff are very rude and do not understand what customer service is about. My final bill had tips charged multiple times from my room service. When trying to inquire about it, the person (I beileve her name was Nissha) would continually cut me off in the middle of my sentence. This happend multiple times!! I could not get a word to save my life. I travel to New Orleans for business every now and then, and it is unfortunate that one person can set the experience of a hotel as acceptable to I will never stay there again. I finally left the hotel unsatisfied with the response or solution because I had a business meeting to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Coleen60
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful from the lobby, to the executive club, to the rooms. Priority club had a nice breakfast in the executive lounge including fruit, pastries/Breads, a few hot items such as potatoes and sausage, juices, and coffee. The lounge was cozy and from one side you can see Bourbon street. They also had a cocktail hour(s) from 4-8 with the first drink being complimentary (and all other drinks were very reasonably priced). The location of the hotel was at the very beginning of Bourbon street, a prime location for getting around. The hotel also had a beautiful restaurant/bar inside with friendly staff and a good selection of food. Security was always around at the hotel so things were safe. Security even escorted the pizza delivery guy to my room since I didn't want to go down to the lobby to get the pizza! A gem for the Bourbon street area! The rooms were very inviting with plenty of drawer and closet space, nice bed with a huge pillow-top mattress, a small table and two chairs. There was a safe for use as well. The water pressure of the shower was very nice (not the trickle you get at some hotels). Housekeeping was wonderful, always revolving around our busy schedules and not interrupting at all. We were all on the opposite side of the hotel (away from Bourbon street). There was no view of anything but it was quiet and easy to get a good nights rest. My only complaint would be the key reader for the room. It was acting up since the second we arrived.
