We reported it multiple times but kept being told that it must be our keys and we should keep them away from a cell phone (one was the original key I had just been given which was only in my hand). Another time we were told it might be the battery in the reader, and then another that the reader might needed to be cleaned. Needless to say it took a full 5 minutes of fighting with the cards and reader to enter the room EVERY time. They should fix this. This is the only reason I did not give the hotel a 5.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: 306Danielle306
Reviews.Content: I work at a Hotel in San Antonio Texas and traveled here for a vacation and it was amazing. Everybody is friendly and the hotel is beautiful! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone considering to stay there. We had a King bed and the room was so great spacious and luxurious, slept very well and the location of the hotel is phenomenal. GREAT JOB CROWNE PLAZA! Also Joe who works in Valet was very helpful and attended to any need or question we had. I plan to visit again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk people are terrible.”
Reviews.Author: anotherhokie
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location is great, Lobby is really nice, rooms are big and very nice. Price was reasonable for location. Cons: Front desk staff, all of them. I personally spoke to 4 of them checking in/out and asking for suggestions or directions. Just normal interactions. None of the four ever smiled, ever laughed, ever made me feel like they wanted to be there. If management can change that or change them, this would be an excellent hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: Provida
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference with two colleagues. We slept soundly although there was revelry below on Bourbon. The beds were soft. The service was exceptional and the location couldn't be beat. Unlike luxury hotels that nickle and dime you, the business center was free to use the computers and print. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brywood
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Astor Crown Plaza Hotel in mid December for 3 nights. This hotel is situated at the corner of Bourbon Street & Canal Street = Great Location. Check In - we arrived early, around 1030am. They only had a room with two queen beds. After politely asking for a king bed, they were able to accommdate us. We were thankfull, as check in was not until 3pm. Room - our room was a little smaller than the standard room - 6th floor opposite of Bourbon Street. We chalked this up to arriving early; as this seemed to be the only available king this early in the morning. We could have moved rooms later if we preferred; but choose not too. The room had all the amenities - flat screen tv, coffe maker, desk & chair, chair & ottman, radio alarm clock, bath products as the other rooms. We thought the bed was comfy. We did not have a view; it was of an old parking garage. Housekeeping - no issues at all. The room was made up quickly & never too late. Food - we only ate breakfast inside the hotel - Bourbon House. The food was fine, service was good. We did stop at the bar several times; as the selection of whiskey is fantastic. Not much else to say; we would & will return to this Hotel when we go back to New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Manager honored our reservation”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: When my family arrived on Christmas eve, we were told that the reservation made by our travel agent for two queen beds and a roll away could not be honored. I had called two days before and the day of our arrival to be certain that this reservation was okay and I was assured that we would have three beds for one of our family group. But upon arrival, I was told that it would be a fire hazard and we could not have a roll away in a room with two queen beds and they had no other accommodations. I showed them the reservation made by my travel agent and told them that two beds was not going to be acceptable and that my reservation needed to be honored. The front desk clerk went to get her supervisor who found a suite for us that worked beautifully. We had a delightful time after the initial rough waters. My thanks to the evening supervisor on Christmas eve who honored our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: cjm1959
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest in New Orleans approximately 25 times and just returned from 3 nights at the Crowne Astor. One of, if not the worst hotel experience in my life. 1.Totally rude staff. 2 Room was outdated 3. Restaurant and Bar closed at 11:00 p.m. Yes that is correct. Unbelievable. 4. At checkout, was charged 32.00 per night for parking and I flew into New Orleans. No Auto. Simply trying to pad the bill and hope that I did not notice. 5. They close the balcony over Bourbon St at 12:00 6 It took over an hour to be served once seated at the restaurant. 7 No maid service in 3 nights. Yes correct again. I thought New Orleans was trying to make a comeback after Katrina however with service and accommodations like this, I wish them luck.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, only okay staff”
Reviews.Author: caspervr
Reviews.Content: If you're headed to New Orleans to experience the French Quarter, this hotel has the perfect location. Otherwise, this hotel is pretty good for the price, but definitely not 5 stars. -Room size is ok, but the bathrooms are fairly small. -I stayed for a conference, and the front desk staff were not very helpful. They were courteous, but did not go out of their way. -The business center was appreciated - free printing -The lobby is gorgeous -The room temperature control was hard to figure out and would turn off after 15 minutes of no movement in the room - very annoying -It came in handy that there was a CVS right across the street from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: renrod
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New Orleans with friends for the Sugar Bowl this past week. The hotel was in a great location. It is right on the edge of the French Quarter and off of Bourbon Street. It was a few blocks away from Jackson square and about 10 blocks from the Super Dome, which was an easy walk. It was super clean, beds were comfortable and the service was friendly. Especially the guys working valet and the bell hops. They gave us some really good recommendations for food in the area. If you are looking for a good breakfast spot go to Daisy Dukes. They have two locations that are near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We chose wisely!!”
Reviews.Author: AlannLisa
Reviews.Content: Our first experience in New Orleans was spectacular, and it all started with our check in at the Crown Plaza. The attendants at the curb took our truck, helped us with our baggage, and were very pleasant, friendly, and patient. Our check-in was free of problems and quick, in spite of the fact that the lobby was packed with new guest arriving. When we entered our room it smelled of roses or some wonderful flower scent that made me just want to lay on the bed and take it all in. The restaurant downstairs was top notch, the food was mouth watering, and the service outstanding. The only thing that could have made our trip better was to not have so much noise while trying to dose off at night, but we were in New Orleans, off Bourbon Street,....the noise was something we certainly expected. No negative issues with the Crown Plaza whatsoever! We had a wonderful stay and can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “My bed was held up by plastic plantpots.”
Reviews.Author: Greig M
Reviews.Content: My bed was held up by plastic plantpots. Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no personality”
Reviews.Author: WashDCTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New Orleans for a friend's 40th birthday party. We were a big party and were all over the hotel. I'd been to NOLA before and stayed in the Quarter. The Crown Plaza was good, but it lacked the certain charm that even the other large hotels in the Quarter have. I felt like I was staying in a hotel that I'd be in traveling for business rather than for pleasure. Don't get me wrong, the rooms were clean, the staff was great, and all the hotel amenities you'd expect were there. I just felt like I was staying with a robot rather than a friend.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anh T
Reviews.Content: I came to New Orleans, I love it and I also love the hotel, I'm so proud of my decision =). One of the most famous things in NOLA is the French Quarter. Believe or not, The french quarter is just 50s walk away from the Hotel's door then you came to the main street of the french quarter, with so many restaurants, bars, shop,.... Astor just became more excellent when they have the "Borbon house" restaurant right in the hotel, Isn't it amazing? the "Borbon house is big and cool, they serve good foods and awesome seafood. about 1min walk away you can easily find CVS or Walgreen. There are Nine West, The children's place, foot locker, payless and even more just right there front of your eyes. The hotel looks amazing, it looks just like some castle with light and xmas trees,... I came to New Orleans last week, and Astor is kind of close to every "Things to do" " where to see" and you can buy your favorite coffee at mcdonald which was 1min walk away. Cool right ?

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: mzpriester
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a mystery hotel on an online travel booking website. For the price, can't beat it. But it's definitely not a four star hotel compared to other neighboring 4 stars. I would give it 3 maybe 3 1/2. Decent hotel, the beds were not as comfy as it looks. My husband and I experience extreme back pains the next day. Not many 4 star amentities, but the room was clean and convenient to everything on Bourbon. With that said, try to get a high floor room because the noise from outside will definitely keep you up.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: terrydverdun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 4 days in early Dec. before boarding a cruise ship. Overall the experience was great. I had originally found another hotel on line. When I brought the information to my travel agent, who is quite familiar with New Orleans, she talked me into the Crowne Plaza. While my original hotel was very good quality, she said the neighbourhood could be a bit sketchy coming home after midnight. Great call. The location of the Crowne Plaza on the corner of Canal and Bourbon is perfect. We were on the ninth floor near the corner. We could here the band playing on the street early in the evening, but that is one of the reasons you visit N.O. You have to walk about two blocks to get to the "meat" of Bourbon street. Everything else in the French Quarter is an easy 10 or 15 minute walk. If you stroll down Canal St. there is plenty of shopping and Harrah's casino is about ten minutes away. The St. Charles St. streetcar turns around in front of the hotel. As for the hotel itself, we arrived and departed by taxi, so we didn't have any of the valet parking problems described by others. The reception staff was friendly and efficient without being too "perky". I appreciated their businesslike approach. The room was very spacious with two queen beds, a sitting area and a work area with all of the usual amenities. The bathroom was large with an excellent shower with good water pressure. The shower products were replaced everyday. The housekeeping staff was top notch and the rooms were spotless and well prepared each day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy New Orleans and everything it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Elegance and great location...but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGardenGuy
Reviews.Content: Like WOW. This is not the lobby I think of when I think of a Crowne Plaza. If this isn't their flagship hotel, it probably should be! It's located in the French Quarter at Canal and Bourbon. The lobby is stunning and elegant. Tall ceilings with beautiful chandeliers, floors of shining marble, comfortable seating make it a place you want to call home. The rooms, too, seem to be a step above the Crowne Plaza norm. Dark wood furniture with coordinated decor and accents, a nice amount of space, fun seating and top notch beds make for a comfortable stay. The granite and marble bathroom has a coffee maker (with local Community coffee), hair dryer, magnifying mirror, and a Speakman shower head. Bring your own amenities, as theirs are blah. The gym is nicely equipped and there is a small outdoor pool, minus the hot tub. The Bourbon House restaurant will knock your socks off. Huge (!), floor to ceiling windows with a fun view of Bourbon Street, bow-tied wait staff and crisp white linens make for an outstanding first impression. I've included pictures of the menus. The small lobby bar was functional. The Astor Crowne Plaza could easily be a five star property with a few easy changes. The staff was hit and miss. Housekeeping and the front door staff were wonderful. The front desk staff were less than impressive and useless when it came to helping me solve my internet connection problems (for which there is a $10 charge). The concierge was helpful but was in a huge hurry for no apparent reason. The carpeting in the rooms was also filthy...and could easily be improved with a thorough vacuuming. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the rooms, either. Lastly, the bed pillows were like chair cushions. I had been to this property before and was more impressed the previous times. But for location and southern elegance and a fair price, it's a pretty good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: poopdeckFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza over the Christmas holidays. Average hotel is most aspects, but the location at the corner of Bourbon and Canal is a real plus. Reasonably priced. The room we had was large and spacious. While the window was directly above a parking garage and noisy cooling tower, it had a view to the river. The window was filthy. The overall feel is that of an older hotel that has been brought to code, but not completely. We had bedside lamp cords strung down a wall and around a corner, with few wall outlets. Plenty of hot water. Good size bathroom and layout. Small safe in the room. Did not use parking. We were not treatly rudely as mentioned in other reviews, but there was a certain "attitude" among front desk staff that was lacking. I recommend the hotel, but it would be so much more inviting if there was just a little more courtesy and willingness to help displayed by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: fairtravels
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans for a one night stay with the kids. The hotel is fine and the price was right but if you are driving the only way in and out is by using their valet parking. I am writing this as we wait for our car. So far we have waited one hour. Because of this issue I am unable to recommend this hotel. Look elsewhere if you are driving to N. O.

Reviews.Title: “This is how you do it”
Reviews.Author: jbhb
Reviews.Content: My family has spent the last few days at the Crowne Plaza and have been completely delighted. The rates are very reasonable, the rooms clean and spacious and the staff kind and helpful. We like hotels that don't nickle and dime over everything but provide a comfortable home base on a vacation. We like that there aren't $8 bottles of water out or a mini bar "for our convenience." We like that the internet fee is reasonable, we love the view and the location. We were staying someplace else in New Orleans originally and left after 2 nights. This hotel saved our vacation and we greatly appreciate the incredible service.

Reviews.Title: “NOLA...Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SandnSun67
Reviews.Content: It seemed pricey at first but given the area and proximity to Bourbon it was worth it. I really liked the valet and was easy to check in. The parking lot is a good ways away but even checkout was ok. I wish the checkout and curbside loading of shuttles was a bit more organized. All guests seemed to show up at the curb and there was not a point person to 'herd' us and keep us in line and pointed to the correct shuttle. Was still a very good stay and we'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Trip”
Reviews.Author: TSTrippin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned after a week at the Crowne Plaza New Orleans. I have nothing but praise for the hotel and staff. I found none of the rudeness others spoke of. In fact I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge was always a great help and actually requested our feedback from special side trips to places he was less familiar with. Restaurant waiters and staff were eager to please and I found the entire staff, desk, housekeeping and doormen to be funny, friendly and gracious. The room was very comfortable, great beds and pillows (Yay!). The only complaint was the breakfast buffet which was very skimpy in my opinion. We had a memorable lunch one rainy day and were entertained and enlightened by our engaging waiter. I would stay there again without hesitation and recommend it to others looking for a fine hotel with easy access to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: cat330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the corner of Canal st and Bourbon. It is near all the excitement of the french quarter but far enough to avoid most of the noise. The French quarter is within walking distance. The best thing about this hotel is that it offers Papa Noel rates in December. Hurry as they fill up fast. The room was very clean and the staff was all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Family Trip minus expensive valet”
Reviews.Author: vunje
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for our family get away. Quiet rooms, friendly and helpful staff, and perfect location. Worst part is the valet parking which is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: jpsirx
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here for a conference and had no problems at all. Staff was pleasant, hotel room clean and spacious. Lobby nicely appointed with good quality restaurant, (bourbon house) attached. Location is on french quarter perimeter with streetcars across street, bourbon street and royal street around the corner. The stretch of canal st that it's on has some panhandlers and cheap stores, a bit of a seedy feel but not unsafe. I would stay in a bit quieter area off the main drag next time but otherwise the hotel and its staff are perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: edgar5757
Reviews.Content: Big game in town, and hotel was full. Nonetheless it was quite in the room,that facing Bourbon. We felt safe. The room was next to the elevator and the ice maker but it was quiet. Fourth floor location. Small glimpse of Bourbon St.The cleaning ladies were super very quiet and thorough.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for the great stay at your hotel! We booked 3 rooms for 5 nights and took two sets of friends. Prior to staying at the Astor, we stayed at the Roosevelt for 2 nights. Although the Roosevelt was very nice, I have to say the people and the service at the Astor were far more superior. Paul, the Concierge, was very helpful and knowledgeable. He did some research for us for Thanksgiving dinner and we ended up choosing The Red Fish Grill. He even made the reservations. It was excellent and we had a delicious meal. The guys in our group took his recommendation on what to see and loved the Civil War and WWII museums. The executive hostesses, Miss Pamela, Miss Irian and Miss Rhonda (from Accounting) were excellent. They were all so friendly, kind and helpful. We really enjoyed spending time with them and picking their brains about NOLA life, where to go, etc. By the time we left they felt like family. They are already missed. The hotel was in the perfect location, our rooms were clean and comfortable, the beds were great, the Bourbon Milk Punch at the Bourbon House was incredible, and everyone made us feel special. I already recommended this hotel to friends will be visiting NOLA next week and will continue to sing its praises. Thank you SO much for making our stay in NOLA an incredible experience.

Reviews.Title: “The concierge”
Reviews.Author: sue67-12
Reviews.Content: the concierge at our hotel (hotel monteleone) was having difficulty with the computer...so we walked over to the Astor Crowne Plaza and their concerge Paul Kernan was more than happy to help us. He arranged for tickets on a city tour and a boat tour as well as gave us excellent recommendations for things to do on our own. We are very appreciative of his services.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy NOLA”
Reviews.Author: islandlover1953
Reviews.Content: Great location on the corner of Burbon St and Canal to explore all of the French Quarter and Riverfront. The service was excellent. Room first assigned was not ready so we were quickly upgraded to a top floor room with executive floor privledges. Everything very clean, everyone very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: alittledabble
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about this property. We were here for a couple of nights. The pros: The hotel itself is updated and the facilities are worthy of the 4-stars they advertise. Nice and clean as well. This was my biggest concern in advance of the trip and I shouldn't have worried. It's a nice facility. The room was very large. Noise-wise, we asked to be in a "quiet room" and were given the 14th floor. The fact that all the rooms have ear plugs for free is a sign that this is an issue. but you should know that going in given the location. It was a non-issue for us in a "quiet" room. We heard a street band Saturday night and some commotion, but it was just white noise and in general, that kind of thing doesn't bother me. It was also a convenient walk to the French quarter, etc. Perhaps 10+ minutes to Jackson Sq. The Cons: The service went from just okay to bad. Morale seemed low, people seemed to be doing just the minimum to get the job done. Flat tone in voices, no hurry at all to help even if there's a line of people. We also had a mistake on our bill and had little help with that though it did finally get resolved after 3 different phone calls. The valet was a joke. Don't bring a car to this hotel. We had no choice, we drove into town. Utter lack of communication on the part of the valet service. I guarantee if you stay here and use the valet, you will end up frustrated and it will put a damper on your trip. Finally, the biggest drawback of this hotel for me was the location. I think this is a personal preference, granted. It's just at the edge of the French Quarter but the location (Canal and Bourbon) is really dicey. Canal can be rough in general and then on top of that, Bourbon St, particularly that end, is just sleezy with the Hustler club, etc etc. Many people LOVE being right on Bourbon, so just know when you go. But for me I prefer more of the charm of the rest of the French Quarter rather than the drunken slop of Bourbon, so I'll stay somewhere else next time. This may also be one of the better values hotel-wise, so factor than into your decision making and see if the location is worth sacrificing for the good deal. Just know that there will be times that you wont be able to get your car out of valet. Other hotels on Canal might also have similar issues I'm guessing.

Reviews.Title: “Two good experiences in a row!”
Reviews.Author: SippyOH
Reviews.Content: Checked in TH and out on SUN, spending 3 nights with Astor CP in NO. This was our second visit in mid NOV and another fine experience. Location is hard to beat! Just close enough to chaos and right near streetcar lines. Room was comfortable and ammenities were great on Executive Floor; cont'l breakfast and nice evening reception. Staff were friendly, polite and professional. Check-in and out were a breeze. Overall the facility was clean in spite of heavy traffic of guests. Housekeeping was outstanding. Adjacent Bourbon House was excellent for lunch and a little overpriced and loud for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Service was the worst I have ever had in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Rickey B
Reviews.Content: Valet service became a shuttle service to a pay & park. We were in New Orleans for three days. One day we needed our car and it took the valet service 1 hour to get our car. They kept bringing the wrong cars. When we checked out, they would not bring our car to us. As the young lady at the desk put it, you can either take a shuttle bus to the parking lot or you can walk. We had paid for valet service and I had tipped $10.00 to get our car the previous day.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad, and Ugly!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBunny52
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this property over the weekend. Let me share my stay with you...... THE GOOD: Staff was pretty friendly, the beds were very comfortable, 42" TV in room was nice and room service was prompt and breakfast was tasty. THE BAD: No free Internet in guest rooms...another $10 per day. No complimentary coffee.....another $2.50 for a small cup. Drinks in the bar were a bit pricey. A few noticeable items in my room showed the hotel's age. THE UGLY: Getting in and out of this location was terrible! Valet was extremely expensive ($32 per day) and not very convenient at checkout. I was asked to board a shuttle with luggage in hand and then taken to a parking lot about a mile from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mcwillm
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful. It is around the corner from The main drag. It is in the French Quarter, but somehow away for it. Right on Canal which is a great location. We did not rent a car and walked everywhere from there! The cleaning service is slow. We would be out all day and then go back to the hotel to take an afternoon rest and the room would still not be clean. Once the room was cleaned, it was fine. The room is not the best room I have been in, but we didn't go to stay in the room! The breakfast is not that great. We got omelettes, but it didn't come with toast?? We did not eat dinner there. The doormen were always excellent and ready for directions, even looking on their phones for walking directions!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierfan_7
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for us while spending 4 nights in New Orleans. The room was nice and clean with comfortable bedding. We liked the fact that going out the front door we could catch one of the streetcars to either the riverwalk area or to the garden district. Going out the side door of the hotel which opens onto Bourbon Street walk a few steps turn right and there is Acme Oyster Bar and Felix's (perfect if you like oysters on the half shell or any other kind of oyster). We are priority club members so took advantage of the complimentary breakfast and happy hour drinks and appetizers when we were still in the hotel. We had a lot of things on our agenda to see and do, so we didn't spend much time in our room. The front desk staff and bellmen were always friendly and helpful. We will definitely look into staying here again if we return on another trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurlFam
Reviews.Content: Great location on Canal between Royal and Bourbon Street. Close enough to walk anywhere in the French Quarter, St Charles and Canal streetcars just outside the door. It is quite loud from late afternoon until about 11 or so because of the loud brass band that plays on the corner of Bourbon and Canal (we were on the sixth floor overlooking Canal). The hotel is fine but could use an update. Our king room was a little larger than average, especially in a major city. Room was clean but not sparkling, the panel covering the air conditioning/heating unit fell off and wouldn't stay back on when I tried to fix it (and housekeeping didn't seem to notice or try to fix it). Not a big problem though. Large flat screen was nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Concierge wasn't particularly helpful in helping us find a good breakfast place on a Saturday (we found Stanley's in Jackson Square on our own and were delighted with breakfast there). On our last night, the fire alarm was pulled at 5 am by a drunk college kid, but fortunately we were up already to catch an early flight. That, combined with a few interactions we saw between security and other guests makes me wonder how good the security team is at the Crowne Plaza. None of which is enough to deter me from staying there again. In short, nice value, GREAT location, and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at the cnr of bourbon street and canal street so could not be in a better location, hotels on bourbon street would be crazy loud with the bars and clubs being open till 3am. Checkin was easy, staff friendly. Room is beautiful overlooking canal street, we had a gift of ear plugs if needed and linan spray which was nice. Bedding is very nice and bathroom is well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, especially the concierge Paul Kernan”
Reviews.Author: Yoram S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in September 2011. Enjoyed very much the accomodation and the location. We were especially impressed with Paul Kernan whose excellent advice and guidance added a great value to our stay and enjoyment of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A "just OK" Hotel with the best location at NOLA”
Reviews.Author: EDalcin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just ok, more suitable to conventions. Stay away of the restaurant, specially at the breakfast. The employees don't care about you. Takes ages to have a table, because they open just a minimum part of the tables available. And, it doesn't starts at 6:30AM, as say the adverts. It goes beyond 8:30AM. Actually, there is a plenty of options to good food, in affordable prices. There is no reason at all to get into the restaurant at the hotel to be disrespect by the attendants. The roons are OK and the location is great. Acctually, the location is the best feature in this hotel. Worth a stay, if you can stay off the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “You could not ask for better in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Berlinwill
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! Overall our stay here was very relaxing and comfortable. I give it 5 stars! No need to use the overpriced vallet parking, and no need to have over priced breakfast here either. These seemed to be the things people have complained about most. There are tons of alternatives to both parking and breakfast. The staff was fantastic and helpful. The room was immaculate , beds were very comfortable. Bedding changed daily. Not much of a view from my window, but I was not in N.O. to sit and stare out the window. We had two rooms and had to move hotels after the weekend, and we wished we could have stayed in the Astor Crowne Plaza. Everything is within reach from this hotel. This place was a gem in the crown of a wonderful city. I cannot wait to go back! .

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better location in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: mbmomma
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect - walking to everything - right on French Quarter and at a trolly stop. When we checked in, our room was large and roomy but really loud - a big steam vent from ajoining room and ice machine made it bad. We asked to be moved and they accomodated us no problem. The room we ended up in was a bit small in an older building(hubby called it "European style") but it was clean, refurbished and quiet. The bed was really comfy too. To say it was quiet on the corner or Bourbon and Canal Streets is saying something. The view was right into the ajoining building, but it's pretty much like that there, so can't complain about that. So, the accomodations are fine - but it's all about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip October 2011”
Reviews.Author: nanaseventimes
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice and comfortable room. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Great view of Bourbon Street from the 13th floor. Food was awesome. Our meeting rooms were also very comfortable. Had a little difficulty with VPN connection, but internet access was OK. Shopping and entertainment was very close to hotel and feel that accessibility is a well worth the cost. All in all great experience.

Reviews.Title: “This ia a classic hotel with the empasis on class”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler154954
Reviews.Content: I need a firm Matress and after contacting thefron desk, they showed up with extra topping and made it right for me. The location is fablous trolley cas in verry direction, the garden district and audobon park,inserturaium the aquarium, the french market. Get a Beiienette right on Burbon st and Canal the excirement was right outside the door, but when the door closed and you were on the inside you were taken back in time as the chaos faded behind you

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: DoubleEagleDave
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel on Canal Street. Very near Bourbon Street. Bourbon Street Oyster Bar and Acme Oyster House very close. And some great food at GW Fins. But coming into the Atrium, you know you're in excellence. Treated us like kings and queens. Great spacious room, excellent friendly staff, free breakfast (Priority Club) and Manager's Happy Hour. Just loved our entire experience...next time back, gotta stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ask for room away from street”
Reviews.Author: CandCPhilly
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Hotel is conveniently located on the edge of the French Quarter at Bourbon & Canal Streets. This location places the hotel within easy walking distance of some of the best restaurants and attractions in New Orleans. That said, be sure to ask for a room on a higher floor not facing onto either Bourbon or Canal Streets. The noise level can be pretty intense late into the night. Bands set up on the streets and play until all hours. Meanwhile, the crowd is whooping it up until 3 am weekdays, 4 or 5 am weekends. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel. We were there for a conference. The hotel-supplied conference food was lacking and one fellow attendee compared the bread pudding to government surplus cheese. But so what? There is so much VERY GOOD traditional New Orleans cuisine available practically at the hotel doorstep, the problem of poor quality hotel event food is a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Old World”
Reviews.Author: kmog30
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the suite we stayed in was comfortable and clean. If sleep is a priority do not stay in rooms overlooking Bourbon Street. Even with ear plugs, the sound of the brass band playing till 4:AM penetrated and made for a restless night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - all you ever need”
Reviews.Author: GAhiker
Reviews.Content: I have visited New Orleans regularly for about 20 years and this hotel stands out as having all I need. It is right on the edge of the French Quarter, so it is perfectly located for sightseeing and music in and around the Quarter. It is across the street from a street car stop, so getting uptown is easy. It is a clean, well kept hotel. It is probably missing some of the bells and whistles that some of the other hotels in the french quarter provide, but the price is right. And all the bells and whistles are out of the hotel! I never spend any time at the hotel during the day. When Icome back to regroup before dinner, the staff is always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All That I Couldl Want”
Reviews.Author: DesAmie
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor-New Orleans is an excellent hotel. I booked the hotel last year for our club that sponsored a trip to New Orleans Thanksgiving Weekend for the Bayou Classic. We have been doing this trip for 10+ years & the Crowne Plaza Hotel is by far the best we have stayed in. The rooms were neat & clean with flat screen TV's & the entire staff attended to our every need. Everything that is on their website is actually in the hotel; no suprises. By booking so many rooms I was given an awesome deal on the rate. The entire atmosphere of the hotel is wonderful. There is a roof top pool, balcony overlooking Bourbon Street, as well as banquet rooms, lounge, resturant, exercise romm & beautiful decor. The location is is @ the corner of Canal & Bourbon so park your car & stroll through the French Quarter's. If traveling with small children the hotel doesn't have much to offer except the pool as do most hotels in the French Quarter's & Central Business District.That area of the city is geared more to adults. I will be returning again this Thanksgiving along with 56 other friends & family. I could just go on & on about this hotel; try it you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza for four nights recently. If we werenâ€™t in New Orleans for a business function, I would have preferred to stay somewhere more charming, but the Astor was a solid business hotel. The bed was very comfortable but was really high off the ground so someone with mobility issues might have a problem. There was a flat screen TV with a lot of channels, including on demand movies. I didnâ€™t use the gym, but my husband said it was better than average. There is a business center with free internet access, which is pretty unusual and very much appreciated. Also, I donâ€™t believe they charged a resort fee, although I could be wrong about that. One thing I missed was a casual coffee stand at the hotel. In my experience, most hotels do have a Starbucks or something similar. The Astor had a Dickie Brennan restaurant called Bourbon House, which looked really nice, but was expensive and not really an appropriate place for just a cup of coffee. One advantage to this hotel is it is on the right side of Canal Street for access to the French Quarter - it is right next to Bourbon Street. Many business hotels are on the other side of Canal, which necessitates crossing a very wide street. Nothing really stood out for me about this hotel, but it is fine for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: sharoncasey1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in October. Location was fabulous. We were in the old part and overlooked Canal Street. The room was very nice and the cleaning staff were great. Was surprised there were no refrigerators in rooms but was sent one very quickly by the staff at the front desk. The girls there were extremely helpful when on the day before our last day there we saw several buses full of college students unload and pile onto the floors where we were staying. The head housekeeper saw us comming out of our room and advised us to go immediately and ask to be moved because the noise level would keep us up all night. The ladies at the front desk went into action and we were moved very quickly to another area of the hotel with many apologies for the inconvenience. I cannot say enough about the restaurant attached to the hotel. Their staff is fabulous and extremely helpful. They make one feel very special and the food was top quality and presented very well. Had raw oysters for the first time and I am now a fan. Paul, the concierge, is the man to go to for help planning your outings in the city. He was most helpful and we enjoyed his many suggestions. All in all this hotel and it's wonderful staff made our trip to New Orleans most memorable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. THANKYOU Astor Crowne Plaza staff!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rcrobman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and have for the most part only good things to say about it! The location is absolutely perfect - right at the corner of Canal and Bourbon Street in the French Quarter. Although it can be a bit hectic and noisy at times being at that particular corner we did not find that the noise bothered us in our room which was front and center on Canal Street. When we arrived there were a few problems with our room - apparently there had been a major college football game a week or so previously and the hotel suffered some damage in some of the rooms. That being said I cannot commend the hotel enough for how they dealt with the problems. In every case they had someone up to our room correcting whatever problem we found within an hour of our report and in each case they fixed everything to our complete satisfaction. A special mention needs to be made about the concierge - Paul Kernan - at this hotel. We cannot say enough good about Paul! His knowledge of the city and the French Quarter is extensive and the advise that he gave us on where to eat, how to get places, suggestions on what to see etc etc helped us greatly! We can only say that if you are staying in this hotel make sure that you take advantage of this great resource - it's like having your own personal knowledge base of New Orleans available. All in all we truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would have no problem recommending it to others - you certainly couldn't find a better location to launch your excursions from and I doubt you will find a hotel that is more attentive to you as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expected great”
Reviews.Author: martymonk
Reviews.Content: The Astor has many nice qualities however, it just does not deliver the complete package. Depending the time you arrive it may be difficult to get near the entrance to unload because there is only a small area to drive up and with taxis and other people coming and going on canal street it is difficult. Once inside the lobby is very nice and staff helpful. We stayed on the executive floor and the room we had was noisy due to large cooling equipment bellow 4th floor window. The view was the brick wall of a building adjacent to the hotel. There a few rooms that do have a view of Bourbon Street. (you may want to request that side). Also there is a charge for internet service on the executive floor, disappointing. Only the first beverage was complementary in the executive club. Staff was friendly there. The restaurant may be the best part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: Sophie425
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother and dad for a few days in August 2011. My mobile, my brotherâ€™s mobile and my designer glasses were stolen from my hotel room. Fortunately my passport and money were in the safe. The hotel did not care; Iâ€™ve written numerous letters since I got back and not once have they replied. The staff were rude and uncaring. They were extremely unsympathetic when I asked to move rooms. We decided to cut short our stay in New Orleans and quickly left the city. I was shocked and appalled by the service and I never want to stay in a Crown Plaza again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crwchief6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip so I personally did not pay for the room. If you want a nice place to stay in New Orleans and want to feel safe and close to the action of Bourdon then this is the place. I parked on the street and was greeted by an individual who took care of the vehicle for me. Yes parking is expensive here and it stinks to have to pay. I think it was $35 a night. Other than that everything else was great. Check-in was a breeze and the hotel staff were friendly. Room was a king. Bed was very comfortable. Nice size room to move around. For PC members you can go to the reception room for light food and drinks. There is also a resturant in the hotel but I havent eaten there. I had a view of bourdon street and surrounding buildings. Noise was not a problem. Bourdon street is right next door so if you came for the party you dont have far to walk. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price gouging”
Reviews.Author: Xerxes R
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get everything confirmed in writing by a sales associate before booking. They don't let you out of the reservation once it's made. Also, you have to pay $35 per day valet charge even if you don't have a car. There are additional fees for everything. Buyer beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mumsie75633
Reviews.Content: We traveled with friends to attend a wedding on the cruise ship before it embarked. Our friend stays in Holiday Inns for work, so he had accumulated lots of "points" and paid for our room. I have no idea how much the room was, but it was on the fourth floor, an upgrade I believe. It was very nice, and we even had a praline on the bed instead of the usual mint/chocolate! There was a hot buffet breakfast every morning on that floor, and happy hour later in the afternoon. I do not know what the other floors/rooms are like, but we were treated very well on the fourth floor. No noise, but we were not facing Bourbon Street. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: parisrome2008
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect,- walking distance to the places we wanted to get to - Bourbon Street, French Market, Riverwalk. The room was great - high ceiling, king bed that was very comfortable, big bathroom. Concierge was very helpful - front desk was ok, bell desk was also very helpful. Our room was facing Bourbon Street on the second floor - you get all the noise so I do not suggest this.

Reviews.Title: “Corner of Bourbon and Canal”
Reviews.Author: Neall007
Reviews.Content: The best thing going for the Astor Crowne Plaza is it's location. Right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, it is walking distance to bars, restaurants, the waterfront and even Harrah's casino. The rooms are comfortable and clean, and the staff were more or less helpful. There are often conventions at this property, so be prepared for the lobby to be full of patrons. Also, be wary of the "valet" parking. It is $30 a day to hold your car, and when you are ready to retrieve it they load you on a bus and drive you 5 minutes away to the offsite parking lot. Not very convenient if you need your car in a hurry. There is a complimentary airport shuttle, but you will need to reserve in advance because there are limited spaces available.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great experience”
Reviews.Author: alinoel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 9/11 - 14 for a conference. The location is terrific for venturing out. My experience was tainted by a broken door lock for 2 days, and a mouse running around on my floor. As I waited in the hall for help with the door lock, a mouse ran out of one room and down the hall near me. It ran into another, so I told the maintenance staff about it. I saw it once more before they trapped it in a room. That was unpleasant for sure. My room was on the 7th floor and was over the HVAC system. I could hear it all the time, so I wish I would have been on the Bourbon street side or on a higher floor. Advice: higher floors if you are not on the Bourbon street side and to bring some sanitizing cleaners for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality...”
Reviews.Author: Karenfr0mWisc0nsin
Reviews.Content: My visit of 5 days at the Astor Crowne Plaza was truly a pleasing experience. The entire staff was courteous and always helpful. I was was booked into a 3rd floor room on the corner of Canal and Bourbon right over a jazz band, which after my long and tedious trip from Wisconsin was just a bit too distracting. A quick trip to the front desk and with a smile I was upgraded and put in a quiet room on the 6th floor.The rooms were spotless, the bed was so comfy and the breakfast on the 4th floor in the Executive Club was a true delight to wake up to. Not only was the food excellent but the staff was a pleasure. Conveniences abound with the location being near the French Quarter, Jackson Square and unique shopping in the area This was by all means, a 5 star experience. My son got married in the French Quarter on the bank of the Mississippi that week end. Thanks to the Crowne Plaza, the wedding was the Total Package. Karen from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy with a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCongeniality
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend and was not expecting this hotel in New Orleans on the corner of Bourbon to be so nice! A lot of hotels in this area have a stale, moldy smell. This one does not! From entrance to the room all was fresh. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Louisianatraveler11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful & clean. Staff was great & very helpful for directions. Beautiful inside. Room service was great and was 24 hours. We were upgraded and were able to go to 4th floor executive club which had free breakfast everyday. It also had first free drink at 5 pm with reasonable priced drinks after the first. Pam in executive club was very funny & helpful for breakfast. This is a beautiful historic hotel close to everything in walking distance. Loved it, no complants. I left my camera in my car and it was valeted. Everything was still in my car, nothing missing.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza from Sept 21-26. It was our first trip to New Orleans and we were not disappointed. This hotel has a great location, corner of Bourbon & Canal. We were able to easily walk to all of the area hot spots, Jackson Square, Riverfront, Harrahs. We also used the Trolley Cars, they run up & down Canal St. with stops right across the street from the hotel. We had booked through Hotwire and requested a room on a higher floor because we were worried about the street noise level. They did not disappoint us, we had a beautiful room on the 14th floor. It was great! Very comfortable, nice bed & Flat screen TV, & quiet at night. Housekeeping service was also great, they cleaned and refreshed our room twice a day. We were pleasantly suprised to come in late at night and find our bed remade and the bathroom picked up with fresh towels. We also had privledges to the 4th floor Executive lounge & enjoyed breakfast there every morning. I must mention Pamela Green who was our Hostess most mornings we were there. What a great employee in your hotel! She was pleasant & friendly, really went out of her way to make us feel welcome to New Orleans. I had also mentioned when I booked my reservation that I was celebrating a birthday. They didn't forget & we had champagne set to our room with birthday wishes. Thanks Don, that gesture really made us feel special! I must also say thanks to Paul Kernan, the Conciege at this hotel. He was readily available and assisted us on several occasions with great tips. Overall this hotel is a great value at a great location! Lots of great friendly people who genuinely seem happy to help you enjoy your visit at this hotel and New Orleans. I would certainly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at start of French quarter.”
Reviews.Author: twoz311
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at the center of it all. At the start of Burbon st , close to casino, and affordable. Rooms are clean, and medium sized. Overall good value, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ESU1988
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA for a conference and stayed at the Crown Plaza. Rooms were clean and very spacious, bed was comfie. Yes the wi fi was painfully slow, but I was able to connect at the conference site so no big deal. Overall this property was well run, clean friendly and frankly all I could have asked for. 2 thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy3214
Reviews.Content: I took a vacation to NOLA with friends from Houston. I had such a great time. The staff was awesome. Duana & Michelle @ the front desk were so nice and gave some great recommendations for breakfast. Melissa the manager went out of her way to accomodate my requests for the rooms that I had reserved. Also, the eggs benedict that we ordered from room service was amazing.The location of the hotel was the best part! Overall, the hotel helped made my experience in Nola great!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DallasDisneylover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and absolutely loved everything about this hotel. The location is fabulous, the staff is extraordinary, and it's quite comfortable. My only complaint was that housekeeping didn't replace our dirty coffee cups, they simply wiped them out and returned them to the tray. (I know, because we tested them by placing a bit of lipstick on the bottom of the cup.) Mr. Zimmer, I hope that gets resolved. Other than that, this is a 4 star beauty!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Classy”
Reviews.Author: pinkjdd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and it was a lovely hotel if you are looking for a "big box" experience. The entry was wonderful and welcoming (and cool!) but the rooms and amenities were very pedestrian. The hotel is at the corner of Bourbon and Canal so it can get noisy, but if you are there to explore the French Quarter it's a super great location. The executive lounge on the 4th floor serves a breakfast buffet and afternoon cocktails but it's not a controlled floor and they don't check room keys or names. I paid the extra money for the executive floor and it was disheartening to know I could have saved the money and just walked in. The advertised high speed internet in the rooms was slower than molasses in winter. Save the money and use the business center on the 1st floor if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mobi136
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a conference in New Orleans at the Astor Crowne Plaza. The hotel was old but stately and beautiful and the staff there was wonderful right down to the bus boys and valet. We were always greeted with a smile and hello. I would love to return for a vacation justto see the city and it's history. The only thing I didn't care for was the music outside after 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: gencle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not as i had hoped. To begin we got nothing we requested for a group of three. I almost got burnt in the shower since the knob malfunctioned. Our bedding wasnt changed & each maid seem to blame the other. Furniture was old & outdated (not very welcoming). Some of the staff were rude & not very helpful. Best thing about this hotel is the excellent location which is in reach of everything. There r many other good hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... but beware of parking charges!!!”
Reviews.Author: Papa-Ratzi
Reviews.Content: We were placed at this hotel after signing up for a time share presentation we found on Halfoffdepot.com. We are already Priority Club members for the Holiday Inn chain that owns Crowne Plaza, and have stayed at other locations around the country. If you are visiting New Orleans to check out the city... you can't do much better than this location. It's on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, so you will find this place to be right in the heart of the action and walking distance to most anything. Street band played every night we were there and man did they perform. Everything we expected and more. Lots of great restaurants nearby... my top recommendation is Drago's for their Chargrilled Oysters and Johnny's Po' Boys. You will find New Orleans is fairly expensive when it comes to food, but these two places are not only a good value, but have very good food. Try the Johnny's special po' boy... you'll thank me. Astor itself was nice... a little fancier than we like, but nice. Room was a good size and beds were extremely comfortable, but view was mostly of unattractive rooftops. Pool is small and more of a singles spot than a place to hang out with your kids (at least it was that way on our visit). My only complaint was the manditory valet parking. We were charged $32 a day for parking, not including a tip for the guys who retrieve your car. The garage is also 8 blocks away (from what I was told), and traffic is bad. I was thankful everytime that they brought my car in one piece. After we had checked-out and returned home, I made a call questioning a charge on my final bill which was handled quickly. However, the staff member I was talking to asked me about my stay and after complaining about the valet charges... she told me there is a nearby lot that I could have used with $4 daily charges. Don't be surprised like I was, do the research prior to arriving concerning parking and inexpensive food. You'll enjoy yourself much better when you don't feel like you've been nickel and dimed into the poor house.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Astor Hotel New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: troschne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for my second time Labor Day weekend for Southern Decadence. The front desk staff was very courteous. When I got to my room, I noticed single strands of black hair in the bathroom, which I will assume might have been erroneously left while the housekeeping staff was cleaning. Overall, the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel still does not have free WIFI in guest rooms--there is a charge for that. It is easily enough remedied, though. You just have to take your laptop to the lobby, get a signal, and go back to your room, and you're good for 24 hours. My big complaint, however, was the extremely homophobic remark that the valet/bellman, Marco, made to the other valet/bellman. Marco needs to realize that the "-- of -- in the lobby", as he so eloquently put it, were in town spending money, and helping to pay his salary. Someone needs to take that young man aside and give him a clue. This -- will take his business elsewhere next year. Nice hotel, mostly sub-par staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: SJAtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Astor Crowne Plaza in August for four nights. First off, this is the best location in New Orleans! The hotel is located right at the corner of Canal & Bourbon Street so anything you want to do is just outside your door. You are right on the edge of the French Quarter and the heart of downtown. Harrah's Casino is just 5 blocks away and there are so many bars and restaurants within 5-10 minutes walking distance you will never have to touch your car or get a taxi. The Astor is very safe, clean and welcoming. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We had the luxury of being upgraded to the Executive Level which provides breakfast as well as snacks and beer/wine in the afternoons. The Executive Hostess is awesome and takes care of everyone like they were family. The roof top pool is very nice and relaxing with a great view down to Bourbon Street. We booked the Astor after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were impressed the manager reads and comments on almost every review. We had the opportunity to meet him during our stay and thanked him for such a great trip. We will definitely return to the Astor as well as recommend to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ABB31
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Clean rooms, comfortable beds and linens, very close to all the action. Pool is small, but has a great urban feel being rooftop. Red Fish restuarant across Bourbon street is very delicious and Oceana down the street had amazing Naw' leans cusisine! Good size fitness room, and fairly friendly staff. The valet guys were by far the nicest, front desk left little to be desired. Fortunately we didn't need them too much! Really close access to the interstate too! Didn't get to do much touring around the city, but the trolley is right out front! We were on a mission...to party for the last fling before the ring! Very very fun!

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza is always consistent”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamBigJim
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Crowne Plaza numerous times and they never dissappoint. Although it's right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, once inside it's very nice and comfortable. We've never had problems with noise that I've heard others speak of. The only issue would be having to get into the hotel on a busy Friday or Saturday night. Just relax and everything will be fine. This is New Orleans! Also, if you can get access to the conceriege floor, it's worth it. They have quite the characters that work the breakfast/happy hour room and they were worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: rmsmith20
Reviews.Content: Summertime is a great time to visit NOLA because it is less crowded and the hotels are cheap. Booked here for one night to attend RUSH concert at the N.O. Arena. Ended up on the concierge level for less than $100 for the night. Hotel has been renovated and the furnishings were nice. Only downside was a very small pool. They had a nice cocktail/snacks happy hour, and the hot breakfast was very nice before returning home the next morning. The staff was pleasant and friendly. Would stay here again for the right price!!

Reviews.Title: “Astor Crown Plaza......a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Astor Crown Plaza over spring break for four nights. The location is wonderful being right on Bourbon Street and Canal Street. We stayed as part of a timeshare promotion purchased on Ebay. Stay firm and say no to the comical timeshare pitch and take the Visa gift card and run. The hotel was wonderful and we got a great nights sleep (ask for a room away from the noise up high). Highly recommend for a great nights sleep, classy hotel and the best location for doing NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible issues with service!”
Reviews.Author: mherchel
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was absolutely horrible! They overcharged me multiple times from my quoted rate and even when presented with the quote in paper, refused to do anything about it. The manager on duty was rude and did not even *want* to help. Horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful, indifferent staff and an overcharge that has not been fixed!”
Reviews.Author: Therchel
Reviews.Content: Your front desk associate made a mistake during my check-in yesterday morning. I was overcharged, and did not realize this mistake until this morning. I spoke to the night manager on duty, whose response was completely indifferent and unwilling to help. His first response was to absolve himself from any blame rather than take responsibility or apologize, but rather listed names of people who made ...the mistake, followed by a list of people who *may* be able to help me later this morning. He didn't offer to have anyone follow up with me, but rather said I'd have to come back later to resolve this issue, with complete disregard to my predicament, my time, or the fact that I have commitments later this morning at a conference I'm attending. This kind of indifference and unwillingness to help is totally unacceptable. I expect more from this brand and this hotel. This is an extremely frustrating experience that has altered my entire opinion of this brand! I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay to stay but please do not valet.”
Reviews.Author: Tuning_Sensei
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is itâ€™s location. Itâ€™s located right on Canal and Bourbon. Within minutes, you could walk to Harrahâ€™s, the mall, or the French Quarter. The most important aspect of any business is location, location, and location. In fact, if it were not for its location (and assuming everything else stays the same), this hotel would not survive very long. First and foremost, the hotel charges $30 per day for valet parking. Let me reiterate: $30/day for valet. Now, what would you expect for valet service? Would you expect to be able to drop your car off with a valet and have them take your car away and bring it back to you when you want it? Well, youâ€™ll get half of that. You see, dropping it off isnâ€™t the problem. The valet will gladly let you unload your car and then take it away on your behalf. Now when itâ€™s time to pick up your car and head home, herein lies the problem. You first must locate a valet to give your valet ticket to. This is a chore of itself. These valets are scattered all around with no central point of contact. After locating a valet and giving them your ticket, youâ€™ll now spend the next 25 minutes waiting...and waiting...and waiting...for a bus. Thatâ€™s right, a bus will come and pick you and several other hotel patrons up (about 12 of you can fit on the bus) and whisk you away to...to...to... a public lot. You now exit the bus on to the lot and now must locate another group of valets to ask for your keys (no identification of ownership of automobile required; itâ€™s on the honor system that youâ€™re pointing to your own car). After obtaining your keys, you load up your car and get ready to exit the lot. Think itâ€™s over? Not quite yet. You see, if your car happens to be blocked in by another car, you simply wait for the other car to leave or flag down the valet again and ask them to move the car(s) blocking you in. After thatâ€™s done, now youâ€™re finally ready to leave New Orleans and head home. I timed myself from the moment I checked out in the front lobby to when I actually got into my car on my smart phone: 35 minutes. This did not include the wait once I got into my car needing other cars to be moved so that I could exit the lot. If this sounds frustrating to you just to get your car, try doing all of this, outside in the pouring rain. The public lot where you are to find a valet with your keys, find your vehicle, and load up your vehicle is all outdoors and uncovered. Now the hotel calls this valet service. Does it sound like valet service to you? Go to the Sheraton, or Wyndham hotel (both located a block or two away). Watch how efficient their valet service is. They actually bring your car to you within minutes! Imagine that! In fact, every hotel Iâ€™ve stayed at with valet service does that. Donâ€™t forget what I stated earlier: you are paying $30/day for this so-called valet service. Do yourself a favor, use the Sheratonâ€™s valet service a block away. You do not have to be staying at the Sheraton to use their valet service. You can pay for your valet service when you leave. Customers of Sheraton get the convenience of paying it all at the end (if they take their cars out multiple times) or have it billed to the room. Just carry/roll your suitcase or luggage with you to the Crown Astor from the Sheraton. Youâ€™ll be paying the same price but youâ€™ll get your car sooner, delivered right to you, anytime youâ€™d like. Or you can find a public lot, stash your car there, and just hit up a cab back to the Crown Astor. Youâ€™ll save yourself a big headache. Oh, the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - PERFECT - PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I wanted to get away and enjoy a long weekend filed with great entertainment and food. New Orleans is the perfect weekend getaway for us. We travel quite a bit and have experienced many of the top tiered Hotel chains. We have to say the Crown Plaza Hotel Astor experience in New Orleans is first class. The Hotel is simple amazing. It is perfect in so many ways â€“ Location â€“ DÃ©cor â€“ Services â€“ Accommodations â€“ Staff â€“ Restaurants. We have been to New Orleans over 20 times (business and pleasure) and stayed in over a dozen different hotels in and around the French Quarter. Hand down this is the best all around hotel in New Orleans. Now that our son is at LSU we expect to visit more often. A Big Thank You to the Crown Plaza Hotel Astor Staff!! We will see you soon!! Paul & Amanda

Reviews.Title: “Great Room-Staff”
Reviews.Author: allenvenable1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ran into the city for a quick business trip. The Hotel is located at the corner of Bourbon Street and Canal. Since we live less than two hours away we are quite familiar with the city and this is not typically the location we look for when we come into New Orleans. We stayed at the recommendation of a friend and Wow are we glad we did. The front desk staff was very friendly and fast. Our room was extremely comfortable and the amenities were very good. The location actually worked very well for us this trip and would definitely stay here again. The one drawback is the $32.00 a day for parking. I was not happy about this or the fact that they park your car eight blocks away. But, this is New Orleans and parking is a premium and you definitely donâ€™t want to leave your car on the street. Thank you Astor for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “first time new orleans”
Reviews.Author: alastair4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in this hotel for four nights in August. Loved the location on the corner of Canal and Bourbon, certainly made it easy to go out at night to experience the food and culture of New Orleans. The restaurant attached to the hotel is great, loved the food and service. My only issue was with the bedding of the hotel, this would have to be the worst of the many hotels I have stayed in around the world. The pillows where small an uncomfortable and what was surprising is that none of the pillows had protectors on them. Not a great look when you pull the cover off to see old sweat and blood stains on your pillow. Also the sheets did not fit the bed properly and kept coming off the bed through the night. To add to this the mattress protector was to small for the bed as well. Because of this I would look at other options if I was to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel--Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: JakeRiley
Reviews.Content: Just spent a wonderful three days at the Astor Crowne Plaza. This is the first review I have ever submitted but felt that I had to let other visitors know about this great hotel. My daughter attends Tulane University, so my husband and I have been frequent visitors to New Orleans. This was our first visit to this hotel, but certainly wonâ€™t be our last. The valet parking attendants were polite and helpful, check in was quick and efficient and all the hotel personnel were friendly. Took advantage of the pool and health club every morning. Enjoyed a nice breakfast in the Executive Club every morning and a libation in the afternoon. Both Denise and Trudy made us feel welcome and took great care of us. The location is perfectâ€”everything is in walking distance. The St. Charles streetcar is right across Canal Street, so it is easy to hop on that to go to Tulane. Our room overlooked Bourbon Street, and although we could hear the music playing below, it certainly wasnâ€™t too loudâ€”and seemed to end at a reasonable hour. To the person who complained about the lack of a microwave and fridge, I donâ€™t know what hotels he has been staying in recentlyâ€”but the majority of hotels I stay in (all 4 or 5 star) do not have those amenities. Many hotels in touristy areas (Las Vegas, New Orleans, New York) charge for internet service. We come to New Orleans at least 4 times a yearâ€”from now on, the only place we will stay is the Astor Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Problematic parking”
Reviews.Author: Justanothermember
Reviews.Content: Just a note: Parking and valet service are a hassle here. Parking is by valet only, and on Canal Street only. When we checked in, cars waiting for valet service were clogging up Canal; on checking out, it's necessary to wait for a van to haul people to a lot at the edge of the Quarter. Not a big deal, but it was time-consuming and backed up. Otherwise, a great location and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst fears realized ! Check your Bedding....”
Reviews.Author: WooHoo27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and was looking forward to a little bit of comfort and luxury. The check-in was smooth and friendly and our first room looked great ( yes, the beds are strangely high and I'm 6 ft ! My 8 year old niece had a bit of trouble getting in and out of bed !) Unfortunately we had to move due to our bathroom sink having a huge crack in it...we were moved to a similar but smaller room. Then, the next day my mum looked at the pillows after my sister had discovered her pillow was heavily sweat stained by a previous occupant (s)...blood and sweat was the general motif ! Disgusting...my sister went to the front desk and the Housekeeping manager was dispatched to check the bedding and supervise the room cleaning. We had to vacate our room for over two hours but when we came back the room had a reassuring bleach aroma and the pillows were brand new. No more problems but no obvious concern was demonstrated by any managers about the bio-hazard filth in their 4 STAR property. We did ask for compensatory gesture and after being offered to have an internet charge removed from our bill (which we declined) we did receive a one night refund ! It would have been nicer if the hotel had offered a heartfelt apology but I guess if you stay in an anonymous large chain hotel that's the price you pay ! The location was central but the entrance seemed to be a congregation point for a few dodgy characters!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: livnlov
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, from the valet stand to housekeeping. We requested a room away from Bourbon Street (which I suggest because of the noise) and had a very quiet room with very comfortable beds. I was disappointed because we the bed had foam pillows but note - you can call the front desk and request down pillows. The location is very convenient and having a CVS Pharmacy and a Walgreens within a block was nice. For those traveling with kids, we warned the pool is very small. If I were to travel to New Orleans again, I would stay at the Astor again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY - FELT LIKE ROYALITY”
Reviews.Author: Desperado823
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both celebrated our 65th birthday this summer and decided to treat ourselves to a vacation. One of the places we decided on was New Orleans. The Crown Plaza had been recommended to us and we are certainly grateful for that recommendation. The location is perfect. From the time we steped out of our vehicle at the curb, our every need and request was more than adequately handled. The valet was friendly and helpful. They welcomed us as though they were actually glad we had come. The gentleman who took care our luggage was most gracious and explained all the services of the hotel and wanted us to be sure that we were comfortable and well taken care of. Bull Harris is an asset to the hotel. Check in was fast and simple. Staff was very polite and offered to help in any way we needed. The price of the room was surprisingly very affordable. The decor of the lobby area was impressive. Our room was spectacular!!!. We were on the 7th floor. The room was clean and beautiful. The bathroom was spotless. The bed was so comfortable that I could have stayed there all day and missed all the site-seeing. It was very quiet and restful. My husband enjoyed getting the newspaper early every morning. We were extended the pleasure of the breakfast on he 4th floor which was great. The food was beautifully displayed and delicious to eat. The staff again was friendly and made us feel right at home each morning. Just after we arrived I realilzed I left my cell phone in the car which was now in the garage. I mentioned it to the valet, Carlos, and thinking they might have time to retrieve it sometime during the day while we were out site-seeing and leave it at the desk. Immediately he radioed for someone to go get it from the car in the garage and I had my cell phone within 10 minutes of making the request. Carlos, was so very helpful with directions and recommended the perfect place for carriage rides. He was a wealth of information and so very friendly. A real ambassador for the city of New Orleans. Everytime we saw Bull or John or Carlos, they quietly wanted to know if we were enjoying our visit and asked if we needed anything. The day we left, we ran across Bll Harris as we were leaving and he remembered that we had celebrated our birthdays and he smiled said "65 and counting". How very special that the remembered with all the people he comes in contact with each day. My husband and I have never stayed anywhere where we felt more welcome and more like we were special. the accomodations were perfect. It is a hotel that we will return to for sure. We recommed the Crowne Plaza to anyone who we know is traveling to New Orleans. We thank everyone at the hotel for making this a wonderful memory. Dean & Howard Mason

Reviews.Title: “I Expected More, Got Less”
Reviews.Author: DrGomab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Astor for a conference and I arrived with great expectations after reviewing the hotel's website. Since the conference covered my 10th year anniversary, I had my wife join me two days in the conference.I stayed at the hotel a total of 7 days. First I will cover the Good. The location. The French Quarter! Hotel right on Canal and Bourbon St. If you like Bourbon Street and the musician this is cool, if you have trouble sleeping and are easily waken...oops. Not the hotel for you. A street band plays right outside the hotel each night. Nice lobby, but small with little seating. The A/C works well in the hotel, perhaps a little cold, but you will appreciate a good A/C in New Orleans in August. Front desk staff was nice and helpful, they were attractive, but not outgoing. The beds were first class. I didn't look under them and I did not care too. Door men will help with luggage and hailing cabs. Not So Good: Biggest Gripe, the hotel does not have microwaves or a fridge as standards. They do not even have microwaves available at ALL! I booked my room, months in advance, but when I arrived the fridge was not in my room and there were non available. Also, the upcharge to request a fridge was $25. Later that day, they did bring a fridge. They do have ice on every floor, but with the heat, cold water is a must. They feed you well in NOLA so it was disappointing they did not offer microwaves or any place to re-heat good grub! The room was nice, but it is time for them to refresh them. The carpet was bad...visibly dirty. Paying for internet??? This should be reserved for the Super 8, wait I think they provide free internet. Free internet should be a no-brainer. Finally, I had some documents sent to me next day to review for my next trip. They arrived on 8/3, I though they were not sent and a partner called his assistant to verify, but did not call back. The day before I checked out, I got a call that I had a package waiting for me. It was 8/8. The lady at the business center apologized, and it left me little time to prepare. Other Comments: Room size was average. The conference rooms were average. The view from my room on the 12 floor was lame. That is the point with the Astor Crown Plaza, it felt like a standard Marriott Hotel, not like the Ritz-Charles down the street. I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Shirley M
