Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel when I took my son to the 2011 Jr. Olympics at the Tad Gormley Stadium and had the best time every. The hotel was very curteous and the prices for the food was not bad for being on Canal & Bourbon Street. I will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised I would love it so much..”
Reviews.Author: carllou
Reviews.Content: Right next to crazy Bourbon street but you would never known from the inside. The place was grande. I'm so happy I went through Priceline and lucked out. Check in was fast. The room was nice and clean. They also gave you a little surprise gift in a nice package. Ear plugs and sleeping eye mask. What a nice touch to keep out the noise. The room was small but I didn't mind. The bed was simply heavenly. I liked this place a lot. I just thought the pool was tiny but hey..you can't have everthing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Erik B
Reviews.Content: My family including my five year old stayed at the Astor Crown Plaza from August 3rd - 6th. It was our first time in New Orleans and we had a wonderful time! The hotel is the PERFECT location for families! Located at the corner of Bourbon Street and Canal, it is the "starting line" of Bourbon Street. We were on the 3rd floor and yes we did hear a little jazz music at night...but it only added to the charm of this amazing experience. We were initially given a quiet room but we decided to move and live in the moment! "When in Rome...or this case New Orleans...do as the New Orleanians!" PROS: Paul the Concierge!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! He has the Midas touch. Every single thing he recommended was TOP NOTCH! KUDOS PAUL! VALET: We used the Valet for our car and never waited more than 5 minutes to get it. I don't know how the Valet department does it...but that's an efficient operation! KUDOS VALET! ROOMS/SUITES: Huge room, 2 big closets, large bathroom, Comfy beds, lots of room for kids to run around POOL: FUN! Daughter was entertained! EXERCISE ROOM: Husband was happy! BUSINESS Mail/post office CENTER: The very nice woman who helped me mail my packages was a sweetheart! EXECUTIVE FLOOR RECEPTION HOSTESS: You HAVE to meet her...so much fun! BOURBON HOUSE: GREAT FOOD! CONS: Housekeeping. We continued to find things under that lovely red satin bedskirt that didn't belong to us. The young lady gladly came back and re-did or fixed whatever issue came up. We would stay here again. PS Need a manicure/pedicure....go to APRIL's right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K”
Reviews.Author: bnatigcomman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Hotels in New Orleans, I probably would not recommend this one. For the price it is an O.K property but there are some down sides starting with the Hotel parking. You have to use the valet service and it's an additional 30 dolllars per night. Getting in and out of the hotel is a pain because the front door faces Canal street and there is not an adequate space in front of the hotel to pull in and out so you have to unload and load literally in the street. Internet is an additionl 10.00 per night. The room was not very clean. The sink was dirty, toilet was cracked and hair all over the bathroom. Had a constant problem with the door lock. The staff was quick to always fix it but it was a problem our entire stay. Lots of kids staying here so expect lots of noise and unsupervised kids everywhere. Room service is expensive and not worth it. If your room faces Bourbon Street expect alot of noice until around 2am. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: HoosTravelin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Astor for three nights near the end of July. We were in town with a large group for a long weekend. We enjoyed our stay and I can echo many of the earlier comments on TA - very helpful staff at the front desk, large clean rooms, higher beds than in most hotels, quick elevators and nice lobby (used the free wireless). The location is ideal for visitors, sitting on the corner of Canal and Bourbon (which is the beginning of Bourbon Street at the edge of the French Quarter). So, you could go down Bourbon Street, catch the streetcar right outside the hotel (or at a stop nearby), or head down to the casino a few blocks down on Canal. Our room was on the Bourbon Street side, and you could definitely hear the noise at night, but thanks to the other TA reviews, we were prepared for it. We didn't have a car, so I can't comment on the parking. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would be back.”
Reviews.Author: MDGiorgi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and in a great location. The beds were very nice and the rooms were quiet. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Beautiful hotel, excellent location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: I was here for a convention recently, but part of the reason I chose to attend was because of the hotel's location on Bourbon Street, by the French Quarter. I wanted to be able to easily walk to the French Quarter and this hotel was well-located. The room was beautifully furnished with traditional furniture including traditional beds (bed sat higher than the typical hotel bed). Room overlooked Bourbon Street, but noise was not an issue. I remember having a great impression of the staff prior to my stay when calling for information about transportation options. The concierge (Paul) was very knowledgeable. I saw him in person when checking out of the hotel and he voluntarily called the shuttle company to confirm my reservation. He was very professional and helpful. I did not eat on site so I cannot rate the restaurant facilities. But this hotel is surrounded by restaurants and bars nearby. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: cswbkw
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to this hotel. We can't beat the location! We stay here the night before our cruises and have had great experiences. Clean, comfy, helpful staff. We travel with a sound machine so we are never bothered with city or hotel noises. This location is at corner of Bourbon and Canal and is a very active area. Great restaurants very close by and nice stroll to Cafe Du Monde.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, awesome location and awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: edeisenstadt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza after relocating from Florida. We had a wonderful stay. The location was spectacular, right on Bourbon Street. Jackson Square and the French Market were just a short walk away. The staff was great. The housekeeper, regretfully, I don't remember her name, did a meticulous job in cleaning our room. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful, particularly, Michelle. She was simply a wonderful help. Also, the concierge, Paul Kiernen, was extraordinary helpful, making restaurant reservations, giving us an overview of the city, and also setting up with a City Tour which helped us get better acquainted with the city. We will refer all of our guests and relatives to the Astor, a truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rosebrien
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astor recently on a combination business/pleasure trip (2 days business, stayed the weekend for pleasure). The 2 best things about this hotel are the location and the service. It is located right on the corner of Canal and Bourbon street - centrally located to everything in the French Quarter. Keep in mind that you are right on Bourbon street - great for walking anywhere, but be prepared for the noise and somewhat sleazy characters you are likely to encounter immediately outside your hotel - par for the course on Bourbon street. I stayed in the newer tower, and the lobby and rooms were quite nice - I would say above average for other Crowne Plaza properties I've stayed in. The front desk staff, housekeeping, and concierge were all professional and very helpful. There is a Dickie Brennan restaurant on site (The Bourbon House) and it served the best oysters I've eaten in 20 years, a nice place, still not sure why the lobby bar closed so early, though (probably to avoid the inevitable drunken walk-ins after 11:00). A couple of notes: the website says they have airport transportation, but all they do is refer you to a private airport shuttle service that charges $20 each way and makes numerous stops - consider taking a cab, for $10 additional you get door-door service. Valet parking is a challenge, always hectic, at 1 point they had you board a shuttle and then took you to the parking garage - how exactly does that qualify as "valet"? At $31/day, I expect them to bring me my car. The valet fee was more than I paid for my rental car. I returned the rental and saved money by using cabs and trolleys. If you're just visiting for the French Quarter and Downtown, you don't need a car. I would definitely stay again, above average chain experience in a great location with friendly staff - can't ask for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, RIGHT on Bourbon Street... but quiet~!”
Reviews.Author: TXharris
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location of the hotel, and the ammenities. We could not have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...until!”
Reviews.Author: workhard_playhard
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this location and were happy (initially) with the fact that it was at the corner of Bourbon & Canal streets. We were there for the Bourbon St nightlife and for the great NO food . The hotel was nice with no complaints about the room, lobby and appointments throghout. We would NOT eat at the lobby eatery for breakfast again however...poor service, sub par quality food and way too expensive. Our biggest problem with this hotel was what we initially thought was great....it's location! Two random bystanders were shot just outside the hotel door that opens out on to Bourbon Street on the Fri night we were there around 11 p.m. When I spoke to the hotel manager about this the next morning, he informed me that the intersection of Canal & Bourbon (just outside the hotel's front door!) was one of the most dangerous areas in New Orleans and that crime there was a very common occurance! If that is known, we wondered (and asked) why the hotel didn't have security there or why there wasn't more of a police presence...to which we got no answer. The following night there was a shooting involving police , in which a man died, further down Bourbon - in the 700 block we believe. While we had a great time in NO, we never did feel at ease after the first shooting and are not sure we'll be back anytime soon .

Reviews.Title: “Good bad ugly”
Reviews.Author: nwdiner
Reviews.Content: Good: bed is comfortable. Bell balers very helpful n friedly. Bad: parking available by valet only. $33 per day plus tip each time. Way way way slowwwww Ugly: front desk girl (Asa Jnea) why so rude and unhappy? You are the first impression for the hotel. You bring the image of the hotel down. MOst everyone else were friendly. You as the front desk person should be the most right? Only one chance for your hotel to make a good first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: genemckay
Reviews.Content: I read several bad reviews and almost cancelled my reservation. I'm glad I didn't. The lobby, rooms, restaurant and bar are very nice. No noise from Bourbon Street - but I was on the 14th floor. Though the valet parking was expensive, I only needed my car once, and the wait time was about 15 minutes. Just plan ahead! Great room rate through hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: beaches911
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night because we arrived in New Orleans a day early and the hotel we were staying at the rest of the week didn't have any vacancy. The staff here was very friendly and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. It's a really great location for all the tourist stops in the French Quarter. If I ever return to New Orleans, I'd definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza!!”
Reviews.Author: stargazerNYC31
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Astor Crowne Plaza during the Essence Music Festival. My boyfriend and I spent 7 nights there, June 29 through July 6. Once again the Crowne Plaza did not disappoint and provided us with an enjoyable stay. We arrived on a Wednesday, before all the crowds poured in later in the week for the festival. Check-in was smooth, and we recieved a small jar of New Orleans Spice for being priority rewards members. Our bellhop Eric was very friendly and funny, and had us laughing all the way up to our room on the 12th floor. We had a king room on the Bourbon Street side, with a great view of Bourbon and Canal street. The only noise we heard were the sounds of the brass band during the day that would play right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal. And even then it was not very loud, just the faint sounds of horns and cymbals. They did provide a little care package with linen spray and ear plugs, but we never had to use them. The room was immaculate! We were told that all the mattresses had been recently replaced, and all the rooms now had flat screen TV's. (Last year our room had a tube TV, so this was a great improvement). The bed was very high but extremely comfortable. The room was free of dust, and the air conditioning was great. It kept the room at a comfortable temperature at all times, which is a must because of the heat and humidity in New Orleans during the summer months. Bathroom was spotless with no visible signs of mold, or mildew anywhere. Towels were always plentiful and the water pressure in the shower was amazing. Housekeeping always respected our privacy. Most days we would be out of the room on the late side, around 2:00 or 3:00pm. They never knocked, and we always came back to a spotless room. Let them an excellent tip for their excellent services. We ate at the hotel's restaurant Bourbon House for lunch and dinner a few times. Great food and superb service. I loved the fact that late at night everyone was required to show their room key to gain entry into the hotel. Being so close to Bourbon Street, and with so many people out and about, it just gave an added sense of security to take such measures. We did not make it to the pool or gym this time around, but I do remember them both being adequate when I stayed at the hotel last year. We did not have a car, so we had no issues with valet parking. It's so easy to walk in New Orleans, take a cab, or ride the street car. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and well maintained. All the staff that we encountered were friendly and willing to go above and beyond to meet our needs. New Orleans is a great city, so rich in culture, art, history, music, food, and fun. Be sure to have breakfast at Brennans, it truly is a wonderful experience. Don't miss out on great eats at Acme Oyster House, Deanie's, Court of the two Sisters, Red Fish Grill, and a Hurricane at Pat O Brians. The Astor Crowne Plaza once again met all of my needs and made my vacation a memorable one. Can't wait to do it all over again next year! I've truly found my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Astor!”
Reviews.Author: shadow08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the Essence Music Festival weekend and I was really impressed with the customer service. The staff were very attentive to our needs and worked to correct any mishaps. I thought this was the party hotel but not at all. The hallways and lobby were kind of low key for the most part, especially at night given you had to be a hotel guest to enter. Our room was located on the historical side of the hotel and I found it charming but modern with the high ceilings, flat screens, and really high beds, which slept great. Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the Astor and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Back again!”
Reviews.Author: Keishac
Reviews.Content: Once again, I had an enjoyable stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza Hotel in New Orleans! I always love to stay at this hotel because of the location...corner of Canal and Bourbon. You can't beat that! They were all booked up when I first got my tickets for the Essence Festival, so I reluctantly made reservations at another hotel in the area. That hotel messed up my reservation a couple of weeks before my arrival, so I made a phone call to Don Zimmer, Director of Sales and he worked a miracle and managed to get me a room at my favorite hotel in New Orleans! Thanks, Don! Our room was on the 6th floor on the Bourbon Street side and I was sure we wouldn't get any rest! But surprisingly, it wasn't bad at all! Plus, who sleeps during Essence Festival?!! Yes, parking was a hassle during the event, but I can honestly say that it's not usually like that on a normal day. I had to walk from the parking lot a few times back to the hotel, instead of waiting for the shuttle. But I must say the valet parking staff were nice, friendly and as accommodating as they could be during such a huge event. Overall, I had a great experience at the Astor Crowne Plaza, once again! I look forward to returning again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Do not reccommend”
Reviews.Author: misslee33
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel was great. Everything else was not so much. The room was damp. We checked in, and then went to a concert, by the time we got back, all of our belongings were damp. I could not even find something warm and dry to put on. I put the do not disturb sign on my door for the entire weekend. Every morning, starting around 8 AM, the maid started knocking. I would wake up, and tell her no, then about 20 minutes later, she would come back. This went on until I opened the door and showed her the sign. But she did it again the next day. These would be expected of a cheaper hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Shootings and swingers”
Reviews.Author: justme8990
Reviews.Content: We were in new orleans for my birthday and I chose the plaza thinking it would be an upscale property. The rooms were small but clean and the restaurant was great. However the pool and fitness center was closed because there wad a swingers convention. They did not tell us when we booked and had no access to the amenities. There were people walking around with whips half naked. I would not have expected this for an upscale chain like the plaza. I specifically chose this hotel for the amenities and location. Regarding the location, we stayed on july 8th and 9th. There were 2 shootings outside on bourbon street if which we had to run for cover. I would definitely not recommend tthis hotel unless your a swinger who likes to live on the edge!

Reviews.Title: “Astor CP Made My First Time in NO Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: luckytravels66
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in such a great place. Don't let the hot July weather keep you away from this great city. It's all cool breezes at the Astor Crowne Plaza NO! It was my first trip here, but certainly not my last. We enjoyed all the pleasures of a Suite on the corner of Bourbon Street. Each night we were able to enjoy the hospitality suite on the 4th floor, and Denise R. and Tonia R. staffed it each night. We loved loved loved them both. One night Denise even sang for us! We will look for them on our next trip. The rest of the hotel staff were equally as nice and helpful. All around great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havanha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor Crown Plaza for the Memorial Day WE with a couple of friends. It;s a nice hotel -with really great beds (hard to get up in the morning- but best of all is the location. And the sales manager who swiftly responded to all our questions. On the edge of the French Quarter but also right at the cable car stop to discover the Garden District or the cemeteries and a nice stroll trhough the quarter to Frenchmen Street. If you avoid the Bourbon Street side or if you stay on a high floor, which we did, you will not have any noise from Bourbon Street (and that is a must). One remark. Do not expect too much from the pool. It looked like a big frat and bachelor(ette) party with beer all over the place, not really what you expect from such hotel. Overall, a great experience, would come back but would not take my swimming trunks anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Parking”
Reviews.Author: dlmaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor in New Orleans during the essence festival 7/1-7/3 and although the hotel was very nice and clean the parking situation was horrible. There is a 31.00+ fee for valet parking but they don't tell you that the parking facility is off site (specifically 5+ blocks ). There is a shuttle that picks you up and drops you off at the parking facility, however since this was a special event there were roads blocked. We stood and waited for a shuttle about 30 min the first night, the second night the shuttle never came and we ended up having to walk back to the hotel. I would think that this hotel would have some kind of agreement with the city or nopd to be able to go through the road blocks to get the hotel guest back to their rooms. The icing on the cake was when we were getting ready to check out they wanted us to shuttle all our bags to the parking facility to get the car. So for the parking reason alone I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay for Saints games!”
Reviews.Author: Chelybell
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Crowne plaza since the ATL/Saints game in 2006. As Saints season ticket holders, we drive three hours from FL at least 8 times a year and odd times with and without the kids! This place is so convenient. I personally like the old wing (Alexa) but the newer section is just as nice. Just booked our rooms for the Red Dress Run and the 2011 Saints home opener (we're coming game or no game)! We love this place- can't wait to get in the room, let my other half get showered while I run out for a Hand Grenade to kick the weekend off!

Reviews.Title: “The service was great, not so sure about the cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: atinyk
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference from Friday June 24-Tuesday 28, 2011 in New Orleans, LA. I arrived early and was given an early check-in. The staff, from the porters, room service and the front desk, were all excellent. The other side of the coin, however, is that I do not trust that it is very clean! My skin has been crawling since I stayed at the place and IÂ´m convinced I have several bed bug bites! Friday night I was itching so bad, I couldn't sleep so I went down to the front desk and was told the mattresses were new. And yes, the mattresses(they were also in rubber/plastic covers) may have been new, but the pillows were stained and dirty. I was given new pillows and a discount on my rate that night. The itching continued. I was not moved to another room because the hotel was booked solid. Since I have returned home I've had to spend the day washing and drying every stitch of clothing I took to the hotel! ItÂ´s my understanding that bed bugs can live not only in mattresses, but headboards and other dark nooks and crannies in rooms (like behind pictures on the wall). If you are uncomfortable in your room for ANY reason, asked to be moved to another one! DonÂ´t stay in a room that you're not comfortable! Also, if you donÂ´t sleep like a log, bring ear plugs b/c the party goes on 'till 4AM. Live brass bands outside your window on Bourbon St make for great entertainment, but if you have early meetings, it can be challenging!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff...Especially Concierge Paul Kernan”
Reviews.Author: AHS61
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza from June 11th through June 18th. This trip was part buisness / family vacation. The hotel staff at the Astor provided outstanding customer service. However, there was one member of the staff that ensured our visit to New Orleans was exceptional, Paul Kernan the hotel concierge. I spoke with Paul before our visit and he e-mailed information regarding local attractions. He booked an airboat swamp tour and a ghost tour for us. They were the highlights of our trip. We could not have asked for better tour guides (Captain Ernie and Andrew). Paul was also an excellent resource regarding restaurants and provided a list of activities for my family to do during the day. Paul was always friendly and made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Crowne Plaza. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: libbyfh
Reviews.Content: I hope this email will be forwarded to the appropriate people, including Mr.Zan at Prism Hotels, especially since the emails I have tried to send have bounced back. What does that mean, I wonder? At any rate, here is the text of the message I sent... I do not like to write these sorts of letters, and I write them infrequently, but my stay at the Astor Crowne in New Orleans was so horrific that I feel compelled to let you know. I arrived Friday, June 24 for the ALA convention. The good news: a room was available before noon and I checked in. The bad news: the carpet was wet -- someone had obviously cleaned it and it hadn't dried. I spent a couple of hours in the room, left for business, and when I returned after dinner, the stench in the room was unbearable. It was as if someone had left laundry in a washing machine for 4 day and everything had mildewed. I called downstairs, and I was moved to another room. The bellman agreed with me that the odor was unbearable. So far so good. I went about my business on Saturday, came back in the late afternoon, and found a number of tiny black "objects" among my sheets. They were not alive, but they looked a lot like bed bugs to me. I called downstairs -- everyone came up, including the hotel engineer, housekeeping, and the head bellman. They weren't sure what the objects were but agreed I should move to another room. I moved to my third room a few minutes later. The air conditioning was broken. So was the hair dryer. And the keys didn't work. I checked out Sunday morning. As far as I am concerned, this was the hotel from hell. I am an experienced traveler, and I am not particularly demanding, but this was beyond the pale. And, when I brought it up to the front desk manager, he said they had inspected both rooms and didn't find anything wrong with them. Not a good thing to say to a customer who is on Facebook and Twitter. He did apologize but made no effort to compensate me for the two days of misery. I don't believe that's the wisest way to deal with paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “Bad valet!!”
Reviews.Author: kvtc1
Reviews.Content: We actually enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It was clean and the customer service was okay. The tub was a tad grimey but nothing some shower shoes couldn't fix. We didn't have any problems until we checked out and it took them an hour to bring us our car- parking is $31/day by the way. The guy out front was so rude to us and he had the nerve to have an attitude because we asked him what was taking so long. Just imagine standing on the busiest street in New Orleans with all your luggage in 100 degree heat with your kids. It was a mess. After about 30 minutes or so he asked to see our receipt. Surely he didn't have us standing out there all that time because he thought we hadn't paid!!!! And he was not apologetic either which made things even worse. We probably won't be returning there.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: makkkkko2000
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large, clean, great location and the best concierge we have ever had , anywhere (Paul)- He told us where the best deals for food, entertainment, bar specials- just FANTASTIC. Only downside-- if you are a smoker- the panhandlers outside the front door are very intimidating.They need patrols. Very high for valet parking and a very long wait for your auto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, worn and outdated, avoid 'executive' upgrade”
Reviews.Author: audrocks
Reviews.Content: Booked via Travelocity. Checked in Friday, 6/3, 2 nights. Checking process was smooth with front-desk staff polite and helpful (though surprisingly unknowledgeable about the surrounding Burbon St. area). The two staff members seemed to have a lengthy discussion about the fact that the reservation was prepaid via the online service rather than booked with the chain itself. I've seen this before and wonder if rooms of lesser quality are given to those who book via low-cost-providers. Bellman was helpful with luggage and courteous. Booked an "executive king" room at an extra cost beyond a lower-tier room (standard or deluxe). We were told these were on the 4'th floor where the 'executive lounge' is located (more on this later). The room was clean and well supplied with towels, toiletries, etc. However, the furnishings were dated (think 1980 Las Vegas) and the furniture lacking (there was one chair in the room and it was a plush, red barrell type). the bed was quite cmofortable with nice, good-quality linens. There was one tiny window in the room and it was about 6 feet away from the exterior brick wall of an adjacent building. I was very surprised the more expensive rooms were not on a higher floor - see above comment about booking via online service. Interestingly, a pair of ear plugs was supplied in the room; we found out why with loud street noise at 7am. The bathroom was a little small and cramped but otherwise decent - there was a makeup mirror and hair-dryer supplied. The Executive lounge is not worth whatever extra money it costs. There are a few sofas and chairs with a television and bar. The first drink is free but anything beyond that must be paid in cash. Light snacks are provided in the evenings - cheese cubes, carrot sticks, post-stickers, etc., and continental-breakfast provided in the mornings. The hours are very limited - breakfast ending and the door locked at 10:00 am on Sunday, for example. Given the proximity of some of the best dining in the nation a few steps away this is really a waste. The best feature of the property is it's location at Bourbon @ Canal. Virtually anywhere you would want to go in the city is within walking distance or a short cab ride. (Note- this is New Orleans and as you would expect the crowd outside might seem a little rough to some late at night; I never felt uncomfortable, though.) The concierge was of moderate help in arranging a tour - clearly they receive a kickback from some tour companies over others. we did not visit the rooftop pool but it's visible from the lounge. it's quite small with a few lounge chairs surrounding it. Summary: I would not stay here again, despite it's location. There are a dozen hotels within a very short distance and this property was tired and worn with a moderately disengeged staff.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ruth725
Reviews.Content: This was not my first trip to New Orleans but my first time staying at the Crowne Plaza Astor. I am so happy my sons and I chose this hotel. You couldn't ask for a better location if you are there to enjoy the French Quarter! It borders on Bourbon Street and if you eat in the restaurant, you can have a view of Bourbon St. activity with your meal. From the entry of the hotel to the room with super comfy beds, we were pleased. The hotel staff was very accomodating. There's a quaint lobby area where you can sit and plan your next adventure in the city. Definitely recommend this hotel and definitely will reserve here again when in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Not a 4 star hotel. Not even close.”
Reviews.Author: jkharrison
Reviews.Content: I believed I would be staying at a Crowne Plaza with similar services and accommodations previously enjoyed at other locations. I was extremely disappointed in most aspects of my 5 day stay. The room was in poor condition due to age and wear - most likely due to the location near Bourbon Street. The bathroom wasn't clean (brown spots on light fixture that have been there for quite some time). The last night of my stay I arrived back at my room to find it hadn't been completely cleaned during the day. Dirty cups in the sink, room hadn't been vacuumed, brown water in the toilet, etc. The phone in my room didn't work - I had to call the front desk from my cell phone to request a wake-up call. I tried to be pleasant about my room problems, commenting on the non-functional phone, thinking it would motivate someone to fix it - it didn't. Employees were complacent about issues I was having in my room. I don't mind paying for parking, but WiFi???? Get over it Crowne Plaza - most other hotels provide internet for free especially for long time loyalty members. The mattresses are old, hard and need to be replaced. The hotel basically put the bed frame on "stilts" to give the appearance of a pillow-top, as I found out when I tried to move the bed to plug in my lap-top and the frame fell off the "stilts". When putting the bed back together I found what appeared to be dried vomit on the dust ruffle. Yeah. My favorite experience - the missing protective mesh screen on the hair drier air intake. It sucked my hair into it - I couldn't turn it off and the hair drier finally shorted out. My hair was literally smoking. I couldn't get it out of the hair drier, couldn't move away from the drier due to the fact it was hard-wired into the wall. I finally had to break my hair a few strands at a time to get free - it took about 10 minutes. I stopped by the front desk to tell the attendant I needed a new hair drier and why I needed a new drier......she swiped a card and gave me a free breakfast on the executive floor for my trouble. Nice. I don't eat breakfast. Maintenance replaced the hair drier while I was at dinner, but left the discarded screws on the floor of the bathroom - I stepped on one with my bare foot. Ouch. Checking out I explained the hair drier situation to the desk clerk and did receive one night free stay and the internet charges were taken off my bill. Since this was a business trip it benefited the company I work for, not me, for the trauma I experienced (smoking hair stuck in hair drier). My best experience was the parking garage valets- they were all terrific., and the room service waitress. They deserve raises as they are friendly and helpful. I would strongly suggest you find another accommodation if staying in New Orleans. The Crowne Plaza Astor was at one time a very nice hotel, but you can do better for the money you pay. It is not a 4 star hotel - I've stayed in better 2.5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: daveandheather
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in the perfect location on the corner of Canal and Bourbon St. in New Orleans. Rooms were spacious, clean and we had a great view down Bourbon St. and of the River. This hotel is right on the corner of Bourbon St and can be loud and smelly once outside the doors, but inside it is very nice. The pool is small with no bar / food service. Overall, a nice hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kcrho1
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans to attend the NCAA ' Sweet 16' basketball games. Let me say that the location of this hotel is the best. Located at the corner of Canal and Bourbon Street, it offers instant access to the French Quarter and all the fun and uniqueness it has to offer. We enjoyed the proximity to the Quarter and to the Central Business District. We were able to walk to the Arena for the games, (about a 20 minute walk), since the cab ride there was $20 --no, it is not that far, they charged a special events fee. Lobby was very pretty and very clean. The marble floors had a very nice shine to them. Our room was located on the Bourbon Street side of the hotel. I have seen some complaints about the noise but neither my husband and I, nor our friends, found this to be a problem. Also, the hotel is located right across the street from a drugstore, and a McDonald's is close by. (Tthe horrible service and attitude of the staff at McDonald's is a whole other review.) There are also a lot of souvenir shops, restaurants and other stores nearby. Ladies, there is a Nine West Outlet store across the street and I must say that the prices were not too bad. The staff was very friendly and helpful. In my experience they understand that tourism is their bread and butter and they acted accordingly. Not at anytime was any staff member rude or unwilling to help us. The staff even suggested the best way to get around New Orleans and where to go. One of the waiters in the restaurant told us the best places to visit and hang out (He actually offered to go with us, but we did not take up that invite). Room was clean and functional. It suited our needs very well. Room service ordered once, and it was delivered in a timely manner. I can say that for the price, this was a wonderful hotel choice. If you like the Ritz, it's down the street and you can visit the lobby. Downside, not all the rooms had flat screen tv's as advertised. I didn't care, since we didn't watch a lot of tv in the room, but if you advertise the feature, you should deliver it. The hotel bar is very small, and the drink a bit pricey, but they don't stint on the liquor, and being on the corner of Bourbon Street, going elsewhere to get drinks was easy (and I didn't go to any restaurant/bar where anyone was light on the liquor, like many tourist areas). Hotel restaurant had decent food, service a bit slow, but once we got seated and waited on, things improved greatly from there. Lastly, didn't valet, so can't rate that, but whenever we needed a cab for four, the staff was quick to get us one. I would recommend this hotel, not the height of luxury, but certainly at least 31/2 stars,

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of all of the action”
Reviews.Author: Desidm
Reviews.Content: Was booked at this Hotel for a business trip adoring the days before Easter. It is located at the corner if Canal and Bourbon streets right in the middle of all of the action. The valet parking was. A little tricky, since one has to pull up in from of the hotel on busy Bourbon street and parallel park. Check in was okay, and the rooms were adequate, albeit a little outdated. There was a pack of lavender and a sleep mask provided, ostensible to help one sleep, although I was so exhausted at the end of the days to need them. As for the clientele, well, it's on Bourbon street, so expect to converse with drunk individuals in the elevator. I did not feel unsafe however, just amused. It is very convenient to the French quarter for shopping and whatever else one might want to do in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and will return again this summer!”
Reviews.Author: ladyconnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the corner of Canal Street and Bourbon Street [faces Canal Street]. Though Bourbon Street is on the corner, the hotel is not directly near the partying and loud noise so as to not be kid friendly. However, with regards to adults, it is a close enough walk to the happenings, restaurants and such on Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. The street cars are just across the street. McDonald's, IHOP CVS Pharmacy and other stores are all in close walking distance. The hotel is very clean, well kept, orderly and has very nice decor. The staff is proffesional and efficient. I felt very safe there. It's an excellent value and well worth the nightly rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErinDennis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend 2011 (5/25-5/29). Down for a wedding with friends. Booked on bookit.com and got a great rate. Hotel is in the PERFECT location. On the corner of Canal and Bourbon, you are right in the heart of the action. Decatur is like 2 blocks away, so a quick stroll into the French Quarter. Streetcar stop is also only 1 block away, so you can get to Tulane/Uptown area also very quickly and comfortably and the casino is a quick 5-10 minute walk. We were on the 12th and 13th floors and literally heard nothing, so not sure what other people's noise complaints were about, but maybe because we were on a higher up floor. The earplugs, lavender spray and eye mask on the bed everyday was a nice touch though. Hotel was very quiet, very clean (and trust me when I say that - I am picky about cleanliness) and all of the employees were friendly and helpful. Pool was kind of small, but it is on the rooftop, which is really neat. Parking is super expensive everywhere in NOLA. Don't bother bringing a car, just bring some good walking shoes, a streetcar map and be prepared to hail a taxi once in awhile. The restaurant downstairs has great food and the 24 hour room service is definitely a plus when you are rolling in late from Bourbon Street. Would definitely stay here again the next time we are in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bana6969
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my wife's birthday March 2011. The hotel was booked with points and there was no issues in checking in. The hotel itself is in an amazing location. Right beside on of the main streetcars as well as step (yes, steps) from bourbon street but just far enough for you not to get all the noise. Great when you are stumbling home from a late night of jazz. Amazing staff overall. One issue was that we got back to our hotel at about 4:30 and our room was not cleaned. The staff must have been busy but it wasn't that big a deal since they came around and offered to clean the room. I just had them replace the towels. Great pool location and exercise room if you want to use it. Other than that it I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PeterDCanada
Reviews.Content: Location is great, rooms were small, value ok, staff very friendly and always helpful. We loved our stay here!!!!!!! Only negative = we were told WIFI was free however it was only free if used in the lobby. WIFI in the room was $9.99/night. The business centre in the lobby has three high speed computers you can use for free. Very seldom were all three in simultaneous used so in the end no big deal...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: TexasCoast_11
Reviews.Content: We loved the Astor Crowne Plaza.The lobby is very large with chandeliers and a marble floor....very pretty. Our room was large and very nice.The beds were great.The only downside is that the pool is very small which disappointed the kids. There are many great restaurants within a block or 2.(Mr B's Bistro, Acme Oyster House, Deanie"s) and a nice walk to the center of the French Quarter.The hotel is just a great place to return to when you've had a busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel , location & staff”
Reviews.Author: EdinLakeview
Reviews.Content: My wife and children spent the weekend with me at the Astor Crowne during Easter weekend. We are locals but simply wanted to get into the French Quarter for the Easter Day parade as well as a fine brunch. The hotel was simply immaculate. The front desk service was great with a friendly bunch of staff. The hotel manager, Peter Ambrose even greeted us as he was greeting people in front of the front desk, even at 9:15 on a Friday night. The room was great with what appeared to be a brand new mattress, since we stripped the cover to find out the brand name. We spent a large part of the afternoon watching the Easter parade from the balcony overlooking Bourbon Street. Great hats ladies!!! We had a very enjoyable bruch arranged by Paul the concierge, who was extraordinarily helpful, and who had booked the reservation at Arnauds down the street. Even though we have lived in New Orleans forever, we finally took a swamp tour which Paul arranged for us. We were picked up in front of the hotel so we left the car in parking all weekend. We thank all of the staff for their extreme courtesies, especaillay Paul who was patient, kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Judi26
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was perfect! The rooms were very comfortable. The personel who helped us, from desk clerks, doorman, bellboys, room service, chambermaids, and waitstaff, were outstanding. There was free internet use in a room off the lobby. The most helpful person was the Concierge, Paul Kernan. He was friendly, knowledgable, and helpful. We were impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel along with how quiet the rooms were. We would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff in executive club”
Reviews.Author: Loversofhistory
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ASP on the executive club level. Everyday we had breakfast and evening treats in the executive club. There were two ladies who were in the EC to help and serve drinks, Pamela Green and Denise Rushing. They both were extremely friendly and helpful. They always greeted us when we entered and had a ready smile. They were extremely friendly and efficient. They made the stay a memorable one. We stayed here and would stayed again. Great workers.

Reviews.Title: “A High 10 for Astor from us Brits.”
Reviews.Author: SMR016
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 10 days at the beginning of May 2011. We have spent a lot of time travelling all over the world and within the USA. We could not fault the spaciousness of the room and its cleanliness, the very helpful and friendly staff, and the very large portions of food from Room Service!! The Bourbon Restaurant attached to the hotel was very high class but retained its friendliness. The position of this hotel is ideal for all bars and restaurants. It is only a 10 minute walk down Canal Street to the French Quarter Market, Cafe du Monde and Riverwalk. Fabulous. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. If there was something we could fault, it would be that the AC was too cold in the room, but once we asked for it to be changed it was done within 10 minutes. Congratulations Astor you get a high 10 from us. And a big thank you to Peter, Pamela and George for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Anyone”
Reviews.Author: inkedearbuds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend last year, and it was great. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, and the rooms were clean. You get a complimentary sleep eye pillow and lavendar spray to help you sleep. Although, the location is great because it's easy to get to the Quarter, as it's on the outside border of it, however, it's not super loud from what's going on outside. I like to sleep, so this was a big plus. We stayed on the executive level and had complimentary drinks each evening before hitting the town, and breakfast each morning. I can't comment on the food because we mostly ate outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Firegeek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent stay, couldnâ€™t ask for a better location; the side door leads onto Bourbon Street, the streetcars are across the street from the front door, easy 6 block walk to the river/casino and restaurants of all types any direction you walked. My favorite things about the hotel were the outdoor swimming pool that was a quiet cigar area in the evening and the incredible service by all of the staff. I have to give the kudos to Paul the concierge who pointed us to activities and restaurants that we wouldnâ€™t have found otherwise and the gentleman who was always around when we needed something whose picture was on the keycards (Bull?). I would definitely stay here again. If I did have a con, it would be that you couldnâ€™t open the window to listen to the street bands that played between 7 to around 10.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice upscale hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Vis78759
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 nights at the Astor Crowne Plaza. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel left a nice little sleeping comfort gift on the bed for us containing ear plugs, a sleeping eye mask and a little bottle of lavander spray. This hotel is very centrally located in the French Quarter, walking distance to just about everything in that area including Burbon Street, Harrahs Casino, the river walk, Cafe Du Monde, etc.. The hotel was able to get us booked on a swap tour day trip at the last minute and the recommendations from the staff for dining and entertainment was spot on. My only issue was with the in room coffee maker. It leaked coffee all over the bathroom vanity and on to my personal items. When I addressed this with the front desk, they really did not seem to care. OH - last thing, parking will run you $30 extra per night so be prepared for that.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: AreWeThereYet1973
Reviews.Content: Bourbon Street is right outside the door and when you are in town for a meeting and only have a few hours to enjoy New Orleans, what a pleasure it is to be where the action is. My room was clean and nicely decorated, if small. There was minimal noise on the 3rd floor of the Canal Street side except for the trolley and an occasional police siren. I enjoyed my brief stay. My only two complaints are minor: 1) the front desk staff was friendly but not very knowledgeable-- when I casually asked how old the hotel was, the young lady checking me in gave me a blank stare and an "I have no idea-- old?" Perhaps management could offer their staff a brief history of the hotel during their training? Or maybe this is just the way things are in New Orleans, as I had this same experience --the blank stare in response to a question-- from a waiter in a local restaurant as well. 2) I must have been staying in an older section of the hotel and was not given very good directions on how to find my room initially. There are several levels of floor 3-- a 3 and a 3M. I wandered the halls on the wrong 3 trying to find my room after a long trip in. But overall, a very pleasant hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Graeme W
Reviews.Content: The location right with an entrance onto Boubon street is great. For the price the facilities (gym, pool etc where great). I stayed 6 nights on the 11th floor and found it very peacful. Only negative is the internet connection in the room is slow.

Reviews.Title: “Finally making some improvements”
Reviews.Author: sue570
Reviews.Content: 3rd floor is getting new mattresses but our room (9th floor) has the stiff-as-a-board type.. Do Not pay for internet service let along "high speed" option. It's 2011 and someone should let the management at the Crowne / Holiday Inn chain know that internet is now available in High Speed. Has to be one of the slowest hotel internet connections on the planet. No frills health club with machines that leave a lot to be desired. Like the view and location but it's time to make some key upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amigotravels
Reviews.Content: The Astor Crown Plaza is an elegant hotel on the very edge of the French Quarter and fronting on Canal Street. It is convenient for all the sights in New Orleans. The rooms were exceptionally comfortable with nice linens and plenty of towels. We stayed for 4 days for a conference in early May. My room was very quiet being located on the Canal St. side of the hotel. My colleagues had rooms on the Bourbon St. side and said it was very noisy late into the night. The hotel does provide earplugs however. The exercise room is well equipped and the pool is nice but small. Good restaurant down stairs -The Bourbon House. The only negative is that there is little to watch on television if you want to relax for a while-channels are limited. Terrific stay however and staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby, but great location on the edge of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: aks_va
Reviews.Content: This is a typical conference hotel, with furniture and carpeting that have seen better days. However, it's surprisingly quiet, given that it's on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, and has a nice fitness center. Not the type of place I would stay if traveling on a vacation, but for work it was adequate. Overall, it's just average.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Worst Hotel I've Experienced”
Reviews.Author: Zach989
Reviews.Content: Dirty room? Check. Noisy? Check. Rude staff? Check. Soft water? Check. Terrible water pressure? Check. Slow internet? Check. We reserved our room through http://BookIt.com, which may have been our first mistake. It doesn't seem like they're a full service travel agency, as they were unable or unwilling to help us when we had a problem. We picked the 4-star 4-diamond Mystery Hotel, and pretty sure those ratings are from the early 80s. We arrived to a not-so-clean room, and a ton of noise. There's numerous carpet stains, and what looks to be chips in the porcelain (or plastic more likely) of the tub, and a few disconcerting stains in the tub as well. The walls in this place are very thin, so you can easily hear your neighbors' conversations and every time they use the sink/toilet/shower. The hotel is also on the corner of Bourbon Street, so you get to listen to the music blasting from some of the clubs all night too. We had originally asked for a king sized bed on a higher floor, but got two queens on a low floor. When I brought this up with the front desk, they didn't seem to care, and essentially left me with "the hotel is on Bourbon Street, so what did you expect?" Well, I expected my requests to be at least considered, the staff to be helpful, and my room to be neat and tidy. As for the noise, maybe you should install double paned glass or more insulation so guests don't hear everything going on next door and 5 floors below. At the very least, clearly state on your website and any place you advertise that it's a noisy property. To top it all off, the showers seem to be pumping out maybe a gallon an hour, so you're left with a trickle of soft water. Have fun trying to get shampoo and soap off with that. I don't know if the soft water is a New Orleans thing, but from my experience at some of the bars and restaurants, it seems to be just a Crowne Plaza thing. So stop pumping water softener into your water, and dial up your pressure while you're at it. Lesson learned: don't stay on Bourbon street, and remember that Crowne Plaza hotels don't seem to have received updates in a few decades. Go with a boutique hotel (some in the area looked very cool) or one of the bigger brands that has a little more cache (and deeper pockets to keep their properties up to date). The only nice thing about our stay was the one concierge guy that was kind and helpful. Other than that, this place is the pits.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Cthusky322
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights during Jazzfest. Recently upgraded rooms and facilities make this a great hotel with a prefect location on Canal St. The staff could not be more helpful. The executive lounge is open for eight hours (morning and evenings) and the manager (Pamela Green) is the best!! We will return to this hotel often.

Reviews.Title: “It was a super hotel stay until bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Kova67
Reviews.Content: I was in a king room for four days and had no issues. The hotel is clean, my room was quiet. I switched rooms to a double for the last night because a friend was joining me. The next day when we were walking around I noticed 8 small "dots" in a series on the back of my lower leg. No, I did not go back and tell Crowne. I did not think they were anything really. By that evening they looked like "bed bug bites" - about the size of mosquito bites and just as itchy, but in a linear series on my lower leg. I know hotels cannot control this without knowing about it...and this was clearly not a massive infestation, but I am certain these are bed bug bites and I only hope that the washing of the contents of my bag upon arrival home was enough to kill any that may have tried to come with. I did have my luggage on the floor but kept all my items in it at all times. Sigh... I would recommend this hotel because bed bugs are in even the swankest of hotels. It was a clean and quiet hotel for being right in the heart of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service, & Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: Fatimadavid
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ideal within the French Quarter. Service was good. We stayed on the Bourbon Street side and the noise was not unbearable. Besides, we didn't go to N.O. to sleep - we went to party!

Reviews.Title: “Location--the good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: williedillo
Reviews.Content: Location right at Canal and Bourbon St is in the middle of everything. Make sure you request a room on an upper floor facing away from Bourbon St. We had one and it was very quiet, but I've heard the ones facing Bourbon St. can be pretty noisy. Room was spacious and clean. They gave us late checkout on departure (I'm a Priority Club member) which is a nice thing to have in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pidge2294
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews about the noise, but we didn't have any problem at all on the 7th floor. The rooms were very spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable, the best sleep I have had in a long time. Our last night there, we did have a fire alarm about 1:30 am that scared the bejeebers out of me, along with the following announcement telling us they were investigating and then the follow up announcement telling us they found nothing wrong. But, I didn't view it as something annoying, just scary and could happen anywhere, I WAS thankful they let us know all was well or I would have been sitting up all night thinking I smelled smoke:) Location, staff and cleanliness were all excellent. I'd like to thank everyone there for being so wonderful and kind, even the gal in the mailroom on M1 I'm sure most people don't even see, she was a sweetheart.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: TMD61
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotless clean Would definitely stay there on our next visit to NOLA

Reviews.Title: “NOT for families or Anyone Looking To Sleep”
Reviews.Author: NellieVA
Reviews.Content: I'll preface by saying this review is based on a one-night stay. That said, if we had had to stay longer, we would have moved to a different hotel. My wife and tween daughter stayed at the Astor on a Saturday night, ahead of a cruise departing the next afternoon. I am a Priority Club Platnium member, and chose this hotel based on reviews here, the location, and the fact that the Intercontinental was full for the weekend. This was my first visit to New Orleans, and my lack of knowledge certainly aided in my poor choice of hotels. The location is great, IF rpt IF you want to be on Bourbon Street and you came to party. Located directly on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, you could not be closer to the "action." Upon entering the lobby, I was greeted by multiple groups of twenty-somethings all drinking and acting like it was pledge week. I was not familiar with New Orleans' open container laws. Upon check-in, I asked if an upgrade was available -- given my Platinum status. I was told she could move me to the 12th foor, "away from the noise." I was also told my room card would allow us access to the Executive lounge. The ride up in the elevator was surrounded by more people in various stages of intoxication -- and it was barely 5:00pm. The room was nice, but standard fare. There was still an ancient looking 25-inch tube TV with poor reception -- you had to wiggle the coax cable to get the picture in clearly. The room overlooked Bourbon street. The bathroom was showing it's age, with rust covering the back of the magnifying mirror and the shower flange hanging loose from the wall. The only part of ths hotel I can recommend is the concierge. He was VERY helpful, and went out of his way to help us. He advised us that the "city was full," with a couple conventions in town (not at this hotel, but eating up rooms in the city). He got us a table at Arnaud's for dinner, and gave us some advise for seeing some sights after an early dinner. He warned us to avoid Bourbon street after 9:00pm; he really should have said to avoid it after 6:00pm. On our way to dinner, aside from the slew of strip joints (a Hustler club is directly across from the Bourbon Street entrance to this hotel), there were men up on a balcony exposing themselves. This of course is NOT the hotel's fault, but I write to give fair warning on the neighboorhood. The biggest problem with this hotel is the NOISE! We were on the 12th floor, but the noise from Bourbon Street below was incredible, and it went on ALL NIGHT -- literally. The hotel provides a SINGLE sweet dreams welcome bag per room, which had earplugs and a sleep mask. The three of us fought over who got the earplugs. As it was, we all had a miserable night of sleep. There were also multiple episodes of people coming back to their rooms late in the night, and making a lot of noise. I thought I was back in a dorm. We woke early, and decided to go to the Executive lounge for breakfast. My flashback to a college dorm was solidified when I opened our door and saw overturn pizza slices laying on the carpet outside our room. A couple doors down, and blue, inflated condom was tied to the door knob and a couple beer cans lay on the floor. Outside the elevator was a large wet spot and foul odor...I can only surmise what happened there. When we got to the lounge, the door was propped open and there was no one checking keys. Perhaps because of this, the lounge was overflowing with guests, of which I'm not sure how many were really supposed to be there. Many of them were clearly hung over -- or still drunk. The breakfast was passable, but they were out of most sliverware and the tables were dirty and not bussed. Our concierge friend saved the morning, and booked us a city tour. As I said, he is the only redeeming factor to this hotel. At this point, I was not surprised at all, when we returned around noon, and rode up to our room to check out, that the elevator was full of people already holding open beer cans. Another thing that surprised me was the inability to check out via the TV. Also, getting a cab outside the hotel to reach the pier was very chaotic, with buses arriving and the valets trying to deliver cars, etc. As noted, I am a very loyal Priority Club member, but I cannot recommend the Astor for anyone not looking for Bourbon Street debauchery or a flashback to a college frat party.

Reviews.Title: “Best get away in YEARS, due to great staff and Don in particular.”
Reviews.Author: OhioBE
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue, and for that, fellow travelers, I apologize. My fiance and I took our first real getaway in 5 years to visit New Orleans, a locale I'd wanted to visit since I was young. We stayed from 12/1/10 - 12/5/10, during an unusually chilly time for NOLA. I cannot compliment enough the staff and obvious pride they have in their positions at the Astor. The people always make the place, and this hotel is no exception. I would return if only to see them! We did pick a season that was lower traffic and did not valet (thanks much to our booking person's advice, we didn't need to rent a car at all - see my notation on what a city block in NOLA really is, lol). Thus, did not experience any of the frustrations other travelers have listed. What we did encounter was a very speedy check-in, despite a later hour of arrival. The lobby was absolutely BEAUTIFULLY decorated for the holiday season with an enormous Christmas tree and other trimmings. It set the tone for our holiday trip. Sadly, I couldn't put work aside. However I did spend about 4 hours each day in the lobby utilizing the free wi-fi (and sipping on my complimentary rum punch *shhhhh* ). During this time, a children's choir visited the hotel to carol- it was such a nice touch. These little things, like the hotel supporting local arts showcasing, make it special. Be sure to check out the sugared Mardi Gras themed sculptures in the lobby as well. I was able to stay on the quiet floor -which I very much appreciated. The beds were fantastic- we did experience a small issue with the plastic support as others have, but my 'hubby' was able to pretty much quick-fix it. Don responded to other reviews that all box springs and supports should be fully replaced by April 2011. On each pillow, there was a care packet with a sleeping mask, pillow spray and ear plugs. I can see where this might come in handy during Mardi Gras or other peak season festivities. But with the fantastic location at Canal and Bourbon, my goodness, what do people expect of the noise level? That's part of the experience, right, ma chere? On any account, it was a lovely touch. We watched our first parade right outside the hotel - the Jingle Crewe. It was great and something to experience. It was certainly a community effort - I think that's what strikes me the most about NOLA - there is a palpable sense of community, one that welcomes everyone from everywhere. Incidentally, we met the Mayor of NOLA who also upheld our overall impression of community and welcome. NOLA should have an ever brightening future under his guidance. Here's something I learned: when someone tells you a location is 7 to 12 blocks away, it's about a quarter mile. I was expecting big city blocks and a huge walk. You can walk so very easily to the French Quarter and the Aquarium/Casino area. About a 12 min walk in either direction. If you are remotely physically able, you can meander just about anywhere in your own good time. Our room was IMMACULATE. As an asthmatic, this was acutely important to me. Molds/mildew hit me *really* badly - my mother (a senior citizen now) actually was upset that I was going to a damp, humid area of the US because I'm "going to land in the hospital and you don't want to ruin your trip, do you?" You know mothers! Still, a valid concern. Absolutely no problems. Room was spacious, TV was great. Bathroom was perfect. We used the in-room safe quite a bit for my jewelry, electronics and cash. It worked out great! We did have to watch the hotel room door, sometimes it didn't close all the way - just open it and close it again. It's something in the digital lock system and has happened to me at other establishments. Just check twice before leaving. Housekeeping is early - but that's how hotels function. It's not atypical across the US. If we asked for more time, they returned in about 90 min. Perfect for me. The concierge service was fantastic, and quick to give insider advice. That's what we like! One of the concierge gentlemen actually flies from Atlanta to work weekends at the Astor. He transplanted after Katrina, but keeps coming back! That's what I mean when I mention pride and dedication! The value is great - I certainly couldn't swing the top price for a Mardi Gras experience but really, REALLY wish I could. I hear you can utilize the hotel balcony for parades! And, I'm too old to split a room with four people to amortize the cost, lol. So winter visits it must be... unless I can find FAB flight rates and land a decently priced room as well sometime during slower months in the summer. Don obviously takes great pride and satisfaction from a job well done. I'm almost glad I wasn't able to post back sooner (read my "jumping the gun" earlier post) because it meant I was able to read through his comments and service responses. I really am floored at his PR and customer relations acumen. The hotel has a huge asset in him. One thing I would love to see - some sort of brochure or check-in packet insert, or wall hanging in the lobby, that outlines the history of the building. I believe the Astor used to be a Woolworth that caused quite a bit of controversy due to violating building height regulations with its number of floors at the time of construction. I love having a sense of 'where I am,' if you know what I mean. History also makes a place special. With best regards, gratitude and true appreciation, Jessica Hamlin & J. Martin Poston

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: NJ&MJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves high praise. It is clean, very smoothly run even though extremely busy, and its employees are friendly, proactive, efficient, and take pride in their work. I stayed here seven nights and was impressed and completely satisfied with my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Acceptable Condition, Uncomfortable Bed.”
Reviews.Author: rgood_11
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better. The staff was friendly and responsive. The room was clean and nice enough, but not quite as nice on the whole as I was hoping for. The beds, though, were no good. They were hard, had tiny pillows, and generally unpleasant hotel beds. Seeing as the most important part of a hotel is the bed, for me, it was difficult to justify paying that much for an uncomfortable spot to rest my head. Also, $10 a day for wireless is unacceptable. The one day of free wireless if you link up in the lobby is good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - minus the (expected) noise!”
Reviews.Author: jaw9961
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a nice hotel in the French Quarter and got a great deal on this one thru BookIt. The staff was wonderful with recommendations to eat & visit. When we arrived, we found a gift bag with a sleeping mask, ear plugs and lavendar spray - guess we should have expected the noise. Our room on the 8th floor faced Bourbon Street and the jazz music and crowd noise started around 6 PM and went thru the night). Being Bourbon Street, it was to be expected so can't really complain too much! We were probably the only ones back in our room and trying to sleep at 10:30 on a Friday night due to an early flight Sat. It was easy to get to to/from airport and valet brought the car around when we needed it to go to the airport. We called the night before just to be sure and then again 15 minutes before we needed to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Denise Rushing- best executive hostess”
Reviews.Author: musicrules55
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that i have never had such great hospitality, service, and kindness than i received from Denise Rushing the executive hostess at the crown plaza astor hotel in new orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: travel05_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my husband at the end of March and thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Astor and in NOLA. We stayed in a room on the 11th floor. It was very clean and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful with dining suggestions, etc. The restaurant in the hotel (The Bourbon House) was great! Try the Shrimp Club sandwich! I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location for family- Housekeeping less than desirable- BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: 2mygirl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a week over spring break. You can not beat the location on the corner of Bourbon and Canal. We found the hotel very nice and comfortable. The front desk staff were personable most of the time. Our room was located on the 10th floor closest to the elevator. We did hear the elevator running constantly. This did not disturb us too much, but I could see it disturbing some people. It sounded like a thunderstorm or strong winds. I kind of liked it while I slept. It started early and was slightly bothersome in the early morning hours. So if you are a light sleeper may want to watch this. We did not hear any street noise though. My biggest complaint is with housekeeping. They knocked on the door at 7:45 am and asked if we needed anything. We were still asleep. My son said no. The maid then handed him a piece of paper and asked him to sign it. I could hear the whole conversation. She did not explain to him what it was. He signed it. He and I assumed it was some sort of customer service check. No! We were signing off on getting our room cleaned! No towels, didnt take the trash, make the bed! Nothing! I have never had this happen before. I have stayed at a LOT of hotels, and usually when you answer the door still in your pjs, they apologize and return later. It was not like we were sleeping til noon or anything! The big kicker is when we returned that day and asked the front desk to have our room cleaned she said ok- only to return that night with no towels. Called once again- no answer- went downstairs and talked to front desk. Assured me someone would come. Again- 1 hour later- no one! It was ridiculous! I finally called and was not so nice! I demanded towels, soap, shampoo, etc... A very sweet young boy delivered our supplies. In exchange I gave him our trash and dirty towels. I must say this was quite ridiculous. I think they need to rethink their procedure or retrain their staff. The restaurant downstairs provided good food. Slightly pricey, but it was very good. Parking is expensive- I believe it was 31.00 per day. But the valet staff were very friendly and got your car for you as quickly as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out very well. Reviews were SO helpful!”
Reviews.Author: HotModelForTSA
Reviews.Content: I was here with a friend and my 17 yr daughter. We requested a "quiet floor" as suggested on this site and were put on the 8th floor with a window on the Bourbon Street side, which was still pretty loud, so I don't know what the value of asking was. I guess it could have been slightly worse, but there were more floors above us than below, so I think it could have been much better. They do put one cute bag in the room that included one pair of earplugs. Thanks to the reviews, we had brought our own. The location of the hotel is great for getting to all 3 streetcar routes without walking far or along any dark streets to get there. The lobby and rooms were beautiful. Mattress great. The fittness room was very nice, we didn't try the pool as it closes early. Each time we wanted to plan or book things the one guy for helping with that was busy with other people. Maybe they could have someone on standby to help others, we sat in the chairs clearly waiting for him, for quite some time. We left our bags in the luggage room between check out (noon) and our airport shuttle pick up and had no problem retrieving them quickly, there seemed to always be one or two staff there. All of the staff were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Location in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Candi407
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans for the first time to celebrate my birthday.We arrived on March 17, 2011 and checked out on March 21,20011. The personnel at the hotel was very professional and helpful in every way. The rooms were beautiful as well as comfortable.Even though thousandsof folks were up and down Bourdon street as well as Canal Street all night long our room was quiet when we went to bed absolutely no disturbances.When I return to New Orleans I will stay at the same hotel. The favorite resturants in the quarter that we could not get enough of was Oceania and LaBoyu. both had excellent food and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe, Rude & Unrully Staff”
Reviews.Author: wmjdillman
Reviews.Content: My wife,daughter, and I checked in to this hotel on January 28th, 2011 to stay for the weekend. I am a local business professional and had a free two night stay that I received as a raffle prize from a local golf tournament. Upon checking in, the valet staff was friendly and instructed us to call down about 15 minutes before we needed our vehicle. That evening we phoned the valet desk several times and did not get an answer. So I called the front desk and they made arrangements to get our vehicle so that we could go do dinner. We dropped our car off that evening and had no issues. Early the next morning I phoned down ahead of time as I was instructed to upon check in, no one answered the phone again at the valet!!!! So I called the front desk and was told very rudely that "I needed to come down and get my own car" So, I hung up and called back to try and speak to someone else. After the person picked the phone up and didn't answer and tried to connect me to valet I went downstairs. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was looked at like I was crazy and was told there are no supervisors!!! Terrible feeling when the hotel has your car keys and your credit card number and you cannot do anything to get it!!! At this point I noticed that part of the valet staff was hanging around the front desk, and I said to this person "maybe that's why no one answered the phone because you are hanging out up here"!!! after this the valet attendant told me "it wasn't his job to answer the phone", and I replied "way to be a team player"!! After not getting my through to this individual he was ready to actually fight me. It's 8:00 on a Saturday morning and this guy working at the hotel is trying to pick a fight with a guest! Quality individual!!!! At this point I am concerned about my safety...what is this guy going to do, no managers around, no supervisors around so what the heck! I can do whatever I want!! If you want to be threatened by the Saturday morning valet staff, then this is your place!!! This hotel is a complete joke, as a local I would never want to put anyone I know up here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: travelbug08
Reviews.Content: Had a fun time at the Astor Crowne over Mardi Gras weekend 2011. As others have said, the location is superb and the balcony served as a welcome respite from the crowds to watch the parade. We had no issues with noise whatsoever. At times, I could hear the revelry outside but it was a faint 'we need to get out there' noise, not a 'good gawd, doesn't anyone sleep in this town' type of noise. We booked a triple room, and the room was indeed fantastic. Beds were beautifully made up with lots of extra pillows, giving the room a very regal look. We were given a linen bag containing earplugs, an eye mask and a linen spray. First quibble - we were only given one bag per room....for a triple room. I flagged down a Housekeeping lady and she confirmed that yes, there is only one welcome bag per room. Are we supposed to share earplugs and eye masks?? At almost $300 a night for a triple room during Mardi Gras weekend, I found this to be very nickle and dimeish. The bathroom was very nicely appointed, but the water pressure was weak, there was no air vent and I couldn't help being weirded out by the fact that the coffeee maker, coffee etc were located in the corner of the bathroom countertop. Coffee pot in the bathroom?? I thought it was just me until my friends commented on it as well. Quibble number 2. I decided to phone the front desk to let them know that the rest of my party would be getting in very late. As I have done in every other hotel I've stayed in, I turned to my bedside table to dial only to realize that there was only one phone in the room and it was across the room on the desk. I'm sure this sounds like nitpicking but I was kind of surprised. It's one of those things you don't really notice until you're exhausted and already laying down.
