There are ALWAYS phones on the bedside table! (Quibble #3). So I get to the lone phone and press the button that says 'Front Desk'. Someone answers and tells me I've reached Housekeeping. Figuring I'd misdialed, I do it again. Same thing. I finally asked the lady if I should press 'Housekeeping' to get the Front Desk. We shared a laugh over that one. She gave me the number for the front desk and I finally got through to them but I had to keep the number on a pad near the phone. (Quibble #4) Room Service was fantastic! No quibbles here. Prompt, excellent quality and the staff was very courteous. The Creole Potato Salad is to die for! It is expensive by the time you factor in delivery, tax and the built in gratuity, but it was worth it when we just couldn't be bothered to brave the Bourbon St crowds. Wanted to store some water and soda but there is no mini-bar and no refrigerator in the room (Quibble #5). Even lower end hotels have a refrigerator. Housekeeping staff is great. Never had to ask for anything. They work hard and do a great job. I will say that there is only one small trashcan in the bathroom and another small one in the room itself. These fill up pretty quickly and we ended having to swap out bags ourselves. Crowne Plaza, either add another can or make the lone trashcan in the room bigger please. The balcony is awesome. We went up to view the parade and I ordered a rum and coke, which took forever to come. We were ready to leave and it still hadn't arrived so I flagged the girl down to cancel it and, considering she still didn't have the drinks with her, she agreed. The drink was still charged to my room ($15.38 by the time they added delivery charges and tax). I called the front desk the morning I checked out and was assured it would be removed, but it was still there when I looked at my charges online. I had to call the hotel again when I got back to New York. It was eventually removed so I was happy about that. There is a full service business center where I sent a fax (at $3.00 for the first page and $2.00 every additional page, thank you very much), but there is also a room in the lobby where there are computers for use free of charge. You can even print. I loved that and it came in very handy for printing our boarding passes before we left. $9.95 a day for wifi just wasn't worth it when I could just run down to the lobby for a few mins. The Bourbon House restaurant attached to the hotel is awesome! Had my first try of alligator there and loved it. The Crowne Plaza also offers coupons for a 10% discount at Oceana Grill nearby. Their 'lost bread' and alligator sausage are to die for and the blackened bayou duck is sinful. Great good all around. Re tours, we booked a river cruise from the concierge in the lobby who told us we had to be there by 2pm. We got there at 2 only to find that the boat had left at 1:30 lol. We still had all the flyers where he wrote 'be there at 2pm'. Not to be deterred, we just jumped on line down at the dock and booked a cruise on the Natchez that was leaving at 2:30pm. We hadn't paid a deposit so it all worked out. All in all, we had a really good time in New Orleans, and a big part of that was due to the Astor Crowne. The location can't be beat, the people are friendly, the restaurants are great and I appreciated the security measures in place during Mardi Gras. We were issued ID bands and they were checked relentlessy. I would recommend staying here if you get a good rate but I think there are enough things that take away from its 5-star status to diminish the value of what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jtwatson3606
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights and had a wonderful trip. The room was clean and spacious, the employees were very professional and overall the stay was wonderful. I had no issues for the time I was there. The location on Bourbon and Canal made the hotel convenient to everything, but it was very quiet once you got inside the building. We didn't make it to the Bourbon House this time, but have had good seafood there in that past. I used the gym facilities twice and they were above average for a hotel. Here's a tip, fill up your water bottle with the filtered water in the gym. The water from the tap is not wonderful. I will definitely consider the Crowne Plaza on my next trip to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a stay, FANTASTIC LOCATION...minor issues”
Reviews.Author: mervie357
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this room for our trip to New Orleans for Mardi Gras. We thought we were very lucky to get a room here since we waited longer than we should have....we didn't realize just how lucky till we arrived. The location is FANTASTIC. It's located at the edge of the French Quarter, on Bourbon and Canal Streets, two of the highlights of New Orleans. If you're going for Mardi Gras (next year), many of the parades pass directly in front of the hotel and you can watch the parade from the street level or on the hotel's balcony (on one night the balcony was closed for a private party attended by Melissa Leo and other cast members of the show "Treme"). I was very happy with the check-in process, especially when I noticed they gave us a room in the 12th-floor Quiet Zone as I requested when I reserved the room online (a lot of hotels don't pay much attention to those requests). This is to avoid being kept up all night by the sounds of Bourbon St. The room was very nice. The biggest thing I noticed that was missing was a minibar but there was a vending machine and ice machine down the corridor and staff never stopped us from bringing drinks/food up to the room. Btw, room service food was delicious. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. There was a small problem with housekeeping, but it was resolved by the generous intervention of other housekeeping staff. An annoying thing I noticed, and I saw that another contributor noticed the same, is that you pay $10 for 1 day wifi service but you're only given 23 hours!

Reviews.Title: “What a great location !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaiRom
Reviews.Content: It is located at the entrance of the French Quarter at the Corner of Bourbon and Canal Street. It is close enough to the French Quarter without all the noise. We got a room on the 9th floor so noise wasn't a factor for us. Every night during our stay, there was a group of musicians playing Jazz/Blues music on Bourbon St just a few feet away from its side entrance. They attracted a fairly large crowd. We could barely hear them from our room but could be noisy for those on the lower floors. The hotel did provide ear plugs, lavender linen spray and eye masks to help you to sleep but we didn't have the need to use them. It is also easily accessible to the lines for the cable cars. The stops are directly across on Canal Street. It is close to shops and several fast food restaurants. We got a room with double queen beds. The room size is adequate. The mattresses were very comfortable. They weren't too hard or too soft. The linens were nice & clean. There were questionable large stains on the bed skirt but I wasn't as concerned since it weren't the linens on the beds. I would be if it had. As space is a premium based on its location. I thought it was ridiculous that the hotel was charging $31.50/a night for parking so needless to say we didn't use their valet parking service. We found a covered parking garage only a few minutes walk from the hotel for $15/night with a guard on duty and security cameras. There is a business center with 3 computers and a printer. Free internet in the lobby & business center but there is a charge of $9.95/night in your room. There is a pool but it was outside and not heated so it was too cold to swim. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy. The hotel staff was friendly. Overall, it was a great stay. There is a saying in real estate...location, location and location and this hotel has it. A great value for the price we paid !!!!

Reviews.Title: “For what I paid, not too shabby. But...”
Reviews.Author: Hanson05
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night, 5 day business trip to New Orleans, and stayed at the Astor due to it's close proximity to the conference location. I booked the room through an online site, and believe I paid $99 per night for what was advertised as a "totally renovated, 4 star hotel." Now, for paying $99 per night, which I felt was a reasonably good price, the hotel met the standards of a hotel under $100 a night. The location is fantastic and most people I encountered at the hotel were friendly and helpful. However, the hotel classifies itself as a 4 star, which it is not, and the room rate on the back of my door was listed at approx. $465, which would be extremely inappropriate. The positive's: -Location -Price I paid -Entire property is non-smoking -Inclusion of a fitness room at no extra cost -Proximity to The Bourbon House -Pool on the roof terrace -Relatively decent sized rooms -Prompt, friendly, and tasty room service -Quick bell-service & friendly bellmen -Great business center/Location of it was excellent and the 3 computers w/printer also great. The negative's: -Upon check in around 9:35 PM, I requested a room high up as I was there for work and needed to get some sleep. The receptionist said no problem. She promptly handed me keys to a room on the 3rd floor. I asked if they didn't have anything higher, so she gave me a room on the 4th floor. -The room on the 4th floor was F-I-L-T-H-Y. There was sugar or some white substance all over the desk, the floor throughout the room was sticky and immediately turned my feet black, the bathroom was not clean, my alarm clock was broken, the in-room blow dryer was broken, the entire room smelled and felt really musty, and the closet was tiny with no mirror on the door. I wiped down the desk myself, and started unpacking because I figured I just got a bad room because I had booked through an online discount site. I was going to leave a note for the maid the following day, with a gratuity, asking her to please really clean the room. But, the one thing I couldn't deal with is a broken hair dryer as I need one in the morning so, I called down to the front desk to ask for a new one. I called 4 separate times that evening, between 9:45 and 10:30, and no one answered. The phone just rang and rang and rang. Eventually, I gave up and went to bed, figuring I will deal with it first thing. -Called the front desk the following morning at 5:30 to ask for a new blow dryer. The receptionist said they have none, and would send up maintenance. A 4-star hotel doesn't have extra's? I would have to wait for maintenance to fix what was clearly a fried blow dryer? You could see the burn on the exterior of the device. I waited until 6:20 with no one coming to my room, and called the front desk again. Surprise, no one answered the phone. Called again, and no one answered. Great service. Quite frustrating when you are trying to get ready to leave for the day. -Went down to the front desk, explained what happened, and that there was a reason I was up at the crack of down in New Orleans. I needed to get on with my business meetings! I then took the opportunity to explain that the room was also really dirty, to which the receptionist responded "You should have called the front desk upon check-in last night." Not a good response considering the numerous attempts I had made to contact the front desk. -Eventually, she agreed to switch me to a room right next door in order to solve the broken dryer issue, and to get me into a cleaner room. So, at 6:45 AM I had to move all of my belongings to a new room while scurrying to get ready in order to get to my business meetings. The new room was much, much better. It was clean, didn't smell, all electronics worked, was larger, had a full sized closet with mirror on the door, some additional amenities my first room didn't have, etc. I was really happy with the move. I went down and thanked the receptionist for the accommodation. I most appreciated it! Still, I didn't get a paper delivered to my door 2 of the 4 nights I was there, didn't receive my check-out bill for my last night (on personal credit card) under the door, my dirty room service plates & tray sat outside my door for 12+hours even after someone who had apparently had one too many hurricanes ran into it and scattered the dishes throughout the hallway, and the maid service forgot to leave coffee in my room one day. As I said, for paying $99 a night, it is a perfectly fine deal & hotel. I didn't feel like I overpaid and would consider staying here again for work, if I could get the same rate. I used the fitness center every day, spent a couple of hours by the pool one afternoon, loved the location, and felt perfectly safe traveling all alone. Yet, if you are truly looking for a "4 star" hotel, I'm not sure the Astor fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BaronKD
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this Hotel. The accommodations where very nice. The location is the best in the city and everyone working there were nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dbeltz2428
Reviews.Content: We could have not asked for a better stay than the Astor. The front desk staff was very friendly and provided a warm welcome. The rooms were very clean except the area behind the television. Water pressure was ok but needs improvement. Thanks everyone at the hotel for making our spring break vacation special.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for carnival go-era.”
Reviews.Author: Poddersmac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for Mardi Gras 2011. If I had only one word to descibe this hotel it would be location. Right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal we couldn't have asked for better! Check in was quick and easy. We were pleasantly surprised to be offered a twin queen room although we had only booked a Std double. Furthermore our request for a room on a high floor was granted without hesitation. When we got to our room we were stunned at the size of the room. It was huge and adequately equipped. I see that some reviews have mentioned the fact that there are no flat screen tv's. I have only one comment on this....who comes to NOLA to watch tv? The hotel was perfect for watching the parades with access to the second floor balcony for some serious bead catching:) in terms of service and housekeeping the staff could not be faulted. All were pleasant, friendly and only to happy to help us during our seven night stay. We felt very safe during the carnival madness as security at the hotel was very tight with only guests with wristbands being allowed access to the hotel. If I had to make one negative comment it would have to be on the absence of a free wireless. The cost being 9.95 a day. Other than that I would definitely stay here again. In fact I doubt we would choose anywhere else. Thanks to all staff at the Astor for a wondeful stay. Let the good times roll.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: LakeLizard
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again. The location of it is great if you want to be right by Bourbon Street. And although it's an old hotel, it has been renovated and is in pretty good shape inside. The thing that will never take me back to the hotel though is the valet service. YES, it's really that bad!! There's no parking anywhere around the hotel so you have no choice but to valet park. I knew that going in, but figured the hotel would have adequate staff to handle everyone. When we arrived on Friday night we had to wait for at least half an hour before we could even get close to the front of the hotel. This gave us the chance to watch all of the drunk people stumbling from Bourbon Street, which would be a common sight day and night in front of the hotel. Finally "Big John" came to my window and helped us unload our luggage onto a cart. Big John was wonderful. We got inside, check-in was quick, and we were off to our room. The room was nice for an older hotel. Not much drawer space or table top space though. We didn't have any problems with noise, but our room was on the inside of the hotel. I heard that the rooms on lower floors that faced the outside of the hotel could be noisy (Bourbon Street noise). I was told that I could call down to the valet stand and they would get my car in about 10-15 minutes. So the next morning I tried to call down to the valet stand to request my car be brought up. I got a recording that said due to valet being so busy, I'd have to go downstairs and request my car. So off we went and in about 20 minutes my car arrived. This was a good day for valet service, let me tell you, because it was never this good again. Only down side was that one of the guys left his empty Powerade bottle in my car. Nice...I have to clean up their trash in my car now. Everytime we returned to the hotel, traffic was backed up out front. There is really no place for the cars to go and Crowne doesn't have enough staff to handle the volume of cars that come in and out of the hotel. So we had to sit and wait, and wait, and wait, each time. And the valet guys don't come to you, you have to jump out of your car and try to stop one of them. So Sunday morning, I try again to call downstairs to request the car. I get the recorded message that I have to go downstairs. I get downstairs and am told that because it's a heavy checkout day, I have to wait for a shuttle that will take me to the off-site parking area where I can pick up my car. Seriously?? I'm paying you $31.50 a day for valet and I have to go get my own car? They said the shuttle would run every 7 minutes. It pulled up, I got on, we went to the offsite garage, and I had to wait there for one of the guys to go get my car. After I got my car I had to go back to the hotel and pick up the rest of our party. This actually worked pretty well however if I had been checking out and had luggage it wouldn't have been favorable. Monday morning - again, not able to call down and get the car. So we go downstairs. We needed to leave timely to get to a tour location, so I gave us 30 minutes. 45 minutes later I finally see our car coming. By this time, total frustration with these guys has set in and I was really having to hold my tongue. After all, I still had one more day of them taking care of my car! I get in the car, the seat has been completely readjusted and the radio has been turned completely off. I had turned the volume down when I got out the day before, but when I turn on the radio the station has been changed, and the volume cranked up. Gee...just make yourselves at home! Tuesday morning, it's finally time to leave. We went to breakfast and on our way back stopped at the valet stand to give them the ticket. We still had to go up and get our luggage, so I figured this would give them ample time to get my car pulled up. We load up the luggage, come back downstairs, and we wait. And we wait. And we wait!!! Finally after 45 minutes, "Ro" says he'll check and see what the hold up is. I followed him to the valet stand because I wanted to hear what was going on. The guys at the offsite garage never heard Ro when he requested my car. Ro tells them to make my car the next one that comes down. Almost another half hour goes by before my car finally arrives. One hour and 10 minutes after I requested it!!! And again, the radio station has been changed, seat completely readjusted. I can see needing to move the seat some, but changing the radio station and cranking it up? I'm sorry. This isn't your personal vehicle. So I basically have no big complaints about this hotel except for the valet service. But the valet service was so bad, that I would never stay here again. We were with a large group of people and we all experienced the same problems with valet. Complaints were made to management, but nothing ever got better. I understand that due to the location of the hotel and the volume of people coming in and out, it's not an ideal situation for these guys trying to work valet. But the number of staff seemed to be inadequate. Big John and Ro seemed to be the only 2 that even acted like they cared. The other valet staff just had an attitude...probably from getting chewed out so much and from working in such a bad situation. But for $31.50 a day, I expect WAY better service than what we received. Also, the hotel doesn't offer free internet service. $9.95 a day, and it's not even a full 24 hours. They only give you 23 hours. For the price of this hotel, you'd think they could offer free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mrstorey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Mardi Gras week at the Crowne Plaza. Even though the city was in the whirlwind of Mardi Gras once inside our hotel all of the feverish activity flowing around us seemed to stop and we experienced calm and courtesy from the staff. Our room was freshened every day with plush towels and crisp white sheets. We never had to ask for a thing as all of our needs were anticipated. Oh, great location too. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dwtncajun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times over the years. The location is great from things on Canal ( few blocks from Casino). And out the side door your on Bourbon Street. Always are impressed with the service and cleanliness. But being their this year during Mardi Gras makes you appreciate the hotel, friendly staff and all it offers. From quick check in to great room service. From my visits to New Orleans it's the best place I've found

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Astor, Had a Blast”
Reviews.Author: Ben0002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astor with a large group of friends from March 4th through March 9th, 2011 for Mardi Gras! We had two rooms, side-by-side which we had requested, and we had such a great time. The hotel is obviously located right in the middle of all the action w/ parades on Canal and tons of partying on Bourbon. The rooms were great and very nice. Other reviews have stated that the TV's are outdated, which was true of our room (I went in some other rooms that had new flat screens), however we didn't turn our TV on a single time so I could've cared less if the room even had a TV. It's New Orleans, why would you need a TV? Other reviews have stated that the wristbands and security were problematic, but we never experienced an issue with this. Guest wristbands which we acquired frequently for our friends visiting us that were staying at nearby places were $20.00 and easy to purchase. The wristbands even come in handy in instances where a cop needs to walk you back to your hotel and you can't remember what it's called (the wristband has the hotel's name on it)! The staff at the Astor is the best, I pretty much got to know all of them while I was there: Shout out to Bull, Duana, Aria, Andrea, Shandreka, Vic! Bull was pretty much the shiz! The front desk staff has the most beautiful girls in any hotel! I really can't say that I have any complaints about this hotel. The parking situation can be difficult, we valeted and then we were leaving on Wednesday the staff in the front of the hotel expected us to take the shuttle to the satellite parking lot to retrieve our car, however we kindly persuaded them to go get it for us! I'll be staying there next time I come for Mardi Gras!

Reviews.Title: “Not very special”
Reviews.Author: Haltz
Reviews.Content: I'm always excited to have an opportunity to be in New Orleans. The location of this hotel promised to make it is especially memorable event. But the lobby itself was remarkably on festive, given that we were on the brink of Mardi Gras, and even though I arrived at 2 AM, I still had to wait for service at the front desk. The pool was nice, although it was initiated part of the hotel, someone could never really get any sun. The exercise room was full of damaged equipment that was generally poorly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: terryinal
Reviews.Content: I have been to new orleans plenty of times.Best place I have stayed,everythink was find from checkin to check out. I read some of the not so good reviews and don't understand them. I would stay again and recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Star74
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here at the Astor Crowne Plaza in the past year and a half. What I like best is its location; located on canal and bourbon, it's easy access to French Quarter, and then to the trolleys that will take you to CBD/Warehouse and the Garden District. Check in no problem, spacious room, very attentive staff. Obviously given location saturday night was a bit noisy but that was easily remedied with ear plugs; the other nights were quiet so it worked out well. Our room was spacious, bathroom as well. Both times I have found this a combination of great location and nice room. Would recommend it and will stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Service in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Debbie8110
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping and Room Service were most impressive. This is a friendly, service oriented hotel, and I enjoyed my stay immensely. Others have noted the downside of noise due to the location at Bourbon St. The hotel provides a care package including earplugs to assist their guests. I enjoyed my stay and felt safe and pampered. Room service was prompt and the food was great. Housekeeping met all my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Excellent, Hotel - OK”
Reviews.Author: szynka
Reviews.Content: A relatively nice hotel in an excellent location No major complains. When we arrived, there was no staff to help us with luggage. Otherwise the staff was generally OK. Check-in was fast. Our executive floor room was equipped with old, medium quality furniture, a tiny safe, a coffee maker which was spilling coffee , a hair dryer which had to be fixed and an old TV set. There was no minibar or refrigerator. Bed and pillows were comfortable. The room was clean. The noise from the street was not disturbing . Internet access was about 10 dollars per day, charged separately for each devise one wanted to use (for example laptop plus mobile, or two laptops at the same time). It was not very fast and was not working continuously. The windows were not clean and they did not open. With an ineffective air condition, the air in the room was somewhat stuffy. This also negatively influenced sleep quality. The executive lounge offered a mini-breakfast in the morning and micro-snacks plus drinks 4-8 PM. One could have one bier or one glass of wine per day free of charge. A next bier was charged 3 dollars. Another unusual thing for an executive lounge was a box for tips at the counter. There was a computer with free internet access in the lounge plus 2 TV sets in one room. There were paper cups for coffee to-go, which was nice. There was a very helpful bellboy at the door when I was checking out. I can recommend this hotel for its excellent location. Otherwise it was average quality.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Ryans72
Reviews.Content: Where shall I start? We had a great two weeks travelling all over Louisiana and Mississippi, and thought we would spend our last night in the French Quarter. Our room was the most expensive of our trip, it was also the dirtiest, and dingiest. We asked for a new room, and were offered another which was no better. A third room was marginally better; we decided to stay as we had been all day on the road. Many thanks to bellman Jose who was most charming as he moved our luggage, and it was him who arranged the third room for us. We should have known better - next morning we went down for breakfast, and had a disastrous experience. We ordered two poached eggs on toast - pretty simple we thought. They brought the eggs, but no toast! When we asked, they said they were out of wheat toast, would we like white. We agreed to the white, it still never came. When we asked, wheat toast was brought to us! Don't know what that was about - but by this time, the eggs were cold, breakfast was awful. They did agree to comp the breakfast, but we would rather have had a nice breakfast! My advice is, don't stay here - it looks lovely from the lobby, but the rooms are bad, the the service is even worse! And it was the only hotel we stayed in which didn't have free wireless - even though it was the most expensive! Save your money, stay at the Hilton or Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, clean rooms, fantastic food and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ike1985
Reviews.Content: My Collegues and I stayed at this hotel, while attending a conference at New Orleans last May. Walking into the hotel through what can be described as an athmosperic entrance you are greeted by a beautiful foyer and very friendly and helpful staff (especially considering we checkied in at 2:00 am). We were shown to our rooms which were spacious, cool and nicely furnished. The beds were very comfortable if a bit soft, the bathroom spotless and quite big and the room generally quiet (surprisingly quiet condsidering we were looking over Bourbon Street). The rooms were cleaned thoroughly every day. With regards to food i heartily recommend the restaurant on the ground floor, the food was divine and the staff go beyond the call of duty to make sure you have a great time. Special thanks go to the concierge for all her advice and the bell boys for taking care of our luggage when it was time to go. All in all a great hotel - I'd happily return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to the French Quarter and everything New Orleanian”
Reviews.Author: jbirchfield
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Walking into the lobby through the grand wrought iron doors gives a nice feeling of history, unlike hotels that are being built now. The lobby was beautiful and the staff were very welcoming. Once in the room you are reminded that you are in a Crowne Plaza, which is not a bad thing, it is a just typical CP room. Beds are comfortable, and the bathroom amenities are nice. The hotel is very accommodating in helping guests find there way around the city and are quite knowledgeable. They gave great recommendations for restaurants and sites to see. I dealt mostly with the front desk staff, as the concierge is quite busy with guests. The location cannot be beat, it is honestly the gateway to the French Quarter where you can eat, shop, and people watch until your heart is content. I will be visiting this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect property, location, staff, the only place for me”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Astor every time I go to New Orleans, which is at least 2-3 times a year. My last stay was over Memorial Day, and I'm embarrassed to be writing at this late date. In fact, I have booked three rooms for Mardi Gras, and we will be arriving there on March 3 this year. All of my past stays in this property have been clean, comfortable, and easy. The staff here is very friendly and willing to help with any problems. Letitia in the business center has been so very helpful to me in the past, and the bartenders in the lobby bar are always entertaining. Housekeeping staff are beyond accomodating, and we have always been very well pleased with their service to us. The business center is well appointed, and there is usually a station open of the five (I'm pretty sure it's five) provided. The lobby is beautiful, and there is a concierge there to help you with arranging tours from carriage to swamp. The only down side would be that there are not refrigerators in the room. If you are considering this property for Mardi Gras, know that the location is ideal for parade going and Quarter hopping alike. Some of our number prefer to socialize in the Quarter, while others of us (myself included) love the parades. The location on Canal & Bourbon makes that easy for everyone. Harrah's casino is just down the block. Wonderful restaurants (including the Hobnobber on Carondelet) are within easy walking distance. The Bourbon House (a Brennan's restaurant) that is part of the hotel is a wonderful place for oysters - don't be that patient sould standing in line for an hour at Acme next door. Those of us enjoying the ambiance at the Bourbon House look out at you with pity. :) The food and service are exceptional at Bourbon House. This is *the* property - it has location, great staff, all manner of services, and a wonderful restaurant. I stay in no other property while in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cobi00
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for six nights for a conference and was very impressed with my overall experience. Due to some of the tough reviews on Tripadvisor I was a bit concerned going into it, and I was therefore more vigilant than usual. I was pleasantly surprised. Be sure to ask for a room in the new tower. The rooms in the older section are much smaller and less desirable. The hotel is very clean and kept up, including the meeting rooms and public rest rooms. The conference food was very impressive. I did 3 or 4 group breakfasts and lunches, and one dinner and they did an excellent job with food service and quality. The front desk service was excellent, and the concierge, bellman, and doorman/valet were all very good. I would rate the lobby bar service as only fair based on one evening and one morning coffee experience with indifferent employees, but this was a surprise exception to what I experienced in the rest of the hotel. Excellent fitness center was kept very clean. The location is outstanding, on the corner of Bourbon and Canal Streets, just at the far end of the Bourbon St party area. The hotel is a perfect oasis from the Bourbon Street scene. Short walks to Decatur, Jackson Sq and the Casino. Would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone experiences the same things differently I guess.”
Reviews.Author: smokinkittys
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 4p on a Thursday (1/20/11) - Stacey (sp) was amazing at the front desk, she was helpful, answered our questions and directed us wonderfully. We asked for a room on the 11th floor or higher and not only was it granted, we were told to check it out and if we had any problems they would gladly move us to another room. It has been my experience that you generally get what you give - we behaved graciously and were treated perfectly - the bellman took care of us, suggested a couple of places to eat & even asked us how our stay was going every time we came in or went out. We valeted our car and asked for it twice during our stay - each time it arrived before I could finish a cigarette. Don't forget, this is a hotel on Bourbon Street - hello - you are going to have a bit of residual noise, if that's an issue, you should stay off the beaten path. Surprisingly, even though our room was directly facing Bourbon, it was minimal and not a problem. The room was immaculate. I've stayed at a lot of places in N.O. and the Crowne is a very upscale property in comparison. There were plenty of towels - sheets were clean - beds were soft - carpet was beautiful - water was HOT. And the location - awesome. Here's the deal - don't go in with an attitude gathered from some of the sour reviews here, some people just cannot be pleased and will complain about anything - expect a pleasant experience and the staff will probably respond likewise. We had an incredible time and I'd definitely stay here again. I would just like to once again thank the staff that was on duty at the time of our arrival - you are doing a great job and we appreciated your attention and kindness. Mr. and Mrs. Earnheart

Reviews.Title: “good location, dirty sheets”
Reviews.Author: itsmoi
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was average, the sheets were stained, heater never quite worked properly, but the location was good. Â On our last day of visit we checked our luggage at the bell desk, when we came back 3 hours later the door to the luggage storage room behind the bell desk was shut and there was no one near the bell desk, there were 2 other ladies in front of us waiting, after 5 minutes ones of the ladies began knocking on the door and no one answered, she knocked several times and finally tried opening the door, and there were 3 bell hops huddled in the side room with the luggage! Â it's a tiny room, they most definitelyÂ would have heard the knocks and the "hello, is there anyone there?" Â one of the bell hops came out and handed her luggage, and then shut the door again, with me standing right behind her by the door with my ticket! Â I opened the door asked for my luggage and promptly left (the other 2 bell hops were still in the side room). Â I don't know what they were doing in there, but I have learned one very important lesson, never check anything of value at the bell desk because you never know who is going to be handling your luggage. Â In case management wants to follow up with their staff, this took place around 2:30pm 1/16/2011.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst experiences I encountered it all the years I have spent traveling to New Orleans & The New Orleans area”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneWolters
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent location. The beds are so uncomfortable that they dip into the middle & if you sleep 2 in a King size bed you have to hold on to the end of the bed so you are not swallowed into the middle. The beds are supported with PLASTIC bolsters that broke, on two occasions when we sat at its corners. The AIR CONDITIONER is set a some kind of timer, that if you do not move, it shuts off. HOW UNCOMFORTABLE it is to wake up in SWEAT because I do not move while I sleep????? After touring the town, it was UNACCEPTABLE HOW HOT IS IN THE ROOMS!!!!!!! Parking is another issue! You valet you vehicle, to be tols in order to retrieve it you must take a shuttle bus, with all your belongings, to get the car you entrusted the hotel with. Thank you to Rogelio, for taking the time to get our vehicle, with a SMILE!!!!! Thank you to Joyce Carson, who was the only person, who spoke kindly & was extraordinarily understanding towards all the above issues. You are truly one of the BEST ASSESTS at The Astor! Too bad the white girl at the front desk, was unable to speak intelligently without running to get a security guard, who also totally understood what & why I was upset. Then comes, the manager, Eric Miller, who was so indifferent & totally without any concern whatsoever for NOT WANTING TO MAKE THIS RIGHT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value with Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: blondewithabrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza from 12/262010 - 1/4/2011. As Priority Club members we always try to book on the Executive Club floors when we stay as we did during this visit. The Executive Club services and amenities at this location are well worth the upgraded price. The morning breakfast is helpful and appreciated especially when one person wants to sleep in or is not interested in leaving the room yet. Evening cocktail hours are very guest friendly - from 4 -8 PM and usually included something hot. Service by Denise was very friendly and genuine. Beds are wonderful, bathrooms adequate and having somewhere to sit other than the bed is great. We would like to have had a more updated TV and a mini-frig on the Executive floor. Hotel is in good repair, front desk staff was knowledgeable and helpful and we especially appreciated the extra security of checking for room keys on New Years Eve. Our room was spacious and well-lit. Bedding was of good quality and housekeeping was very responsive to our wishes. As noted, there is some street noise but we have found that to be the case at all city hotels - not just New Orleans or the Quarter. If you are very noise aware or a light sleeper, ask to stay farther from the Executive Club as the morning guests could be quite loud. In the past this location has gotten mixed reviews. Whatever the past problems might have been, they are now resolved. Management was helpful before booking with information and details to help us select the best room for our needs and the stay was all we were promised. We would stay here again and certainly recommend to friends who wanted to stay in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch! Unresponsive Staff! Painfully Slow Valet!”
Reviews.Author: aggieswo
Reviews.Content: Had reservations for a two bedroom large suite for my bachelor party and upon arrival the room was magically downgraded to a small suite with two beds and the only TV we had to watch football on in the room looked like something out of the 1980â€™s. When the discrepancies were brought to the staffâ€™s attention the only response was a blank stare and explanation of just how busy they were. It didnâ€™t really affect the evening out with my friends but I was pretty disappointed as I was expecting a awesome hotel given the price we paid. The final insult was the almost hour long wait on the curb the next day waiting for my car to get out of valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Keishac
Reviews.Content: We chose the Crowne Plaza Hotel because it was on the corner of Canal and Bourbon St. At first, I was a little worried about hearing all the sounds from Bourbon Street in the room, but we didn't hear them at all! Plus we were rarely in our room. It's so convenient to be able to walk out of your hotel and right out into the excitement of Bourbon Street. This is definitely where I'll be staying everytime I come to New Orleans, except during Essence Festival...they had already booked all their rooms before I could reserve my room! Love this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, & a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: travel2u08
Reviews.Content: My husband & I really enjoyed this hotel! The first thing that impressed us, upon arrival was the staff that greeted us, took care of our luggage, and our vehicle. We were tired from a long trip, & parking is located several blocks from the hotel, so thank goodness we had them to help us to remember to grab everything we needed from our vehicle - or we would have had to catch a shuttle to go get it. ( keep in mind that this is common for hotel parking in this city) All of the other staff members were super too - very helpful and friendly. The room we stayed in was on the 13th floor facing Bourbon Street. It was clean, spacious, and very comfortable. A little gift bag with eye mask, ear plugs, and a little spritzer bottle of lavender spray ensured a great nights sleep every night. We did not eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar, but it must have been wonderful because there was always a crowd. If you want to spend time on Bourbon Street, you can't beat the location! You walk out of the lobby and there you are! I would have liked to see a few more amenities for the price of the room, but overall we were thrilled with our experience with this wonderful hotel and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXECUTIVE LOUNGE GREAT LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: pflovett
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Years Eve weekend and there were crouds everywhere. The executive lounge is open everyday for breakfast and evening snack and drinks. Our first night here we ate in the lounge and were too full to eat dinner, it was great. Ask for a quite room and you will have no trouble with the all night partiers on Bourbon street. Walk to stadium and the french market is 15 minutes. The parking is the only bad thing to say about this hotel. The line to park stetched two blocks down Canal street and almost ruined our stay, that really should be fixed by management that is why I rated service so low. The Ritz down the street and the Wyndham did not have lines like that there is no customer service with the parking. After waiting over an hour to park the car and another 30 minutes to get the car we decided to park in the garage behind the hotel and get better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: lexus873
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in December while visiting New Orleans for the weekend. The hotel is about 30 minutes from the airport. The cab driver had no problem finding the hotel. The hotel is beautiful inside and very clean. The staff was wonderful in checking us in and getting us in our room early. Our room was very generous with space! We were at the end of the hall and I thought we would be away from the noise. We weren't. We were right on Canal St. and heard all the noise from below even though we were 6 floors up. If you plan on going to bed early you might consider changing rooms. We were out till late, but once 8 am hit we heard the traffic from below and the trolleys. The room was clean but I noticed mold on the a/c vent. The bed was comfortable, but for some reason, it wouldn't fully fit on the frame of the bed. You can easily walk to anywhere in the French Quarter from the hotel. A trolley stop is right across the street from the hotel (Garden district line and canal line). Despite it being noisy, I would stay again...just in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of rooms facing Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: HappyWandererQ
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon during a period that was busy with conventioneers. We'd arranged a 4-night package through our travel agent, but neither of us knew half the rooms faced Bourbon Street, nor the downside of that location. By the time we figured out we would be inundated with music every night from 6:00 to 10:00, and until 1:30 am on the weekends, we didn't want to take the trouble to change rooms, even had that been an option. The room itself was OK, but the linens and carpet looked worn. A real bonus, in spite of the so-so accommodations, was the service we received everywhere in the hotel (except for one inept bartender). The receptionists were friendly and helpful, the housekeeping staff and engineering responded quickly to service requests (the hairdryer didn't work), Bull. a bellhop was a real joy, and the young female concierge was a gem, giving straightforward information about local sites and restaurants. I don't know that we'd recommend the hotel to others, but we didn't have anything to compare it to in the quarter. It may have been a real bargain for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: bitbok
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and it was my first time in New Orleans. I couldn't have picked a better place! It was in the middle of everything. You can step out and be on Bourbon street or walk down to the casino or the french market. The room was clean and they cleaned it in a very good way. The hotel staff were very friendly and the room service was excellent! Stay here, you will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION ...Clean and Nice Hotel, sevice could improve”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceToronto
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 fantastic nights at the Astor from Nov 21 to Nov 25th. Me and a few freinds who work as travel agents went down from Toronto and had a GREAT TIME in N.O. The hotel is perfectly located as many reviwers have already stated the Lobby and the rooms were very nice and clean and have no complaints about the hotel itself at all!! I did however find alot of the staff to be very rude and unacommodating. I know they have to deal with drunks all the time considering the location right on Bourbon but a smile and hello your goes a long way. The doormen were also quite unproffesional all they seemd to be doing , at least at night, was chatting up the girls on the street. and didnt seem to like to answer any questions. All in all i would recommend this hotel simply for the comfort and location but dont expect fantastic service. but really if your going to New Orleans to stay in your room dont go to New Orleans. I will be back to N.O and would choose the Astor again.* On a side note make sure you check out the Honey Island Swamp tour ... FANTASTIC !!

Reviews.Title: “Jumping the Gun, perhaps”
Reviews.Author: OhioBE
Reviews.Content: As a marketing and media (new/social media specific) professional, I felt the need to compliment my experience thus far and thought it might offer insight to other travelers. Don Zimmer, Director of Sales, does an excellent job responding promptly to his guests' posts quickly and without platitudes. I commend him (or you, Don, if you read this) for the attention to detail in capturing the post-stay commentary and review as a source for information gathering and a way to identify improvements... from the quick and easy, to perhaps the tougher topics. All are addressed head on. Don, on a side note, you might want to start addressing in Yelp as well, maybe claim the property which will allow you to respond to guests. It is the up-and-coming viral 'marketing' word-of-mouth site. There's a couple doozy reviews there. I also had an EXCELLENT experience with Nancy in reservations and hope to meet her in person. She spent significant time answering questions, helping to wrap my head around proximity and travel needs, the best way to get a 1 day rental car, saving some money here and there and advising on how to address my asthma. She herself walks to work everyday and was able to just kind of give a lay of the land. This is invaluable, especially when you are like me doing avid research, which can often put you on information overload. I'll update after our stay - I'm just hoping for super clean and reasonably updated. I'll try to ask for the "quiet" floor as well.... maybe my priority card will help with this. Many thanks for getting the trip off to a great start and taking some of the hotel sourcing stress away! J. Hamlin Staying 12/1-12/6 Nancy also

Reviews.Title: “Very Overpriced, Hidden, Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jensnow
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights here. The first night we got after midnight and had travelled all day. On our way to our room, we went through long hallways and corridors into a weird part of the hotel. Once inside our room, we were pretty disappointed. We had paid $179/night and it looked like an old dorm room converted to a hotel. The appliances were old. The mattress was old. The pillows had yellow stains all over them and seemed like they were 5 years old. The worst part was the pubic hair on the toilet seat. Seriously! I called down to the front desk and told them we were leaving in the morning and would not be paying for the next 2 nights. We should have left because my husband and I couldn't go to sleep because we felt like there were bugs crawling on us. It was so late and we were so worn out and had an early morning. The next morning, after speaking to someone at the front desk, we were moved to a room that cost $229/night. It was a completely different style room and was actually clean. We were baffled. They gave us that room for $179/night. Long story short, this hotel is definitely NOT worth $229/night or even $179/night. We have stayed in hotels all over the country and would price this hotel at around $129/night.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, brilliant service, couldnt fault it”
Reviews.Author: woodley188
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our IHG points as part of a roadtrip from England, it was an excellent hotel, in an excellent position, we were on a higher level floor and didnt hear any nopise from Bourbon St at all, all the staff were very helpful, in particular the valets who would run around to try and help people, all in all I would highly reccomend it ( and we were her during a very busy football weekend ) Steelers I think !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a night on the town”
Reviews.Author: pinto4lsu
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an unbelievable location on the corner of Bourbon Street and Canal Street. It had a very nice lobby and is conncted to Brennan's Bourbon House restaurant. The only con is that its valet parking only and the cars are kept 7 blocks away. I was told my truck would be there witihin 30 minutes, but it was closer to an hour. I would stay there again , but alot more time for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great night sleep!”
Reviews.Author: MrFun77
Reviews.Content: We knew ahead of time the location of the Astor Crowne Plaza was great, but after reading so many mixed reviews we were unsure what we were going to get. The service was very good and we had no complaints. The best part of our stay was how quiet our room was. We were on the 13th floor next to the elevator and ice machine, but enjoyed one of the most quiet sound proof rooms we have ever slept in. My only question was how a hotel that nice could not have a clock? Overall good choice for New Orleans if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: travellert987654321
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August. I absolutely loved it! The room was very clean, and the bed was extremely comfy. The lobby is beautiful. The front desk staff was okay. The valet parking is expensive, $30.00 per day. However I would recommend it. There are not too many places around the hotel that offer parking for much less, and you can't beat the convenience of picking your car up in front of the hotel. Plus the Valet staffs are great! The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right at the corner of Canal and Bourbon. PERFECT location for tourists wanting to explore what the French Quarter has to offer. Overall, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “happy”
Reviews.Author: eulmer
Reviews.Content: great hotel was in town for the saints/ steeelers game but i visit the town a lot. my first time at this hotel and it won me over right in on the main strip

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Kevin8732
Reviews.Content: We Booked this hotel at the last minute. Great Sales Staff namely Edna J. And Marylin O. they worked within my budget to give me the best services and amenities the hotel had to offer. Hotel staff was amazing. Anything that I needed for my group was handled with the topmost urgency. Attention to detail was better than expected. Great clean spacious room with outstanding. Room service was fast and courteous. During my stay. I had the pleasure of visiting the Executive Lounge. Complete bonus that was unheard of. They offered many things including great staff namely Denise R. All around nice hotel that knows how to take care of their guests. I will be back with another group hopefully this month.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice if you want to sleep or need your car”
Reviews.Author: Tex42_10
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the crown plaza astor in new orleans was less than adequate. I expected the hotel to be a bit loud but the door did not fit the frame very well and along with light the noise woke me up several times each night. Maybe that can be expected near bourbon street...Anyway, two of the three days we were there we needed our car to go visit areas we could not reach by foot. The first day we called ahead and we were told the car would be available in fifteen minutes. Thirty minutes later it arrived with no explanation as to why there was a delay. The second time I was told it would be twenty minutes and it took more than one hour and I could not get an explanation. When I pay over $30 per day to park your car, I expect better service. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Insulted, offended and Emabarrassed..... :'(”
Reviews.Author: Daylyn
Reviews.Content: I came down from Lafayette to spend time with fellow friends whom flew down from Cleveland to watch the Browns play the Saints. A room was reserved at this "Lavish" establishment. On arrive everything seemed up to pare. But what happened on our arrival back to the hotel late that same night was APPALLING to say the least. First let me start out by saying... I myself am a 32yr old Dental Hygienist. My friend whom walked in the facility with me is a 32yr old Highschool Principal. We walked past the front desk were we were approached by the "Hotel Manager" JAMES ALLEN. Than he proceeded to tell my male friend to get rid of me or he couldnt go to the room. Confused we said WHAT.. Mr. Allen says LOUDLY we dont allow people like her in this hotel. HUH!!!! I hear a woman behind me say, "She must be a street walker". Blown away I look Mr. Allen directly in the eye and said,"I AM NOT a hooker"!!! My male friend politely said, "Sir shes a dental hygienist and I'm a highschool principle". Mr. Allen proceeds to giggle in my face and roll his eyes. After giving us a pop quiz on how we knew each other, asking him what my full name was, GRILLING us under a spot light and bringing me almost to tears in front of a lobby full of waiting party's he finally said just go and smiles. I asked him for his name and the name of his boss. He replied with just GO. HORRIFIED, UPSET, EMBARRASSED doesn't even do justice on how that made me feel inside. I will NEVER or EVER recommend this hotel in the FRENCH QUARTER to anyone one I love or care about. If only he knew a family member of mine is a State Senator.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner007
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as the "mystery hotel" through book-it. We took a chance as this property is right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal. It was in a great location convenient to the French Quarter (casino, river front, French Market, shopping) and absolutely lovely. The lobby and restaurant looked amazing! Our friends staying at other hotels said they wished they'd booked with us. The 3rd floor outdoor pool area was a really nice space for some quiet time (although the pool wasn't heated, so swimming this time of year was not in the cards unless you like colder water). We liked our room very much. It is an older property so, the building has settled a little bit over time, but the place has been completely redecorated and looks great. I loved the exposed brick walls in the hallway. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Our AC worked fine. The "blackout" curtains were very effective and allowed us to sleep in. However, it is New Orleans and although we didn't hear the street noise, the other patrons can be somewhat noisy. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We used the valet service and were very pleased with their fast and polite service. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location BUT Disappointing for a "luxury hotel" Stay here is you get a room really cheap.”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: I am here at te hotel as I write this. This is my first review on this site although I have benefited greatly from other reviews. The Hotel is clean and in an excellent location but otherwise greatly disappointing for a higher end hotel. I had pre-booked over the phone and requested a King Size bed and even went to my online profile to confirm the request. I arrived at the hotel only to find myself booked into a 2 double bed room. The staff didn't seem to give a damn. The beds were also below what you would expect from a hotel like this. Very basic, pillows were crappy, mattress is less than the quality at some comfort Inn's . Rooms are big and include the basics. If you want free intenet go to the lobby and use the 'lobby connection". I am at a conference downstais I came back to my room at 1PM the room had not been made. In summary the location is the best ( right at Bourbon ) and the hotel is clean but disappoints compared to any other higher end hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: rbackfan
Reviews.Content: Got this motel as the mystery motel thru book-it...that's right I said book-it, and to my knowledge I was not treated any different then a customer that booked a room directly with the motel. I was treated very well. I had dreamed of staying in this motel, so I was thrilled to peices that this was the motel that book it selected for us. I was not disappointed in anyway, I was in total awe. For all of you that have complained about the parking, Astor Crowne Plaza does not hold a gun to your head and make you use their Valet parking, we parked directly behind the motel at the premium parking garage on Iberville, it is 20.00 a day and you are given a receipt so you can leave and return as often as you like. now that parking garage is Valet service as well, but the self parking garage right across the street is 34.00 a day. Parking is expensive in New Orleans so if you have a problem with it you need to find a motel special on book-it that offers free parking, I have stayed at those places in the past and they do not even hold a candle to the astor Crowne Plaza....I love this motel and would highly recommed it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Elegant Super quiet and lovely staff We loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joannawanda
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on a super busy and loud street. I was a little worried we would not get ANY SLEEP but our room was lovely had super high ceiling and we were surprised by how quiet it was. The beds were incredibly comfortable. I wish I was There now.

Reviews.Title: “good location for party people, but not for me...”
Reviews.Author: MissDivaD
Reviews.Content: the hotel reminds me of the old-world type European hotels i usually stay in when traveling overseas. the lobby is small and it seemed the staff was ill-appointed to accommodate the medium-sized party that was checking in. BEYOND SLOW! the room was not very clean, but i managed to deal w/that.i carry my own spray bottle of Lysol and after wiping off everything and spraying a thick layer in the bathroom, i was satisfied. the restaurant food was not bad, but for this hotel to be in the "heart" of Bourbon St...i was expecting more flavor and flair - the staff in the restaurant were very nice though. i hate i forgot to write their names down, but 2 young ladies there (early 20's, African-American) were outstanding. for breakfast, i simply wanted eggs and toast only which wasn't priced a la carte...they managed to locate a manager and gave me a very fair bill and w/out any attitude or hassle. the front desk staff and other reviews have stated is less than helpful. a simple request for directions was met w/a "huff and sigh"...upper management needs to re-train or fire these folks...they are the first impression. valet staff was friendly, but we found our own parking..just made sure we parked and took a cab or walked if we would be going out in the evenings..that traffic is CRAZY! the hotel is across from a CVS pharmacy which is nice and i found some cheap souvenirs. since this is a tourist area one is encouraged to be aware of your surroundings, especially at night. avoid the dark side streets and the "overly helpful" people standing on the corners. i used to live in La. and i am familiar w/how some people are targeted when a tourist in NOLA.just be aware and you will have a great time! i am not a party type so getting off Bourbon St, and away from the French Quarter affords one a chance to see the true charm of the Crescent City. check out the famed St Louis Cemetery #1(tomb of famed voodoo Queen Marie Laveau), the Garden District, the infamous Mother's Restaurant, and the place for the best beignets and coffee in the world...Cafe Du Monde!!!..i don't like sweets but i could not resist their beignets and hickory coffee..best of all they are open 24/7...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty classy at the corner of Canal and Bourbon!”
Reviews.Author: kennybravo66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for meetings last week of September 2010 with the wife who didn't have meetings. Pretty much kept up with the Crown Plaza standard compared to other Crowns i've stayed at. Impressive decor in lobby (although smaller than most) and above average rooms although nothing spectacular. For convenience sake the location is great to step right outside into the action of Bourbon but the negatives were not being able to stand outside for more than 5-10 minutes without getting hit up for change etc. But this is to be expected when you hang near the F Quarter anyways. Otherwise most sites were in walking distance, there was a small but nice rooftop pool, decent hotel bar. I didn't get to try to resturant due to the plethora of choices outside nearby. Otherwise it was a nice experience and i received a government rate of a little above $100 / night which i thought was a steal. Would definately stay there again for that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, great location, no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: 15monthsapart
Reviews.Content: I stayed for about 7 days. I loved the food at the hotel. The location was within walking distance to my conference and lots of great sights. However, I couldn't get any sleep with the aid of some OTCs! They give you a little bag with an eye cover, jasmine spray and ear plugs. I should've known they would being on the intersection of Canal and Bourbon! But I didn't know wha tthat meant when I booked it. The location and the service make sup for the sleep lost though. It really is a grea tplace to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment abounds”
Reviews.Author: dhblawyer
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the Astor Crowne Plaza on my first visit post-Katrina. This used to be my favorite New Orleans hotel. The location cannot be beat at the gateway to the French Quarter at Canal and Bousbon. The hotel touts an $11 million makeover on their website. The makeover must have been totally cosmetic. The bed in our room was awful with a big crease across the middle like it had ben folded in half. The air conditioner did not work and was loud. It constantly reset itself to 76 and never really cooled the room. The TV did not work and had to be replaced on the second day of our trip. Everything seemed a little worn out in the room. The lobby and lobby bar were great but they do not contribute to a good night's sleep. The price was good but on this off-weekend, I could have booked the Ritz for only a few dollars more. My mistake. I have visited NOLA every year since the storm except the year right after the storm. I used to think it got better every visit. Not this one. The place is a dump. The nice restaurants were not that nice and the party crowd and stench of the Quarter permeate everything. Scary looking people abound. Not the place for a romantic weekend with the wife. Not the hotel for it either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texan24
Reviews.Content: Cab fare: $33.00 flat rate from airport to hotel. Front desk: Very friendly staff at front desk on arrival, departure and anytime I called the front desk. No waiting to talk to front desk staff on arrival or departure. Went into room and room was nice and clean. Very slight musty odor but nothing that was unbearable. Carpet had no stains but looked like maybe it had not been vacuumed. AC vents need to be vacuumed/cleaned and there was a long hair, not mine of course in sink. (see pictures as proof). Sink did not drain very well so maybe hotel needs to unclog. Now, I am a little OCD about cleanliness so it may not be a big deal for some. Am the type that wears sandals in room and covers the remote with ziploc bag. Ice machine was not working the second night I was there. Internet $9.99 for in-room use and free in lobby. Safe in room easy to use. Room was quiet overlooking Bourbon street but one night you could hear a band that was playing on street below hotel room. They provide earplugs if needed. Lobby was very nice and clean and bellhops very courteous. Did not use Restaurant or Gym to be able to review. Overall was very happy with my stay at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jess2n2
Reviews.Content: We booked adjoining rooms with another family and they refused to accomodate us since we booked through BOOKIT. We were told it was BOOKIT's fault and atleast "we got a deal". So basically if you get an online deal your treated like trash here. Locked us out of our room and let another family in while we were at dinner. Next morning room smelled like sewer, had to up and move. Last morning my son cut his foot on glass in the carpet. After this hellish w/e they refuse to do anything about it.... they had originally offered us a free night after I spoke to many people over the phone, said it was in the mail 2 weeks ago, we never recieved it. Today they say they never sopke to me about anything....omg, never again!

Reviews.Title: “The best staff in new orleans...period!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VicNsandy
Reviews.Content: Exellent location for buss. or fun.Very clean and beutiful hotel.The Bellman and vallet staff are THE BEST,Big john,Jay,Mario and Myell I'll call him Mike cause i probably mispelled his name .. You will recognize anyone of these professional gentleman buy their huge smile and the manner in which they carry out their duties.I had time on my hands waiting for the ladies to get ready several times in 4 days so I would stand out front and watch these guys,They are truley Professional at what they do. when you do stay at this amazing hotel,make sure to tip these gentleman ,they deserve it.... this was our 1st nola trip ,we will be back and stay at THE CROWN..

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on the 14th floor, service was superior,restaurant was pleasant and food good”
Reviews.Author: CATZ3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7/24-28th Very nice and accommodating hotel. A business hotel with many conferences...the location is central and busy...since it fronts Bourbon and Canal that is basic. 14th floor was quiet, beds good, ample of everything...clean Pool was small but pleasant and clean. Very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza great place to stay in New Orleans for Williams in MS”
Reviews.Author: LadelMs
Reviews.Content: The gentlemen out front were so attentive when we drove up, the bellman assisted with our luggage and the car was parked upon our arrival explaing the distance it will be from the hotel. The room was very beautiful but the TV's need an update to match the decor. Bull Harris greeted us each day with a wonderful smile and answered our questionswith expertise of the area. We were in the city for four nights and our conference couldn't have picked a better location to area attractions. We can't wait for our next visist

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay For A Conference With Very Few Glitches”
Reviews.Author: DaCheez
Reviews.Content: This location was the site of the conference for which we travelled to N.O. (first time for my spouse). I was initially uncomfortable with the location, the cost of parking (an insoluable problem) and peripheral services like Internet (even Microtel has free Internet - c'mon guys!). Indeed the one prob we had was with the uneven Internet service in the room. Other than that, the room was properly serviced (though a bit musty), quiet (12th floor end), and sunny! And right around the corner from Bourbon Street!!! (advice: people... don't bring your little ones to Bourbon Street - What could you be thinking?!?) Staff was quick, courteous, discreet, effective. Conference facilities were good, food service was great, meeting rooms and public areas very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location....Needs improvement in many areas”
Reviews.Author: SouthernTraveler01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellant location in the French Quarter. Easy access to the streetcars, Bourbon Street etc. The staff was very friendly. Check in was very easy and the valets and bell hops were nice but..... the valet parking they offer is horrible. It's 30 plus dollars a day. The wait for your car takes forever. They give you a ticket with a phone number to call when you want your car and no one ever answers. You have to go to the front desk to request your vehicle and then the wait is on. We requested a king and got two full beds facing a rooftop on Bourbon. The room was clean and the beds were not bad. We stayed on the weekend of the Essence Festival so it was very loud and very crowded. I could over look all of this but when I made our reservation June 9th through 1800 hotels I had to prepay for our room. After our stay I checked my account and I had been charged again. I called the hotel and was passed from one to another and then nothing. They hung up on me. This happened twice. Finally I was told that I had to talk to accounting and after numerous attempts ( no one was ever in that office ) I was told to fax a copy of my voucher from 1800hotels and that as soon as they received it they would notify me. I'm still waiting. Anyway I did finally receive a partial refund ( less $40.00 ) and decided that I was lucky to get back what money I did get and I haven't bother with it anymore. I would not stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone else. It's to much hassle and far to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: deezoomo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, not great, but fine for a quick weekend. Our room had a very strong mildew smell when you first walked in. Once you got into the room you did not smell it anymore. Parking in front of the hotel, even just long enought to check in, is horrible. The charge for their valet parking is a little high, but there is plenty of public parking nearby for less. The location is good, the staff was friendly. To have been recently renovated it is not in the greatest condition. In our room we had a broken drawer on one piece of furniture, the metal around the tub faucet handle was broken and the caulking had large gaps where it was missing in places. The rugs in the entry needed vacuuming and the deck around the pool was a little dirty. We're not real picky but I can see where these types of things would bother others travelers.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: thollandam
Reviews.Content: I have visited New Oreans many times, and have stayed in several hotels in the downtown area. This is the first one I said I will NEVER visit again! From what I was told a woman broke her ankle while trying to take her luggage to her room, sued the hotel, so now the policy is no visitors can carry their own luggage using the cart. We were informed we couldn't, then we had to wait around 20 minutes just to get someone to take our luggage to our room, and that was after two complaints. Then once we got to the room, there was a footprint on one of the headboards. Other than that, the room was pretty clean. We called the help desk twice to requests items, was told we would receive them, after an hr, we called back, and then they informed us, they were out or they had no clean washcloths at that time. They didn't even call to let us know, but what hotel would be out of washcloths??? Also, the valey parking was horrendous! Since the hotel is on the corner of Canal and Bourbon, there's really no room to pull over to wait for the valet to move your vehicle. Saturday night, we returned to the hotel after a concert, and there was no one around to valet our car. We waited 15-20 in the car, after I located the manager, to get our car parked. On top of all of that, and paying $30/day to park, we realized they were parking the car in an uncovered parking area. someone put a flyer on our car, and after the on and off rain and sun, the paper was stuck to the windshield of our Infiniti!! Also when we first arrived and handed our car over, we were informed to call the extension when we needed the car, so the car would be available, since it would take about 15 minutes, due to the cars being parked a few blocks away. When we called to advise them to get the car, no one answered the valet line. I then called the front desk, who asked for our ticket number and said they would call the valet to have our car sent. Well I figured that wouldn't happen, so I waited ten minutes to call the front desk back, I was then told I could not call ahead I had to be down stairs before someone would go get the car! We were late to the concert!!!! I am sure there are some things I forgot to mention, anyhoo, my favorite hotel in Downtown New Orleans is Loews on Poydras, across from the W Hotel on Poydras; another favorite. Another good hotel is the Marriot Convention Center. It's newer, a little further from Canal and bourbon, but worth the walk. oh yes, also there were a lot of kids(teens) out at night right in front of the hotel. That was a bit of a mess as well! Staying off the strip, like at the W or Loews will help with transportation if you're there for a large event. Canal is usually blocked off at night. You will have to show your room key to the police to get back to your hotel, without having to go around downtown and the risk of getting lost.

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: shabaBelfast
Reviews.Content: Great location, Awful breakfast., felt it was a free for all but with little reward in the end. The staff are pleasant but needs a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on the edge of The French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: bearpawqs
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a nice hotel! I was there for an Infection Control conference for about 6 days. I helped with a pre conference course so the hotel sent up a fruit basket about 5 minutes after I got to my room. On the bed was also a little gift bag that included linen water spray and foam ear plugs. When I saw the ear plugs I cringed but I never had to use them. There was a band every night that played on the corner of Bourbon and Canal directly below the room but it never seemed to interfere with anything. The sounds of the city were not that bad either. I was on the 9th floor so it was not too bad. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The AC would run only when there was a body in the room. I stayed in a place in Ft. Lauderdale FL that did the same thing so you got used to it. The room cooled down really fast so it was not an issue. No shortage of pillows or towels. The iron and ironing board worked fine. Some things I did find odd were that I could not get cold water from the tap. The first water in the morning was cold so I captured that in the glasses and for my water jug. Otherwise there was either the ice machine or the water cooler in the fitness center. They did provide coffee for the morning but not decaf, so I had to request it. My experience with the south is they don't really do decaf! No big deal really. The internet was $10 a day from the room but free in the lobby! What a pain. Since I really did not spend huge amounts of time in the room I only purchased one day out of the 6 I was there. The connection in the hotel was rather slow. The fitness center was one of the best ones I've seen. It was spacious and the equipment actually worked! Not like some where you feel like you are taking your life in your hands using it. The location was great! Right on the edge of The French Quarter. Easy access to the Quarter and easy access to trollies and shopping. The shipping office also was available to guests to ship stuff home so I did not have to lug it all with me on the plane. The concierge was also very helpful and knowledgeable. Was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in first class location”
Reviews.Author: UKavalon
Reviews.Content: Always a fan of Crowne Plaza hotels, I booked this stay despite some recent negative reviews. Although this was my 5th visit to New Orleans since 1999, it was my first time at this hotel. Far beyond my expectations!
