Without exception, the staff were all very friendly, helpful and professional . Althought there was no window in our room (!) (apart from a small skylight) this turned out to be a godsend, dampening the noise from Bourbon Street. No problems with any of the room facilities - a broken ceiling light was fixed within the hour. The quality of this hotel enhanced our week in New Orleans and we felt welcomed every time we walked through the entrance. This hotel is ideally located at the edge of the French Quarter and within easy walking distant of the CBD, casino and other attractions. Streetcars stop right outside. Thank you, Crowne Plaza, for helping this to be an unforgettable vacation for my wife and I. To borrow a phrase from Arnie.... "We'll be back" !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, oyster bar & burbon selection - not much else...”
Reviews.Author: tnt-la
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the corner of Canal and Burbon - walking distance from the French Market, Jackson Square, many good restaurants and shops, as well as the street car that takes you to the Garden District. The staff overall was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were just OK - we stayed in 2215 the week of Jun 21 and found the bathroom to be very small and we could hear everything that was going on in the adjacent rooms as well as the hallway...not a good thing for a hotel on Burbon Street. It seemed that in front of our room was where any room service items ended up - not sure if they were put there by guests or hotel staff. The bathtub in the room above us was leaking, so we could hear the "drip, drip, drip" when they decided to use the shower and the ceiling above our tub was moldy and appeared wet. The pool and deck area was way too small for a hotel this size and was not available to us for the majority of our stay due to a "social networking" conference that had reserved the entire tower where the pool was located. With regards to the "social networking"....one of the couples was given a room in the tower (Canal Tower) when they checked in and were then told 3 days later they would be moved. They needed to have all their belongings packed before we set out for the morning and had to re-check in with the front desk when we returned to get keys to their new room - so much for an advanced warning.... Actually, the hotel did not tell any of us (4 couples) about this conference, and some of the things we saw were most definately for adult eyes only - thank goodness none of us had kids there! The hotel did make arrangements with another property for pool access, but the pool was indoors and heated-not exactly what you're looking for in June in New Orleans. The staff was doing their best to make the most of the situation and helped us as much as they could, but it seemed their hands were tied in over coming the inconveniences we experienced. There are plenty of other good hotels in this general location - I would try one of those before coming back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: FinWatcher
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, great location; this hotel is on the corner of Canal and Bourbon Street. Side entrance is on Bourbon and everything is within walking distance. Cross Canal you can catch the St. Charles streetcar and head to the Garden District, Audubon Park, the zoo and Emmrilâ€™s; on Canal you can catch the Canal streetcar and head toward the river and the casino or toward the lake and the Superdome. You are in the Quarter so everything there is well within walking distance. The rooms are nicely appointed; we were on the fourth floor overlooking Bourbon Street and had no noise issues. This is a clean, upscale but not over priced hotel. Easy accesses to transportation and about a 20 minute taxi ride to the airport. We did not eat in the hotel but the restaurant looked wonderful (we were in town during the Oyster Festival so we did all of our dining out). The staff here is very friendly and efficient. They made up our room twice daily (we often take a late afternoon break from sightseeing before we head out to Bourbon Street and dinner in the Quarter). We simply ask for turndown service and when we return after our evening out, we have fresh towels and the bed is turned down and ready. Easy morning walk to St. Louis Cathedral, Jackson Square and CafÃ© DuMond. Our floor had a hospitality suite with a wonderful array of breakfast foods, coffee and fresh fruit; in the evening we enjoyed complimentary drinks, wine, beer and wonderful appetizers. They do have an outdoor pool and fitness room on the third floor. The pool is small but very nice and clean. You can enjoy views of Bourbon Street from the pool patio (from three floors up). We have stayed at the Marriott on Canal (not as comfortable and location is not quite as good for us) and the Ramada on Bourbon (just a little to noisy in the wee hours of the morning). We loved the Crown Plaza and are looking forwarded to returning here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel. Very pretty but not very nice”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night of partying on bourban. The hotel is pretty on the outside and lobby, but the rooms are very small and he beds were uncomfortable. Requested a king and got 2 twins pushed together that made us sink in the middle. Parkinf was $30 which I thought was a tad steep, there was a dirty room service tray that styed next to our neighbors room from when we checked in until we checked out. Staff was nice and let us checkout at 3pm which was generous. Overall location is great, but the rooms have something to be desired. Then again if you are staying near Bourban do you really have the intention of doing a lot of sleeping?

Reviews.Title: “Astor is ok”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: The Astor Crown Plaza was ok. It is quiet, centrally located, easy to get to from the quarter, beds are nice, and the hotel is clean. Overall, I had a nice time at the Astor and the staff was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: amom1268
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for our anniversary. The hotel location is fabulous. Within a 5-10 walk of the French Quarter. Street car line runs right outside. Our room was lovely and clean. We worried a little bit about noise as it is on Canal and Bourbon but our room (9th floor) was very quiet. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant (Bourbon House) and highly reccommend it. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Pool Had An Ecosystem Growing In It”
Reviews.Author: Lm91682
Reviews.Content: The main reason I chose this hotel is because it had a pool area. The pool was absolutely filthy. There were hair and bugs floating on the surface. The filter was never turned on, which is most likely why it was never clean. The corners of the pool had disgusting algae growth. I spoke with management on 5/26 and again on 5/29. On both occasions they said they would call engineering to fix. Neither time did I see engineering appear and nothing was ever fixed. After waiting at the pool for three hours on 5/29 and seeing nothing was done, I asked for a compensation since I was unable to use the pool due to its unhealthy conditions. I was told the pool is a "free amenity" and no compensation would be offered. The person I spoke with said they sent engineering and security up to the pool. Engineering never went up to the pool and security was sent up to the pool area to ensure no one was using glass cups and said nothing about the condition of the pool, nor did they go near the pool itself to examine it. Not only is this pool a health hazard, the poor customer service I encountered was unacceptable. I have never been treated so poorly and been blatantly lied to at any hotel. I also have never seen such a disgusting pool. These are not conditions I would expect from a "four star" hotel. Not only will I never stay in this location again, but I will never stay in a Crowne Plaza or any of its affiliates and will discourage everyone I know from doing so. And one brief note regarding location, although this hotel is within walking distance to major attractions, the corner of Canal and Bourbon where it is located is home to very unsavory characters at night. A little scary. The location of the W French Quarter is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nickamc80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day of 2009. Excellent Location right in the Quarter Area. Friendly staff,clean rooms & comfortable beds

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KWerner
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of tripadvisor and the comments of management (Don Zimmer) showing they really care what people think. The staff was very friendly and hotel was wonderful! Valet parking. Health club was well equipped. Room was very clean with a very comfortable bed. Location can't be beat. Have been to New Orleans many times and this was the best experience with a hotel there we have ever had! Would strongly recommend and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: thebethe
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 13th floor for two nights over Memorial Day weekend 2010. We were 13 stories over Bourbon and we could still here the drums and partying, so if noise at night bothers you: this hotel will be too close to Bourbon for you. The bed was incredibly hard. However, the room was beautiful and very clean. The Astor's AC units have motion sensors on them, and will shut off if they do not sense motion. This made our first night miserable as we couldn't figure out how to keep the AC on and it got super hot in our room. We asked the front desk about it and they sent someone up to disable the motion sensor without any issue. Valet, front desk and all other staff we encountered were very nice and volunteered tips for the area. Overall it was an okay experience but given the money we paid we will try somewhere else next time-somewhere with comfortable beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: mrpeteb
Reviews.Content: If you are going to New Orleans to see the French Quarter then this is the best place to stay! Easy in and out and right at the end of Bourbon Street! If you walk out the side door of the hotel you are at the start of the party! Be prepared because itâ€™s a safe party that goes all night! With NO clocks to be found you will find you self having a blast till early AM! The staff at the Crown was nice and the room was clean. The room was also was very quite since we were right above the party we did worry but it wasnâ€™t an issue! Make sure to stop into Yo-Momâ€™s for a burger, and Pat Oâ€™Brians for a Hurricane! We will be back next time, Vegas has nothing on the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “It was alright for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: CanelaCandela
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of days and for the price it wasn't that bad. The only problems we had was the view, a view to an empty court, and the pool. The pool was dirty and freezing cold...this is coming from some one who is use to swimming in Lake Michigan. Brrrr!! I love the fact that its at the start of Bourbon St. with a good walk to the end, or even(if you are brave enough) a walk to the French Market. If you are looking for good bargain in the French Quarter this place is it. You'll need it because food and liquor down in the French Quarters are expensive as hell!!

Reviews.Title: “Getting old and tired”
Reviews.Author: pnelson1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed on canal and bourbon. However the front desk staff are surly and the rooms are definitely past their best- the carpet in my room was dirty and sticky, the shower was all chipped and the view was of a nearby wall. Charging for wifi is a bit cheap too. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chlodie
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were down for jazz fest. One of the people on the trip had set up a group rate for our rather large group that was awesome. I was concerned after reading some of the reviews, but the hotel could not have been more wonderful. I had made the reservation and had to adjust the arrival date and add my weekend roommate since she was arriving earlier. She was able to check in early and settle in before I got there. The rooms were large and very comfortable. Everything was clean and the packet of linen spray and eye mask was a really nice touch, although not needed with our crew. As every one else mentioned, you can't get much closer to Bourbon Street. The cleaning staff were always pleasant. On check out day they actually were able to give us a 2PM check out which was perfectly matched to when we had to leave. The woman who checked us out was very pleasant, as were all the restaurant staff. The food was also wonderful. I have not a bad thing to say. I can't even complain about a TV not being a flat screen since I only used it to watch the weather in the AM. If you spend your weekend in New Orleans watching TV than that is a whole other problem! I would absolutely stay there again and I hope to be able to do so again for jazz fest next year! Thanks to all at the hotel! What a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Londoner002
Reviews.Content: My husband and me had to stay for an extra week in New Orleans due to the volcanic ash disruption. Unluckily for us, the last 4 days of our stay coinsided with the start of the Jazz Festival, which made it impossible to find a reasonably prized hotel. We stayed 3 days at the Monteleone which is excellent in every way, but then we had to move to the Astor Crowne Plaza 2 blocks away. As the Astor was $100 more than Monteleone (which I later discovered was because of the festival), we thought it would be at least as good. It wasnÂ´t. The room was cold and charmless with ugly furniture. The toilet got clogged up, the hair dryer broke down and kept cutting out. The only good thing about the room was that the bed was comfortable. The swimming pool is filthy and freezing cold. No music or bar by the pool and it is too close to the street and therefore noisy. By contrast, the Monteleone has a lovely pool area on the roof with good music, a bar and nice staff, so the difference was quite stark. When we first arrived we were put in a double room with separate beds, although we had requested and paid for a queen one through Expedia. We complained and were reluctantly given another, supposedly a quiter one (which I had requested) further from the elevator and the street. When we stepped into the room there was this deafening noise! Right outside the window was an enormous cooling apparatus! I think the cooling system for the whole hotel was right outside our window. Third try, and we finally got a room on the same floor that was somewhat OK, with only a low hum from the cooling element. Really not a very pleasant hotel, although the location in the French quarter was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations, location unbeatable....”
Reviews.Author: TC5020
Reviews.Content: Per previous reviews the location is perfect. Within walking distance of all attractions. Bourbon St., Steam riverboat, Harrahs casino, St. Louis#1, Cafe du Mond. etc.. We walked to the WWII museum. St. Charles street car stop is across the street. Fare is $1.25. There is a little shop right next to the hotel for snax, pop, beer, newspaper etc. There was not a mini fridge or honor bar in my room. My room was clean. Front desk staff fine. Bell hops A++. Nothing really pushed the room over the top to give it a five star. For example no morning paper, no honor bar, still had a tube TV etc.. All in all I would stay here if I ever return. I liked being outside of the French quarter and not being in the middle of the noise. Hotel has a resturant, fitness room and a small outdoor pool. The lobby bar appeared cozy. Enjoy your visit to NOLA, I did!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service and Apathetic Staff”
Reviews.Author: amity_chief
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Astor in New Orleans recently. We were both attending a conference being held at the nearby Hilton hotel. Almost every aspect of our stay in New Orleans was inconvenient and unpleasant, and this hotel was the biggest reason. The first day of the conference happened to be Fat Tuesday, March 16th. While we anticipated some inconveniences since it was the last day of Mardi Gras, we could not imagine the number of issues that we would ultimately have. We arrived at the hotel at 7:30 a.m. (I called ahead and asked the staff if we would have trouble driving to the hotel that morning...one staff member said we needed to arrive before 9 a.m. and another suggested arriving before 8 a.m.). When we pulled up to the hotel, there was nowhere to park and no one waiting out front. We drove a block away and asked a police officer where we were supposed to go. He told us to park in front of the hotel. We followed his advice, but still no valet came out to meet us. And no one came out with a luggage cart to assist us, even though we had a week's worth of luggage for two people. After carrying all of our luggage inside (which required two trips), I finally located an employee who promptly told me I had to move my car. When I asked if we could set our things down and check in, he told me again that the car needed to be moved. He then explained to me I had to park the car 8 blocks away in a reserved lot. I drove the car to the lot and was told that a shuttle would take me back to the hotel. After waiting 15 minutes in the parking lot (my colleague was waiting this entire time in the lobby of the hotel with our luggage since no one offered to help her), the shuttle driver drove me half a block before acting surprised that the road had been closed for a parade. I walked the 8 blocks back to the hotel. During this time, a police officer had been stationed in the lobby of the hotel, and when I entered, she aggressively demanded I show her my "wristband" before entering the hotel. I had no idea what she was talking about, so she told me to get out of the hotel. Luckily, someone else overheard the conversation and asked if I was checking in. When I said I was, I was finally allowed to pass. We were checking in early, so the woman at the desk said our rooms weren't ready. We decided to store our luggage while we waited. Then, I realized that she hadn't even mentioned the wristband that the police officer had demanded I show to enter the hotel. I went back to the desk and asked about the wristbands and she said "Oh, yeah. You'll need those." Isn't this information she should have offered without me having to ask? She went on to aggressively warn us that if we lost the wristband, it would be a $25 charge. So, if we lost our wristbands, we would have to pay $50 to get back into the hotel which we were paying over $200 per night to stay at? Needless to say, we immediately felt very welcome at the hotel. That entire day, everyone at the hotel seemed to have an attitude of "It's Mardi Gras, you have to fend for yourselves." First of all, I don't think that attitude is appropriate at all when people are paying a lot of money to stay at a nice hotel and expect convenience and a basic level of service. We were still guests of the hotel, and we shouldn't have been treated like random people walking in off the street. Furthermore, we weren't even there for Mardi Gras! No one bothered to ask if we were in town on business or for another purpose - it was just assumed that we were there to party and have a good time (and therefore shouldn't care about service). I wouldn't be concerned about the attitude of the hotel staff that day if it weren't for the fact that our problems continued throughout the rest of our stay. One day we had to call and request housekeeping clean our room (at 6 p.m.) because they never showed up. The shower head in our shower did not function properly and would shut off in the middle of taking a shower. And nearly every interaction with hotel staff felt like we were inconveniencing them. The "customer feedback" survey delivered to our room on the final day was the last straw. It threatened a charge of $200 if you smoked in a non-smoking room (I take it the hotel's business model is based on threatening people with fines) and then it asked us not to give a negative review based on a single interaction with hotel staff. In my opinion, had only one of these episodes happened, we would have a right to be dissatisfied (despite what the customer survey suggests). Lucky for us, we had MULTIPLE interactions and inconveniences which made the trip one of the worst we have ever taken, and this hotel one of the worst we have ever stayed in. To top it all off, I sent our concerns to the corporate headquarters after our stay. They sent us a form letter email and forwarded our feedback to the hotel management. And as a gesture of a goodwill, enrolled us in their frequent visitor program and gave us some points (not even enough for a one night stay in their cheapest properties). And we never heard from the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Reet
Reviews.Content: It's all about the location! Walk to everything. After the reviews here, I was not sure what to expect, but I was pleased overall. We attended a conference in this hotel, and those facilities were just fine. Rooms were lovely, comfy beds, and very clean. Elevators were readily available even when it got crowded during "French Quarter Festival" weekend. We rented a car one day, and parking was costly (as others have said) not to mention no place to load/unload for valet or even in & out of a cab. There is no free wifi in the room, but we were happy to find it free in the small business center. With only 3 pc's in the center there was often a wait. We also found free wifi in the lobby, however. I paid for wifi a couple of days in the room, and had technical issues. This was eventually resolved with a phone call downstairs and a patch through to India for technical assistance! In all, a nice hotel. Not much they can do about parking issues. But.....if they could just add free wifi in the room, a mini fridge, and maybe a free donut for breakfast.....it would be PERFECTION!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location,very small”
Reviews.Author: Fiaropinion
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel in April of 2010 for a week attending a conference. The hotel is very clean, apparently it is an older hotel that has been remodeled and taken over by Crowne Plaza. Itâ€™s in a great location at the corner of Bourbon and Canal, so if you are in the party mode this is the perfect place. Couple of minor issues the rooms are a little small 12 x 14, a small bath 9 x 5, and foyer of 6 x 6. HVAC did not work so I called the maintenance dept and they taught me how to bypass it. The safe did not work (dead battery) they changed it. The remote for the TV did not work. The toilet over flowed (I wondered why there were plumbing snake scratches all over the porcelain) The TV was really old and fuzzy (see pictures) The hair dryer did not work (had to keep resetting in every minute) When we were in the conference and released for lunch, we all headed for the elevators so with that many people we elected to take the stairwell (bad idea, they are all locked) not good if the building caught on fire

Reviews.Title: “4 Star price for Cheap Motel service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: bdhiley
Reviews.Content: Booked a room in January. Reserved either a King bed room or a two Queen bed room. When I arrived, the receptionist asked me if I wanted the one bed or two. I said just the King, and I'd like a room with a view please. The room, which smelled like smoke, had only one queen with a view of a brick wall and an intake vent. When I called the front desk to inquire about the mix up, she informed me that "No sir, I said one bed or two, there are no more Kings". Then she said "we have no rooms with views". I said that I booked this room in JANUARY! "Sorry sir" was the response. The room had no mini bar or fridge, the TV is too low to view in bed, the TV is about 10 years old (11 million dollar renovation my (--)) and the picture was terrible. The website says "Free Internet". (--) It's free if you go down to the business center, but WiFi will cost you 9.95 per day. Only one small dresser that holds up the TV and two of the drawers were broken and the handle was being held on by only one of it's screws, like something you'd see in a Motel 6! And the valet parking is not only a joke, it's borderline fraud! And it was only 31.60 PER DAY! The least amount of time I had to wait for my car was 20 minutes. I was, however, allowed to watch the valet guys to slap hands and haw haw with their buddies walking down Canal St while my family and I went unaddressed for 25 minutes only to wait ANOTHER 20 minutes to get my car AFTER I made the third inquiry about where my car was. But at least they added about 55 miles to park it that day and I just LOVED the rap music station they switched my radio to. When I informed the clerk upon check out, she offered her condolences by saying "well we were over booked and very busy for French Quarter fest this weekend". NO EXCUSE! You know it's coming and you staff accordingly! The Bar was very nice but a cocktail will put you back a mere 9.25! For a tiny bucket drink. They advertise 4 star quality but I call Bull $hit on that one. I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and I was giving it a another chance thinking I may have been too critical about my stay the first time. I couldn't keep my opinion to myself this time.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: fstop666
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Crowne Plaza and was pleased. The location is excellent and the room was quite comfortable although the climate system was hard to figure out. The only major complaint was no free wi-fi - had to use the business center and no exhaust fan in the toilet. That is something that really needs to be looked at along with maybe a light over the shower. We didn't eat at the restaurant but was told it was good. The lounge could have stayed open later to provide respite from the noise and drunks of Bourbon Street. The concierge was very helpful whenever we needed information.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Trippy84
Reviews.Content: Cons: We chose this hotel based on the reviews and the price. We were so disappointed, (especially after staying at the Ritz-Carlton a block away a few weeks ago for only $30 more.) They tried to pass off queen beds as kings. (We were sent to two tiny rooms with a single queen in each before deciding to give up on the king and ask for two queens in order to have a larger room.) The beds were standard spring mattresses without pillow tops. There was not a minibar or fridge in the room. The TV was old, had a small screen, and an unclear picture on most channels. Someone should have warned us. Pros: Location! It is on the corner of Canal and Bourbon, which is walking distance to Harrah's and anything in the French Quarter. Also, the hotel restaurant is Dickie Brennan's Bourbon House, which is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very Picky Patrons who really enjoyed The Astor Crown Plaza”
Reviews.Author: NARGEE
Reviews.Content: We visited the Astor Crown Plaza as a little getaway for our anniversery. The Staff was very friendly. Arionne was a pleasure! She was expedient, professional and willing to answer any questions about the hotel and/or city. This hotel is located on Canal and Bourbon. Main entrance is on Canal and a second entrance on Bourbon that is locked late in the evening. My husband and I are not "drinkers"...however, we had a great time nonetheless. The Staff at The Astor are worth speaking about. I can tell they work hard to be patient with their Patrons. I imagine they have to be patient as I saw a very patient employee trying to convince to patrons (who had obviously been drinking) that their room had not changed while they were out on Bourbon Street. No continental breakfast etc - however with so many great places to dine within walking distance - who wants a continental breakfast?? The earplugs, eyemask and lavender bed spray made us say "hmmmmmmm" but we understood the courtesy when the night fell upon the city. Bourbon Street can get pretty loud. The great location outweighed any inconvenience of the noise. Try out the Astor...you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bengali2006
Reviews.Content: Great experience--perfect location on Burbon and Canal Street. Stayed for a week no complaints looks like it was newly renovated and everything worked like a charm. Will def stay here next time. Good hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, price and service!”
Reviews.Author: fgt3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in February 2009 and it was perfect. Within 2 minutes you were experiencing Bourbon Street right around the corner and had to walk only a few blocks through the fantastic French Quarter to the many shops and restaurants in the soul of the city. My wife and I fell in love with this city...it is unlike any other I have visited and we are already planning our return trip to enjoy it during vacation. The hotel is in an excellent location to explore and experince New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “ellegant”
Reviews.Author: thinla
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at this hotel, after reading some reviews i was a bit worried. if someone has anything bad to say about this hotel there must be extenuating circumstances because it was fantastic. i am a stickler for little things and from the valets to the bellman to the to the hotel registration attendant, they treated us like royalty. the room was clean and updated, the lobby was gorgeous, the restaurant in the hotel has great food. don't hesitate to go to this hotel, its also in the middle of everything. we didn't have any problems with noise but the attendant said he was giving us a upper room so we would not be bothered in case of noise. thank you crown plaza

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever Mardi Gras 2010”
Reviews.Author: Precious_Ice_Cream
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Madi Gras 2010 and we had the best spot in the house! We could watch the parade from our room. Sean Payton was at the hotel and we saw the NFL Superbowl trophy this was Awesome! As a native N'awlins born I was humbled to watch the enjoyment and expericence my children received as they relished in their "first" experience of Mardi Gras (that they could remember) and the wonderful staff and guests made all the difference at the Crowne Plaza. THE HOTEL STAFF was the BEST!! I would like to especially THANK Ida W. she is an EXCELLENT host, people person, professional, and she is an ABOVE & BEYOND employee!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Marc-AndreB
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with warm rooms. Very well located to enjoy Mardi Gras (be ready for the noise though). But the quality of service is poor. A janitor entered my colleague's room at 2 am, and the only thing the manager could do is cynical comments. My colleague freaked out. Heating was not working properly. And it seems that finding solutions to problems are not their best skills.

Reviews.Title: “They lose it in the details”
Reviews.Author: ergtraveler
Reviews.Content: Im still currently staying here, and using the time I should be at my meeting, but am waiting for them to bring me a working hair dryer to leave this review. Upon check-in, I had to call down for a remote control because my room didn't have one. When I called, i realized that my phone didn't work. I've asked 3 days in a row for a new phone - nada! Yesterday it took me 15 minutes to get the hair dryer to work. Today it is completely shot. I'm missing an important meeting right now because I've been waiting 15 minutes so far for a working dryer. My room service bill today had a DELIVERY charge. Is there any other way to receive room service? This morning, it took me an hour to get the wi-fi to work in my room ($10 a day!). I kept calling down on my one working phone (that is not near the computer desk) and they kept transferring me to nowhere. Can't wait to see what tomorrow brings. Wish I could check out and go join my colleagues at the hilton. They have no complaints....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a perfect location, but slow service and too many things wrong”
Reviews.Author: alexgav
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for Mardi Gras celebration. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect, both for Mardi Gras and in general. It is right on Bourbon and Canal intersection. So you can go exploring Bourbon, or jump on a streetcar on Canal or St Charles, or watch Mardi Gras parades right in front of the hotel. We also got lucky with our room. It was facing Canal Street, so we could actually watch parades from our room. We did watch two parades right from the room, which was pretty cool and a different experience then watching them from the street. They also have a shared balcony on the second floor that they opened up during Mardi Gras so people good watch parades and catch beads from there. The room was clean and well-appointed. The furniture was nice, and so were beds. I would've easily given this hotel 4.0 or even 5.0, but there were entirely too many things that went wrong, the service was very slow, and the price was high. First of all, our toilet backed up as soon as we checked in and used it for the first time. It took two calls and over an hour for someone to come up to fix that. Second, the coffee maker in the room was shorting the circuit. Again, it took two calls and almost two hours to get that fixed. Third, the maid was very inattentive. E.g., she forgot to give us toilet paper one of the days. Fourth, the room keys were a nightware. You had to insert and remove them a few times before they would finally work and the door would open. The make-up mirror in the bathroom was about to fall off. The shower fixtures were missing (non-essential) pieces One of two phones in the room was broken. I'd say for 3.5-star place that charges $250/night (admittedly during Mardgi Gras), the state of the room and the slowness of response it unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: pmarti
Reviews.Content: Great French Quarter location, walked everywhere. Easy check-in and check-out, no surprises on our bill. Hotel staff EXTREMELY friendly and eager to supply every need. Will definitely return to this hotel on future visits to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: GinneryRow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel During Marde Gras, Check in went smooth on Friday afternoon. Room was on the 12th floor. Room was clean and noise from below was no issue. That night we had friends from the Ritz come over to meet in the lounge, we were told no one but a guest of the Astor was allowed in. We then went to the Ritz which did not have that issue nor did the Hotel Montleone or the Roosevelt. On Staurday we attempted to get our car during a break in the parades, we were told the valet was to busy and were sent eight city block to get our vehicle by foot. On Sunday my arm band that was issued had fell off. I was refused entry into the hotel, even though I had my room key and ID. After 30 minutes I was told I could reenter upon paying a $25.00 armband fee. Upon checking out sunday we were told they were unable to give us a detailed bill, they would mail it. (cant wait to see how that goes). We then attempted to get our car, after a hour wait Mario the valet manager advised they could not find our vehicle. I was told I could go inside and see Frank the desk manager. I attempted to speake with Frank, however, the fronk desk girl stated the Hotel had nothing to do with the valet service, and if they could not find my car to contact New Orleans Police. After two hours and 22 minutes of standing out front with our luggage our car was located. We had friends at the Roosevelt, the Ritz, the Marriot, and Hotel Montleone. All the other hotels were just as convenient, staff was wonderful, rooms were the same price or a little cheaper. I would not Reccomend this hotel, there are to many others that know what customer service is. This hotel is way below average compared to what they say they offer.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bouche4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here many times in the last 6 years. After hurricane Katrina the hotel became trashed,the emplayees, managment changed and the hotel became terrible to stay at. In the last couple years new managment and a million dollar remodle made this amazing again. There is a marketing manager Don Zimmer that goes above and beyond to make sure you have a great stay. We met him years ago and have become friends. He makes sure we are always taken care of. Now all the staff and the ajoyning restaraunt are awesome! Even the little bar there in the lobby. We had a plesent stay for the superbowl and they made sure to put extra seats, make sure staff took well care of guest with food and drinks. It was a blast! This hotel is clean, located perfect in the city, good value, great food and drinks, and safe. If you need anything all you need to do is ask, if you have any problems, they will make sure to fix it. Customer service is rare now a day but you are number one here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: tishsilva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and in a perfect location! We parked our car when we checked in and did not need it again until check out!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HEREâ€Ž”
Reviews.Author: rspiehler11111
Reviews.Content: If I could give this a negative 10 star hotel I would. I was born and raised in New Orleans but am now a resident of Nashville,Tn. We made reservations for a suite here on Super Bowl night to watch the game with friends and family and to celebrate with the city. We reserved the hotel online, got a confirmation #, called to dbl check the room was available, which it was, just to lose our room an hr before the game. We prechecked in at 10am that Sunday and they said our room would be ready at 4pm which was fine for us. When we arrived back at our hotel at 4pm they said our room was no longer available. Why? Not because we our reservation wasn't valid, not because there was a mistake with the online site, but because these people extended the stay of the people who had the room the night before us. This means they made a blantant decision to give away our room, our RESERVED ROOM, with no explantion of how they had the right to do it. To top it off, they said the "best" they could do for us was to give us a regular room for a $100 off the price. Later we found out that if a reservation is not honored that a free night stay is MANDATORY. So, if you want a hotel that you know will be loyal to your reservation and will take care of you, this is not the place. God Bless the Clarion Inn on Canal that took care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Not during mardi GRAS”
Reviews.Author: Dixiebiker
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a horrible trip to the Astor. Room was booked thru American Express travel, got a room that motel six would be ashamed of. If you call the local number [--] the staff is very rude. Room was dirty and took hours to get cleaned. Do not let the valet park your car. Someone put an additional 75 miles on our vehicle. Stay elsewhere. Never could get the manager to call me back.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book this hotel, they are liars!!”
Reviews.Author: jrudolph317
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite in this hotel for a major event in the City. Called and confirmed with the main office and then with the local hotel that they actually had suites available. Was assured that they did. Was assured again when I attempted to check in early that I had a suite, but it was not clean and I would not be allowed to check in until 4:00. Upon returning to the hotel at 4:00, was told there were no suites available. Upon standing in a long line of other customers who had been sold suites, was told that ALL the guests in suites had extended their stay - YEAH RIGHT! They insisted there was nothing they could do and they would give me a REGULAR room for $100 less than the suite price! More than DOUBLE what all my other friends were paying. The could not care less about how much they inconvenienced everyone and were only out to stick it to people and sell rooms at an very increased rate!

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine a better hotel in such a location”
Reviews.Author: JimGoes
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, we were offered a room on the 4th floor premier level that was o.k., but had no view and came with a king bed which did not work as I was traveling with my college dorm roommate from 20 years ago. The very gracious staff gave us another double queen room on the 11th floor on the backside of the hotel overlooking the French Quarter. Perfect. Really perfect. Yes, you could hear the sounds of the 4 am party below, but for me I never had to use the supplied earplugs or eyemask, as the sound insulation from the windows was excellent and the thick curtains drowned out the ambient festive light of the street below, obviously part of the recent hotel renovation improvements. The hotel is elegant yet the lobby was small in scale compared to bigger city haunts like NY and Chicago, but it more than makes up for this in the unique ambience and unbelievably easy access to a world of sensations literally at your doorstep. Dickie Brennans is right there, as is Acme Oyster House (right under our window), Arneuds is just up the street, and all the others are within easy walking distance. I read a lot before I went to New Orleans, but I have to say that despite all I read I was really taken aback by the ease of use here (think Big Easy?, maybe I did not get this connection), but it seems French Quarter location is key. Location is everything, and this hotel has it plus all the amenities of a big city hotel. The concierge was excellent and found me a personal and private trip with "Big E" who showed me the Katrina devastation from many perspectives, personal, engineering, economic and social. The workout facilities were very good, offering a good combination of cardio equipment and weights. The pool was small and underused given time of year, but I can imagine that in hot weather the pool despite its size is hopping. This hotel was not my first choice but I ended up a very surprised and happy customer looking forward to a return. Tripadvisor local expert

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL, PREFECT LOCATION, PHENOMINAL STAFF, Could not have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandybeech
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the location is ideal, and the staff was extremely gracious. Can walk right out the hotel and step onto Bourbon Street. We were pleasently surprised at the ease of unloading our luggage and checking in. The valet service went above and beyond to ensure we were out of the vehicle and our luggage loaded up in just a few minutes. The check-in process was a breeze and Stephanie ensured that we were pleased with everything and even gave us some FREE DRINK tickets. Our rooms were good size and the beds were very comfortable. The noise from Bourbon was not as bad as I was expecting and really quited down after midnight. There is a CVS and a Walgreens across the street in case you forget anything. We were staying the night before getting on the Carnival Triumph cruise ship. We were is a slight hurry when we checked out. I called for a bellman to help with luggage and he arrived within 5 minutes. We checked out and went outside to wait for valet to bring the SUV around. The Valet had our SUV around and had us completely loaded up and ready to head to the cruise ship in under 10 minutes. I stay in hotels quite often for work and pleasure, I can honestly say that this hotel is a great value for the location. If you want to stay on Bourbon Street but want a nice modern hotel, the Crowne Plaza should be your choice. Great Experience for us and also for the couple that was traveling with us. We will DEFINITELY be back to New Orleans and the Crowne Plaza Hotel Astor will be our only hotel choice. No more searching around on all the websites, We have found our hotel of choice in New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing could have been better...nothing!”
Reviews.Author: ESOL
Reviews.Content: My husband, another couple and I spent 5 days at this hotel over Christmas. We're retired and almost retired but love to have fun in comfortable surroundings. This was the place to be! From the moment we arrived, we felt welcome and like special guests. Our 2 rooms were connected by a living room. How great is that!? On the concierge floor we had a nice relaxing breakfast and cocktails with conversation and nibbles in the evening. Beginning with the reservation process, through check in to the cleaning team, the valets and the hospitality crew, we were very impressed with the top notch service always with a smile. The front desk answered every question, and even found us a doctor! The restaurant and bar had amazing food and drinks. Try the oysters Rockefeller. Acme Oyster House is next door and Dickie Brennans next to Acme. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. We requested turn down service. Toiletries were plentiful and quite nice. We had a fabulous time and will stay there again and again. Loved it! The folks working here WANT you to have a good time and go out of their way to make that happen!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liv99
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, but I expected a much better hotel. The room was just OK: on the sixth floor, average size, regular TV, with an awful view to the lower roof and not much light coming through the window. The staff was mostly friendly, but could not get us the room we requested, on a higher floor. Not many amenities; wi fi not free of charge; no complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaJoyW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Crowne Plaza in the past and had an excellent time, this time around wasn't as nice!. The bellhops, front door men were excellent , very pleasant any time of the day - however, that's is where the good customer service ended.The restaurant had amazing food, however, having to walk through the restaurant to get to the hostess, is nuts. Getting the room made up was a problem - could have been because of staffing due to Christmas, I shouldn't have to call to ask to have it done! The fire alarm sounded, not once, twice, but three times one night, each time with an announcement that it was a false alarm and go back to what we were doing - sleeping! There were a couple of "testy" front desk clerks, maybe didn't want to work through the holiday - but I just dished it back! Internet connection was pricey. After this experience, I wouldn't stay there again, I'll stay at another hotel, there are lots in the area that I haven't tried. (This was not my first trip to New Orleans I would only recommend this hotel for it's great location!

Reviews.Title: “Just all right....”
Reviews.Author: jadelina_1
Reviews.Content: The Astor Crowne Plaza was just ok. The rooms were clean. The restaurant was good, but very expensive. Parking was $31.50/per night. No free internet. The staff, namely the lady in charge of the housekeeping, was less than pleasent. She dropped by the room three times to ask if we wanted room service. We were trying to sleep! The book in the room said check out is at 12:00 however she insisted that it was at 11:00. We love Crowne Plaza's but were a bit disappointed with this one. We'll look around a bit more before staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: zippyland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six night stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza. The hotel was great -- excellent location right on the corner of Bourbon and Canal. Streetcar, taxis, buses -- all very accessible. The service was good -- we arrived from the airport at noon, and were allowed to check-in right away. Housekeeping was thorough and most of the staff were very friendly. The room itself was on the small side, but the king bed was excellent, and on the 11th floor we experienced no street noise and no disturbances from our neighbors. The amenities were excellent -- the gym had plenty of equipment and the pool looked nice (though it was too cold for swimming in an outdoor pool while we were there). The attached restaurant was fantastic. They have a happy hour where you can get a half dozen oysters on the half-shell for $6, and you can watch your oysters get shucked right before your eyes. The service at the restaurant was spectacular! A few minor flaws: TV reception was fairly lame -- I wasn't so concerned with the non-flat screen as some people have noted, but several channels were fuzzy, and the selection of channels was limited (no Comedy Channel or HGTV). But we didn't come to New Orleans to watch cable TV, so this was minor. The bathroom had one issue -- the tub wouldn't hold water for a bath, so if baths are important to you -- check this when you check in. The biggest room flaw was no min-fridge. I was really surprised by this -- we had to fill up the sink with ice to keep our soda and beer cold. Overall, we were very satisfied with the Astor Crowne Plaza and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MississippiGumbo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many French Quarter hotels when visiting New Orleans, but the combination of location, friendly staff and great beds makes this our favorite choice. Right on Bourbon St and a short walk to Harrah's & the rest of the French Quarter, this is the hotel we recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible management and service...beware of Pamela Green”
Reviews.Author: GLOBALTRAVELER2002
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel as a stopover on a driving trip. First, there was an issue with the food. The next morning, the blowdryer was broken. The following is an excerpt from a letter that I have written (during my stay) to the CEO and Board of Directors for this hotel: "At this point, everything concerning the food issues, the additional night, and other prior issues had already been addressed and rectified. However, another manager, Pamela Green, subsequently called the room three times asking for information that was given the night before. Further, she began to ask us about the situation that had previously been rectified about 30 minutes earlier. Her call and reaction appeared to be entirely in response to our complaining about the food. She then stated that we seemed to be having issues and wanted to know if we had any additional complaints. We told her that the issues had been rectified, but the most recent concern stemmed from the hotel not having the required bread to fill the room service orders. Again, this fact was disclosed to us after my friend had placed the order and returned to the room. Ms. Green stated that she was not aware of the issue, which would lead a reasonable mind to believe that she had neglected to collect all of the facts prior to the first call. My friend proceeded to re-explain everything that had been previously resolved to Ms. Green. Ms. Green proceeded to call back two more times (three times total) in what amounted to what we felt was blatant harassment asking for information concerning the room that had already been verified. After the third call, during our dinner, I went down to speak with Ms. Green. Her demeanor and tone were both condescending and rude. She continued to press that she was missing information and needed it immediately. Again, this information had been provided previously, and it was about 7 p.m. at this point. If this had been any sort of issue, then I am more than confident that the hotel would have asked for it earlier in the day. I asked her why she kept calling the room (3 times), and she continued to deny that she was doing so. She further stated that she contacted an employee at home to verify information, and it was inaccurate. I asked her for the employeeâ€™s name to include in this letter, and she refused. Ms. Green stated that no one deals with anyone but her. She told me that they had looked at security cameras, which was completely odd given the fact that we were complaining about food. Ms. Greenâ€™s statements on the security camera implied that we were now being accused of criminal activity. I told her that I would be writing to the CEO and Board of Directors for this hotel. She then proceeded to tell me that she was changing the rate on the room, and that was the end of the discussion. I told her that she must follow hotel protocol and not her own. I further proceeded to tell her that she was not authorized to charge my card for any additional charges on the card used for the deposit at check-in that were not part of the agreed rate and service charges (see attachment). When checking into a hotel, one is agreeing a specified rate upon check-in, not what a manager feels they may charge to make a point. I asked for Ms. Greenâ€™s business card, and she stated that she did not have any. I have never heard of a hotel manager not having business cards." This morning, the radio is not working, and the Dream Machine CD is broken. I cannot win, and I will NEVER return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Astor”
Reviews.Author: TeaEarleGreyHot
Reviews.Content: I had no trouble with the valet parking; they took care of the car and delivered it on time when requested. Lobby was well-decorated. I was very pleased with my room, which was spacious, well-appointed, and clean. The bathroom was similarly satisfactory. (I wasn't in NewOrleans to watch TV, so the lack of flat-panel TV didn't bother me in the slightest.) Check-in was pleasant, bellhop was friendly and efficient, housekeeping good, bedding comfortable, climate control flawless, and my room on the 7th floor near Bourbon street was quiet for all three nights. I did suffer from the next-door guest's alarm clock, however, from 6:30-7:30AM, but I guess some people are into "snoozing" their last hour. I would definitely return to the Astor, and found it to be comparable to other Crown Plazas that I've stayed at. Too bad that they charge for wireless internet in the guest rooms; it's free in the lobby. For what it's worth, they DO provide drapery-clips and eyemasks to help keep the morning light out, and ear-plugs for those who might have noise issues. Thanks to the desk clerk for directing us to a great restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “A Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hendrixallen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here mid December 09 for 5 nights. The hotel was a former department store, so the rooms/suites have a weird layout. We had a one bedroom suite and you walk into the living room but there are no windows, the bedroom at the back has windows on two walls, with a view onto Bourbon Street. This particular suite is VERY NOISY up till 2am, pounding drums are heard late into the night. In my opinion this should be a Holiday Inn and receive only 3 stars, as it DEFINITELY is not a 4 star property. The furniture is cheap, drapes almost falling off the window, uncomfortable beds, basically a dump in my opinion. Service was acceptable, but certainly not above and beyond. I would NOT stay here again if you paid me

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at a great hotel in the New Orleans French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: LafayetteBoy
Reviews.Content: I visit New Orleans a few times a year with family and friends and we started staying at the Astor Crowne Plaza in the French Quarter on a regular basis this year. There is no better hotel to stay at and the location is centralized so whether you are visiting Bourbon Street or heading to the Superdome or going uptown....all the action is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Astor Delight!”
Reviews.Author: travelermia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in September '09. Check in on a busy Saturday was smooth and efficient. Front desk staff very friendly and professional. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Excellent location on Canal and Bourbon. As a Priority Club member was upgraded to executive level floor with lots of wonderful and free snaks and beverages in the dining room. Staff there very friendly and engaging too. The room was brand new and very clean with a heavenly bed and nice pillows and linens. I did not give this property 5 stars because that's reserved for the top luxury hotels around the world which usually cost at least twice/three times what I paid here. Since I did not drive, I cannot comment on the parking challenges some people apparently experienced here. However, I think that the parking issues compelled them to say negative things about other aspects of the hotel which I found not to be true. Overall, this is a very fine hotel and in March 2010 when I return to NOLA I definitely plan to stay here again. When you compare the hotel to others in the area, you cannot beat it for its location,and value!

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect; hotel is very good”
Reviews.Author: artemesiaWyoming
Reviews.Content: You are on the corner of Bourbon and Canal. Riverwalk is a few blocks away, and all the French Quarter is at your doorstep. The streetcar to the Garden District is one block. The staff was very accommodating. They gave us an extended check-out without batting an eye. Room service was excellent. The only caution I would offer would be with the concierge service. Lee W. booked three different tours for me and went above and beyond to make sure everything went well. Dan Holmes, Jr., the executive concierge, was to have booked a swamp tour for my friends and me, and although he took our deposit, failed to book the tour. He had a line of customers at the time and was trying to do too many things at once. Our deposit was refunded, but we were very disappointed to not to be able to take the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but ......”
Reviews.Author: scubababe50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very nice romantic weekend at the Astor Crown Plaza. Great room with a view of Burbon Street. The city is fantastic, we had great dinners at Curvee and Commanders Palace. My big and only problem with the Astor is the parking situation. Checking out and getting our car took over an hour and a hotel shuttle bus ride with all of our luggage to the parking garage to retrive the car ourselves. Paying $32. per night for parking, I would think that it should have been a quicker more customer friendly process. There are plenty of great hotels in the French Quarter, next visit, I think we will try someplace else that might give us a better end to a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good times during Halloween weekend.”
Reviews.Author: jpinsd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 10/30-11/4. Reserved my room through 1800hotels.com for less than $100 a night taxes included. The location was great and the staff was excellent. The hotel was very nice and convenient to everything. When we first arrived the air conditioning was not working in the room, but it was fixed by the time we got back from having some drinks on Bourbon St. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 Stars ON A PERFECT DAY! Think Twice Before Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: bmw745ion19s
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza in New Orleans. I have normally had good luck at Crowne Plazas for having good quality for the money. I was not expecting the Ritz Carlton but the CP was purely a stop over for the night on a road trip. I was really disappointed and wish I would have spent a little more to stay at the Windsor Court for a much better time! First of all check in took FOREVER and most of the agents didnt seem to care or acknowledge any guest in a personal manner. Next, the property overall while being historic was dirty and dingy, definitely not well kept. My biggest complaint was the amount of classless guests in the hotel and managements disregard of their behavior. Lots of people walking through the lobby with cases of beer, large bottles of alcohol drinking straight from them etc. This was not Mardi Gras and this was a weekday at 2PM. You would think the management would not want these activities in the main public spaces of the hotels. As well I heard several people complain during my stay at the hotel of damage or items missing from their car. Some of them very irate and unhappy. When its more then 1 guest you can usually figure out its not an isolated incident. Thank God mine was ok! I definitely would not return to the Crowne Plaza at any price, even if I was a drunk off Bourbon street! I think this is a 2-Star hotel at best!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Yndi25
Reviews.Content: the hotel is beautiful, right around the corner from Bourbon street. a couple of bumps, there was a few items in the room (hair dryer, iron, telephone between beds) did not work. they replaced them all except the phone (another one is in the room) promptly. otherwise, it was a lovely experience, the staff was great, housekeepers were nice and gave us extra items that we requested! wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel for families..or anyone who wants to actually sleep!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlArizona
Reviews.Content: Unless you are in New Orleans to party hearty and stay up all nite, this not the hotel to stay in. Being so close to Burbon Street (there is an exit right on to Burbon from the hotel), it tends to attract college age/hearty partiers, who come back to the hotel very early morning, intoxicated and LOUD! Every nite starting at around 2:30 or so and not ending till about 5 a.m. we'd have people yelling in the hallways, banging on all the doors, laughing, running up and down the hallways, slamming doors. IT WAS AWFUL. And by the time security would come up, they'd all be in their rooms. While the hotel itself is ok, the housekeeping is awful-my teenagers do a better job cleaning the bathroom! The rooms are decent size, but the beds are hard as a rock, making it difficult to sleep (as if it wasn't hard enough already). It was not worth the money paid...there are more reasonable hotels closer to the river - further away from the action of Burbon Street. The only good thing about the hotel was Danielle at the front desk who was extremely helpful every time we had a question, even calling a restaurant to find out information for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent...”
Reviews.Author: isnugglez
Reviews.Content: The location was great near by bourbon street, the shopping plaza and the casino. The bell boys were extremely nice and helpful. Didn't have any problems with the AC. Was bothered that the covers over had a stain on it... Felt that they could have done a better job with the cleaning. Even the towels looked slightly yellowish. If I was going to visit New Orleans again, I would at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are very uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: storrmywx
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights for this stay. The downstairs is fairly nice looking, you get the impression that your room will be nice. The rooms are just average, no refrigerator, no microwave, the water pressure in the shower is up and down. You cannot cool the room to where you want it. The first night I had such a terrible night sleep because the bed was extremely hard. I asked to move to another room the next morning. I was moved a few floors up to a room that looked just like the first one except there was a nasty spill ? on the bathroom floor. And the bed was just as hard as the first one. I suppose these beds will never wear out, I imagine that was their motive for filling the hotel with very hard beds. I called early to get my vehicle so I wouldn't have to wait so long for it and was told I had to go down and ask for it in person and wait ? Valet parking is too expensive at 31.00 a night plus tips. I realized that I had forgotten my tietac in the room after I left, but it was gone when I called about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Small Issues Need To Be Addressed”
Reviews.Author: tuffinuf
Reviews.Content: We originally booked 3 nights, but stayed an extra night during the Southern Decadence Festival on Labor Day weekend. When we arrived, the bellhop was extremely helpfull with our bags. He made a friendly joke asking if we were moving in. After reserving the room I called the hotel to request a king bed. At the Check In Desk, I specified again that I wanted a kind bed. When we got to our room, there were 2 queen beds. The bellhop immediatly called the front desk and advised of the problem. He let them know that he had another room with a king available and could fix the problem. He took us to the room and assisted us with our luggage and even went down to get new key cards and brought them back up to us. Very impressive that a bellhop could rectify the issue. The new room was on a higher floor and even had a better view straight down Bourbon St. and of the city. I have read other reviews that complained of noise from Bourbon St. From our room on the 10th floor, if I put my ear up to the window I could hear the music. But who in their right mind sleeps with their head to the window. From my bed, I heard nothing of the outside noise but it was the 10th floor. If this is an issue for you, I suggest you get a room as high as you can or get another hotel that IS NOT on Bourbon St. They do supply you with earplugs though and not as an insult. This is a commonly known fact, BOURBON ST = PARTY. USE YOUR COMMOM SENSE. The bed and bedding was extremely comfortable, especially the pillows. There was plenty of space with a cozy chair and ottoman. The room was cleaned completely and quickly everyday. The bathroom was not too spacious but still nice and the shower had a curved shower rod. Even though we brought our on soap and shampoo they supplied upscale soap, shampoo and lotion. We like it to be COLD in our house and the A/C performed waaaay better than we ever expected. It actually got too cold on the setting we put it on and had to adjust it. There was a safe in the room. Plenty of room in the closet. There was a full length mirror. The room attendant, bellhop, front desk attendants and the valets(with the exception of one valet) was very nice and helpful. They had a very nice looking bar/restaraunt, although we didn't use it. This hotel had a great location. The streetcars/trollies stop right in front on Canal St. There are several restaraunts of many types that are within walking distance. Now for the small issues. They offered free high speed internet but only in their business center. Access was available in the room for a $9.95 charge. The water pressure in the shower was good but somtimes fluctuated. On the first night, the fire alarm went off for 3 seconds MAX at 3am. Luckily, we just got in from a night of partying. The pool was a little small and was outside but was not heated. The water was a little cold and we did not get in. It also closed at 9pm and was locked. There was no spa tub. Our key card stopped working once but we went to the front desk and it was quickly reprogramed. There was no fridge or microwave in the room. The tube tv was ok but not flat screen or HDTV. One morning, the room attendant woke us up early when we placed the do not disturb sign on the door. However in her defence, the sign did fall off the door handle and was lying on the floor and she did not see it. The parking can get a little packed when you pull up to drop of you car for valet. There was one valet that was a little rude. We pulled up in the car and he said that he couldn't get the seat to pull up before. When I told him the seat motor had broken, he said that he might get us to park it. I thought this was extremely rude and unprofessional when we were paying for that service. I also thought the cost of the valet service was a little costly at $31.60/day. They also took a little longer than usual to get the car. I would suggest that you call the valet ahead of time so your wait won't be as long. However, on the last day of our stay I called ahead so that we could have the car waiting, load it up and leave quickly. I was told that they were busy and I would have to come down to request my car. I didnt see the sense in this since they would still have to go get the car anyways. However, these were small issues and overall our stay was very pleasant. I would stay again and recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel: fine customer service, good complimentary breakfast for priority club members, reasonable rates, decent rooms. The location is good and within 20 min walk to anywhere in the French Quarter. Use the carpark by Premiumparking on Iberville St. for a $20/day rate. The only negative things are all very minor: the bathtub should be fitted with a handle for safety purposes, the room lacked a fridge, and -that was bad luck- the window of our room was facing the swimming pool just a few feet below, so if you want privacy and you are given a room on the 4th floor, make sure it's not on the pool side.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY - go go go”
Reviews.Author: jennieb2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Astor from June 27th - July 1st (4 nights) for a conference. The hotel was beautiful and extremely clean. Service was superb. Everything worked (AC, water, etc...) Room service was fairly priced. The location is priceless...you are literally on the corner of Bourbon and Canal Street. You cannot beat it!!! There is even an outdoor pool on the roof of the 4th floor. Room service delivers food there. And across the street is a CVS where you can get alcohol......I loved it there and will be going back shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly home from home!”
Reviews.Author: Storm81
Reviews.Content: When i arrived in New Orleans i was exceedingly tired and ready for a good meal and sleep. I was dreading arriving at this hotel as i had read some horrific reviews on this website!!! When i arrived I was astounded! It was like a hotel in a movie, Huge, grand, and gleaming. I was welcomed by the reception desk and shown to my room by the bell hop who carried my bags (and didn't expect a tip!!!) The room was large enough for me with a big bathroom and all the necessary amenities including a complimentary safe in the closet and iron with ironing board, trouser press and hair dyer in the bathroom. The beds were comfy and clean, new sheets each day. The staff themselves were friendly and helpful where they could be and went far above and beyond their duties in one particular area i had difficulty with - many thanks again to the business centre! The bar and restaurant were good, but when you are on the corner of Bourbon and the start of the beautiful French Quarter, you really should go out and find sample some of New Orleans local cuisine. The Crazy Lobster was a real gem of a find, sadly on our penultimate night. The Swimming pool again was clean and allowed 'room service & drink' around its side, and the health centre being open 24hrs is a fantastic idea to help battle the jet lag induced early starts. A really superb Hotel with very accommodating staff! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: 2Busy2
Reviews.Content: This hotel ruined our trip. We came in for Essence Festival and they surprised guests w/a $50/nite hold. This wasn't told to people booking upfront and so many guests were angered but there weren't any available hotels. The room was FILTHY! Had to call for cleanup of stuff constantly and there was mold in the bathroom and thick dust on the room mirrors. My bedsheets had holes. I have never experienced anything like it. They charged my credit card twice (even though the room was already paid for) and mystery charges, such as international phone calls showed up on the bill. They blocked off the worst rooms for Essence guests, even though we paid top dollar. Some of the housekeepers were beyond rude and unprofessional. We extended our stay in New Orleans and checked out and went to Harrah's, which we LOVED.

Reviews.Title: “They robbed us - read the reviews before going to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elmasgrande
Reviews.Content: Have you ever been stolen $100 while on vacation? The manager of this hotel did it to me. With my girlfriend we came back to our room after eating lunch and there was broken glass everywhere on the floor. Surprising, huh? We called the front desk and the manager came to our room to tell us that we would be charged $100 for the broken glass. According to "his computer" (he never showed his registry, in spite of our request) nobody else had been in the room. Therefore, the hotel policy is that we had to be responsible even if we did not break the glass. I was extremely angry and the situation was so bizarre that I only wanted to yell at him. I was charged the $100. They also cleaned the room poorly and there was glass everywhere in the room for the rest of our stay. It was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved Since Our First Post-Katrina Stay”
Reviews.Author: tony5969
Reviews.Content: My lady and I stayed here in December 2006; you can see the previous review on my profile. While the customer service was fine, we gave the condition of the hotel some leeway considering the recovery from Katrina was so fresh. We were pleasantly surprised to see the renovations that had taken place since we had been there last. The lobby looked fantastic. Our room looked like a typical Crowne Plaza with its subdued upscale amenities. The overhauled fitness center was the biggest pleasant surprise. The staff, including the front desk and bell desk, were great with one exception. I saw a sign in the elevator advertising a breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant but when we went to the restaurant one morning, we saw that it was closed. While I waited in line to inquire at the front desk, my lady decided to ask the concierge. She told me that the concierge confirmed that the restaurant was in fact *not* opened for breakfast, albeit in a dismissive way as if we didn't know what we were talking about. When she insisted that we had indeed read some information, the concierge directed us to the third floor which turned out to be the "Executive Club"., for which we fortunately eligible to visit as we were Priority Club members. Other than the concierge experience, we once again enjoyed the convenience to the French Quarter without being directly on it. The $31 daily parking fee is indeed excessive but since we were redeeming points for our stay, it didn't bother us as much this time. While we may consider a different hotel next time for variety's sake, I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: b3inRaleigh
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza for 4 nights. It was a lovely hotel! Beautiful lobby and a great bar & restaurant downstairs (Dickie Brennans Bourbon House). Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Can't comment on the parking since we didn't drive there. And the AC worked fine for us. The only thing we didn't like was that there wasn't a fridge in our room, which would have been nice since it was extremely hot while we there& we would have liked to have had cold water in the room. But overall, our stay was great. The best thing about the hotel is the location - It's right on the corner of Canal Street and Bourbon, so it's very conveniently located to most anything you want to do. Go out one door and you're on crazy Bourbon St. Go out the other and you're on Canal - within steps of museums, the street cars, etc. It's within blocks to most everything !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Astor Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: pat099
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that we did not have a vehicle so I cannot address the valet parking problem. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. A/C worked fine and also had no shower or water temp. problems. The rooms are quite nice, clean and roomy. The last time I was in New Orleans I had an issue with critters in my room. None of that at this hotel. Lobby is beautiful. We did not eat at the restaurant located in the hotel. I felt it was a little too pricey for us, but then again there aren't many bargains in restaurants in New Orleans. The one gem we found was" Eat "restaurant on Doumaine Street. You are able to bring your own bottle of wine with no corkage fee. Food is very good and what I considered average prices for New Orleans. The hotel is at the end of Bourbon street and does require some walking to get to some things but everything is quite do-able. The only complaint that I have is that the daylight staff at the front desk are not very helpful or personable. Had no problems with evening staff. In my opinion you can't go wrong with this hotel unless you do not like to walk. One other thing I would like to mention is that the hotel will not cash a traveler's check over $50.00.

Reviews.Title: “great location not worth the hassles”
Reviews.Author: peaker79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Astor. The location is great -- within walking distance to most places in the French Quarter. We were pleasantly surprised by the size and decor of the room but immediately realized that the AC was not working properly. My husband called the front desk and was told that the AC has a "sensor" that adjusts the temperature when you enter the room and it should cool off within 30 minutes -- needless to say, this was a concocted excuse for poor maintenance, and the room never cooled off. Also, while taking a shower, the water would turn completely off and then back on again - quite annoying!! Last, but not least, the valet parking is a nightmare. After checking out, we stood in line for 30 minutes at the valet stand to get our car. When we finally got to the counter to give them our ticket, we were told that it would be at least 30 minutes before our car would be brought to us. A shuttle was available to take us to the remote parking lot (6 blocks away) to retrieve our car -- we chose this option and discovered that although we had paid over $31 for valet parking, we had to go get our own car from a public parking lot that had a sign posted "$3.00 per day parking." If we had known this, we would have gladly parked our own car and walked to the hotel. Needless to say, we will find another option for our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Improved service”
Reviews.Author: CypressPatterson
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and this visit was the best one yet. The personal service and friendliness of the staff was much, much improved. Every employee we encountered from the moment we stepped out of the car until we pulled away from the curb went almost overboard to make us feel welcome and were extremely helpful. Parking is FINE here - don't be scared away by other posts. Literally step out door and you're in the action on Bourbon Street. Very clean room, very comfortable, tons of pillows. Got an OUTSTANDING rate and I will stay here again and again. Very pretty place.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located hotel made for a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: LisaM81
