Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans with a friend for the first weekend in May following a business trip in the vicinity. We booked the hotel room through a price-bidding travel site and ended up being very pleased with the results. The hotel is located at the corner of Bourbon and Canal Streets and is right in the middle of all of the action. We had a room overlooking Bourbon Street and we didn't notice any of the noise the first night we were there, but on the second night it was quite a bit louder from approximately 11 pm until 5 am or so. Even so, the noise was not so loud that it was bothersome as we are not light sleepers, but if you are a light sleeper I would recommend asking for a room on the other side of the hotel. It also helps that Crowne Plaza hotels offer free sleep aid kits in their rooms and earplugs are included in the kit. We'd heard horror stories about the valet parking at the hotels in the area and instead parked in a nearby parking garage, which was less expensive and we had no trouble or wait in getting the car when we were departing. The hotel is newly renovated and was very nice - plenty of marble and crystal in the lobby, and new carpeting on the floor we were staying on. All of the staff we came in contact with were very pleasant and willing to do whatever they could to improve our stay. The rooms are fairly standard, but nicely decorated and with very comfortable beds. It was within walking distance of anything you might want to see in the French Quarter, the Mississippi River, and the Central Business District. Guided tours for anything you might want (cemeteries, swamps, haunted tours) are all offered in the lobby. We spent the majority of our time simply walking around the French Quarter and exploring the historical streets and staying in a hotel that with such a great location made that much easier. I don't recommend the room service unless you are desperate. Like room service in most places, it is over-priced and there are many much better options only steps away on Bourbon Street. I would definitely stay at this hotel again - great location, great service, great staff, and and overall really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: wtravellersny
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice stay. The location is very convenient and is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good place to stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: spregflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel guest staff are excellent. The rooms are great. Can't ask for a better place and it's close to everything in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Lacked Attention to Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: 2forfoodandfun
Reviews.Content: The service and location of this hotel were good. If this hotel had a little more attention to detail it would have been much better, as the rooms were large. We also got a good deal online (less then $100/night), and if I had paid more I would have been more upset. Unfortunately, the person who had been in our room before us had partied a little too hard over Mardi Gras. The bathroom has brown "stuff" on the door and shower curtain, and the bed pad was stained as well. We had to call housekeeping to change the bed that night (Denise was great) and then the next day had to re-request that shower curtain be changed (which it was) and the room be better cleaned (which it wasn't). Forget the pool - its like 10'x5'. The concierge was awful, as they often are, and is obviously getting kickbacks from the restaurants. FYI - don't bother to eat on Bourbon Street. Restaurants Herbsaint, Gumbo Shop and Olivers (2 blocks from hotel) were excellent. It is important to remember New Orleans is still unsafe in certain areas. We chatted with a local who turned out to be a prosecutor - she said try not to carry a purse, if you get mugged give them the purse (she stressed this as more then usual common sense, like she's seen what happens) and definitely stay in the french quarter area at night. We did venture out via the streetcar at like 9pm, in well-traveled areas, but you had to be careful. We even had a local couple advise us to go down a different street as a "sketchy" person had just gone down a road were were about to take, in a very nice section of the FQ. Don't let the warnings scare you though - Nawlin's is a great time and safe as long as you use common sense. I just was surprise how some people really warned you about safety, and other's never mentioned it (our concierge never mentioned safety even after we asked about a restaurant that was in an area you shouldn't be in unless you were parking valet).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nolajunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come to New Orleans at least twice a year and we have stayed at the Astor 4 times. We will continually keep coming back to the Astor because of the wonderfully helpful staff, clean rooms, great room service and perfect location. Each time we have been, our rooms have been upgraded and once they gave us the honeymoon suite because it was our anniversary. I have never had a bad experience with this hotel or any of the staff. We will stay at this hotel again and again. We would like to thank the staff for making us feel so welcome and we will see you again in April 2009.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Joanna A
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week, Feb. 18th through the 24th of this yr (2009) and was overall satisfied with my time there. My hotel room was facing Canal Street where most of the parades could be seen. The view was fantastic and made it worth waking up in the morning to. The weather at the time was great, big change from what I'd been experiencing in NYC, but I didn't pack quite right for it! So, being able to watch the parades from the comfort of my room was fantastic! The staff was always friendly and willing to go above and beyond whatever you needed. My only grievance is that when I arrived at my room I didn't have a hotel information packet. When I wanted room service and called for a menu (which was not in the room) I did not receive one. It took four calls to both front desk and room service as well as me going downstairs and requesting one for them to come up and bring me a copy. I later got additional calls about being sent a menu, even though I'd already gotten it. I'm sure though, that if it weren't for Mardi Gras, they'd have been more attentive and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: CP1971
Reviews.Content: We just stayed the weekend at the Astor for Mardi Gras. The hotel made accomodations for a shuttle for parking since the streets were closed for the parade routes which was nice. We were upgraded to the executive level upon check-in (which was GREAT since there was a welcome package and free breakfast in the club room). Room was very large, quiet, clean, and the bed was really comfortable. The location couldn't have been better. We were even allowed to have a birds-eye view of the parades from the 2nd floor balcony as they came down Canal street. It was on the opposite side of Canal for the parades, and not close enough for beads..but the view was spectacular of the crowds and floats.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: caseyerau
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Astor right now during Mardi Gras. The rooms are okay, but the heat doesn't work and for some reason the water will completey shut off and turn turn back on while showering. Pretty annoying. I've called twice about the heat and both times I've been told it actually does work, but it takes awhile and it is sensitive to how many people are in the room. That's some good BS. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Crown Plaza.”
Reviews.Author: Irishair
Reviews.Content: This hotel has few amenities. The do not anything to do with the Priority Club. You may get the points but that is it. The heat in the room did not work. The restaurant Claims no association with the hotel. Would reccommend the Sheraton or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovepcb2
Reviews.Content: Arrived Fri 13th and checked in around noon. Great front desk service. They did have security wrist bands due to the crowds but was not a problem at all. You could not enter the hotel with out the bands but there was always mutiple people checking and never a wait. Just walked by and showed them your wrist band. I think this was just for Mardi Gras since we have stayed here before and have not had that. Check out was just as easy. Monday at 10am no wait at the from desk. Our room was large and bed and pillows very comfy. Housekeeping did a good job with cleaning the room. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: jbooth2099
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here over Valentines weekend and really enjoyed our stay. The service was great from check-in to check out. We were able to get into our room early on Friday even though they were very busy. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The value and location combined with overall quality, made this a great getaway hotel for our weekend. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Historical Hotel- but check your bill when checking out”
Reviews.Author: loopylou1559
Reviews.Content: "I booked this hotel as I like historical buildings, I was not dissappointed, the location was great being in the middle of New Orleans. The hotel room was a good size had 2 lovely beds and a veiw of New Orleans, the only fault I have on the room was that the coffee and tea making facilities were in the bathroom- which I found very strange. The recpetion staff needed extra training on customer service however the guy who checked us in was very helpful. I am pleased that I have visited New Orleans but I felt there was very little there to do/ visit and wouldn't return the in future." Make sure you go on the Hurricane Katrina tour, this tour takes you out of the centre of New Orleans to where most of the devastion took place- really worth the money. Take a river cruise on the Steamboat NATCHEZ along the Mississippi river" Make sure you check your bill on check out, as when we checked out they tried to bill us over $150 for 5 nights parking- which was pretty amazing really since we flew from the UK. Also when retruned back to UK we found out we had been charged $24 for 2 movies watched from the room which was not the case, we rang the hotel and the money was refunded and the hotel apologised for the error- Just make sure you check your check out bill and your credit card statement when home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blankstarlight
Reviews.Content: CLEAN, great staff, great location. Only negative was it took over an hour to get my car when we checked out. Apparently, the whole hotel checked out at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “The Astor is a Must See!!”
Reviews.Author: glugo1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! Clean rooms, excellent staff and a wonderful experience overall. Susie Anderson was especially helpful. Great location at the corner of Bourbon St. and Canal St, so you have easy walking access to all the famous New Orleans attractions, including the streetcar!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monavNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, the bedding was dreamy, the hotel lobby is incredible and the restaurant on site is excellent. All the staff were very helpful, couteous, and friendly, especially Susie Anderson, who personally helped us with all our arrangements. Kudos Susie!

Reviews.Title: “First Post Katrina visit”
Reviews.Author: Wausau_WIWapper
Reviews.Content: The week between Christmas and New Years was wide open in terms of getting a reservation in New Orleans. I went for the best 4-star deal on Hotwire.com and ended up here. For about $90 per night including the taxes it was a terrific deal. You do have to consider the extra $30-35 with tip per day parking fee if you drive to the hotel. Still with the location being just about walking distance to everything it can't be beat. The lobby was decorated tastefully for Christmas and was very quiet and secure considering the close proximately to Bourbon Street. The rooms were comfortable, but not elegant. We had a problem with the A/C the first night and it was promptly fixed after notifying the desk. There can be a lengthy wait to get your car out of valet, so allow plenty of time if you need to catch a reservation somewhere. Lastly, the only negative was the pool/spa was closed for renovation. This should have been called out. I had a couple of teenagers in tow and they were a bit disappointed in that.

Reviews.Title: “Astor New Orleans OK, but prefer the Ritz at not much more $$$”
Reviews.Author: BamaParrothead
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying 4 nights at the Astor Crowne Plaza. Hotel is a great location at the corner of Bourbon and Canal and is close to Harrah's, the Superdome and the nightlife on Bourbon. However, that was about the only positive thing about our stay. First off we had to wait forever to check in because there werent enough front lobby people behind the counters. Secondly, you need to know that they will take your car and park it like 5 blocks from the hotel so make sure you get everything you need when they take it to park it. If you don't they will go back and get it for you, but then you have to tip everytime they do it. We got to our room and the A/C didnt work properly. We turned the A/C all the way down to 65 (as low as it would go) and it would hardly ever come on and when it did, it was warm and humid with no air circulation. We had requested an interior room in the renovated section not facing Bourbon or Canal so at least our room was very quiet. However, with it being an interior room (there was a small window) we think that it contributed to the room being humid and warm. Three of us stayed in the room and we all left with a sore throat because of the room temp/air circulation. Next thing we wanted to do when we got there was take showers, and there were NO wash cloths! The entire time we had to ask the housekeeping staff to bring us washcloths. I called the front desk to complain and they said we should have them, but EVERY time they cleaned out room they only left us hand towels and regular towels. Oh and the bathroom is TINY, so is the shower--barely enough room to move around. The restaurant in the lobby was so-so and WAY overpriced. You can head down one of the side streets off Bourbon and get the same food for much less, guess they can charge that because of the location. Also, dont even think about ordering room service. We tried on 3 different occasions to order it and they would always say they would bring us a menu but never did. My recommendation would be to pay the extra $50 a nite and stay at the Ritz. All of our friends were at the Ritz and had a fabulous stay-and the Ritz is one block over in the same location. Their rooms were larger, more airy and the service there is impeccable. And watch coming in late. There is a really rude security guard that makes you show your room key to get in the building. This is totally understandable being that Canal at late hours is pretty dangerous, but he didnt have to be so rude about letting us in. Total jerk. And when I checked out, I found the hotel had booked two reservations under my name, including one with a no-show charge on my credit card. The manager said he would credit it back, and after making me wait 30 minutes he said he credited it back. Well I checked my card today and it was NOT credited back yet so I had to call and deal with the people there again. We had friends stay at other hotels like Hotel Monteleone and Bienville House and they all had great stays...check some of those out, plus they are closer to the French Market and Jackson Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location/Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgoodwood
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Astor in New Orleans for 12/25/08-1/01/09 and were a little concerned after reading some of the reviews here. However, we had a fabulous time! The hotel is at the corner of Bourbon and Canal and directly adjacent to the streetcar line. This was our second time to New Orleans and this time we took less cabs because so much was accessible by streetcar. (12$ for 3 days unlimited on/off and transfers). We went to the French Market, Cafe du Monde, the Insectarium, Harrah's, Camellia Grill, Angelo Brocato's, toured the city, etc., all by streetcar. (Thus avoiding the valet issues which some have noted. However, we did use the valets to hail cabs and I can say they hustled their tails, sometimes even going down 2 blocks to get cabs for us.) Our room was very pretty and included all the usual Crowne Plaza amenities. We were on the top floor, so we only heard the sirens from Canal Street. However, the desk clerk had asked if we wanted quiet, so I would suggest if quiet is your goal that you ask for a high floor or a room not overlooking Bourbon. We did not hear any noise from the other rooms other than the doors slamming sometimes. They also gave us a late checkout since our flight wasn't leaving until almost 5pm, and then held our luggage at the valet after that. Our air conditioning worked great. There is a slight mustiness in the hallways, but I noticed it in several other places on our trip including a couple of very nice restaurants. There is a lot of moisture here, and after Katrina, I'm sure some mildew issues. However, it was not present in our rooms/beds/bathrooms/bar etc., and was clearly not caused by neglect. The only issue we had was the first night by husband tried to move the bed to plug in the lamps and knocked it off the casters they use to raise the bed. We were immediately assisted by the bell desk and then the engineering department who were both very nice and helpful. I will say the engineering guy was very happy that our air conditioning was working good, so that may be an issue as others have noted, but we did not experience it. We also had no problems with our keycards. If you are looking for a highly sterile/cookie-cutter stay in New Orleans, it is possible this isn't for you. However, the location, staff, nicely appointed rooms and the general vibe made for exactly what we were looking for-- an authentic, fun, romantic getaway to New Orleans. We got exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: cm_NYC82
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in the middle of all of the action. It is right off Bourbon and Canal, giving you immediate access to restaurants, bars, shops, and public transportation. The staff was great, room service was excellent, and the rooms were nice and big. The only complaints were regarding the water pressure and plumbing sounds. In the shower, the pressure would sometimes get so low it was practically off. Also, from our room we could hear the sound of the pipes/plumbing from other rooms. The hotel was also PACKED because it was the week Sugar Bowl and New Year's, so it might not be this bad at other times. Another note about the French Quarter in general, is that the city has done a lot of work, and it was very safe, with police everywhere you looked, and I found many of the negative stereotypes which I had heard before going down there were not true.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: brady1348
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. I wasn't overwhelmed by the staff or service or anything, but I was only there for 2 nights. My only complaint is that I requested on Hotels.com to be placed in the new part. When we arrived, the only king bed was in the old part. We decided to give it a try and got to our room to discover someone else was in there. When we went back ot the desk, they didn't seem too concerned. I didn't even see the room but the old part was kind of creepy and almost damp, so I said we wanted the new part even if we had to have 2 queen beds. Our room was great, no problems there. I was still irritated we couldn't get a king bed in the new part and that the front desk didn't seem bothered by our encounter in the old room. If I had been the lady in the room hearing people coming in, I would have freaked out.

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: poui
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is located at the corner of Bourbon and Canal Streets which meant that noise from Bourbon street was easily heard. We also clearly heard conversations from the room next door. The windows were dirty and needed cleaning. The cover for the airconditioner kept falling off. The corridors smelled musty. Eveyrtime the occupants of the room next door used their sink or flushed the toilet gases came up through the pipe of the sink in our room. We were in NO for 72 hours. The safe in the room did not work at all even though we complained and even though they sent someone to fix it. We therefore had to walk around with all of our money and credit cards on New Years eve when the crowd on the street was so thick. I won't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: popuplily
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location. The room was clean and big enough for my grandson to crawl around and enjoy. All the rooms are non-smoking and the beds were comfortable. We were on the 12th floor on the Bourbon Street side and it was quite noisy. The valet parking is pricy ($31) and rather disorganized and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, don't pick the rooms in the older part”
Reviews.Author: travellingdr
Reviews.Content: Great property, great location. The first room we had was in the original part of the building...probably built in early 1800's....nice historically but spooky, rooms were smaller than my closet but the Front Desk clerk was nice enough to move us to the "newer part" of the hotel, rooms were much better still small but I wasn't carrying all my shoes ... I would recommend this place because of the location but still too pricey for the quality of the room

Reviews.Title: “Convenient French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: boatech
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend with friends in New Orleans. We all stayed at the Astor Crown Plaza on the corner of Canal and Bourbon Streets. I have to say for the location this has to be one of the best hotels for comfort and convenience. It's close enough to the local attractions that you don't need a car or a cab, but it's also just far enough away from the the noise coming from Bourbon St. My room was on a corner on the 7th floor over looking Bourbon St. and I could barely hear anything. I was pleasantly surprised to find bathrobes in the closet and a refrigerator. Compared to the rooms my friends had, it seemed like I had a junior suite. (it could have been because it was on a corner) The restaraunt downstairs has wonderful food. Infact a lot of people seem to think so too because there were more than just hotel guest dining there. I have stayed in several hotels in and around the French Quarter area, and I have to say this one is becoming my favorite. When you walk in you feel like you are walking into a much classier hotel than one owned by Holiday Inn. The only complaint I had was the parking situation. You pretty much have to use the valet service and you have to make the block a couple of times before you can slide into the unloading zone. Once you get unloaded they inform you of the $31.00 a day fee for parking. I guess you have to expect that in a large city. I sucked it up and paid it just so I wouldn't have to search for parking on my own. Overall I would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: malcolmandgrace
Reviews.Content: The location was great, on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, but from the start, the other "average" reviews were dead-on. Parking is problematic. There are about 5 spaces that you can pull into in front of the hotel on Canal Street. We had to circle around Canal once to get one of these coveted spots. (Not that we did, but don't even think about about double-parking on Canal.) I think we were lucky to circle around once because we were checking in at 10pm. The Valets hoarded the luggage carts in a luggage room in front of the hotel by the Canal St. entrance. I only saw one for the five cars parked in front of the hotel. We were not able to use one because our Valet mentioned that the room was locked. Checking in at 10pm there was no wait at the the Front Desk, but I think we caught the Front Desk Staff at the end of a very long day (no excuses for a 4 star hotel.) She was very harried and not particularly nice. AT FIRST, we we're staying in the Alexa tower? room #5501. Terrible. Only one of the key cards worked. The room overlooked one of the sidestreets and every possible noise on that sidestreet came right into the room, Where were the ear plugs and CD that everyone spoke of? I don't think they routinely let this room, because the A/C would not even turn on, but they did have an unsightly dehumidifier in the room. The room smelled intoxicatingly of paint fumes. You would think that if the room was let out often, the A/C would be working. We called the Front Desk who said that Engineering would be by to fix the A/C. We waited 30 minutes before calling again. This time, new Front Desk staff came on and said that it be another 30-40 minutes "because of the time change." My husband asked for a new room and this was honored. Maybe, because this time he dropped the, "Hi, this is DR. XYZ from..." We were put into the Canal Tower room #740. Much better. A/C was already running and we had the ear plugs/eye mask/CD awaiting on one of the beds...not that they were needed. This room was so quiet compared to the first. No intoxicating paint fumes! The rest of our 3-night stay, we didn't really encounter rude Staff. As small as this issue is, it was an annoyance. The key cards seemed to work half of the time. We had those replaced on a daily basis. We did not keep them near a cell phone or a credit card. After we had them replaced the 3rd time, Front Staff sent Engineering to our room who checked out the door. They said that the door was working properly. I know that it was not us with the problem because a couple down our hallway asked us to help them get into their room with their key card and there was at least one other couple in line with us, each of our three times, who also had their key cards replaced. The fitness/pool areas (can't recall the floors) were closed for renovation, but this did not affect us and may have for other patrons. Would we stay here again? No. I'll stay at the Sheraton across the street. At least, there, you can pull into a covered passenger loading/unloading area with luggage carts that abound. The Sheraton was what we expected from a 4-star hotel and did not encounter problems worth mentioning on a review. We thought we'd give the Astor a try as it was also listed as 4 stars and had a convenient location on Bourbon/Canal. One more thing. Checking out was fast at 10am on Columbus Day morning. No wait. Our car was waiting for us. The Valet mentioned that the only time the shuttle is used is when they get super busy. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Problems stack up”
Reviews.Author: Samsrobin
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd move/room was a downgraded room, from moves #1 and #2 (guess they wanted us to stop complaining-so we did). Complimentary continental breakfast was the offer to make up for problems, but a full breakfast would have been more appropriate. Staff was VERYpleasant, but the little things that make a stay exceptional were missing. (no TV for Mon. night football, no washclothes, no trash can, no ice machine on floor #9) Location is great and rooms were clean and comfy. Concierge was helpful, but could not print something we needed due to an empty printer cartridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: majorm
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, but quiet. They are in the process of remodeling so who knows what it will be like next time. All the staff members were friendly. For some reason, when we arrived on Thurday afternoon ,there were several room service trays in the hall. They were not removed until the next afternoon. I called house keeping and room service to let them know about the trays and no one came to get them. We reserved two rooms with king beds, there was only one room with a king bed available when we checked in. Our room was a bit stark, but comfortable, no fridge and the ac was cool but I prefer it cooler A fan would have been nice. The bathroom was fine. A very nice stay. Great location. Very affordable. I would stay again. I prefer the Ritz, but for $100 less I'll stay at the Astor again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Several Issues”
Reviews.Author: NancyQuinn
Reviews.Content: Location is great, rooms not so great ... stayed 2 nights and reported the issue (TV was fuzzy, mold in the bathtub) .... I stay at Crowne's all the time but this one was not at par with other Crowne Plaza's

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, even better service”
Reviews.Author: isleview
Reviews.Content: Astor Crowne Plaza - French Quarter 8/16/2008 - 8/21/2008 First of all let me say that people make a place. From the moment we left our cab in the pouring rain the service was excellent. The Bellman took our luggage to the front desk. There we were greeted by Erik Miller. He said that a room was available for early check-in. We were given a room on the 11th floor that was very neat and clean. After we put our stuff away we went out to explore Canal and Bourban Streets. Our location couldn't have been better. Later in the evening we discovered that our tv didn't work. Since we were going out for the evening we asked if someone could check it the next day. This was done and we changed rooms as there was a problem with the cable. They apologized numerous times because of the inconvenience to us. Any time we saw an employee they asked how we were enjoying our stay. The pool was outside on the third floor. It was a nice quiet place to swim,and relax. The hotel also had a very nice workout room. They did say there was a whirlpool but that didn't exist. The day before we were to leave I asked Mr. Miller if there was somewhere to store our luggage as our flight wasn't until 4:22 p.m. He gave us a late check out time. I would definitely reccommend this hotel and can't say enough about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: brunette1122
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took a spur of the moment trip to New Orleans and figured we would get a hotel when we got there. By the time we made it, it was pouring rain and dark. We were stuck in traffic right outside the hotel, so decided to call. We were in luck, they had a room and for a great price! We were able to get out of the car right there and the valet men helped us. They were all very kind and helpful. When we walked in we could not believe how gorgeous this hotel was! When we got to the room, we were in heaven again! There is also a restaurant downstairs. It is a little pricey, but the food was totally worth it. It was the best we ever had. Also, if you go out the back of the restaurant or the front of the hotel and turn the corner, you are on Bourbon St, which, as we are both in our early 20's was very appealing to us. However, there was no noise at all during the night. All the staff was great, very friendly and helpful. During the night/early morning shift there is a doorsman outside who is quite a kick. We did not catch his name, but he reminded us of Al Roker, from the Today show. This man is the only one I know who can be that happy, that late, while wearing a suit! We could not find a late restaurant, but the hotel offers 24 hour room service. The prices are not too bad, and the food was EXCELLENT! The beds are also like heaven. We had a double queen room and both enjoyed stretching out and even though we only got 4 hours of sleep we both felt incredibly rested! Also, even though checkout is at noon, your car does not have to checked out until 4pm and they offer a luggage holding area. I highly recommend paying the $28 for parking and taking advantage of these services. It made our trip that much better! You can walk just about anywhere in the french quarter from this hotel! Also, if you try to get your car at noon, which is checkout time, there will be a small wait. We noticed people getting very angry at the valet service people, but they were doing their job as quickly as they could. Noon is a hectic time, so again, a good idea to just leave it and wait. When we asked for our car at 3pm we got it in 5 minutes. All the staff was cheerful, helpful and professional. Not a single complaint! DEFINITLEY worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “Honestly....This was an amazing value!!”
Reviews.Author: DOREENIENewYork
Reviews.Content: well let me tell you that this hotel was a great value! my boyfriend and are in early 30's that live in the nyc. we travel a lot because i am a flight attendant. i have stayed in MANY hotels and trust me...this was an AMAZING VALUE! i got the room on hotwire for 80$ and OMG>>>we were stunned why people even complain. lobby gorgeous, location cant be beat, and we could not hear anything from our room. and it was a weekend!! heads up...we stayed on the 6th floor opposite side of bourbon street. staff so nice, beds sooo nice with wooden post and the room was cold and refreshing when we walked in. they even give you a sleep bag. the only downside..no view from hotel window but who cares. we were here for the weekend to have fun. it was kept up hallways and a really nice hotel. there is other hotels that are great but if you are looking for a beautiful value hotel in the french quarter stay here! we were really happy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Niap
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great Location, walking distance to everywhere. Very comfortable rooms, nice soft sheets for the bed and more than enough pillows in the room. You can't even tell that there is a renovation going on. We requested for a high floor (8th) and that helps with the noise on Bourbon street. Great view. I won't stay inside the French Quarters due to the party noise at night, Astro is at the corner of Bourbon and Canal and right outside is the Street car...very convenient. Because we checked in late, we only had 1 full day to explore New Orleans, we opt for the 3 hours bus tour (great choice) that took us to all the major site, we felt like we covered the whole town in 3 hours and took tons fo pictures. This tour can be book right at the hotel. We also ventrure out to Mardi Gras World a must see if you are not there for Mardi Gras, it's part of New Orleans. You can get all kinds of souviniors at the French Market/flea Market at a low low price. If you are looking for good crawfish broil, the french quarter is NOT the place. Take Canel north to Broad street (about 15 mins) to Broadview Seafood 504-9443001 they have the best local food. Hotel staff only suggest restaurant in the french quarters, not the kind we were looking for. One last thing, be prepare to pay alot for parking. The Astro Crown Plaza charges about $32 per night. Hope this help.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sublimebrad
Reviews.Content: Got lucky and found this hotel on hotwire for $65 on a weekend night this summer so I booked and went. Its on the corner of Bourbon and Canal, above Krystal if you know the area. Its a very nice hotel, listed as a 4 star. Our room was a little small but alot of rooms down there are like that. Everything in the room was nice though. It had a nice welcome gift on the bed as well. The pool was closed due to rain all weekend but it was on the roof and looked really nice. The Bourbon House is the restaurant downstairs which is amazing so try it for sure! Overall a great experience. Expect $30 for valet parking which is pretty standard in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Astor Crowne Plaza - Sinking Titanic”
Reviews.Author: IntricateTimes
Reviews.Content: I recently (7/21/08 - 7/24/08) stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza in French Quarters. The booking was made with the expectations of staying in an upscale 4-star hotel. This was to be a memorable occassion for the basketball team that I coach. Unfortunately, that dream turned out to be a nightmare. First of all things, the staff at the front desk were not customer focused during our check-in process. We were standing in line and a disgruntled guest cut the line and walked straight up to the clerk, as though we were not even standing there. The staff on hand proceeded to assist the guest and completely disregarded our presences. I checked into four rooms. Two of the four rooms were not up to par. One room had a problem with the door opening and closing. The other room had a clogged up sink, with a broken faucet and a leaking air conditioning unit. A complaint was filed at the front desk and the attendant stated that she would change our room if the problem could not be corrected. It took two engineers to come up before our issue was properly addressed. However, the situation wasn't rectified. The sink was temporarily unclogged, as this solution lasted for about two usages. The door was not fixed. The engineer said that there was nothing that he could do about it. The pan to the air conditioning unit was emptied, only to refill and cause the carpet inside the room and immediately outside the door to be drenched. It was too late to move the kids to another room, so I waited until the next morning and contacted the front desk. I was told that the manager was in a meeting. I attempted to contact the manager again and was blindly transferred to an answering service. I did leave a message for the manager, but he never returned my call. On top of the room problems, the valet attendants could not locate the keys to my vehicle. I had to wait for 50 minutes to receive my vehicle, after calling in advance to ensure that vehicle would be available. This was a major issues, because we were participating in a basketball tournament and that didn't allow the kids to have ample time to warm-up. The valet manager was supposed to contact me and never did hear from him/her. The next day, we called in advance to have the vehicle ready for early departure, only to again wait for over 45 minutes. This time, the vehicle was received with damages to the mirror. The attendants promised to get this taken care of before we checked out. Well, of course that didn't happen. On top of all of this, there were dead roaches in the corridor. This was definitely far from a 4-star experience. I left New Orleans and stayed in a 3-star hotel in Duluth, Georgia, which was hand-down, far more superior to this hotel. PLEASE TAKE HEED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location poor air”
Reviews.Author: cdwells
Reviews.Content: My wife and I agreed that this was a great choice for our stay in New Orleans. We had our 2 teenage sons with us and they also liked it. The staff is very well trained. It took us just a couple of mins. to get checked in and into our room. We got o n the 9th floor to minimize the late night noise. From our window we looked down at Bourbon St. The staff helped us book a tour with VIP tours. We cannot imagine a better tour. I highly recommend using them. The only problem we had was that the air cond. was not very good in our room. I did not say anything to the manager because we were only there for 3 nights and everything else was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: treonne
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New Orleans and the wonderful Astor Crowne Plaza. This Place is Amazing!!! Everyone was so helpful and nice, the rooms were fabulous, the best weekend ever! A few people were exceptionally great. 1 being Nalander "Skip" the Evening Manager. He was the best!! He helped us in everyway possible. I would definitely be back and being a travel agent, I will strongly advise my clients who are traveling to New Orleans to stay at this property! They and Skip are to be complimented!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but beware of Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: River_Houser
Reviews.Content: We happen to have a superb rate for the hotel, the stay was average. Good location. Staff average. When we arrived in our room there was obviously something smeared on the outside of the door (chocolate, jelly, ??). We stayed for 3 nights and it was never cleaned off. We also had to call housekeeping for toilet paper, after they had made up our room for the day. Makes you wonder about the cleaning overall. The worst part of the trip was the Sunday "valet" parking. Don't get suckered!!! They state on the vallet parking instructions that on Sunday you may have to wait 1-2 hours to get your car. My guess is it is longer than that so they offer you this shuttle to get your car. You pick up your keys from the valet service. They then pick you and others up in a small bus, ours did not have air conditioning-in July it was a sauna, and take you a few blocks to the parking garage. You have guys rushing around like mad to get you your car, and then you wait to leave the parking garage. The shuttle is acceptable, if it would have had AC and if they would have informed us previously. Basically you pay for valet parking and you use a shuttle-just be aware and plan ahead. Call for your car several hours before departing on Sunday or you too will pay for valet parking and then use a shuttle with no air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value By Far”
Reviews.Author: Groucho2
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely comfortable and all staff members were friendly and capable. We had absolutely no problems connected with our stay. Loved the convenience of the sreetcar across the street and the excitement of Bourbon St right outside. Breakfast at the hotel was very good plus we had a great view of the French Quarter Festival parade while we were eating. Everything was attractive and well kept, but the people are really what made the difference. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful and seemed to really care about the guests. This attitude seemed to spread to the guests too - I didn't hear a disgruntled voice even once during our four day stay! We got the low rate of $89 as a mystery hotel offer making this the best deal imaginable. We are looking forward to a return trip this year and hope to enjoy the Astor Crown Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DrBizz
Reviews.Content: I just completed a one-week business trip to New Orleans and thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Crown Plaza Astor. Located at the corner of Canal & Bourbon, the location of the hotel cannot be beaten. The lobby is nice and well kept. Dickie Brennan's seafood restaurant and hotel bar are conveniently located adjacent to the elevators. The room consists of a comfortable, firm matress, roughly a dozen pillows, a television set, safe and desk. My room was reasonably kept throughout my stay. All of the action from Bourbon street can certainly be audible on the weekend but the hotel provides you with a sleep-pack of ear plugs, mask, scented mist, and relaxation music. One frustration was the lack of free internet access in the hotel rooms. There was an ethernet connection in the rooms, which costed - I believe - $10 for the week if not more. There was no wireless connection provided by the hotel, forcing me to scan the area for weak signals that I could sporadically leech. There was a decent signal on the ground floor from a nearby restaurant. I don't believe it's unreasonable to expect free wireless to hotel guests of a 3/4 star hotel. I give kudos to the hotel staff who are quite friendly if you approach them. If you are sociable, they can provide you with a lot of assistance during your stay. All in all I would recommend this hotel for its location, reasonable price (roughly $125/night), and amenities (less wireless). I would certainly stay at the Crown Plaza during my next visit to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Good If The Price Is Right”
Reviews.Author: igmogiggio
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few New Orleans hotels. This was my first stay in the Astor. Maybe it's the Katrina effect, but lately I'm not seeing the level of service that I've grown accustomed to in New Orleans. The Good - The hotel was okay. I've had more room and better beds, but it wasn't bad for the price ($150). You couldn't ask for a better location than the corner of Canal and Bourbon. Valet was easy, if not a little expensive ($31). The Bad - Customer service is not up to par with a 4 star hotel. For example, after failing to reach the valet via his extension, the front desk told me I had to walk my ticket down to the front door and hand the ticket to the valet. I then waited 20 minutes for the car to be brought around. Not a deal breaker, but pretty [-] service from a 4 star hotel. The Bottom Line - If you want good location and the price is right, stay here. If you're looking for luxury and opulence, look around a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Astor Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: lynni913
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more than expected. The staff was very helpful especially in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - super friendly and clean.”
Reviews.Author: ladukart
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! I had stayed there before as the Alexa Hotel . But was second guessing after readign some reviews. BUt... The staff was beyond nice---they extended our stay and even offered same discounted rate. When all travel webiste told me the hotel was booked, a front desk agent directly with hotel found me a room --- at a special rate ---- for Jazz Fest in NO! Staff was helpful and pleasent throughout stay. The Dickie Brennan's Bourbon House resyaurent is on propeorty and was Great oyster bar. Shuttle to JazzFest picks up and drops off direclty in front of hotel. easiet to and from in 9 yrs of festing. I highly recommend and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad......”
Reviews.Author: arnoldboon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 17-20th. Location is great. Right at the entrance to Bourban Street. One of my main concerns was the distance to Harrahs, as I like casinos. Distance was not far at all. Its probably a 10-15 min walk. Lots of people on the street, felt safe at all times. Hotel was nice, I was a little worried about some of the reviews on here. One complaint, the shower will turn off by itself sometimes, but only for a second or two. I guess someone next door was flushing the toilet or something. Beds are comfortable. Rooms was spacious. Hotel is old, but thats okay. We really didn't stay in the hotel much anyway. Walking to New Orleans Arena and Superdome is about 20 minute walk. Not really that bad. I do think that is is one of the nicer hotels near/in the french quarter. btw, limo service for 8 people from the airport to this hotel was only 90.00. a1regal is the company name. beats the cab prices.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Astor Crowne Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: kwjtn3
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on BookIt.com as a mystery hotel without knowing the hotel name. We got a great price and were delighted with the hotel when we arrived. It is on Canal Street on the edge of the French Quarter. The common areas were beautiful and well decorated. The employees were friendly and helpful. The streetcar stop was right out front and you can walk anywhere in the French Quarter, Business District or along the Riverfront from here. The room was beautiful and had all the amenities needed. Everything was very clean and the bed was soooo comfortable. The room was very quiet, the thermostat worked well and the water pressure was great with plenty of hot water. The fitness center had good equipment for a workout. I looked at numerous hotels before going and while I was there I saw several of the hotels I had looked at online and I did not see any I would rather have stayed with. I was surprised this hotel was rated only a 3 star. I am trying to figure out how to get the same hotel at the same price the next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: michaelsharkey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from 4/19-4/21. We are in our late 30s and travel with moderate expectations. We both enjoyed this hotel. The hotel is at the very end of Burboun St. Our room was on the 5th floor, Burboun St side which we could hear from the bed but it was not enough to keep us awake. I've stayed in other hotels were you hear the local highways. Plus the hotel gives you one set of ear plugs and a soothing misic CD if you feel you need it. (we did not). ALL, ALL employees were extremely polite and would acknowledge us with a smile or words anytime we passed. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel location is great, within walking distance of everything for a three night trip. If I ever return to NOLA, I would stay there again. You know what to do, Bookit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Really Loud!”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on Canal near Bourbon and because it is an historic property, it has a really great feel - much more like the historic inns in the French Quarter than the large cosmopolitan hotels on the other side of Canal. The lobby is really beautiful and the building I stayed in had exposed brick in the hallways. My room must have had fifteen foot ceilings and overlooked the hotel's entrance on Canal. The staff was very helpful and greeted me cordially at every opportunity. Now the bad - because of the generous room rates, the hotel attracted a lot of young people during my stay. My first night, a Thursday, was nice and quiet, but my second night, a Friday, brought a whole other atmosphere. Around 2am the hall outside my room turned into a Mardi Gras-like parade route. Young people congregated in the hall drinking and speaking in loud voices. Doors were constantly slamming and walls being pounded on. At one point, I heard the contents of an ice chest sloshing its way down the hall. I was able to get back to sleep relatively quickly with the help of the ear plugs that were waiting for me on my bed when I checked in - guess that should have warned me. I will say the walls bewteen the rooms seemed to be pretty thick but the noise from the hallway was a real problem. Other than my second night, my stay was very enjoyable. I highly recommend Chef Paul Prudhomme's wonderful K-Paul's Louisianna Kitchen, just a few blocks from the hotel on Chartres Street. Dinner for two without drinks will probably set you back around $100 but it was a great dining experience!

Reviews.Title: “No problems @ the Astor Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: EnviroGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is fantastic for exploring the French Quarter. Close to great nightlife, bars, and restaurants. The lobby is beautiful, and our room was quite big and spacious (2 Queen beds). The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was clean. We did not have a problem with the service (as reported by previous travelers). Parking was $30 a night; we chose to park our car a few blocks away for $15 a night, had no problems with this. My only complaint is that the room was pretty loud. Not necessarily from Bourbon Street, but from people in the hallways. This actually did wake us up a few times, but I still would stay here all over again. One final piece of info: I stayed here b/c I got a great rate off Bookit.com. We paid $100 a night, so we were very happy. I may not have been so happy if I had paid $200. Anyway, we had a great experience. I was worried after reading previous reviews, but I report no major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: jmholdy
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and location for a price under $100.00 a night. Large lobby and friendly staff w/ excellent attached steakhouse. Ask for a room that does not front bourbon street unless you like loude music all night. Staff was great when we asked to move to a quiet room that looked towards the river. Priority memebers get the nice wine and cheese in the evenings and a light breakfast in the mornings (worth it). Pool is not much but everything else was great. Our third trip to NO and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delay Check-in”
Reviews.Author: Imigrants
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is not honored by the Lobby Attendants, I was waiting for about 1 hour in the lobby to check-in, and nobody show up to give us a decent explanation, later after some of the guest protested somebody told us about computer problem was almost 1:00 am in the morning and 8 guests were waiting. The manager on duty showed up and offers us a free breakfast to compensate some way. The room was neat and well organized, pretty small. But the restaurant (Bourbon House) in the Hotel in the best, please tries the Gumbo and some sea food, but please reserve in advance. The bread is delicious. The rate is quit high, some of my friend stay in the Marriott same French quarter for just $95 per night. Other aspect to consider is this spot is noisy and have so many drunks people around if you are looking for a quite place, this is not your destination.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, that is the only positive I can say”
Reviews.Author: hrmkendall
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm more picky because I'm in the industry (I work in hotels) but I think that since I do work in hotels, I look at this the way I want my guest to experience things. Here is what I found: 1) Called before I came in to make dinner reservations and was put on hold for 15 minutes 2) Made dinner reservations and wrote them down with the concierge 3) Went to check in (I am Priority Club Gold Member) and wasn't recognized, asked the agent for change and was told that she didn't have any 4) No mention of benefits for PC given to me at all 5) One room was large and the other was small (2 queens large and the king was small) 6) We found dirty cups on the top of the armoire and paperwork from weekend guests on the floor 7) Stained pillow cases 8) AC was broken and only read celcius (which we lived with) 9) Bathroom tile needed recaulking badly and the bathtub was scratched 10) asked several questions to the front desk and got misinformation 11) Went to dinner and our reservations were totally MESSED up In short, we had several problems and the rooms weren't great. If you have another option, stay somewhere else. On the plus side... we ate at Arnaurds and Emeril's Nola.... both great and the city tour was AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rojo1664
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was great. We stayed there the week before Mardis Gras. I have to laugh at some of the reviews here. The people are blaming the hotel for things that are happening all over New Orleans during Mardis Gras. One mentioned trying to check in during one of the parades, and wondered why it took hours! Canal St is one of the MAIN parade routes, and well Bourbon St is.....Bourbon St. It's closed each night, and most know what goes on on Bourbon St, and even more so Mardis Gras! The hotel is on the corner or Bourbon and Canal...... The location is great, close to everything. Then the people complaining about the view out their rooms into the shaftway at other rooms! That's the view we had too, and true, not the greatest we thought when we got there, but THINK about it, do you want a room facing BOURBON ST? Bourbon St is NOISY all night, be HAPPY you don't face it when you want to get some sleep! We were extremely happy after the first night that we had such a nice QUIET view of the airshaft. Slept woderfully, on what would otherwise be a NOISY street. The room was wonderful, small, but clean. The staff was great, room kept beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Madness at the Astor”
Reviews.Author: PatLouque
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Canal Street in New Orleans in the afternoon on the day before Mardi Gras and attempted to locate the valet parking area (the only type of parking available according to their website) of the Astor Crown Plaza. We saw nothing on the Canal Street entrance so figured it was either on the side or back entrance---and that's when the nightmare started. In bumper to bumper traffic, we had to go way past the hotel due to NO LEFT TURN SIGNS until we could cross over Canal Street to the side of the street of the hotel. We then attempted to enter the hotel's side street (Bourbon Street) that would lead to the side & back of the hotel where we assumed the valet parking was located only to find that Bourbon Street that ran along the side the hotel blocked to traffic as were the other side streets, so we circled again in bumper to bumper traffic to get to the front of the hotel& received permission from a policeman to travel the blocked street. There was no valet parking on either side or the baclk of the hotel, so we once again went to the front of the hotel. One of us jumped out in front & learned from the bellhops that they were no longer offering valet parking because all of their contracted spots were filled & that we had to park the car ourselves------5 blocks away on a not so safe side street that smelled like urine from the previous parade watchers. The check-in procedure was painfully slow seemingly because they were either shorthanded, undertrained, or unconcerned about the wait. Later, both the desk & housekeeping said they were on their way to deliver more towels & a blanket but never came after 2 calls. We had to wait until Canal Street was opened after the parade which was delayed about 4 hours to leave. The bellhop pushed our luggage while we walked five blocks to the parking garage. My oxygen supply had run out so the walk was very difficult for me. My complaint against the hotel is that they have been in that location for years for many Mardi Gras parades & should have informed us that the streets would close at a specific time, that valet parking was limited & what to do/where to go if arriving by car.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: uniter
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and had a two night stay here. I've got to say, I was really disappointed. I got a room on a mezzanine level - it had 20 foot high floor-to-ceiling windows that overlooked a garbage dump out back. There was constant noise from there at all hours of the night. The toilet was broken and the shower alternated between hot water for a while, then cold. Location-wise, this place is great ... it's got a door that opens to Bourbon St. And although customer service seemed distant at the front desk, when I called to let them know my flight had been cancelled and I'd be there a day later, I was not charged for the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money”
Reviews.Author: sthnchic
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, it cost $192.00 with our discount, I thought no big deal. Check in time was 4pm and check out time was 11am so I thought that was bit steep until I got to the hotel and found out that the price did not include anything, internet was an additional 9.95 and there was an extra charge for the safe, so we declined. The room had a king bed, a small tv in a cabinet and a small desk, the bathroom was also very small. To go around the bed only one person could walk around it at the same time. The air would not turn down so we were hot, also there was no view, if we opened our curtains we saw into another persons room. There was no parking which we figured would be the case however there was valet but it was 29.95 so we opted for parking that was a block down and it was only 10.00 a day. There was no complimentary breakfast, they did have a buffet but it was $10.95 a plate and the buffet was very small. Aside from all that we made the best of it until at 3:30am people started arguing outside our door and we had to call security because it was getting out of hand, well after 30min security finally came and settled the matter. However about 15min later they still continued to argue. So, I am never going to stay there again, if your single, dont need to sleep and have all the money to waste then this is the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Usually great,but not this time!”
Reviews.Author: barbiesmith
Reviews.Content: y family & I have stayed here for Mardi Gras for several years & it is a fantastic location. However, this year I had a big problem with a security issue. During Mardi Gras the hotel places a table at the entrance of the hotel & checks guest's arm-bands (which are issued at check-in to prevent non-guests from entering). On Saturday night I let my 19 year old son go meet his girl friend at a restaurant & told him to be home early. When he returned to the hotel he had his girlfriend with him & was told she could not enter the hotel unless she had an arm band & that he could purchase one for her at the front desk. My son told the big burly security guard "OK" , grabbed his girlfriend's hand and proceded to the front desk to buy her am arm band--- This is when the terror hit for my son! He was thrown up against the wall by two security guards (my son is 139 punds!). He told them that he was going to the desk to get his girlfriend a band- because the front desk workers have to apply it- He was physically thrown out of the hotel. The manager told him to come back later- SO, he sent my son out into the dangerous night of new orleans. They went to eat french donuts and came back. He was then told by the gaurds that he would not be allowed back in the hotel that night & sent my son to sleep on the street. My son was scared & he was scared to call me because he didn't want to bother me. When it started to get late, I called his cell phone. He told me the story & this little woman went down stairs to give those guys a peice of my mind. There were hundreds of drunk people coming in & out of that hotel; there was vomit in front of my door, people passed out in the lobby & they thought it was neccesary to use such force with my 139 lb child. They owe us an appology. There were 4 shootings the street over the night this happened. Thank God my son wasn't one of them. These people should have called me if there was a problem. They handled it poorly. Very poorly. Thank God my child is alive! Barbie Smith Monroe, LA

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: bmoretraveler50
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza. We didn't have any choice in booking the hotel as one of us was there for a business conference and this was the group hotel. Overall, our experience was good. Contrary to some of the reviews here, the staff we interacted with were extremely helpful and friendly. The first room we checked into had a mildewy smell to it so I went back to the desk and requested another room......only to end up w/ a room w/ mold in the shower and daddy-long legs in the corners of the high ceilings (too high up to get them down!). I went back downstairs to the desk again and instead of treating me like "that annoying guest" they were extremely apologetic and accomodating and upgraded my room. The hotel lobby is nice and the bartenders at the hotel bar were a very friendly bunch. We arrived pretty late on a weeknight and most of the sit-down restaurants in the French Quarter (I say "sit down" to differentiate between the dozens of bars along Bourbon St that serve pizza and hot dogs) were closed but the restaurant attached to the hotel was open. It wasn't the best meal we had while in New Orleans but it wasn't bad either. The hotel location was great - we happened to be there at Mardi Gras time and it was right on the parade routes and all the action on Bourbon St. It seemed to be a great location at any time of year - very close to the Magazine Street bus line if you want to catch that and go see the Garden District and the great shopping along Magazine Street. Bottom line is that we enjoyed our stay there. I guess you are naturally less picky when the hotel cost isn't coming out of your pocket but if I could get a decent rate here, I'd stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Charmed New Orleans Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cypressmom
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews on this hotel, I was skeptical. The location is excellent for Bourbon Street and if you did like our family a stay before a cruise. The hotel has an old southern charm to it. The rooms are nice with very comfortable beds. The safe is a nice size. We found the staff to be very nice and helpful. There was a gentleman who had problems and was creating a scene with abusive language to the manager. I think this would have been better if the gentleman did not try to drink Bourbon Street dry. My room was in the back and quiet. My daughter had a room acroos from us overlooking Bourbon Street and she said it was noisy at times. The hotel does have blinders and earplugs for free if you feel the necessity for them. I would recommend this hotel to anyone including families. There is a Krystal and McDonald's just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lane1729
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night; wonderful stay, great location. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but some negatives”
Reviews.Author: rg1traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early December 2007 at the end of a business trip to visit a friend. Great to see New Orleans coming back (although 9th ward and other areas still not fully recovered). Nice hotel and nice holiday decorations. Air conditioning in lobby not very good. Did not get the room I booked (and I am a priority club gold member!) nor did I get priority club welcome package. Night attendant who checked me in (arrived close to midnight) was not very friendly -- and I had to wait in line for almost 15 minutes (which is no fun when you've traveled all day and expect express treatment as a PC gold member) but he did change my room without difficulty when I asked. (Wanted smoking and was given nonsmoking, but had to go to room with luggage and come back downstairs on elevators with luggage (see below) to get room changed). New room (#311) was much larger (but very oddly shaped and kind of dark; sitting area nice, but two chairs would be better as a small loveseat) and air conditioning did not work. Worst problem was no internet at all (not wireless or even cable!) Had to go to lobby for internet. Elevators were horrible (they really need to fix the timing). Had to wait -- no kidding -- 10 minutes for an elevator on two occasions. Also, air conditioning was fixed when I called for an engineer. Bathroom was sub par. Amenities were minimal (like an average holiday inn) and, despite my asking for it, no bath mat in bathtub which made me feel as if I was going to fall every time I took a shower (not safe!). Otherwise, a good hotel. Right on corner of French Quarter, so good location. Also walking distance to Aquarium (Hurricane on the Bayou at IMAX theater at aquarium is a MUST SEE) and walking distance to casino. If elevators were working on a more normal, well-timed basis and if the bathroom amenities (including bath mat) were better, would be a 4+. But, for the price I paid, it is only a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Signs of Stress”
Reviews.Author: jayirwin
Reviews.Content: Although the French Quarter escaped much of the flooding after Katrina, the entire city is still reeling from the devastation it caused. This includes businesses in the French Quarter, which have been greatly affected by the fact that over 50% of the population has not yet returned to New Orleans. Understaffing is as big an issue to local businesses as rebuilding, it seems. I attended a conference held at the Astor Crowne Plaza in early December 2007. The room I stayed in was clean, comfortable and very generic. However, the hotel seems to be having some real difficulties. The restaurant was poorly staffed and no one seemed to know what they were doing. The hotel air conditioning system was totally messed up. Most of the meetings rooms were absolutely freezing, yet the humidity was incredibly high. That said, I would whole heartedly recommend a stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza. Even though there was a lot of disorganization the staff was incredibly nice, helpful and friendly. I got a very warm feeling from everyone I passed in the hall or approached for help. They really are trying to offer the best service possible given the very difficult circumstances they are continuing to face. Another observation: the French Quarter is loud and the Astor Crowne Plaza is right on Bourbon Street. If you're sensitive to noise this is going to be a problem. There were revelers and multi piece bands playing right outside the hotel until 4 am. This is of course what's fun about New Orleans for many. But if that isn't your thing, ask for a room near the top of the hotel. They do also provide earplugs to guests. Definitely consider visiting New Orleans. The city needs our tourist dollars to help recover.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it - if you like moronic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jumpfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, but has a staffing problem. I went to brunch for breakfast and had to get EVERYTHING - including beverages. Then the staff expects a tip for delivering a bill. I tried to check out early, and told the counter staff that I was voluntarily forfeiting the night's cost. All I wanted to do was close out my credit card for incidentals. They still wanted to assess me a $50.00 "early check-out fee" - despite the fact that I was not getting my money back for the night's stay! When I protested to the manager, he gave me a non-caring shrug of the shoulders and basically said there was nothing he could do. I just got notice from my trip organizer that someone on the billing staff apparently deleted some entries with my group's paperwork, and we could all be facing an additional $30.00 charge to our credit cards. Just like the rest of New Orleans, this place is a big scam designed to strip out-of-town folk from their money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a 4 star mystery hotel on Bookit.com. I was a bit concerned after reading negative reviews on here, but had the same experience in Boston this summer, and that turned out fine, so I was optimistic. Upon arrival, I learned my concerns were unfounded. The hotel was very nice, perfect location, and staff were all very friendly and helpful. We felt welcomed from the minute of our arrival, until the time we left. Our room was beautifully appointed, beds VERY comfortable, nice amenities. Noise was a concern expressed by others, but we experienced no noise whatsoever during our stay. In fact, there was a little gift bag in the room that had earplugs, an eye mask and lavendar pillow spray, which was a wonderful surprise. On our last of 3 nights, I called for a late check out, and they gave me 2 extra hours, which was great as we had a late flight out that day. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend the Astor Crowne Plaza to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CheesyHokie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights at the end of October. First off, it's a great location for the French Quarter, it's on Canal between Royal and Bourbon. You can't get much more convenient than that. We paid $174 a night as part of a conference rate and, personally, I found it a bit high, especially when I paid the same rate at the Sheraton for the last 4 nights of my stay. Check-in went fairly quickly although the Priority Club line was not staffed. I did get a goody bag as a Priority Club member which was a nice touch. The rooms are large and clean with all the standard amenities. However, the wallpaper was peeling in a couple of places, the shower grout was mildewed and the faucet in the bath dripped and leaked the whole time. I'd stay there again if I could get it for a lower price but at $175 a night I expect the property to be in a bit better shape. The few staff members we encountered were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.....”
Reviews.Author: lkn7427
Reviews.Content: ok...so i was skeptical about booking this hotel because the reviews of it were either were saying it was spectacular or horrible....our experience overall....was pretty good......the hotel was nice....not nasty or horrible like previous reviews.....for an older hotel....it is kept up well....the employees were oh so friendly....everyone smiled and greeted us....we tipped everyone from valet to the front desk to bell persons to housekeeping because they did in fact deserve it.....we checked in 6hrs earlier than the designated time and they had both of our rooms available....we booked our rooms through bookit.com's mystery hotel....it was a great deal.....the main problem i encountered was valet....they do not have a lot on site....so you had to wait a while to get your car....the first day we were able to call and have our car ready....but over the weekend, it was a good 15-30min wait for the car....which was a bit of a drag with a big group.....it was $25/day for valet plus tip which was pretty steep, but its right smack dab in the middle of the french quarter.....so that's a given.....So the whole experience was great....but one problem that makes it final for me to never stay here again....there was a rat in our room the last night....we saw it running around...and flipped out....who knows how long it had been there....we called front desk...and they offered us to change rooms....but then we saw the rodent run out....so we just decided to stay...but that pretty much ruined the last night there....i spoke to the front desk when i checked out...they said because i did not book directly with the hotel....they could not reimburse my money in any way....and my valet bill still had to be paid in full because apparently it's a seperate company from the hotel.....so they gave me guest relations' number....i spoke with her....she said she'll comp me for one night's stay if i use that within the next year...why would i stay in a hotel i know can't take care of a rodent problem......so i said no....so she said let her check what other options there are and she'll return my call.....almost 2 weeks later....she never called me...i called and spoke with the manager on duty....and he had her call me back...i was busy at work so her message said that she had been in meetings and it slipped her mind about the situation.....and she apologized....so now....she left another message...saying she'll credit me back my valet bill which was $111 for 4 nights for the room with rat......which is fine i guess....it just sucks that the experience had to end this way......but the employees were outstanding!! its just such a shame that such a nice hotel had a rodent problem.....

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: like2travl72
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay with my boyfriend at this hotel - 9/28/07 - 10/3/07. We took a chance and booked the "mystery hotel" deal through bookit.com. When I found out what hotel we were going to be staying at, I immediately started reading through all of the reviews I could find. Some of them scared me, and I was tempted to change our reservations - I'm so glad I didn't - this hotel was fantastic! We requested a non-smoking room on an upper floor, and got a room facing Canal St. on the 9th floor. We arrived early and checked in early with no problems. It was quiet, clean, and the bed was sooo comfortable. The water pressure was good, too, something I always appreciate. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat - this hotel is at the corner of Canal and Bourbon - walking distance to everything in the quarter. I would imagine that the rooms facing Bourbon would be louder, so I'd request a room facing Canal, or one on an upper floor if you want quiet. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza French Quarter!!!”
Reviews.Author: jackbnice
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza French Quarter!!! Everything about our stay was fantastic. We went during Mardi gra and had a blast. There was four of us and we all agreed that the location, people and cleanliness of the Astor Crowne Plaza was awesome. The manager himself carried our bags up to our room for us. I only have one complaint....... The balcony was off limits cause it was mardigra.... BUT even so had a wonderful time and would recommend this hotel to any and everyone.. Ronnie ....... Alvin TX

Reviews.Title: “Terrible from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: the_admiral_MB
Reviews.Content: This was my worst hotel stay ever. Hotwire should be embarrassed go carry this hotel. When I arrive the valet man start yelling at us. The we went inside and the manager didn't really care. He was to busy flirting with the female guests. We final got checked in and they put us in a room between the ice machine and the elevator so it was noisy all the time. The every morning at 8:00 AM housekeeping would knock. There were no "Do Not Disturb" signs. Then after telling htem to come back later. They would be back in 15 minutes. We final wrote a note on the door but they did not speak english to read it. Then one night we returned about 1:30 AM to crash and our neighbor left on his music really loud. We called downstairs and they replied "Sorry". We finally got someone to come turn it off about 2:30 AM. Then on checkout, there was yet another mess. Needless to say, I will not return. I explained how bad everything was when I left, they replied you will have to talk to hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza is fine, but beware of parking prices”
Reviews.Author: bogie27
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza in August 2007 for 2 nights. The hotel is clean, the rooms were comfortable. But make sure to ask for a high floor if you don't like the noise. This hotel is in the French Quarter not far from Bourbon Str and you can definitely hear the music and noise. We heard music up until 3 or 4am both nights of our stay, but it really didn't keep us from sleeping. We ate at Cafe Dumonde (don't think i'm spelling it correctly, but ask anyone and they'll know what your talking about), mostly for it's historic aspects. They serve the well-known beignets. Also, you must eat at Landry's. Yes, i know it's a chain restaurant that you can find in a lot of different states, but something about the one in the French Quarter just tastes better. Also, there is no on-site hotel parking. You have to leave your car with the valet and the price to have it valet'd is $27 per day plus tax and tips!!!! Yes, this was a big surprise to us. We were told that other hotels in the French Quarter charge roughly the same price. We thought a better idea would have been to park at one of the all night parking lots in the French Quarter for $10 to save $$$$. The difference is with the hotel, you have "in/out" privileges and it's the same price, whereas, if you park you car at one of the lots, once you leave, you have to pay again to re-enter!

Reviews.Title: “Location plus a bit o'history”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl96
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a small group and our rooms were lovely and comfortable and clean. Location of hotel is the best selling point. Lowest point? Check-in and valet service was extremely slow - it took at least a half hour in both cases.
