Setup of the hotel because it is multiple historic buildings melded together is a little strange - up and down steps plus narrow hallways to get to your room on the same floor. Plus the elevators are a little confusing - we were never quite sure where we would end up in the lobby/property. Would definitely recommend - we had no problems within the hotel/rooms whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CarolineSteele
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a Royal Caribbean International cruise on board Grandeur of the Seas in March 2007. The departure port we booked from was 'New Orleans'. We have always wanted to visit New Orleans and thought this would be a good opportunity. We booked the package through the Cruise Shop in Lisburn, in Northern Ireland. The Cruise ship was excellent and the food fabulous. We loved New Orleans. We stayed in 2 hotels in new Orleans. The first night was spent in the Hilton Hotel (which was excellent) then we went on our cruise. On return we spent a further 3 nights in the Astor Crowne Plaza - French Quarter. The Astor Crowne Plaza was easily the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The reception staff were rude, condesending and uninterested in customer service. On arrival we were booked in to an occupied room. When we opened the door via the key card we discovered a room full of personal possessions. The elderly couple who were staying in the room returned when we were standing in their room. Reception were very uninterested in their mistake and re-allocated us another room. During our 3 night stay our room was serviced at various times (even late afternoon), the pool was so cold and dirty we could not use it. The Jazz Music on Bourbon Street was so loud it was impossible to get any sleep. The music did not stop until 5am every morning. We booked an alarm call which we did not get. When we complained reception informed us that we had received the call but that we had obviously slept through it. We know that we did not get the call because we did not sleep at all during our stay. The most annoying thing about this hotel was the attitude of the reception staff. When we complained the Duty Manager Mr Craig Wells, he was rude to us. He arranged to meet us on the 4th Floor courtesy suite and did not turn up nor did he appologise. When we complained at reception we spoke to Eric DeJean who said he was the front of house manager. He sent a bottle of wine to our room the night before we were due to leave the hotel and seemed to think that made everything acceptable. I would never stay in this hotel again. Although I will definetly return to New Oreleans.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: 785susanw
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 2 children) stayed at the Crown Astor for two nights. The valet and front desk were courteous. Our room was clean and comfortable. The kids tried out the pool. It was very cold. This hotel was located on Canal at Bourbon streets. Therefore it was close to many attractions. We were on the 8th floor, but we still heard the bands and noise from Bourbon Street. It was not enough to keep us awake. The hotel does provide ear plugs if you need them. Overall we had a positive experience and would stay here again. A final note: I have seen other reviews on this site regarding the air conditioning. After some experimentation, we concluded that the AC has a motion sensor. When no one is in the room or we were asleep, it shut off. When we were in the room and were active the AC ran and it was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, nasty hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alabama3Meridian
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza was the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The room was hot, the tv was broken, at one point the commode wouldn't flush, and the playstation never worked. And those were the good things about the hotel! Cleanliness, or lack thereof, was the biggest problem. The comforter was dirty with makeup all over the top of it. Twice I had to call downstairs and get new towels and washcloths because they were not clean. For example, one night they had left only three washcloths for my family of four. One of the washcloths had red lipstick all over it, one had a small black curly hair in it, and one was clean. Another night, I unfolded/unrolled a towel to dry off my little girl and it had black streaks all over it. Nasty! Then, there's the issue of food...Don't trust the information book they leave in your room. It had a breakfast menu for the restaurant so we went to the restaurant to eat. There is no menu as a very expensive buffet is your only choice. The food was not good, but the worst part was that there was a dead bug floating in my son's apple juice. The waiter must be accustomed to this, as his response was minimal at best. In fact, he never brought us another drink--I finally just got up and got him some water. I have never left a negative review for a hotel, but this was just horrible! Stay away--anywhere has to be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: egrose
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Comfortable rooms, very spacious. Since this hotel is located on Bourbon Street, it is loud with all the bands. Just ask for a room that will be quieter. Overall I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ron_L_64
Reviews.Content: Great deal on Hotwire or BookIt. Hotel was very nice, excellent location. Nice bar adjacent. I did not use any services so cannot comment there, but room was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: neilohendo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with the best seafood bar I have ever been to. The staff are exceptional from the manager right down the the waiting staff. We arrived and the computers at reception were down. I asked the manager if he'd let us have a few drinks to pass the time. He said yes was very friendly and chatty and took us into the seafood restaurant and introduced us to the staff. Beds and rooms were huge and there was a safe and pleasant atmosphere. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJlawgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through BookIt as a Mystery Hotel for a reasonable rate. Can't recall what the rate was but we came in to N.O. on Saturday, June 16 and were able to speedily check into our room at around 12:00 noon. Front desk personnel were very friendly. Room was nicely furnished and there were 2 queen size beds and a nice sized refrigerator with a microwave on top. We were on the 6th floor of the hotel. Loved the fact that they had a pool and actually used it for a couple of hours on Saturday. Would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel...are you kidding?”
Reviews.Author: Marks_girl_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have never been to New Orleans. We were only going to be there for one night so i thought we would go all out and stay right on Bourbon St. We were arriving about 9 pm so it was dark and left the directions at home. We call the front desk (while on our way into the city) and after being put on hold for 10 minutes on 3 different times, we are now on the other side of the city. The lady who answered the phone had no idea where the hotel was located. She kept saying "Find the business district". We have no idea where that is. We went to a gas station and asked and they got us there. It's now 10pm and we try to valet park. We sat in front of the hotel for 20 minutes while the valet guys chatted and talked on their phones, again we don't know where to park. They finally graced us with the privilege of paying about $30 a day for the valet. We go inside to check in and stood in line for another 45 minutes because there was only one person behind the counter but there are 20 people checking in. We get to our room which was okay, but the AC was off. We turn it down to about 70 to get it nice and cool by the time we get back from the bars. We return to the room about 4 am to find that the ac not on. It was sooooo hot and stuffy, but i will admit we were too messed up to call the front desk to stay up even later to wait for them. In the morning, housekeeping woke us up at 8am. Since we got to the room at 4am, i was not happy to be woken up. They walked in the room! Never a knock, nothing. I yelled "get out" and the lady yells "well next time put the do not disturb sign out" i yell "next time knock". There was never an "oh I'm sorry" or anything, just yelling. The lady returned at 10:30, this time with a knock and said, "you only have 30 minutes until check out" What is she my mother. I'll pay the extra fee if i have to for checking out late. I have never had someone tell me when to leave a room. I'm a paying guest, don't talk to me like that. We told the lady at the desk about the AC and she said "oh you should have called when you first got to the room and we could have moved you". Well it was 10pm, we wanted to go out and we didn't know it wasn't working, it was just turned off. I've had better stays at Holiday Inn's and payed about $150 bucks less a night

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: LegalGoldenEagle
Reviews.Content: I am discouraged at Hotwire. It usually provides accurate star ratings for hotels, but this one was way off the mark. When I booked, the hotel got a 4.5 star rating. I think a three star rating is more accurate. The bad: The air conditioning unit in our first room wouldn't work properly. It was set on 74 when we first got there. We set it for 66 so it would cool down fast, but it never got below 72. In fact, it would cool for about fifteen minutes, then shut off. The toilet stopped up and they never fixed it. A lamp didn't work. Our room was right next to the elevator and it was noisy all night. The pool was tiny, and had the same consistency and color as a puddle of mystery liquid on Bourbon Street. In our second room, supposedly a non-smoking room, you could smell smoke, and the comforter had two cigarette holes in it. Parking, even for New Orleans, was high. Our view in both rooms consisted of a concrete wall or parking garage. The good: When requested, they quickly moved our room with no problem. The air conditioner actually began working (at midnight) in our second room. Water pressure in sink and shower was good. Location was great. Not much else. I would not recommend this hotel, even for the Hotwire amount we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Total Comfort at the Edge of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: redeco
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at the Astor Crowne Plaza as part of a large tour group with Premier World Discovery. Like most Crowne Plaza properties, this hotel offers good service and attention to detail. I found the porters at the front door particularly helpful. The front entry on Canal Street is quite grand with lofty ceilings and iron and crystal chandeliers. The interior can be confusing because there is a main hotel building with its own elevator and a smaller wing with separate access. My room was in the smaller wing and totally comfortable. Towels were fluffy and plentiful, water pressure and hot water excellent. Beds comfortable and wake-up calls worked like a charm. Climate control was good, which is important in New Orleans. I had the opportunity to use the restaurant and the bar that is attached to the hotel and fronts Bourbon Street. Both were excellent. Room service was good and on time. However, I recommend the world famous Acme Oyster House around the corner for a bit of New Orleans color. The oysters are fresh and the gumbo is terrific. Location is just on the edge of the French Quarter...everything is within easy walking distance and cabs are plentiful at the front of the hotel. Harrah's Casino is about a five block walk down Canal Street. The neighborhood felt completely safe. I'd stay here any time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Astor”
Reviews.Author: manddcole
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza in New Orleans, LA. The hotel is magnificent and we experienced an incredible stay. We stayed on the 4th floor with an executive club. We ate a continental breakfast with fruit, french pastries, cereal, milk, coffee, etc. During the afternoon, wine and beer, cokes are freely available along with hot hor de vours, fruit, etc The roof top pool is lovely'; my child is 9 and played with three other children, 11, 12 and 13, while I enjoyed the hot tub. The pool attendant was wonderful stocking a large tower full of towels. The health club has a large room full of equipment. along with a shower, etc. Restaurants in the French Quart are some of the greatest places to eat in the world. The Bourbon House is right inside the hotel and we ate there for dinner and lunch.. We paid $69 per night for a room on the club level which we got through BookIt as a "mystery hotel." Needless to say, it was the most excellent value for a "six chandler hotel." We got two rooms, king size beds with the most luxurious linens I've every slept in! Perhaps the best part was the location. On the corner of Canal Street and Bourbon, it is the most convenient to the Canal St. street car, the bars, shops, and restaurants in the French Quarter. Overall, it was the most awesome hotel stay I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeathLA2LA
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The location can't be beat. It was right in the heart of everything. Bourbon Street and Canal. There are great restaurants and clubs, right outside your door. I am very particular about the rooms I stay in. The rooms were not the Ritz by any means...but definitely nice. The staff was very nice...total southern charm. We were originally placed in a room that was smoking, We requested a non-smoking room and they very graciously assisted us. I will stay there again on my next trip to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Price too”
Reviews.Author: Chonkyfire
Reviews.Content: I just got back from New Orleans after staying at the Astor Crowne Plaza for 3 nights for business. Our organization booked a block of rooms there but I could have chosen to stay at another hotel if I really wanted to. I'm pleased that I did end up at the Astor. The location is great with the side door right on Bourbon St. and the staff were friendly and helpful. Some of the reviewers have pointed out trays left out in the hallways for long periods of time and empty vending machines as post-Katrina observations - unfortunately that is still the case but it wasn't too big a deal for me. Lots of places are still understaffed down there so I can temper my expectations slightly. The hotel seemed to be reasonably occupied and I ended up staying on the 13th floor with a great view of Bourbon St. I was a little disappointed in the fitness area but they supposedly offered the option of working out at other nearby facilities for a reduced guest rate. I was usually too busy working or hanging out nearby to care though. In the end, if the price is right I would stay here again for business unless a complimentary breakfast was included (I know, I know, there are definitely plenty of good places to eat around here but its the convenience that always appeals to me.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Astor”
Reviews.Author: flavere
Reviews.Content: I won a 3 night stay at the Astor. Upon check in there was a delay because the desk person did not know how to process the certificate I had. I waited for a manager, Denise who was able to process it and was able to help with several other concerns that I had. The hotel is in an excellent location, right at Bourbon and Canal streets. Walk out the door onto Bourbon street or walk out the other door on Canal and get on a trolly. If you stay in one of the executive floors there is a complimentary continental breakfast in the morning and a cocktail party in the afternoon. Excellent hor derves. Brennan's Bourbon House restaurant is right in the building and Dickie Brennan's steak house right around the corner. Walk to hundreds of other restaurants and bars. Normal shopping on Canal, including a Walgreen's right across the street. Only one drawback I found to this hotel is no internet access from the smoking floor. Otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: CKCsmile
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! There was a group of approx. 12 people and we all stayed at the hotel and loved it! Great location, clean beautiful rooms. The beds were comfy. Location was perfect. Staff was very nice. The valet parking was a plus. Had my car ready and in front of the hotel when I got ready to leave. The only complaint I have would be that our room key did not work on 3 different occasions and required us to go back downstairs several times. This will now be my hotel of choice while in New Orleans (this was my 3rd trip in 5 weeks)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mysticks1
Reviews.Content: This was our "mystery hotel" booked through an online agency. For the price that we paid it was a great room. The location is wonderful with the side door opening directly onto Bourbon St. I thought the room was a little small in comparison to other rooms that I have stayed in but you don't go to New Orleans to spend time in your room. The room was very clean when we arrived. The room that we received was a corner room on the 11th floor facing Canal St. which had a good view but being in that location there was a lot of street noise in the hours before dawn such as buses and traffic. If we were to stay there again I would request a room away from the street which should be much quieter. Everyone that we dealt with was very helpful and friendly. The wait for our vehicle from the valet was only about 10 minutes. I would consider this hotel to be a good choice for a stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Shame”
Reviews.Author: Legalsax
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Astor probably a half-dozen times over the last 3 or 4 years since it originally opened. Our last stay was in the summer of 2005 pre-Katrina. It has always been an excellent top-notch experience. 4-stars all the way. Unfortunately... it has not recovered from Katrina. We took a cruise out of New Orleans for Spring Break last week. The couple who were traveling with us wanted us all to stay over an additional night and got on Priceline to book a one-night stay. We were thrilled when they told us they got the Astor for $85.00. Our previous stays had been at least $135.00 a night and up. Now we see why they price is so cheap. Getting to the hotel after dis-embarking the ship just before noon, the Valet was helpful in getting us parked. Valet parking at the Astor has always been a nightmare so it was a pleasant surprise to get parked quickly and efficiently. That was the end of the improvements at the Astor. Our rooms were ready even though it was before Noon. We soon learned that the reason was that most of the hotel was almost vacant. They were apparently only using a few floors of the building. They had no bellmen on duty apparently and after waiting 20 minutes to get our luggage brought up, one of the management was kind enough to bring it up himself. Otherwise our luggage would have sat unattended indefinitely in the entrance to the hotel on Canal. Our room was clean enough but the wear and tear was evident. Very much changed from our last visit in '05. Stains on the carpet and bed covers. Generally dusty not quite "right". Yes, we found mouse trap strips under the beds but no mice thankfully. The room was hot and the air worked minimally eventually cooling down during the night. The hallway was full of room service trays... some from breakfast, and then later on lunch and dinner. When we went to bed around 10pm, they still hadn't been picked up (including the breakfast trays). As someone else pointed out, no wonder they have a rodent problem! The kids wanted to swim so we headed to the pool. The pool and workout area seemed unchanged. I went to grab a soda out of the machine there on the third floor which read sold out. I went to another machine on another floor... also "sold out". Another floor- same thing. And another. I saw a woman who appeared to be with housekeeping and asked about the coke machines all being empty. She mumbled something about them "going fast" and said I should try on the upper floors. I went up to the 14th floor where the machine said it had drinks but wouldn't take a $1 bill. Back down to the 13th floor and BINGO! A machine that had drinks and took my money. It even spit out two cokes! BONUS--- after only half an hour of trying to buy a Coke!!! If you want to be creeped out, go to the upper floors of the Astor. They are apparently unused any more. It was like being in the Shining. We got up and left the next morning so I can't comment on how housekeeping performs but I expect it was on par with the dirty trays in the hall and the empty Coke machines. I tried to guess occupancy based on the number of USATodays laying in front of doors. We were on the 5th floor and maybe a third of the rooms had papers laying out. It's clear that the hotel is being run on a skeleton staff. What a shame. Crowne Plaza should be so much better than this!!! This used to be our favorite hotel in the Quarter. We'll now stay far away from the Astor until we start seeing regular consistent good reviews on TripAdvisor over a period of time. Very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: heathork
Reviews.Content: My parents, my husband and I recently stayed over St. Patricks Day. We chose this hotel because of the ameneties and the $$. I usually stay at the Bourbon Orleans or the Royal Sonesta and this did not come close. We arrived on Friday 3-16 and proceeded to check-in. My mother is a travel agent and booked this room pre-paid ahead of time. Although when we checked in they tried to charge us again and could not understand that the room was pre-paid even tho we had travel documents showing that it was. This was only aminor setback. We got to the room and it was fine, small but no smaller than most rooms in the quarter. The temperature in the room was a sweltering 79 degrees, very uncomfortable. We switched on the A/C and headed out for the night and hoped it would be cooler by the time we returned later that evening. This was not the case. I was only down to 76 degrees by the time we arrived back at the hotel. We called the front desk and we were told that maintenance would come up and fix this problem. They eventually showed up very late in the night after we had all been asleep for a while (it was many many hours later). The next morning I noticed there was only one washcloth in the room for 4 people. We asked the housekeeping staff to leave more but they said no. The hotel was very very busy which was understandable for the weekend but no special attention was paid to customer service. I was looking for the business center to print my boarding passes and I was told "Its over there" and pointed across the room. This is not very explanitory. It took me 20 mins roaming around the building asking various workers to finally find this center. It was an ok hotel, customer service could have been improved but if my other favorites we already booked, I may try here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price- Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tandjc
Reviews.Content: Got the great rate through Bookit.com. Spring Break at a 4star hotel in the French Quarter for $79/night? Score. Amazing location. Nice room. Semi-friendly staff. Did I mention location? Nice amenities- internet, pool, hot tub. My only complaint is that the room service trays were left in the hall for hours at a time (can't they come back for these??)-- this contributed, I think, to the fact that there was a mouse in our room on the 4th night we were there. I told the desk and they just said "We'll report it." Not a sorry or anything. The whole city smells bad, but that's not the hotel's fault:)

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Bayoululu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during mardi gras. Stayed on the 4th floor (on 4, but close to the 4M elevator landing). Room was small - but normal for any historic downtown hotel - and very comfortable. Staff was overworked but excellent. Ice machine on our floor was broken, but running up to the 5th floor for ice wasn't a big deal. Noise from Canal was minimal. Given all Nola's been through and the slow recovery efforts, the hotel is in good shape. Given the short supply of staff, the hotel took very good care of us. Staff was pleasant even dueing the busiest times - and Mardi Gras can get very chaotic! 24 hr room service is back up and running. Valet does take a while - but just plan accordingly and call ahead 15-20 min. Can't beat the hotel's location! I would highly reccommend this hotel, especially at the current great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jamison
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through bookit.com and was a little worried after some of the negative comments posted. I got such a great rate, though, that I figured how dreadful could it be? The Astor was a very pleasant surprise. We arrived early and were warmly greeted and granted an upgrade to the club floor ( thanks Desmond!) . Our room was very large, immaculate and offered a great view of Canal Street. The bed was divine and I think had the most pillows of any hotel I have stayed in. The club room was a nice respite in the afternoon after racing through the French Quarter. Our hostess was very pleasant and the variety of beer, wine and snacks were very good. Breakfast was also more than adequate. It's an excellent choice for location, value and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Service”
Reviews.Author: texasredtop
Reviews.Content: The valet service took my vehicle for a little 23-24 mile joy ride. You pay over $25 a day for valet service and their employees use your vehicle like it was their own. I have been staying there once a year for many years but never again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at the Astor...”
Reviews.Author: ju123
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a 2 night stay at the Crowne Plaza in New Orelans through a mystery property deal on [--]. We knew we would get this hotel as someone had already mentioned it on Tripadvisor. We arrived after a very long transfer through traffic from the airport and were impressed from the outside, although there were a lot of roadworks around the area. When we were walking up to reception it was clear that this hotel was still in the process of repairs following Katrina. However following a smooth check in we headed up to our non smoking room. The room itself was great, with no smell of smoke which seems to be the main gripe with a lot of reviews on here. The king bed was amazing, as was the bathroom area...it felt very 4 star and but for a few scuffs on the carpet could have been close to approaching 5 star standards. The location is great. Just around the corner from Bourbon Street, although that can of course work for and against people as it can get loud during the evenings. In fact you can walk to all the local tourist attractions in about 10-15mins. As for the city itself obviously New Orleans is trying to attract tourists back and it will take some time to get over the Katrina problems. We found the city to be almost suspended in time, people were trying to have a good time on Bourbon but it just didn't seem right. All in all we liked the hotel, and if you fancy a few nights exploring this, shall we say, somewhat different city then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel would offer the best of southern hospitality. I couldn't have been more mistaken. The property is pleasant, but the employees are rude and arrogant. There is no sense of cordial-ness or even an effort to make sure "the guest comes first." It is nearly impossible to reach a manager, and when I eventually did, platitudes were all I got. The front desk receptionist is rude and has the annoying habit of cutting me off in mid-sentence and constantly interrupting. No one seems to much care about the satisfaction or comfort of the guest. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tried it ...not impressed”
Reviews.Author: don viajero
Reviews.Content: Being a customer of the moderate price motels, I was looking forward to a 4 start hotel. One of my brothers picked it as the hotel that our three families would stay while visiting our youngest brother, sister-in-law and the new baby in New Orleans. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room had two queen beds and were quite comfortable. Though a non-smoking room, it a had a lingering odor of smoke. The closet space was adequate for a three night stay. The bathroom was definitely more upscale: ceramic tile floors, granite-top sink; and upscale water fixtures. Towels and complimentary toiletries were restocked daily. The room temperature was a bit cool even though the "stat" was set at 71 degrees. We didn't eat at the on-site restaurant preferring to take in the local eateries. What took away from the experience was the swivel mirror in the bathroom was broken; a large electrical panel-- 1' x4' which is tacky in and of itself -- had fallen off its hinges; and to get your car you had to wait 15 min. or more while the valet literally ran a couples of blocks to get it for you. Minor details would be the gouged-out frame of the full length mirror; having to go to another floor to purchase a soda because our floor was "sold out" (who was buying it, I don't know because we saw very few people going and coming); not getting a requested wake-up call the morning of our departure. Call me cheap, but there wasn't even a mini-fridge or stocked fridge in the room. We got a complimentary paper delivered to our door only once. And there was no free, room wireless. However, there was a "business center" to fax, internet access, etc. It wasn't the worst experience I've had, but I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible time at the Astor Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: like2travelWa
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews before staying here & thought they were harsh. Unfortunately, the reviews were true. I stayed here 11/27-12/1/06 for work & had a terrible time. The hotel lobby was nice; hotel staffs were OK. The hallway has a mold/mildew smell & the carpet was old. I went to my room and could not open the door. I noticed there were dishes outside, so either the room was occupied or the hotel staffs have not cleaned the hallways. As I entered into the 2nd room, there was a disgusting smell (vomit & smoke); I had requested non-smoking room. So on the 3rd try, the room they gave me was much better. It was on the same floor as the Priority Club lounge (4th floor). There is only valet parking at this hotel; it cost $28. Vallet takes approximately 15mins to get your car. My 3rd day, it took over 45mins to get my car. Every time I asked about my car, the valet person told me it was coming. I told them that I could have walked to my workplace in 20mins instead of waiting for my car. They told me that they will not charge me for that day. I decided that I won't be using their valet service again. I ended up using another parking place; this was right behind the hotel ($20/night) and it took them 5 mins to get my car. When I returned to the hotel that night, again, I could not open my door. I went to the registration counter & was told that they checked me out already (Thurs.); I had a reservation til Friday. While waiting for the hotel staffs to sort out the issue, I spoke to other hotel guests nearby. Apparently these guests were having problems with their reservation; the hotel did not have rooms for them. At checkout on Fri, they charged me an extra day of parking. After trying to explain to the staff that I wasn't currently parking there and the guy was clueless, I gave up and left. I had a terrible time at this hotel & I don't recommend this hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: cjval
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. I realize that there are still some clean-up and service issues, but the ones here were not hurricane-related. The hotel was dirty and our non-smoking room smelled strongly of smoke. My mother's non-smoking room was a bit cleaner and did not smell smoked-in. The service was at best, mediocre. I would not choose this hotel again. There are many, better places to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: cupcake2
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! Even had we paid full price, the value was there. This hotel is located at the corner of Bourbon and Canal, very convenient. The room was wonderful. We were put on the executive floor for no extra charge. This included free drinks and appetizers from 5-7 in the evening and a light breakfast from 7-10 in the morning. The room was very clean and the bed was extra comfortable. The staff could not have been better. I have no reservations in recommending this hotel. At bookit.com the hotel is listed as a mystery hotel for $69. If you are going to New Orleans, this is the place. The Bourbon Street restaurant in the hotel is incredible. We ate there two nights because it was so good.

Reviews.Title: “A mercifully kind review”
Reviews.Author: JJHMI
Reviews.Content: My 4 day stay at the Astor Crown Plaza involved conflicting emotions: on the one hand it is really hard to beat up on a hotel which is struggling to come back from Catastrophe, while on the other hand there are certain minimum standards of "hotel civility" which are hard to ignore in the breach. The ultimate "bottom line" is the price/value ratio --- in my case the rock bottom prices of the room --- avg $136 - $150 per nite (plus characteristic 18% tax + $2.00/nite surcharge) still made the hotel very, very competitive with just about anywhere else in the U.S. I refuse to "criticize" the Astor Crown which obviously has staffing and service issues; rather I will make "gentle suggestions" which will make things more comfortable for guests: 1. Can you provide working ice machines on any other than the 4th floor? 2. Can you furnish edible room service (filet/chicken entrees were totally substandard) ? 3. Can you provide fresh towels (no add'l towels after 2 requests). 4. Can you, please, please fix the dripping faucet in the bath tub? I missed NOLA last year because of Katrina. I was delighted to return and urge others to do likewise. It is still a great City. The Astor NOLA is a great bargain... only because the rates are so darn cheap, I will probably book there again ! JJH p.s. Antoines and Commanders Palace back in full stride and worth the trip by themselves !

Reviews.Title: “The details leave a lasting impression”
Reviews.Author: shootout
Reviews.Content: For the price I was not impressed. After checking into our room, within 5 minutes another guest entered our room, they were given the same room. There was an swarm of ants in our room, after locating a phone in our room that worked I called housekeeping regarding the matter. They arrived and sprayed Raid over the entire bathroom , to the point that I had to spend time cleaning the Raid from counter top and floor. Went to get ice, our floors ice machine was broken. We decided to order room service,when the bill arrived the menu item had a price increase of 52%. I called to inquire as to the difference, "you must have an old menu", I asked when did the menu change, "April 2006" , the hotel adjusted the food bill by 20%, but did not honor the old menu price. When checking out we discovered a prior guests trash under the beds, so much for housekeeping. If you must visit New Orleans I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Epitomy of 5-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: watreal
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I have been to. We stayed in a Hotel in New Orleans a week earlier and it was nothing compared to the service and appearance of the Astor. The exquisite staff was top-notch. Valet was top notch. I had the privilege of being helped by 2 of the finest employees i have ever encountered. Ms. Keyana and Jamie were The Best of the Best. I will be sure to re visit the Astor on my future trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip to New Orleans and Loved the Astor Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: ruz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a business trip to New Orleans and stayed for three nights at the Astor Crowne Plaza. We had a terrific experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. I had a king room that faced Canal Street, but didn't notice any noise problem. My room was on the 4th floor (Executive Club floor) and the room was in excellent repair--clean and smelled pleasant. Everything worked (hair dryer, alarm clock, temperature control). I used the onsite exercise facility. The door lock wasn't functioning the first morning I tried to use the room, so I called from the phone near the elevators and the front desk sent someone up immediately to fix the problem. I definintely would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty lobby, okay rooms, inconsistent service made for a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza in New Orleans for a conference. I would have given this hotel a higher rating, had it not been for an unbelievably uncomfortable encounter with the front desk manager who was so rude and unprofessional, I sent a letter to the general manager (the first time I have ever done such a thing). Basically, there was confusion about the charge for Internet services in the hotel's business center. My classmate, without asking, got her fee waived by this manager, since she (as many of us) had to post an assignment for class. My classmate encouraged me to ask the front desk manager for the same waiver, since I also had to post an assignment. I guess I caught the manager in a bad mood, because she laid into me about expecting the same thing that another guest had (she actually said "If you overheard me comp a room for a guest, I suppose you would expect a free room too?"). I was shocked, and asked her to explain what the difference was, since we were doing an assignment for the same class. She said "we are not a consistent business, and if I want to waive a fee for someone who is polite, I will do so." I've worked in retail for years, and I know when people are being rude or impolite, and I was certainly not. She then called the Business Center and said "I have a guest here who wants to use the Internet for free. I WAS going to give it to her, but now she's just arguing with me." First of all, that was a lie--she told me flat-out that she would not waive the fee for me. And, arguing I was not doing. I don't like to draw attention to myself, nor do I complain about service. Her unprofessionalism was so egregious, however, that I felt personally insulted and wanted an answre that made sense, customer service-wise. I feel as though this front desk manager meted out such waivers as the whim struck, and grew angry when I caught her in several lies about why she waived the fee for my classmate (she said, at one point, that my classmate's laptop was broken, which would be acceptable, had my classmate owned a laptop or borrowed one, which she did not). It was one of those situations in which you cannot believe things are unfolding as they are. This woman, the front desk manager, seemed to delight in making me beg and actually smirked when I cried (she really upset me). It was disgusting, and I am sharing this experience with anyone I know who travels. Since my letter to the hotel has not been responded to, I feel this is my only recourse. As for the hotel itself, please read on: Upon arrival, our group encountered nice, but very confused front desk clerks. Our group of 12 had been reserved in 4 rooms through our professor, and the front desk clerks were unable to figure out who was assigned to which room. In fact, they couldn't retrieve my professor's reservation. They gave a room to four of my peers, who moved their luggage in and began taking turns in the shower. When my professor arrived (30 minutes later), the confusion was cleared up by the front desk manager. However, the four women who had been assigned a room and moved in had to move out and go to the correct room (since the front desk clerk did not give them the right one). The rooms themselves were ok, though the promised queen size beds were full-size. We were missing some key items in the room, including a bath mat for the shower, and we were given those very quickly. We did notice, though, that the daily room cleanup did not include any dusting, so the coffeepot, end tables, and desk had a pretty gross layer of dust the entire time we stayed there. I did not get a chance to use the concierge services, on-site restaurant, or fitness center, so I cannot comment on those. I highly recommend choosing another hotel on Canal Street other than Astor Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean room”
Reviews.Author: cpdh
Reviews.Content: I can't say much about the restaurant, bar, work out room, or other amenities of the Astor Crowne Plaza, and I'm not certain it's yet fair to judge New Orleans hotels by strict standards. What I can say is that the five nights I spent there last month were entirely comfortable. Our room overlooked Bourbon Street, but the noise was minimal - whether that reflects on lighter traffic on Bourbon Street, I don't know. The beds were delightful. I slept deeply each night thanks to the good mattresses, pillows, and linens. When I first walked in the room, I noticed how tidy and attractive it was. A basic room, but it had a look of better quality beddings that was appealing. Yes, service at the hotel is shaky, but I think many places in New Orleans are having difficulties still with filling positions with experienced staff. My real quibble: $10 a day for Internet connection. I cannot understand why hotels do not offer wireless or in room connection as a standard "free" amenity. New Orleans has a long way to go in many ways and in many areas, but the Crowne Plaza seems to be getting on track quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient With Some Glitches”
Reviews.Author: DocPsych
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Astor Crowne Plaza for two nights while on business. Located on Canal Street just around the corner from Bourbon Street, the Astor is ideal for the tourist who wants to experience the French Quarter via a short walk. The Astor staff was friendly and cordial, including the desk clerk who asked me what type of room I preferred (a king or two full-size beds). She honored my request for a king bed on a high floor. I had a room on the top (14th) floor, which helped control noise from the constantly busy Canal Street. The room itself was quite adequate, a standard size room with a desk and USB computer hookup. The hotel "conveniently" posts no information in the room about the $9.95 + tax charge for the use of their high-speed internet access (a window pops up once you connect to the internet, requiring you to agree to its terms and charge. The bed and bedding were quite comfortable ,one of the best hotel mattresses I have ever slept on. Just as another poster experienced, a light bulb was missing from one of the nightstand lamps. I discovered the hair dryer in the bathroom did not work and reported it at the front desk. The cordial desk clerk replied that he would have it looked into right away. The dryer was not fixed until I took on the job myself out of sheer necessity the next day. While the hotel is a good bet for tourists, I do have one strong suggestion for those with children (including teens): Do not take your children to Bourbon Street. It's sleazier than ever and is most inappropriate for impressionable youth. I can party as hearty as anyone and have liberal veiws, but Bourbon Street has virtually no limits. Wandering drunk tourists, women openly flashing their breasts for some cheap beads, t-shirts for sale with the most vulgar words possible emblazones on them, and posters of nearly nude women in suggestive poses advertising live sex shows. Yet, I saw several families wandering Bourbon Street. Leave the kiddos at home if you intend to cruise on Bourbon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a nice place to stay for our first trip back to New orleans since last jazz Fest. Went with our two young kids and my mother (5 total). The staff was very friendly and helpful....from the doormen to the bell staff and esp. the front desk and concierge. The rooms are great...with the only exception that we had to ask them to reinstall a fire detector that had been removed by a previous tenant. But the beds were very comfortable with a nice view. The room service menu was not initially in the room but everything was fixed upon speaking to management on the first night. The room service food is pretty good. You do have to valet your car but they are pretty quick at retrieving it for you. They say to call ahead but most times we were instructed by a message to go down to the front to request the car so just fair warning. New Orleans has a far way to go in the recovery but do not hesitate in visiting this town. The Zoo is open as is Cafe du Monde and a few other places which seem the same. Prepare yourself that a great deal of the small businesses have found it hard to stay open. The city is in need of tourism and economic boost. The French Quarter has a few changes, of course, but it was great to feel like there is a future for this great city that has given so much to its travelers. enjoy the bar and restaurant and fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “Getting cleaned”
Reviews.Author: edboogie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Crowne Plaza on Apr 25th. The location cant be beat at the corner of Bourbon and Canal. I was a little worried about noise so I requested a high floor and a quiet room. We actually wound up with a room that faced a small inside courtyard on the fourth floor. It was extremely quiet. The front desk staff was very nice. The second, third and fourth floors actually have 2 levels. One is called the mezzanine level and it is seperated from the other floor by about 8 steps in the hallway. It took us a couple of times to figure out we wanted 4M and not 4 in the elevator. It is all by room number. The lobby was for the most part vacant and I didnt see anyone lounging around. The hallways are all getting caulked so they can get a coat of paint. And the carpets were getting ripped up to replace or clean them. They really needed it. This didnt pose a real problem and I assume when the work is done it will be very nice. Our room had a 16 foot high cieling and was clean and comfortable. The light in the bathroom was rather dim and one light bulb from the light on the nightstand had been stolen. We did have some trouble with housekeeping. The first morning they showed up at 8 am and wanted to clean because they thought we were checking out. There was no do not disturb sign for us to put out. We said we were not checking out and asked them to come back later. We went out for the day and came back at 5 pm and still had not been serviced. We called the front desk who called housekeeping and it was done an hour later. We had the same lack of service the next day and at 3:30 pm had to request to have our room serviced. The sleep amenities were nice and each bed had 7 or 8 pillows on it. It was very comfortable. The room didnt get alot of sunlight because of the small courtyard it faced. The bath amenities were very nice. Several restaurants have limited menus or times. The Napoleon House is only open for lunch. Some places ran out of food, but for the most part everything we ate was good. If you like bbq at all you really need to try Zydeque, a cajun bbq place at Bourbon and Iberville, out standing. Also glad Red Fish Grill was as good as always. Pat OBriens no longer has popcorn. Had terrible wait staff service at Bacco, which ruined our meal. Once the hotel public areas get cleaned up and the housekeeping staff gets back to normal this would be an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with Astor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had booked in for Mardi Gra. Our room was basic. The door to the bathroom was hard to close. The hairdryer didn't work. As we had a long trip we slept in on our first day. We left the room at 1.30pm - after taking down the "Do not disturb" sign. We came back after 5pm and the room hadn't been made up. Rang house keeping and they promised it would be done by the night shift, we asked for fresh towels to be delivered in the meantime to we could shower and go back out - half an hour later we were still waiting. They were delivered within 5 minutes after a second call to house-keeping. The woman who delivered the towels was apologetic and assured us our room would be made up that night. We got back after midnight and nothing had changed. Spoke to the manager and he said that if Do not Disturb signs were left on the door after 1pm the room wouldn't get made up - and he denied everything the housekeeping people had told us. I pointed out there was nothing in the room that indicated there would be no house keeping service after a certain period of time - he didn't care. Next day we were out by 10 am - room hadn't been serviced by 3.30pm - rang housekeeping and was assured it would be done - which happened an hour later. Couldn't figure out if our room was serviced in late afternoon , why couldn't it have been done at the same time the previous day? The last day in the hotel - we had been out since morning and came back after 5pm - the room had not been touched. Rang house keeping - they said they would get back to me. Left a message on the General Managers mobile phone then 10 minutes later 4 staff turned up to clean the room. By this time we couldn't be bothered dealing the hotel manager. Also had a problem with room service - went to order from the room service menu and was told it wasn't available - they had to send the temporary menu up. We had planned to watch the evening parades from our room with what appeared to be a nice dinner on the standard menu. Couldn't get what we wanted on the temporary menu so spoke to the Manager and he blamed the previous guest for removing the temporary menu. I suggested housekeeping should be ensuring each room had one. He gave us dinner free - it was served up on plastic plates and cover with plastic food wrap - anything fried was soggy and most food was not eaten. If we had known the standard menu wasn't available we would have gone to decent restaruant before the parades started. There would have been no complaints if they had simply ensured their restrictions and changes were clearly advertised in the room. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: cousteau8
Reviews.Content: I was not prepared to pay pre-katrina prices for post-katrina service. The hotel is lovely, but it was very difficult to check in because there is no place to pull in/check in/get your luggage in except very busy canal street. The bellhops seems disorganized and ineffecient. I had to get out, stop traffic and guide my driver in front of the hotel. There is no parking garage connected or valet service (that I could get wind of) and their garage is down the street a block from the hotel. I ended parking in a public parking garage in the back street of the hotel which was faster, easier and cheaper. The hotel is currently serving as home for displaced people, so the atmosphere was more like overworked apartment managers. There was foul language and inappropriate dressing from the displaced in the lobby and up and down the halls, kids playing... the maids were overworked and lugging the largest piles of trash out of the rooms and in no mood to be helpful. I felt sorry for them as I heard one woman resident-since-the-hurricane berating a small housemaid that was beyond her capabilities of dragging trash into the hallways. We couldn't get movies turned on (I know this all seems trite, but it was not Hotel 6 pricing) although we tried for 3 hours. Although the hotel boasts a 'business center' and the front desk assured us we could get a package fed'exed out... upon arrival lugging the huge box, the door was locked and it took 45 mins of wrangling someone down there to find no one knew where the forms were, the scale, what the procedure was. The front desk was positively overwhelmed. In fact, we ended up dragging our luggage into our room after the 20 min wait to check in (front desk was considering/resolving the problems of various displaced who were being moved to another hotel or straightening out some service). There was no room service menu in the room, we were told to go to the attached restaurant, which was not the hotels restaurant so although we asked for "real" (not styrafoam) plates and forks, we couldn't get them. We went to New Orleans to show some support and it was intense seeing the damage, spirit and Mardi Gras. I hope things continue to settle there but I would be hard pressed to stayat the Astor again. Particularly I would call ahead to see how their guest register was looking and if they still had many displaced people, they need to have more staff to handle that. As a note, we stayed the first 4 nights across the street at the JW Marriott, with none of the inconveniences we experienced at the Astor. The Astor is being paid for the dozens of displaced families staying there, and still charging regular room rates to the rest of us guests, so why don't they hire some efficient people to get through this crisis?

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the astor for the 2004 Mardi Gras, I was very impressed with the cleaniness of the rooms and helpful staff regarding questions or directions to places we wanted to see. I was reading reviews on this site and see most loved the place but some complain...oh well that will happen. Only thing I didnt like was a Bloody Mary I ordered, but hey that may be the way they make them in Orleans..I wasnt in New york anymore. all in all I think it was a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: nina0801
Reviews.Content: Our family of five had a wonderful weekend getaway at the Astor-Crowne Plaza. The hotel is lovely, and the employees were exceptional. The service was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “My heart goes out to all the staff and residents in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i loved the astor hotel and i loved New Orleans even more because of my experiecnce, as a first time visitor. All the staff were friendly and warm. The location is perfect as your in the heart if the french quarters and everywhere else to be honest. I hope to be back one day soon to get some of that southern hospitality. Until then my prayers and thoughts are with you all in this great time of need. love you all fiona anderson - london

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had the pleasure of staying at the Astor Crowne Plaza in June of 2005. The staff was friendly and very competent and made our mini-vacation quite enjoyable. Ms. Kimberly Johnson was exceptionally helpful and should be commended for her fine efforts. With its great location and exceptional service, I heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zoe-la
Reviews.Content: After a string of mediocre hotel experiences on our recent vacation, the Astor Crowne Plaza was a joy! The location was perfect for exploring New Orleans on foot. Every single staff member we encountered were professional and accomodating. The room was truly clean and appointed with special little extras that went beyond the call of duty. After a full day of touring, we couldn't wait to fall into the fabulously comfy bed, pillows and fresh linens. Our room remained quiet even as the New Orleans nightlife buzzed on the city streets below....we loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke !”
Reviews.Author: toad1212
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel visit up until the final day..... After a long and relaxing vacation my wife and I approach the valet stand to retrieve our car for the long drive back to Florida. This is where the joke begins. After a 15 minute wait ... You and approximately 15 others are picked up, packed in and hauled off two miles down the road to a parking garage in a neighborhood which resembles downtown Beirut. Once there you are shoved out and left to wait while 1 valet attendent scrambles to get 15 vehicles.... What a JOKE ! are you kidding me ?? How and the heck can the Crown Plaza charge their guests $27 a day for this ?? I could have just parked my car in a full service garage behind the hotel and had a much more enjoyable experience. Next time I will just stay at either the Sheraton or Marriott and not risk my life retrieving my car in a parking gargage in the middle of one of the worst neighborhood's in North America ! Astor ... you should be ashamed of yourself !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Especially house keeping emplyee Betsy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first visit to New Orleans during the busy Essence Jazz Festival weekend. The Astor Crowne Plaza was excellent the staff was very helpful, giving tour information, serving the room and dealing the needs of their visiting guest. This is a very busy weekend yet the staff was exceptional in providing excellent service. I would stay at Astor Crowne Plaza again and again. Perfectly located on the main corner of Bourbon and Canal the street car is direct outside the main door of the hotel. Jasmine and soft music CD. sleeping mask and ear plugs provide to easy the traveler to sleep. Our room view over looked Bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: gotcpa1972
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of the hotel was great. We loved being in the middle of everything, but i think that is where the "great-ness" stopped. My husband waited outside for the valet while i checked in. At check in, i requested a quiet room, to which the front desk said would be no problem. the bellman brought me to a room right above 4 gigantic roof fans that were extremelt LOUD. i requested to move to another room. the bellman came 15 minutes later and brought me to another room (during that time my husband decided to find parking on this own, since the valet could not be found). i unpacked and decided to use the restroom. assuming the toilet was clean, i sat on the toilet, but it was dirty! there was dried, sticky, yellow pee splatter all over the seat! i felt dirty and disgusted! i called the front desk and spoke to the manager, who said that he can have someone come clean the toilet. i told him that would be fine, but asked if the toilet was not clean, how was i to be sure the tub or even the sheets had been changed? at that point, i was just mad. he basically asked, "well what do you want me to do about it". i just didnt want to move any more and someone came to the room to clean the toilet. i decided to take a shower after the ordeal, and the tub had such a slow drain, i can only define it as clogged. the dirty water (from my toilet experience) was hovering around my ankles. my experience at this hotel was horrible, and i will never stay here again. i dont know if my experience with this hotel was isolated, but it is too coincidental to be just that.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation to remember”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have to say, going to New Orleans for the first time can be a little frightening, but the astor crowne plaza staff made us feel right at home. Me and my wife stayed for three nights. The valet service made us feel like we were in New York by bringing our car around to the front door curb side. The two staff members that really helped us out were the night time doormen Brad And Romeo, they made us laugh and smile. Friday night after checking in my wife notice she left her phone in the car so Brad got it out of our vehicle and brought it to the hotel. We felt really stupid but saturday night my wife's phone battery was dead and Romero charge the phone all afternoon for us in the hotel shuttle. Without the cell phone we wouldn't have been able to check up on our teenagers at home. Overall our stay at the crowne plaza was great. Thanks Roger Spenkman

Reviews.Title: “God Sent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visit New Orleans maybe 10 times a year, but have to say this time was the bomb. Whenever you come to New Orleans, please stop by just to visit the hotel, than make your reservation for a weekend. You will enjoy every bit of it. The comfort in the lobby, rooms, and surroundings. I grade this hotel a 10+. We went for a youth conference at the Hyatt but, stayed with some friends at Crown Plaza New Orleans off Canal Street no mistake. Was busy all day but, at night time we party all night long. The Friday night we got tickets for the making of BET Comic View Show....well, after calling one of my sisters she informed me she had front row seating for the same show, just to meet her there off Canal and University.....not to far from where we were staying......Laugh my butt off too, you know it's good to laugh at times.....so if you see me on BET hey we had a good time. Now the Sunday a friend of mine took us to eat at the Trolley Station for some good breakfast and cheap price, it's nice for folks who lives there show us around too, jsut be very helpful to the guests or their friends. P.S. I will tell all of my friends and family about this hotel so get ready for lots of guests......everything was fine to the finest.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Moggy
Reviews.Content: The Astor is elegant, comfortable and perfectly located, with a warm atmosphere. We were upgraded to the executive floor and had suites with complimentary breakfast and afternoon snacks. As the hotel was formerly a department store there isn't much natural light in some of the rooms, but it has been cleverly decorated to compensate. The beds were divinely comfortable and came with a relaxing cd and eyemask. We did need the earplugs they provided as the music from Bourbon was loud one night. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more efficient, a truly delightful team. We just didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, comfortable beds, and Great Hot Tub!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife's and my stay at the Crowne Plaza (Astor) in New Orleans was better than we ever expected! Every morning I went to the hot tub to relax. My wife, Denise, and I never had a honeymoon or a vacation in more than over nine years since we've been married. Joshua Caraway up-graded us to a suite in room #307! Randy Perkins, at our request, allowed us to stay an extra night with a low rate. LaShanda Davis, Varonna Boyd, And Sharlene Baldwin gave us "The Extra Mile" when it came to customer service. You should be very proud of the entire staff at this hotel. Even the housekeepers respected our privacy and provided excellent service. My wife and I did not have time to do all we wanted to do, so we will not hesitate to book rooms in this wonderful hotel in the near future. Thank You Very Much!! Bruce and Denise Detotto

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service and a special thanks to Eric Dejean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mr. Dejean provided excellent service and helped my party on several occasions with questions and advice. I will definitely consider staying at the Astor Crowne Plaza again for the location and quality of the hotel. Eric is definitely an asset to the Astor Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for DC/BWI Group to Essence Fest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first year taking our group to the Crowne Plaza and also our first year with NO COMPLAINTS about the hotel from any of our guests. Needless to say... they can count on our booking YEAR AFTER YEAR! The service was FANTASTIC. Everything was great with the checkin. All of the room keys were ready as we requested AND our rooms were on the Upper Floors OR Away from Bourbon Street with was perfect. Jeronica & Pamela at the front desk handled the couple of issues that we had with no problem, basically because we had guys that had a King Bed... and you know how upset they can be with that. Personally, Jeronica deserves a special something because she was able to handle the most difficult problems with ease and with no frustration when the other front desk personnel were easy to become frustrated with the problems that occured. She said there was not a Front Desk Manager on duty, but she was great and made some exceptions to make our guests happy. The rooms look just the way they do on the website. The only problem was with a mouse in our room (we were a little freaked out). But the manager had someone come up and set some traps. I guess you can only expect it being so close to Bourbon street. We really enjoyed ourselves. Tamika N. Crider - Travel Agent Group Travel Specialist On The Go, LLC

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Customer Assistance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an oppertunity to stay at this perfectly located New Orleans, LA location and I loved everthing about it. However, the most impressive aspect about my stay was the customer assistance I received. From curb side parking/valley to check-in/check-out and everthing between, my experience was the best I have had in years. Thanks to Ms Kim Johnson and Pam Green of the Crowne Plaza staff for making my stay so GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “No matter what you call it, it is still a holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: jennnifer
Reviews.Content: Let me say the good things first: location, location, location. This hotel has the best location if you plan to spend time on Burbon street or the French Quarter. Also, upon arrival they provide you with ear plugs :) because it does get rather loud both on Burbon (hotel is on corner of Burbon and Canal) and on Canal Street. Also, the streetcars are right there, so you will have great and easy access to the heart of New Orleans. Also, the lobby is really pretty. Now. I won't ever stay at this hotel again. First off, they charge $21.99 a night for VALET parking. Aside from checking in, we only attempted to use valet parking once... at checkout. When I called to give them my ticket number for them to pull my car up, I was greeted by a voice mail which said to for me to take my luggage out the front door and get in the shuttle where they will drive me to the parking garage and I can get out and drive my car out myself. This is UNACCEPTABLE (and I wonder if it is criminal). I'm NOT going to pay the most I have ever paid for valet parking to be shuttled to a parking garage. So I called the front desk and they told me to call valet parking (i.e. voice mail). So then I called the "excellent service" number, a number provided upon arrival in case you have any complaints. The woman who answered didn't want to hear anything and transferred me to the front desk (where I already had called)... then I called and asked for the manager on duty, who explained that they shuttle because the traffic on Canal Street. So I looked out the window, Suday morning at 9:30, and I counted about 5 cars on Canal Street. No traffic. The manager on duty did get my car pulled up for me and my husband. So the problem was solved-- but not before I had to wait 20 minutes for someone to take responsibility for solving this issue. The room is pure Holiday Inn. Under the sink in the bathroom, there was a HUGE hole in the wall. The toilet paper hangs on a hook under the sink where you have to lean over to get it, and then it falls off to the floor every time you try and get some. The hair dryer didn't work, and the iron was missing half of the base so that I almost burned myself when I went to put it on the ironing board. Room service was a trainwreck. They had told me the wait was 30 minutes. My breakfast didn't get there until one hour, 5 minutes later. The waffle was cold and soggy with much too much powdered sugar on it. My chocolate milk was made with white milk and syrup and was room temperature. They did comp. my breakfast, which was a good thing since I couldn't eat it. They advertised a gift shop in the lobby. When I asked for directions at the front desk to the sundry shop, the girl looked at me with a blank stare because she didn't know what sundries were. When I said I wanted a coke and a snack, she sent me to the *liquor* store next door to the hotel. I should have asked for the store by name, and I still don't know if there is a sundry store IN the hotel. The bottom line is: if this is a splurge and you normally stay at 2 star hotels, you'll probably enjoy it. If you like to stay at luxury hotels or luxury botique hotels, then the best Holiday Inn has to offer just won't measure up. Instead of this hotel, if you don't mind staying on the other side of Canal Street, I recommend the Reinassance Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore negative comments about staff”
Reviews.Author: glrsandldy
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my reservation after reading many of the negative comments, especially about the front desk. When we checked in we were delighted by the gentleman who took care of us. He was very entertaining and informative, offering up what he felt were some of the "must see" items in the city. Our room was very well kept and the maid service was wonderful. Even though the in room material said they would not change the sheets until we had stayed three nights, the bed was changed daily. I would highly recommend this hotel and when I return I will likely stay there. The location is perfect to get the full flavor of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally polite & helpful! From the valet to the front desk staff, EVERYONE at this hotel ROCKED!!! You will not find better service in this city. Rochelle Williams & Eric Dejean were so helpful and friendly during check-in that it started our trip off with a pleasant aura! THANKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Astor”
Reviews.Author: pvillan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend trip to New Orleans. I booked our hotel from an online travel service, so it was sight unseen. I was very pleased with the location and room at the Crowne Plaza Astor. One day of our three day stay the room was not cleaned by 3:00PM, but other than that, the hotel was a real pleasure for both of us. The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel, and the hotel provided earplugs, lavender spray and an audio CD to help guests relax and get a good night's sleep. Since the hotel is right at the corner of Bourbon and Canal Streets, some folks may need the help! The staff was very courteous and friendly. Several of them went out of their way to help us enjoy our weekend and give two newcomers some tips on where to go, what to see!

Reviews.Title: “The Astor Crowne Plaza is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza. It is located in the French Quarter, which is a great place to visit. The service was excellent especially, Susie who was very friendly and helpful during our stay. I recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to experience a true New Orleans adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisag961
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Astor Crowne a total of three times. I love this hotel and will not think to stay anywhere else when i visit New Orleans. Besides the excellent location, the front desk supervisor Erick Dejan (not sure if i spelled it right) made us feel really welcomed. Service and a smile really goes a long way. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel to New Orleans every year for the Essence Festival. What we discovered is that many of the hotels say they offer discounts for the Essence Festival, but when we checked regular rates, it turns out that many of the hotels were actually charging higher rates for festival goers. The Astor Crowne Plaza actually charged a slightly lower rate than their regular rate, and had rooms available. Their staff was EXTREMELY polite and patient from the reservation agent to the valet parkers. The rooms were exquisite. Each bed had a featherbed on top that caused us to miss many events, being unable to get out of bed! Security was super tight. When they saw a lone man get on the elevator with me and my friends (all female), security stopped the elevator two floors later and got on and asked us if we were okay! All in all, the festival in 2004 was a bust, and we decided not to attend anymore in the future, but the Crowne Plaza was definitely the best part of the trip. The only complaints that I have is that the hotel does not have on-site parking and the bar closes too early. I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What happens at the Astor says at the Astor !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Astor to celebrate our 6th year Anniversary. The room was nice and Susie went out of her way to make the stay special. Great hotel with Great employees

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a business owner, I was looking for a hotel to hold my next event. This hotel is excellent. It is beautiful and peaceful which is a surprise considering it is on the corner of Canal Street and Bourbon Street. The sales department is excellent and my experience with my sales manager, Stefan Maronge, has been outstanding. Mr. Maronge made me feel as though my small event was the most important event in town. I look forward to holding my next event at this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ASTOR CROWNE PLAZA!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whenever I want to stay downtown in NOLA, I ALWAYS stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza!---the best client service (especially Susie!!) and the hotel is simply beautiful---and VERY clean! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE as THE hotel with the best service and location in NOLA! John

Reviews.Title: “Luxury amidst style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have extremely good memories of my stay. The hotel employee who welcomed me, Susie, was a very gracious hostess. She took the time to show me all the amenities and explain all the available services. The room itself provided a luxurious, self-indulgent getaway from chaotic family life for a weekend. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking in the quarter and enjoying the best of the food, music, and art of the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: maya1964
Reviews.Content: I am a smoker. I like to smoke in the privacy of my room, perferably with a view. Unfortunately, at the Crowne Plaza, smokers are banished to the fourth floor of the Crowne Plaza--the only floor with smoking rooms without views ( unless you count the view of the pool with lounging people whose heads are up against your room window as a "view"). I had such a room and of course I could not open the curtains, therefore, my room was pretty much in the dark unless I turned on the lights during the day. On my second day at the hotel, I requested a room change, I told the front desk I needed some sunlight, and they moved me to a room overlooking Bourbon Street, which was fine, except, just a view of the roof tops and neon signs. Oh well. Just a warning for those requesting smoking rooms at the Crowne Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Noisy on the South Side”
Reviews.Author: beacho
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Great location (Corner of Canal and Bourbon Street). A room on the south side of the hotel (side opposite of Bourbon Street) is very noisy. There are large cooling towers on the building next door that create a low level roar all night. I don't recommend a room on this side of the building. The pool is very small and quickly fills with quest. The French Quarter food is excellent. Bourbon street was a bit more trashy than i expected. I much preferred the east side of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Good Rooms, Outdoor Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly, in good business class hotels which can make you a bit fussy when you come to travelling for pleasure. I was in New Orleans for 6 nights during Jazz Fest and also some conventions. The hotel was great, busy and in a location that really doesnt get much better in terms of accessing all of New Orleans attractions. The beds are also really comfy. I was concerned it would be noisy as it is at the corner of Bourbon Street but it was fine. Having the outdoor pool was also great. I would highly recommend staying here either for business or pleasure. The tours that were recommended by the concierge were also spot on not sure what one of the earlier comments meant by them adding on a cut as I didnt see this. Would almost definitely stay here again when we come back to New Orleans which we definitely will be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: aoifeb
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last labor weekend and i kept meaning to write a review, we were originally booked into the sister hotel but when arrived found out we were staying in the crowne plaza...great, it was a better star! the rooms were nicely decorated and the convience of the location was the best for us, we could just fall in the door after a night around bourbon st, but it was quiet too, the pool was a nice place to relax after a hard days sightseeing, the staff were nice and friendly. I love new orleans and when i go back I will definataly stay at the crowne plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and great staff. Close to the quarter but far enough away from the action so it's relatively quiet. Our room was in great shape, very clean and the bathroom facilities were top notch. A little pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel! Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here, and we were overwhelmed by the service. The staff was overly polite ("Southern Hospitality," indeed), the rooms were beautiful and clean, and the restaurant attached is excellent. The location (on Canal, just on the edge of the French Quarter) was perfect. I will stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a mid-30's couple and were a little concerned about staying right on Bourbon St. in the thick of things, as we haven't been in a "party" mode for quite a while. 3-night stay (Thur - Sun) in mid-March. When we first arrived, we were given a 2nd floor room right above Bourbon. Thanks to some advice from the bellman concerning the noise, no way we were staying this close to Bourbon!!!!
